text: 500 ml bottle. Brilliant brassy gold color. Medium sized creamy white head. Wheat malt nose has notes of sweet banana, cloves and Monkberry moon delight. Sweet wheat malt flavor is tangy and yeasty with lemony notes. Quite good and very Bavarian.

Bottle 
Пробова на дегуста& Отличны&

Our first Kristallweizen and its a good one! It pours a classic crystal clear yellow with a thin medium head, the aroma is a strong banana wheat tornado and the taste follows close in line. It lives up to the rep as a filtered clear hefeweizen, but it doesnt lose too much flavor (as apparently is a problem with many others of this type). If you wanna try a Kristallweizen, get this one! Super weird that its evidently from the oldest brewery ever circa 1040? Good for listening to the Best Show in the kitchen while digesting some za and watching the dishes get washed behind a black door with your boo boo.

bottle (alko, probably- has been sitting on my shelf a while now). golden, clear. nice weiheny spicy clovy phenolic, sweet banana estery nose. malted wheaty sweet, bit thin all though. med bodied, nice soft malted cereals sweet, filling fresh feeling. the softest, roundest, nicest malted wheat in flavour, pillowy, with a bit of that weihen hefe- yeasty spices. excellent flavour. tad dissapointed in the intensity though, guess a lot that i love about weihenstephans weisse gets trapped when filtering.

Bottle. Clear golden beer, large creamy white head, decent lacing. Aroma of wheat, spices, clove, banana. Taste is light sweet: banana, clove, spices, some bread. Light+ body, average to lively carbonation, thin texture. Quite refreshing example of useless style.
Clear yellow body with a large white head. Aroma is sweet fruit, banana mostly. Taste is sweet and very low bitter. Watery texture, soft carbonation, light body.
Backlog. 50 cl bottle from systembolaget. Pours golden with big head. Wheaty aroma with banana and yeasty wheaty taste.
Bottle from Liquor Barn. Aroma had Banana, spice, and hay. Taste was sweet.

Ar: Medium intensity peach and lean banana; a very slight amount of black pepper and clove; soft, full, and pale malt. Ap: Crystal-clear gold; medium white head with moderate retention, leaves a fine cap of foam, finely bubbled ring, and a spare web of foam sticking to the glass sides. T: Fresh banana and peach skin; low bitterness, slightly herbal, with a fair amount of sweetness; touch of black pepper and clove; a touch of tannin and soft bread on the finish. P: Medium-light body with high carbonation; finish is medium-dry. O: Excellent filtered German wheat; all of the hallmark flavors--banana, peach, pepper, clove--at pleasant, balanced levels; beautiful clarity, with spot-on mouthfeel.
From 500ml poured in an English Pint. This beer retains all of its rich wheatey character and sweet slightly tangy flavor while losing the graininess and creaminess. The prototype of Kristallweizens.
Bottled. Pours clear yellow color. White head. Aroma is banana, clove, wheat, banana, bubblegum. Flavor is same. Bubblegum, Banana, clove wheat. Its my first kristallweissbier!
Spicy, citrus, and herbal aroma; taste is banana, clove, spiciness, and a late/aftertaste that I can only describe as cheesecake.

Big sour wheat smells. It pours clear and bubbly gold with a big bright white head with tiny bubbles. Nice weiss notes to the flavor with an unexpected sweet malty finish. Sparkling carbonation with constantly rising champagne-like bubbles. Super fresh and refreshing. Must be awesome at the source.

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2017 Pours gold with a thick white head. Aroma of malt and cloves. Taste isnt easy to describe but the flavors are all balanced well with each other and the whole thing light and fluffy. Well done.
Really tasty. Has a nice floral taste to it. Descent aroma. Thought it was delicous.

50cl bottle at home. Appearance: clear light straw with medium white head and visible carbonation. Aroma: malts, grain, citrus, clove and banana. Taste: medium sweetness and low bitterness. Notes of unripe banana, citrus, malts and spices. Palate: light bodied, watery to sticky texture and lively carbonation.

Bottle from Erzengel (euro local swap 4/2016), many thanks! Pours clear golden with a white head. Wheat, banana, clove, citrus, herbs, quite what youd expect from a weizen, and executed very well, quite what youd expect from Weigenstepan. I dont quite see the point of the kristal part though, I like my weizen hazy.
50cl bottle from biere-import. Light hazy gold. Thin to medium white head. Taste is light sweetness, medium bitterness. Aroma and flavour is malt, citric, hops, herby, clove, banana. Easy.
Bottle - clear golden color with white head. Notes of banana, medium malty body. Finish is slightly sour. Fresh and good.

0.5l bottle. Fresh malty aroma, banana notes. Clear golden color, white head. Malty taste, perfect balance between sour and bitter notes. Light body, watery texture, average carbonation and sour/bitter finish with banana notes. Super refreshing and easy drinking. Well done.
helder gouden/geel met witte kraag. aroma van mout, gist, zoet, graan, smaken zijn glad, zacht, moutig, graan, stro/hooi, matig tot redelijk zoet, citrus, licht, gewoon goede smaken, matig body.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2016 Goudgeel, helder Weissbier, witte schuimkraag. Aroma: Tarwemouten, gist/banaan/kruidnagel.Smaak: Tarwe en broodachtig als eerste daarna de gist die kruidig en fruitig is..kruidnagel, banaan. Wat grassig en hooi....lichte hops en iets prikkelig.Frisse heldere Weissbier .... lichte body, iets waterig, medium koolzuur maar wel zeer smaakvol.Afdronk is fruitig en meer pilsmout ...kruidig en kort.Heerlijk op deze zonnige dag.

Bottle from beer club. Pours straw color with a light thin head. Light and crisp with a good amount of carbonation. Decent beer for a hot summer day.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Brewtopia. Pure gold with lasting small head and lace. Mild grassy banana clove honey wheaty aroma. Medium sweet crackery honey wheaty banana tropical fruit with dry mildly spicy grassy finish with just a tiny pleasant touch of fruity sweetness. Medium light body wheaty soft lively carbo. Not my favorite style but very delicious and refreshing.

On tap at growler guys meridian. Pours out a pale crisp wheat topped with a white head. Nose is nice malt notes a little banana bread spice. Taste is more of the light spice banana bread notes and a grain.

Pours bright gold and crystal clear with a thick white head. Aroma is the wheat malts you would expect with the clovey-pepper thing going on, but in a much sharper way. Taste is initially bread & peppery spices, but very quickly a pilsener malt flavor kicks in an goes for the finish.
Butelka 0,5l pita w domu. Kolor złoty, klarowny, piana średnia. Aromat bananów i lekkie gożdziki. Zdecydowanie wolę klasyczne weissbier.
Clear bright light gold with small white head. Great weisse character. Light and easy but not watery. Pretty much exemplifies the style.
Light and crisp, a little dry and straw finish. Light bodied. Decent beer. .
500ml Flasche. Klar und golden mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Spritzig. Dezentes Bananen- und Hefearoma. Mild im Geschmack. Gut trinkbar.
Bottle pour. Very clear with a one finger head. While I enjoyed this beer, I prefer their regular Hefeweizen. The taste was a little too subdued on t his one.

Bottle from a local supermarket. Pours clear golden yellow. Smells are banana and floral. A bit more than medium carbonation. Taste is dominated by the hops with the Same notes as the smell. Finish is slightly bitter. Nice, but Kristall is just not the same ;)
Muy rica, equlibrada, refrescante, clavo de olor, aroma a cuero y cereales.

Esters, sweet, grain malts, wheat, caramel, light cloves. Clear, bright gold, massive, frothy, white head. Light sweet. Esters continue, medium ripe banana, caramel, bread malts, wheat and other grains, lively carbonation, medium bodied. Nice Kristallweizen, well-balanced, fairly sweet. Bottle from WineRack, Chiswick.

Bottle, at home. Crystal clear pale gold, with a big white frothy head. Nose is intense; bananas, spices, perhaps a little malt. Taste is spicy, rather soapy, a bit sweet. Spicy palate and finish. Fairly refreshing, but slightly sticky in the finish.
Halve liter fles. Helder, lichtgeel, goede kraag. Aroma van banaan, tarwe, gist. Smaakt fris, banaan, rarwe. Bitterzure afdronk.

Aroma doet ijzerachtig aan, zoet ziltig.
Smaak banaanachtig, lange beetje weeïge maar interessante nasmaak. Kan ook een imperial pils zijn, maar zeker een dorstlesser.
Nice, clean refreshing bananaish, wheaty, perfectly balanced brew. Moderate sweet all the way. Awesome.
Large white head and pours straw yellow. Tastes of wheat, ripe banana and a little bubblegum. Light on the tongue and a fairly light beer overall. Moderate hop finish, touch of spice.
Bottle. Pours straw yellow. Aroma of wheat, banana and bubblegum. Taste is light sweet with mild bitterness. Light and refreshing.

Bottle from Market Street Wine Shop, Uptown. Pours golden with a huge white head. Aroma of slightly overripe bananas, wheat, grass, spice. Tasty! Overripe bananas by far, wheat, coriander, clove, light lemongrass.

Tap @ Growler Guys. Light golden yellow color with a finger of white head. Mild aroma is wheat and a little fruity sweet. Wonderfully smooth and crisp taste, very thirst quenching on a 100* July day. Light wheat notes, citrus and fruity yeast carry a little sweetness through to a crisp end. Very pleasant.

Piwo klarowne w kolorze slomkowo-zlotym z ladnia biala piana. W aromacie drozdze, banany, przyprawy i lekkie gozdziki jak w typowym pszeniczniaku tylko bez zmetnienia. W smaku bardzo pozytywnie, swietny balans pomiedzy slodycza i lekkim wytrawnym finiszem. Banany idealnie komponuja sie z pszenica, wysycenie na srednim poziomie bez wyczuwalnej goryczki. Bardzo gladkie i pijalne, lekkie i smaczne.
500ml bottle at Beer Cafe. Clear, pale golden with a thick white head. Yeasty banana aroma, flavour is similar with citrus and spice notes. Bit thin but otherwise very good

Pours clear blonde with a modest white head. Nose is fairly sweet with some bread and light hop notes.Flavor is a bit richer with a slight carbonation bite adding to well balanced hops and light German malts. Finish is very quick. Light and drinkable.

5

Bottled April 15th.

Pours a crystal clear straw yellow with an impressive head of foam that has good longevity.

Spicy spicy nose with notes of coriander and clove. .could make a fine perfume out of that!

Coriander, cloves, a bit of pepper, lemon zest. ..finishes dry with medium to medium high carbonation.

Well, what a bloody treat this is!!!

Een mildere en frisse versie van de normale Hefe Weizen versie. Sprankelend met lichte tonen van graan, banaan en kruiden. Echt heel lekker zomer biertje. Zeker een goede toevoeging aan de serie als je behoefte hebt aan iets frissers.
Bottle at Bavarian Brauhaus. Pours clear golden with a large white head. Aroma is banana and spices. Taste is banana sweet, clove, peppers, grain. Medium btter
500ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours clear gold with a large pillowy white head. Aroma is bananas, wheat and yeast. Taste is bananas, minerals, wheat, lemon.

Bottle from HomeBrewStuff. Havent had a weizen in ages, and kristallweizen is not my favorite style, but still tastes good. Crystal clear gold, lazy carbonation, small tight head. Wheat on the aroma, very bready, minor fruity notes. Banana/bubblegum flavors increase in the taste, and finishes sweet. Slick mouthfeel, but I really miss the sediment.

Superior tasting beer that exuberantly rises up to greet you when poured. Aroma is a mix of yeast and freshly mowed grass. Nicely carbonated light body releases a finish that alternates between hints of strawberries and watermelon. As refreshing as advertised. Perfect on a summer patio.
Clear golden. Light fruit aroma. Tastes of tangy fruit, malt. Touch of banana. Slightly sour aftertaste.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2016 Bottle. Golden color with creamy white head. Aroma is citrusy, peaches, some yeasts. Taste is bananas, peaches, rather sweet. Quite smooth mouthfeel. Delicious. Best Kristall I know. Still, I stick with my opinion that Kristallweizen is the most unnecessary style there is.
Bottle at home. Pours light yellow with big white pillowy head. Aroma of banana mixed in with citrus, yeast and wheat malts. Medium sweetness, light to medium bitterness. Good.

The first of this style Ive had, and it meets the style description to a tee. Certainly pours clear with thin near-white head that lasts about 1/2 finger. Aroma is banana and bubblegum. Flavor has the same with some mild clove and hint of hop bitter. Finish is clean and calls for more. Very drinkable, as all from this brewery.

Pours a clear light golden color with a super thick white head. Aroma is of cloves, banana, yeast, and hay. A heavier, oil slick palate. Flavor is of yeast, clove, oak, bittersweet zest, and wheat. Leaves a clovey yeast finish.
Opinion of a beginner beer fan: Smells slightly of bananas and honey, but not too strongly. Taste is slightly underwhelming with a light mouthfeel.

Aroma: Banana, wheat, bubble gum, metal. Appearance: Head high, quickly falls down, clear light golden color of the body. Taste: Watery, wheaty, light clove, banana. Palate: Carbonation is too high, body is low, finish is sweet.

Bottle, thanks rayaron. Clear yellow golden with a huge creamy white head. Smell of clove, yeast, banana and overripe fruit. Sweet, fruity, notes of yeast and banana, mild lemony bitterness, dry finish. Light bodied, fizzy. Not flavorful as Hefe, but well made and decent.

The beer has a very nice look. The beer pours a very thick layer of soft fluffy white foam. A lot of the foam collapses quickly, but a decent layer of foam remains on top of the beer. The beer itself is of course crystal clear. The beer shows a lot of nice bubbles rising to the top. The color of the beer is a nice golden yellow. The smell of the beer is a nice typical weissbier smell. It is set and delicate. I can clearly smell koriander and citrus fruits, like almost every weissbier. The beer has a nice fruity sweet aroma, which is accompanied by a nice zesty and koriander bitterness. The smell is nice but not very special. The taste of the beer is the same. It is a typical taste of weissbier. It has the same aspects as the smell. It has the nice citrusy and koriander in it. The balance between bitterness and sweeties is very nice. All in all, it is a good weissbier. However, I miss the nice cloudiness an unfiltered weissbier can have. The soft aspect this can give is lost in here. The regular Weihenstephaner is beter.

Originally rated on 7/31/08. This was my first kristal beer. Have to say it was pretty good. It poured a clear pale yellow body, medium carbonation, and a thick head that disappeared quickly. Aroma of cloves, nutmeg, and a little banana. Mouthfeel was good and smooth. Flavor is predominatley clove and nutmeg with a little friutiness thrown in. Overall a pretty good beer, but the sweetness would keep me from drinking several of these in a row

Shared 16.9 oz. bottle. Clear straw color with gigantic meringue-like white head. Aroma and taste of banana, wheat, yeast, and mild hops. Has a slight acidic tartness. High carbonation. Light-bodied. Decent.

Aroma: unusual, almost smoky with some banana undertones; Appearance: light straw, clear, with billowy head that settles to a thick layer; Taste: also slightly smoky with some spicy, banana notes; Palate: medium body with spicy finish; Overall: not my favorite style, but somewhat refreshing. Would probably not buy again.

Bottle 0.5l. Clear yellowish, fizzy with big bubbly white head. Sweetish aroma, yeasty and earthy with some minerals and some fruitiness. Bittersweet flavor with notes of wheat and banana, earthy and a bit soapy, bitter finish. Very carbonated, light to medium-bodied.

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass from Market Basket. Aroma is fruity esters and yeast with variable other aromas--burnt herbs early, vague glue aroma late. Appearance is clear, light greenish-tinged yellow with no sparkle, tiny foamy white head with fair retention and trace lacing. Taste is initial hint of skunk and then powerful fruity esters, particularly banana and bubble gum and late biscuit with mild tart. Palate is light-to-medium bodied with thick texture and lively carbonation (slightly painful) and dry finish. Overall,

clear pale yellow colour, huge, stable white head; aroma of banana, some figs, grains mybe some lemongrass; taste of banana, caramel, honey and some sourness - like a sourish malt dring with intensive carbonation; not 100% convincing...

Light straw-gold with a huge, snow-white head that settles down into an incredibly thick, meringue-like topping. Smell is subtle; some cloves, banana, apricot, bread. Taste is savory, clean and slightly sweet with banana and spice notes. Quite effervescent with small bubbles; just a little tangy in the finish.

Sweet bubblegum, crisp malts and trademark Weihenstephaner yeast aroma. Golden with loads of carbonation and big head. Taste is similar to the original weissbier maybe slightly different banana character leaning towards sweeter. Finish is the same banana and some slight citrus tartness. For whatever reason, and not just because of the appearance, its not as good as the unfiltered version, but its still really enjoyable.

0,5l bottle. BB 08/2016. Yellow clear shiny colour, rather big white head. Smells spices, plums, light sweetness, light yeasty. Medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. Tastes of spices, light peach, tobacco, but Dusty, not as full mouthfeel as regular wheat beers. Finishes lightly dry with notes of spices and tobacco. Okish, I prefer regular weizen
7,3, 6, 3, 11

Bottle at Taps Beer Bar, Kuala Lumpur. Poured a crystal clear straw colour with a frothy white head. The aroma is light banana, grainy malt, yeast. The flavour is light acid citrus with a light crisp yeast, banana palate. Light to medium bodied with lively carbonation. Way too light for me really but out here in KL it has redeeming refreshing qualities!

Aromat: przyjemny, banany i goździki.
Wygląd: barwa złota, całkowicie klarowne, piana obfita.
Smak: wytrawne, powtórka z aromatu, czyli banan i goździk, goryczka niska.
Tekstura: niewiele ciała, wysycenie średnie.
Ogólne wrażenie: bardzo smaczny kristall weizen, prawidłowy aromat bananów i goździków, piękna piana i całkowita klarowność piwa. Wysoko pijalne.

Bottle - big pillowy head, medium gold color, relatively sweet malty aroma and flavor, mild hop balance, some fruity like esters in there too, good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Słomkowe, klarowne piwo o bardzo obfitej pianie, która z czasem redukuje się do warstewki na powierzchni. Aromat i smak intensywne i bananowe, praktycznie banan w płynie. Goryczka niska zgodna ze stylem. Ogólnie bardzo dobre pszeniczne piwo, mimo że klarowne nie traci nic z typowego charakteru niemieckiej pszenicy.
Danke an WillemsUrenkel für das Bier. Riecht hefig-frisch. Start süßlich, fruchtig. Mitte Muskat, helles Malz. Abgang helles Malz, Hefe, frisch. Sehr schön.

(draft @ Winking Lizard - Peninsula, OH) Clear gold with a puffy white head. Light wheat and banana aroma with a flavor to match. Good banana and dry wheat notes, impressive for the fact that its filtered. [1/1/16]
A very enjoyable weizen. Smooth and fresh tasting, with sweet tones here and there make this an enjoyable beer for any season.

Bottle picked up at Niagara Falls Consumers Beverages. Pours a crystal clear golden yellow, massive fluffy white head, loads of lacing. Nose is sweet, wheaty, malty, fruity. Tastes sweet, thin on the tongue, bitter, a little fruity, Brady, some malt. Easy drinking.
Thuis uit een grote fles. Gumball/Banana smoothie. Backlog from 2015/07/14.

0.5l bottle as a part of bavarian beer set, marktkauf/edeka. pours a clear pale golden with a steady white head and a nice lacing. aroma of fresh banana, bubblegum, and grass. flavour of banana, hay, vanilla, apple peel. light and drinkable.

Barwa słomkowa podchodząca pod złotą, piwo idealnie klarowne. Piana gęsta lecz szybko opada. W aromacie banany i wyraźna pszenica. W smaku dominują goździki, po nich banany. Wydaje się być trochę wodniste. Pijalne.

Bottle from Sprouts: Aroma is decked with authentic German yeast that brings about scents of bubble gum, banana, clove and dried marjoram. Poured a sparkling golden blonde liquid and was topped with a gigantic fluffy foam capping of head. The drink is mostly grain bread like malts complimented by lightly spiced yeast that give off the same flavors as my nose detected which was banana, bubblegum, and clove. Light in grain and wheat flavoring and a chance of hay in the after finish. This beer definitely taste better when drinking it with a large foam cap head on it than when the foam goes flat
Bottle pour. Clear light golden with a large soapy white head. Aroma is banana, cloves, and wheat. Medium body. Sweet with just a hint of bitter in the middle.

Bottle 500ml. Weizen glass. Aroma - slight banana flavour but oh so tempting. The three plus finger head stifles the nose somewhat. Clear and full of streaming bubbles. Amazing mouthfeel and delicious perfectly balanced mix of sweet beer flavour with virtually no bitterness. Flavour lingers on the tongue all the way until the next mouthful.

Pours a clear straw from a bottle with thick white head, quickly dissipating, lots of lacing. Wheaty, banana/apricot aroma, flavor similar with a little spiciness in there, maybe cardamom or something, then a little spicy yeastiness too. Good beer.

Aroma:

Clove, banana, wheat, yeast.

Appearance:

Pale golden/yellow beer with a small white head.

Taste/Palate:

 Starts really sweet, moving towards a smooth banana flavour.

Butelka 0,5l. do 29.06.2016r. Barwa żółta, bardzo klarowna. Piana biała, dosyć duże pęcherzyki, prawie natychmiast spada do zera. W aromacie dosyć przyjemnie, goździki, banany, pszenica, czuć świeżość. Może najpierw o odczuciach w ustach, bo są dla mnie zaskoczeniem. Spodziewałem się szczypania i takiej "agresywności". Jednak piwo okazało się dosyć łagodne i ułożone. W smaku niemalże identycznie jak w aromacie. Także pod tym względem dosyć przewidywalne. Nasycenie idealne, alkoholu brak. Bardzo lekkie i pijalne. Polecam.

A 500ml bottle with a best before date of 25th February 2016, poured into a Riedel weizen glass. It poured a crystal clear golden straw colour with a big three finger white head that dissipated slowly leaving sticky lacing. Light aromas of wheat and banana with hints of clove and honey. Taste starts grassy with some citrus lemon followed by banana and some wheat. Light to medium bodied with medium to high carbonation. Overall, this was not a bad beer but I definitely prefer the unfiltered version which has stronger aromas and taste.

Bottle 50cl. @ local AH supermarket. Clear golden, a lot of bubbles, large frothy white head, good retention, light lacing; aroma of wheat, banana, yeast, sour dough, bit soapy; taste is medium sweet, light sour noets, wheaty, light banana, bit spicy; medium body, watery to oily texture, average carbonation, mild sweet and sourish aftertaste, light bitter touch in the finish, spicy notes; well-balanced and rich Weizen, excellent.
Not impressive, prefer Hefe also from Schöfferhofer. From shop next to peberbräu

From bottle in weizen. Pours clear and golden with billowing head and lively CO2. Hints of cloves on the nose with a zesty palate, a refreshing warm weather beer. Glad to try a champion of the style, especially in October. Prost!

On draft at HopCat. The pour is a clear yellow gold, light, with a thin collar of white head and some stringy lace. The aroma carries a strong Belgian yeast with it and a bit of clove. The typical flavors I'm not crazy about at all. There is a little pilsner ish thing going on, but it's not bad. The flavor is surprising. It's more smooth and drinkable than the smell would lead. It's very pilsner-ish and light. There is a maltiness that's happening and taking some of the negativity away from the Belgian aspects. The mouth feel is light and crisp with a lingeringly sweet malty finish. Much more drinkable than I thought at first. Not bad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is wheat, somewhat fruity citrus, not horrible. Appearance is golden, white head. Taste is wheat, fruit sweetness, leaves quickly. Mouthfeel is crisp, light body, easy drinking. Overall, Ive had worse.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2016 500ml bottle from Beers of Europe. First Kristallweizen Ive tried. Clear pale yellow colour with a thick creamy white head. Aroma and taste of banana, cloves, fruits and spices, wheat. Pleasant finish and aftertaste. Very similar to the Hefe, if a little lighter.
2015-06-21

Sehr feine Hefe
Blank gefiltert
Weißer feiner Schaum
Nicht aktuell standfest
Ein nahezu perfektes Kristallweizen

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Cornelius. Light gold crystal clear. White head. Bananas cloves. Medium body, soft fizz. Sweet caramel and citrus. Oily but quenching. Very tasty.

500 ml. Topaz and crystal clear body as advertised. Lots of fine bubbles support a lasting meringue of foam. Crisp nose is clove, banana, honey, tart green apple and a hint of lemon bubblegum. Tastes of the same mix with a touch of dry grass in the long finish. Light-medium body has a smooth but lively carbonation and a good drinkable balance.
0,5l bottle. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma is banana, wheat and yeast. Taste s sweet with wheat and spicy character. Medium body with lively carbonation. Overall its pretty good beer.

0.5 l bottle from Firma Bier, best before 13/5/2016. Clear, pale golden yellow with a huge, foamy, slowly diminishing, white head. Sweetish-yeasty aroma of ripe banana, vanilla, honeydew and some clove, almost artificial. Sweetish-yeasty taste of ripe banana, vanilla, honey and some clove, followed by a short, slightly bitter and spicy finish. Medium body, creamy and effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Difficult to find in certain parts of Germany but nearly everywhere available in NL, this Kristallweizen has more aroma than many unfiltered Weizens. Lots of banana in it, balanced by a pleasant, spicy finish. Very refreshing, absolutely round and phenominally easy to drink.

Bottle from Ninas Mini Market. Clear golden body with a lasting white head. Steady carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma of lemon, green apple and yeast. Flavour of grass, salted lemon and apple peel. Medium body with an oily texture. Light fizz. Crisp and bitter.

First of all, didnt try many, maybe just 2-3, and i got my mind up that these so called castrated-weizens are not for me; why to take away all the fun that yeast can provide? Its no use. Even more if weihenstephaner is THE perfect weizen, how it could be better without its trademark yeast? But reviews here were good so i thought was worth a try.
0.5 cl bottle at the braustuberl, it wasnt on tap. Golden color, obviously Kristall clear, big white head, and fizzy look. Smells like the classic weizen. Aroma is very similar to the regular one. Huge banana and bubblegum, very fruity. IT matched perfectly with a brieze bread, excellent combo. Taste is balanced, sweetish, with a delicate bitterness in the finish. Extra dry, light body. I miss the smooth doughy yeast but its surprisingly good. I seriusly doub a kristall could be any better, no doubt this being on the 2nd position for good, now im curious like to try the New Glarus one.

From a half liter bottle. Pours straw clear with tons of carbonation and thick head that sticks. Mild sweet banana nose. Mild fruit taste that coats your mouth. maybe a hint of apricot. This is a beer you can drink a lot of in one sitting. Unfortunately its brewed across an ocean ;)

Poured from a 500 ML bottle into a pint glass. A Crystal clear golden color with a small white head. The aroma is of sweet malt, banana and wheat. The flavor is outstanding, with malt, wheat and banana perfectly blended. A nice crisp finish. Really refreshing.

Clear golden colour with an amazing frothy white head that last longer and keep a nice lacing until the end. Aroma is a mix of wheat, fruity, sour and malty, notes of bananas and yeast, really different. Taste is fruity, notably sweet, banana notes very present, hints of yeast and quite spicy. High carbonation and medium body with a sweet yeast finish.
500ml bottle. Clear golden body with a tall white head. Smells to me quite similar to their standard beer, but tastes a bit more sweet and less yeasty.
UPDATED: OCT 13, 2016 Bottle. Pours clear/straw colored, with oversized foamy white head. Aroma of banana and spices. Taste, bubblegum, bananas, spices and clove.

Pours a golden yellow, completely filtered color, with a stable, fluffy big head.

Smells of a dough bread infused yeast character with a whiff of clove and cardamon to it, ballanced by grassy hops, together with lots of straw. Reveals ripe banana underneath, adding to the spiciness of the yeast, without loosing its white bread malt qualities. 

Has a very lively carbonation, with a soft mouthfeel, resulting in a very refreshing, light bodied beer pending between spices and malts.

Tastes almost as clean as the beer looks, while the initial yeast profile shines not only due to its pleasantly integrated spices, but also due to grassy hops and a certain amount of bready malts. The malts turn sweeter after the swallow, showcasing the beers flawless taste, enriching its yeast characteristics by additional balance and complexity, as well as a copper note, brought to the palate by the otherwise soft carbonation bubbles. Finishes with hay infused yeast, weaker on the spices than during the beginning, absorbed by profound, sweeter malts, pleasantly feathered by leafy hops.

Convinces by its perfect mixture of flavors, creating a fantastic balance, tied together by a very smooth mouthfeel, while remaining its refreshing impact.

(Bottle, 0.5 l - BB 03.04.16, from Alko, 20150815) The beer poured golden and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had clove and fruitiness. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, clove, grass, malts, hint of tartness and medium bitterness. Aftertaste was fruity, spicy and bitter. A tasty brew but a bit too harsh.
Beer pours a beautiful light cloudy amber. Effervescent on the palate with notes of citrus and orange upfront with a malty backside. Sessionable and delicious. This beer tastes like another!
Tap at Mr Beerys. Crystal clear straw with visible bubbles forming a nice white head. Soft wheaty aroma with a slight hint of banana. Nice smooth wheat flavor. Classic drinking beer!

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2016 WYGLĄD: Barwa złota, klarowne. Piana drobna, trwała, wysoka.
AROMAT: Dosyć intensywny. Klasyczne: banany, nuty chlebowe, goździki, guma balonowa.
SMAK: Słodowe. Sporo akcentów goździka i gumy balonowej. Wysokie nasycenie.
SB inte Oskarshamn, flaska. Banan frisk mycket friskk. Kolsyra i övermäktig mängd. Oförarglig.
500 ml bottle into weizen glass. Sweet spicy wheat nose. Pours a clear pale yellow with the typical towering head. Light carbonation. Smooth creamy mouthfeel with spicy/umami finish. Good weizen.

Filtered clear, light gold color. Impressive white head that leaves extensive lace.

Nice sour smell of raw wheat. Theres light hop in the background.

Frothy taste of light (watery, even) malt up front. Weak wheat that also features some definitive sourness. Short aftertaste of mild citrus. Very light body with a high level of carbonation.

Not my cup of tea--this beer has no flaws but is otherwise very pedestrian.
Bottle. Pours a clear golden amber color. Aroma and taste are light malts, banana, and some grass.
Bottled from AH in Mestreech. Light yellow color, huge head. Sweet nose. Aroma is wheat, hops and flat. Flavour is wheat, banana and soft hops. KIt is a kristallweizen, but too sterile toi be good.

500 ml bottle
Appearance: Clear golden beer with big white head. Leaving nice spots of lacing
Aroma: banana, clove and wheat.
Taste: Moderate sweet. light fruity, some banana and wheat with yeast and spices. Light bitterrness in the finish. A bit watery aftertaste of tofee, banana and wheat.
Light- moderate body, decent carbonation. Clearly a kristalweizen Prime Example of the style.

Aroma has some banana and honey, hints of citrus. Colour is dark yellow, very clear, white foamy head. Palate has relatively lot of bubbles, mouthfeeling is quite close to sparkling wines. Taste has banana flavours, otherwise its very light and with not so many nuances. Light and sparkling beer, that goes nicely on a hot day, but isnt very interesting.
Bottle. Nice weizen aroma with a little aroma of banana. Nixe taste. I prefer the hefe weizen from weihenstephaner but this is a good one

Bottle from Stockmann in Tallinn. BB 03.12.15. Very clear, pale golden colour with a big white frothy head. Looks similar to Original Helles I think, only the head seems bigger and I see more bubbles rising. On the nose its sweet, I get a lot of bubblegum and banana notes, as well as wheat, dough, herbal hops. Some bandaid too unfortunately. Tastes very crisp and malty, semisweet, then herbal bitter, with a dry, cloying finish. Light body, very active carbonation. Sharp, even stingy. Strange... not exactly my kind of thing. Its my first Kristallweizen, but I dare say it doesnt feel right - I would almost say its gone off. Will sooner or later give it another try.

Bottle.

A: Brilliant gold with a foamy white head.

N: Big biscuit, some pine, peppercorn, wild honey, lavender and coriander.

T: Goodly sweet, light bitterness.

M: Light body, foamy carbonation, no alcohol presence.

O: This is quite different but very very good. Easy drinking.

500 ml bottle
Clear white golden beer with big white head. Aroma has banana, clove, toffee and wheat bread. Flavor has light fruitiness, banana, some yeastiness and some spiciness. Palate is medium full and foamy. Finish has mild bitterness. Aftertaste is watery with some sweet toffee, wheat and banana. Faint yeastiness. The aftertaste is a bit stingy actually. Not as rich as the unfiltered. Mostly had this just to get the style tick.
Pours "Kristall" clear pale yellow with big white head. Herbal clove spicy aroma. Light malt sweetness. Herbal German, clove, wheat and hay.

Clara dourada,límpida,brilhante,espuma abundante e duradoura;aroma e sabor frutado e condimentado,aparecendo banana,cravo,tutti frutti,malte e fermento,leve,refrescante,adocicada sem ser enjoativa,boa drinkability. Weizen seguindo a boa tradição da Weihenstephan,mais leve em comparação a versão não filtrada,boa pedida para quem quer uma cerveja leve e facil de beber.

Bottle from Plonk. Pale amber crystal clear pour with big rocky white head. Hefeweizen esters are subtle banana and pear, subtle, that distinctive weihenstephaner yeast. Without the yeast its more subtle than their regular hefe, but still hits a nice balance.

Pours a clear straw gold with substantial white head that dissipates steadily.
Nose is grass, cereal, light honey. First taste is unexpectedly sour, but not unpleasantly so. Bitter lemon complements the usual banana note, while the spice is mild.
The attraction here is the carbonation, which provides a refreshing effervescence even through the dry finish. Otherwise, this is a very restrained beer, good for a quaff on a hot day.
Bottle served in a ceramic mug. Aroma is honey, light spice, wheat, Belgian-esque notes. Flavor is light and playful. Wheat and spice and grassy notes. Very timid brew but pleasing.

Pilsener pour, very nice carbonation, generous soapy head. A: Pilsener malts, fresh grass and hay notes, some banana and lemon. Quite a bitter sensation. T: relatively clean and crisp, resembles Pilsener. In the middle some fruity notes start to develop, lemon, grass, hint of banana, even some almonds. Ends with a wheaty, mildy dry aftertaste with a slightly coppery sensation from the foam. Not bad.

Bottle BBE: 13.01.16. Well-chilled. Pours a clear straw/golden with a quickly-dissipating, loose white head. Continuous stream of bubbles from bottom to top - almost lagerish in appearance. Strong over-ripe banana aroma, cloves, bubble gum and chalk. Unusually, the first taste is acidic or sour, with a medium bitterness and a medium-heavy sweetness following on. Theres bit of body, probably medium, and a dry leathery texture. Very high carbonation and a lasting finish. Overall this is an odd experience - a decent refreshment on its own, but the ugly sister compared to the unfiltered goodness.
This is my favourite wheat beer. As youd expect from the name it is crystal clear, light on aroma, but great taste that you could just keep on drinking.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Kristallklares goldgelb mit reichlich festem Schaum. Malzig, Banane, hefig süffig, sehr spritzig. Insgesamt ein klasse Kristallweizen.

Bottle, 500mL. Home. A clear light golden beer ; bubbly ; average white head with a poor retention. Cereal aroma, herbs, citrus, light clove, skunky note. Light sweet, light dry bitter ; light refreshing ; acid note. Light body, thin texture, fizzy carbonation, short dry sweet finish. Overall, a good refreshing kristallweizen ; light dry ; light spicy.

Spisane z Notatek kiedy Ratebeer był w zeszycie i główne poszukiwania nowych piw i smaków, odkrywanie świata to były głównie piwa zagraniczne w dużej mierze niemieckie, 
Piwo wypite: maj 2008, 
Z notatek wynika że smakowało jak na tamten czas :)
Bottle: Poured a clear golden color with strong carbonation and a tall white head. The aroma was malts, citrus and banana while the flavor was spice, biscuit and banana. Very good.
Bottle. Golden pour, white head. Aroma of grain, yeast, banana and wheat. Taste has lots of that typical German banana yeast and some sweet wheat. Simple, but drinkable.

The Kristallweizen in this renowned series, with an obviously cristal clear, pure golden blonde colour with a fierce whirlpool of bubbles rising up from the bottom, like champagne; they support a big, frothy, snow white, rocky and flowery head. Looks truly stunning. Aroma expectedly has a lot of sourish wheat, a bit sourdough-like, along with soap, white bread, fresh banana, cloves, vanilla ice cream, white grape peel, red apple. Taste is softly fruity, notably sweet, with a big presence of banana flavour (more than in any other Kristallweizen I had so far), spicy yeast notes, minerally carbonation sparkling on the tongue, deep and elegant wheat sourishness which, together with the strong carbo, dries the mouth a bit; mouthfeel is smooth, supple and a bit oily. Underneath the banana and the wheat, a very pleasant, soft bready maltiness provides structure. The finish continues the wheat sourishness and barley sweetishness, which keep lingering in the throat, but a leafy background hop bitterishness is added too, for structural purposes. I prefer Hefeweizen over Kristallweizen but in this style, this is surely among the most well-balanced examples Ive had. Has more fruit (banana) flavour than usual and finds perfect balance between its different flavour components. Weihenstephaner quality standard, Id even regard this as the archetypical example of its style.

500 ml bottle with a BB date of 11 Dec. 2015.
Pours light golden with excellent clarity and a high level of visible carbonation flowing up to an over-sized, frothy head. 
The aroma features banana and clove with a light bready base. The flavor follows. 

O: Not a favored style; even so, not as great for style as expected.

Poured into a weizen glass.

3.5 A: Clear medium yellow color. Big ass 4+ finger pillowy white head. Retention is very good, but only a few whisps of lacing are left.

4.0 S: This smells like the regular hefe without the yeast component. Lots of clove, then more clove, then clove, then peppery spiciness. Neutral wheatiness. Its missing something without the yeastiness, but its still pretty damn good.

3.5 T: Like the nose, the taste is missing that integral part of what makes the hefe so good. Clove, neutral wheat, and pepper. A few hints of banana. Again, still good, but not world class.

3.5 M: Medium body. Good carbonation despite the massive head. This lacks the creaminess that the regular has. 

3.5 D: If you havent noticed the theme yet, this is a shell of its normal hefe self. Its still a pretty damn good shell, but I dont see a reason to ever buy this if the hefe is available.

This is excellent yellow beer. The aroma absolutely bursts with notes of malt, hops, and spice in a very Belgian-like presentation. The taste continues this trend, splitting the difference between a pilsner and a helles with some Belgian qualities again. The palate is medium bodied with a note of spice at the end. Perhaps the greatest lager I have tasted.
Pours a clear straw yellow with a thick creamy head. Sweet, spicy and yeasty aroma. Banana, spice, caramel malt flavours. Slight bitterness. Medium mouth feel. A good wheat beer.

Bottle. Pours golden clear with a big foamy white head. Lots of carbonation. Aroma is of wheat, malt, spice, and banana. Taste is of wheat, banana, and bready malt. Has a fair amount of spiciness as well. Lingering spicy taste with lots of banana. Mouthfeel is light and very carbonated. Easy to drink, it tastes good, and I liked it.

500ml bottle, pours clear gold, small bubbly white head. Aroma is big on banana and bubblegum, light wheatiness and caramel. Very clean and crisp with a dry light bitter finish. Light bodied, slightly oily texture, carbonation soft to average.

Bottle (50cl): Served in a shaker:
Medium sized white head.
Clear lime yellow colored beer.
Aromas of wheat, herbs, vanilla, sweet spice tones, light malt, some flowers, fruity...
Flavours of wheat, banana, vanilla, bitters, light herbs, bisquit, hint of marzipan, some sweet grains, hay...
Aftertaste is light fruity, with malts, bitters and herbs and a vanilla creamy edge.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: UPDATED: MAY 5, 2015 Very good brew. All is here like perfect weizen. You don even notice absence of yeast, and you dont believe you actually drink this crystal clear golden liquid from your glass. Maybe a bit thin body, still drinkable and refreshing.

Very well brewed but not for me. Clear yellow with a persistent creamy head and perfect carbonation. In flavor it is almost like a hefe weisse but not as nice. Probably a great accomplishment
 to brew a clear weisse but whats the point if the result is not as good. The opaqueness from yeast in the bottle has never been a disadvantage of the style to me. Enjoyed drinking this but next time I will have a hefe again.

Aroma: caramel, roasty, leather, banana, alcohol. Appearance: pale, clear, minimal head, white foam. Taste: light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour. Palate: light body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,

Like a Belgiany bud. Filtered clear yellow pour with high white head. Nose is Belgian yeast, esters, and simple malts. Light almost medium body with a little heft. Belgian yeast, bubble gum, lagery malts. Simple clean and nice for like $3 a bottle

Bottle poured. From notes. Pours a crystal clear (just as advertised) gold color with a lasting white head. Banana and some belgian yeast flavor and aroma. High carb. Another nice beer in an impressive lineup from these guys. Enjoyed this.
Clear golden color with huge head. Aroma is wheat, yeast, banana. Flavor is wheat, banana, bit sweet.Tasty!

Couleur dorée, bonne mousse blanche. Nez malté et fruité (banane), style hefeweizen. Gout levures (ester?), banane, leger houblonné et clou de girofle. Corps moyen. Pas trop mal pour le style. Fin épicée

Bottle from Wine Rack in Ripon. Pours straw coloured with a big white frothy head. Mild banana aroma. The taste has plenty of banana. Herbal and grass notes too along with light spice. Refreshing and enjoyable
Poured from bottle nice golden color with a thick white head. Aromas of bananna, clove, and wheat. Taste is light and crisp with slight bitterness in the end.

500ml bottle from Prost! My first crystal weissbier. Pours clear yellow gold with a white head. Aroma is banana, clove. Flavor follows, light on the banana, more pronounced on the clove. Good mouthfeel, easy drinking.

Pours a clear pale gold color with a thick white head. Banana, clove, wheat, floral, bread and malt aroma. Clove, banana, apple, pear, wheat, floral, bread lemon and malt flavors. Medium light body and average carbonation. Banana, clove and bready finish.

Aroma: caramel, roasty, leather, banana, alcohol. Appearance: pale, clear, minimal head, white foam. Taste: light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour. Palate: light body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,

Fine white head over Krisstal clear light golden beer. Aroma and flavour is wheaty and yes there is nutmeg and subtle cloves in there. Crisp n clean in the mouth. Well carbonated. Clove/Nutmeg after taste is odd.

This is actually pretty yummy. I cant say Ive tried a kristall-weissbier before, but I do like wheat beers. I havent had one for a long time until I got some hoegaarden on offer yesterday, so today I had a look at what else they had, and this was on the shelf.
Its quite a lot lighter, and obviously doesnt have the haze of a hefe. Mouthfeel is wonderful though, I could see myself getting through a grand amount of these on a hot summers day.

(Bottle) Pale golden colour with frothy, lasting, white head. Malty, spicy nose with notes of bread, grass, citrus, banana, soap and a touch of coriander. Malty, spicy taste with bread, citrus, coriander, banana and a dry finish with low bitterness. Rather light body, with just a touch of sweetness. Tasty and well balanced, but lacking some of the complexity of the hefeweizen. Quite nice.

Light golden, white head, decent head retention, and mild lacing. Bananna, caramel, bubblegum, and citrus notes. 

Medium bodied, citrus, lemon, wheat, and salt notes. Nice balance, mild bitterness, silky. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of wheat, banana, spicy yeast, floral notes. Flavour is moderate sweet with a light bitter finish. Nice decent Weizen.
Bottle to weiss glass. Crystal clear. Biting effervescence. Lots of banana and obviously thinner than a regular weiss.
@ Nedre Mölla 7/1-15. Bottle from Systembolaget. Wheaty and estery with notes of banana and cloves, also light yeasty. Body is light to medium, the finish has notes of banana and clove.

@ Havregatan 150105. Bottle (500 ml) from Systembolaget. Wheaty and estery with light yeasty and light spicy notes, banana, sweet, light to medium body with a watery texture. The finish is dry, sweet and wheaty.
nice malty with slight hop aroma. golden and crystal clear with a nice head. taste is mostly malty with a slight hop. also banana and clove notes. smooth finish

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours a clear golden yellow colour with a big white head. Yeasty aroma, with banana and fruits. Fairly sweet with a distinct sweetness to finish. Medium body, average carbonation.

Backlog rating. Bottle at home from Ales by Mail. It pours a clean pale straw color with a large white head that sticks around. Aroma is yeasty, citrusy and grainy with notes of banana and bread dough. Taste is crispy and tangy, with notes of grains, hay, citrus, banana, yeast, spices. Finishes quite spicy and dry. Light bodied with lively carbonation. Lacks some character and body compared to the original version, but retains the highly drinkability and good part of the flavour.

Bottle; pours clear gold with big white head; aroma is wheat with some fruit and honey; taste is light and sweet with wheat, fruits, honey, and a light spice; semi dry finish; not very bitter; nice beer
500ml Bottle at home alone. Clear golden with a white head. Mild spice flavour. Moderate grainy wheat finish. Nice.

Very interesting beer, like a lager-weiss crossover. Not got the same aaaaahhhh of the hefe but I love this little curiosity of a beer and not a type Im familiar of at all. Looks amazing and pilsner esque, almost too golden and handsome for words then it bangs you with those cloves and banana flavours of a hefe. Silky on the palate and feels royal when you sip. I just wish it was a hefe but a great beer practical joke. Whats that plain john, want another boring lager that youve been drinking for 8 million years? OK Ill pore it mate then hit im with this fucker. Good one, he might thank you for it.....
Very fizzy and effervescent, almost champagne like. Taste is weisse, banana and clove, maybe a touch sweeter.
Geweldig lekkere kristall weisse dit. Drinkt heerlijk weg. Weinig tot geen schuim. Mooi helder bier.

On bottle from Systembolaget Strømstad. Clear golden color, good foam. Fruity and floral aromas, some banana; medium/low aroma intensity. Medium/light body & medium complexity. SOme bitterness, good balance. Enjoyable, but a bit disappointing on aroma intensity.
Very effervescent and sparkling on the tongue. Almost champagne-like. Light gold and smooth tasting.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2014 500ml bottle poured in its own weizen glass.
A - Huge fluffy bubbled aired white head. many tiny bubbles fleeing from the bottom. Pale yellow and clear color. A filtered Weiss, right?
S - Strong smell of banana in the nose. Cinnamon and cloves. Delicious flowery-spicy combination. Also malts and yeasts. The pure definition of liquid bread
T - Much like the aroma. Wheat is very evident followed by the banana and spices (again, cinnamon and cloves). A bit earthy too. Very very light hops bitterness. Just great
M - Medium and bit molasses body. Big carbonation. Dry taste and light bitterness. Very pleasant and drinkable
O - Delicious as expected from a Weihenstephaner. Refreshing and delicious
[ BA Review @ 6/8/2011 ]

Bottle @ De Tolly Joogipood. Pours clear golden with medium white head. Aroma of wheat malts, some honey, fruity. Taste is refreshing, some sweetness,wheat malts, banana, fruity, grassy, some pleasant yeast in aftertaste. Light body. Good beer.

Poured from bottle to glass. Clear straw hue with creamy white head that settled. Aroma is wheat, honey, straw, sulphur, clove. Mouthfeel is great with a medium light body and crisp carbonation. Taste is dry throughout with a noble hop bitterness following and slight sulphur finish. Overall this is a good brew.

Transfer from BA review on 11-29-13-

 Poured from bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance  The beer pours a golden color with a fizzy white head of two fingers. The head fades relatively quickly, fading to leave a lighter level of streaky lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma is mainly of a grainy and bready smell mixed with aromas of some sweeter caramel and a bit of light fruits (banana, orange, and pear). Rounding out the aroma are some quite light but detectable aromas of some spice of clove and coriander as well as a yeasty cake aroma.

 Taste  The taste begins with a slightly grainy and moderately caramel sweetened flavor. As the taste advances some of the yeast and spice greet the tongue with the caramel fading but being replaced by some lighter fruit flavors of banana and citrus. More toward the end, a somewhat grassy flavor comes to the tongue as well as the grainy tastes seeming to amplify to some extent, with the mix of flavors in the end, leaving a rather nice clean and malty flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the average side for a brew of 5.4 % abv with a carbonation level that is on the average side as well. Both are rather nice for the blend of grainy malt, sweet, and lightly hopped flavors of the beer and make for a very easy drinking brew.

 Overall  A nice very easy drinking brew with some great blend of tastes making it a nice flavorful drinker.

"hands down the best filtered wheat ive ever had. the aroma had a touch of skunk at first, but was actually quite nice. the flavor was near perfect in its bubble gum-banana-clove goodness. fresh, smooth, makes me wonder how good the unfiltered version is. can Schneider have a rival?"
filtered weissbier, yellow color, rocky and uneven head, foams quite a lot, typical weissbier aroma = banana, boring weissbier

Pours light bubbly pale golden color with big foamy white head. Light malty aroma with spicy yeast , cloves and floral hops. Light sweet malt flavor with crisp citrus and spicy yeast finish with cloves.
Bottle. Clear, golden, frothy, white foam, lightly bitter, light sweetness, light body, thin feel, lively, & long finish.
Clean and refreshing wheat beer with lots of banana and a little bit of yeast. Not much of a body yet never feeling watery.

Good retention and light lacing. Smells of banana, spices and bubblegum. Tastes of spices, banana cloves and bubblegum aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
50cl bottle. Clear golden colour with a nice white head. Clove, light banana and bubblegum in the aroma. Average carbonation and light body. Overall, nice refreshing beer.
Bottle. Looks like a pilsner, but with a nice aroma of banana and clove. Taste is slightly sour, banana, bubblegum and a touch of spice. Tasty and refreshing, but I prefer the unfiltered version.

Bottle from Asda. Clear, pale gold. Thick, dense white head. Lots of clove. Antiseptic. Overripe banana. Taste has a little fruity sweetness, but is mostly spicy dry. Fairly full bodied. Finishes spicy dry.

500 ml bottle @ "Prater Biergarten",Prentzlauer Berg, Berlin.
July 26, 2014.
Beer served in a Weizen glass.
Pale golden color with a creamy white head and regular carbonation.
Aroma is yeast,citrus,grass,a bit banana and some wheat.
Tastes crisp and yeasty.
A refreshing liquid on a hot summer afternoon and 30 C.
bottle at a bar. poured a deep golden colour with a nice thick white head. wheats, grains, banana, yeast, herbal notes, malty finish, ok...

Clear golden with great looking full white head. Banana, cloves, light other spices and some stone fruits. Fresh dough with a light creamy touch of white wine. Medium bodied with again light creamy feel and slight dry finish. Pretty good stuff, though slightly too heavy on the cloves for me.
Bottle. One finger, white, medium lasting heaf, some lace. Straw yellow, chrystal clear. Floral wheaty aroma. Hoppy delicious taste. Very good.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle 0.5l from local Alko. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, wheat, fruits, banana and malts.
Bottle. Pours clear, light golden with some head. Nose and taste has ripe bananas, yeast, cereal and some orange peel.
Flaska från Systembolaget. Klar ljusgul vätska med muffigt vitt skum. Jästig veteölsdoft. Kanske den mest smaklösa av veteölen jag druckit, men inte på ett dåligt sätt. En riktig törstsläckare.
A great beer for a hot day; light, yet crisp taste with a smooth finish. Not an everyday standard, but an enjoyable drink.

Bottle from Gator Beverage. Pours slightly hazy but nearly clear light golden yellow with a big fluffy white head. Aroma of yeasty banana esters, hay and wheat, pears and light fruits. Flavor is banana, yeast, hay, a honey sweetness that makes this sweeter than a hefe, pears. Pretty much tastes like it smells. Very light bodied with plus carbonation with a lingering sweetness on the tongue. A nice brew overall that I would never turn down.
Out of the bottle and enjoyed during the WC final. Clear and deep straw with a full white head. Wheat nose and flavor, with slight spice in the backing. Nothing great, but also not bad.

Pint bottle. $3.99 at Wells. Pours, well, crystal clear, with a yellow tinge. Big pillowy white head. Little if any lacing. Aroma is subtle: yeast, banana, malt. Flavor is much the same. Almost like drinking water. Deliciously light yeast-banana water. 

My favorite part of this beer is the appearance. When poured, the clear nature of the liquid make this phenomenon clearly visible: a tornado of carbonation spiraling up from the bottom of my pint glass (not the proper glassware, but hey). I stared in fascination, then drank the beer. 

The best light beer Ive ever had.
Clean in appearance, with a fine German hop aroma. Some fruit in the flavor. Very nice.
På flaska från systemet. Ljusgul färg. Luktar vete. Smakar skumbanan. Lång eftersmak.

This beer is has a very olivey, hoppy after taste color is Krystal clear light yellow . Also has a bitter taste not for the weak over all would not drink it again leave that for the curious. Good luck
Golden in color hazy with a thin head. Easy drinking Hefe. Nice flavors good fruit like flavors linger throughout.

The beautiful bastards at Weihenstephaner have done it again. This was my first Kristallweizen but Im sold. The appearance was extremely sexy. Effervescent, clear, heady, golden. Im convinced that this beers looks will get you laid. Potential sex partners will shed their clothes and inhibitions at the sight of this glorious beer. Okay, I might be exaggerating a little but its a really good looking beer. Smell is excellent, too. The aroma had some banana, clove, and yeast. Taste had lots of banana, a good amount of bubblegum sweetness, cream, and spicy yeast. White meat and creamy cheeses would be a perfect match for this ale. Kristall was silky smooth, light, and refreshing. This one is perfect for when you want a wheat ale thats a bit more fitting for a special occasion.

Bottle.

A- Banana, laffy taffy,spices, wheat.

A- Yellow color, crystal clear liquid, white head.

T- Banana, banana, banana taffy, slight spice, wheat, slightly sweet, bubblegum.

P- Light body, average texture, average carbonation, smooth finish.

O- Tons of banana in here. A lot like Banana laffy taffy. A little bit of spice like cloves and coriander come through as well as a hint of bubble gum that make it feel like a lesser Hefeweizen, but lesser doesnt mean worse! The banana and flavor is just outstanding! The appearance too. I have never seen a beer so clear. Its like looking through a glass of hinted water. Just a great beer. Really want to try more of this style now.

The body has a clear golden color with lots of beautiful carbonation steaming up to the surface. The pour produced a very tall, aggressive and tight foamy head. It has a bright white color with great retention and lacing. Its nose is full of fruity yeast with notes of banana and clove. There are notes of pale beady wheat as well and just a touch of citrus. The flavor is very bright and fresh with plenty of fruity yeast. There are notes of banana, clove and a slight hint of citrus fade into dry crisp wheat malt notes. The finish is very crisp and snappy with some wheat tang and citrus quickly leaving the tongue. The body has a solid medium feel with cleansing active carbonation.

For those that believe their Bud Light is refreshing, they need to try one of these. Clean aroma of wheat and slight citrus. Clear golden appearance with a white head. Light and watery palate with good carbonation. The finish is clean. Great blend of wheat, citrus and pale malts. This has a German feel that makes it traditional yet unique. Good summer beer.
Bottle from Lazy Dog. Pours a transparent golden with a layer of off white head. Aroma of bananas, yeast, and bread malts. Taste is nice and crisp, the yeast hits you first then the bananas join in.
0,5l bottle from Alko Hietalahti. Pours clear golden with a high head. Aroma is malts, wheat and yeast. Flavor is malts, wheat, yeast and banana. Quite nice for a kristallweizen.

From the bottle, pours a clear light amber with a frothy white foam. Grains, hay, and grass like aromas. Body is light with a slight bitterness. Wheatgrass with a touch of toasted like flavor. Bitterness and a slight sourness from the wheat completes the finish.

Smell of yeast, grain, banana. Very pale yellow colour, almost clear. Extreme white head. Aroma of honeydew melon, banana, sugar, yeast, finishes with grain. Very sweet. Rich but soft carbon. Kristallweizen is not among my favourites, but as they go, this is one of the better ones.

On draught at Prost - pours clear golden with medium thick head. Nose of cloves, banana, grass. Taste is of smooth balance if grass, cloves, and banana .

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours crystal golden pale with thin white head. Soft fruity aroma, dry taste. A bit of banana taste too
Bottle 50cl from Alko. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of wheat, some banana. Wheat, hay, banana in the sweetish flavor.
Very good complexity, not over the top anywhere results in a great brew, tasty with a light flavored meal

Bottle bought @ systembolaget. Pours clear pale golden with a big frothy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving some sticky spotty trace on the glass. Smell is slightly sweet with wheat crackers, white bread, cloves, banana leaves, hay and lemon zest. Taste is tiny sweet, tiny bitter, tiny sour, malty, estery and tiny spicy with wheat crackers, heavy cloves, hay, dry soil, white pepper corns, banana bread, lemon zest and pear skins. Mouthfeel is soft, round and light to medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet, tiny sour, malty, estery and tiny spicy with wheat crackers, banana bread, hay, cloves and white pepper corns. Solid...

Crystal clear, golden and bubbly beer with a huge foamy head. Citrus, yeast and banana on the nose. Sweet banana, yeast and citrus flavors. Light to medium bodied. Crispy carbonation. A really refreshing weissbier.

50cl shared bottle @ home from Mitra. Clear pale color, strong big white long lasting head, good lacing. Aroma citrus, apple, floral in the nose, flavor is candy sweets, pie, moderated cereal, slightly yeasty. Taste medium sweetness, hint of citric sourness. Light to medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation, fine sweetish finish. Very refreshing, easy to drink, great with a dinner.

Habe lang kein Kristallweizen mehr getrunken... Die Farbe ist schön und auch der Geruch ist weizig und hefig, wie es auch bei einem Kristal sein soll. Dieses Bier unterscheidet sich nicht deutlich vom Hefeweizen von der gleichen Brauerei. Ich vermisse das Anderartige hier. Allerdings kann man nicht gegen den Geschmach sagen. Alles ist einfach rund aber nicht überragend.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2016 BB 28.01.17. Poured a crystal clear pale golden yellow colour with a two- to three-finger bright white frothy head that retained very well and laced very well. Carbonation lively, high and coarse. Aroma of moderately strong cloves, grainy malt, and light sweet fruit/banana. Taste of sweet banana, low to moderate strength cloves, slight malt, light yeast and hint of wheat. Light body. Crisp, light, clean, refreshing with a lingering moderately strong spicy banana finish.
Bottle 50 CL. Pours golden with massive white foaming head. Spicy, banana, grass. Not too bad.

Weihenstephaner Kristall Weissbier is a solid wheat beer from Germany. Clear yellow pour with a thick frothy head with some wheat aroma. Taste has some banana notes and finishes clean. The clear version of a wheat might appeal to those that dont like the thickness of the unfiltered Hefeweizens. Kristall Weiss fills the reputation as a classic German style well.
Golden color , perfect, big , white head. Aroma of wheat , banana and fruits. Wheat, spices and fruits in taste. Medium body , medium carbonation. Fruity finish with light bitterness. Very good beer.

Bottle. Pours clear golden in color with a massive whitish head. Notes of wheat, banana and sweet fruityness in aroma. Banana and wheaty flour notes in taste, some fruitynes as well. Quite good actually, even if this one naturally lacks the final punch when the hefe is missing here. Refreshing though, even if this feels a bit monotonous in the end.

Clear straw with huge creamy/frothy white head and tiny sparkling. Medium strong aroma of wheat, sweetish-ripe fruity tone of banana, slight spicy undertone. Crisp, light bite, light body, medium long finish has same elements, sweet, clove, cinnamon and bubblegum like pointed out before. Very easy to drink and light and refreshing. Really hot day now and this works fine even with bbg going on.
Golden yellow with white foam head. Aroma of yeast and fruit (bananas). Taste malty and also here the bananas. Spicy and good to drink.
50cl bottle from BierNavigatie. Clear golden with a white soapy head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Sweet with some bitter herbal tones. Wheat, banana, yeast and some grass. A decent weizen.
500 ml bottle. Light yellow with large long lasting head. Flavor is of wheat, bananas and some malt. Refreshing, but tastes better with the yeast left in.

Bottle from Beer Gonzo. Pours golden yellow, very slight haze, medium white head which leaves some lace. Bread, banana and spices in the aroma. Tastes clean and crisp, some spice in the finish. Light body with hint of creaminess. Good, refreshing beer.

0,5 l bottle with a good looking redesigned label. Pale yellow golden in the glass, not really clear. High carbonated, for a Weizen, small white head. Banana and yeast on the nose. Tastes a little bit thinner than the standard Weizen, but even the typical banana, yeast and light sweet herb. Dusty end. Not bad for a Kristall Weizen.
Bottle-weizen glass. Clear yellow gold with frothy head. Aroma of clove, banana and apricot. Dry finish.

From bottle. Pale clean yellow. You could read the news through this pour. Thick, persistent white head. Decent lacing. Full, breakfast cereal nose. Earthy with some banana. Medium body. Well balanced tastes of banana and malts. Great mouth feel. Starts fizzy and then moves towards creamy. Very well put together. So many good things for a beer that looks so basic. Perfect summer drinking.
Klar och ljust, guld gul med ett stort gulaktig skum. Doft: Gräs, blomsteräng, banan, trevlig jäst doft, tropiskt frukt godis. Smak: Skumbanan, jäst, gräs, blommigt, gammeldags kola, gräs.

A very fizzy golden yellow coloured beer with a frothy white head. A typical, but potent wheat beer aroma, loads of spice, cinnamon and clove, slightly yeasty, citrus fruit, banana, mango, hints of cereal and bubblegum. Dry mouthfeel. Although there is a full gambit of wheat beer flavours, tropical and citrus fruits, clove spice and a hint of sour yeast, the predominant flavour is the cereal elements, malt and wheat, which does give the taste a slightly sweeter edge. A fizzy, spicy finish. Bottle purchased from the Brewerys store.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours yellowish with a white head. Taste sweet, crisp, banana. I thought this was very good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I drank this beer from a bottle procured at Sherlocks Decatur poured into a Hefe Glass. Reminiscent of a traditional Hefe gone clear. Pours clear straw with big white head which lasted a good while. Scent is banana and cloves. Taste is crisp, sweet, and earthy. Carbonated bite seems more pronounced than a traditional Hefe. Enjoyable beer. Too much to ask for this in cans. Bottle - Sherlocks Wine Merchants - Decatur, GA

Poured from bottle into a tulip glass. Light yellow color with thin head. Tastes include banana, gum, and a hint of citrus. Very light and easy to drink beer while still maintaining a great taste. Really enjoyed this one, would drink again for sure.
A wheat beer that looks strangely like a lager. Pretty similar to the heffe weiss but with a cleaner, crisper feel to it. Pretty unique and very tasty.
Bottle for the style rate. Standard beer yellow with big fluffy head. Nose is banana and candy. Tastes of banana, bubblegum, vanilla, light malt, some grass. Thin palate but crisp.

A- Pours a golden yellow color with a nice, frothy, white, 2 finger head.

S- Faint banana, wheat, light fruits.

T- Lots of banana, very crisp, apricot.

M- Light and bubbly.

D- Very refreshing and light. This is an easy drinker. Great for a summer day.

0.5l bottle. Clear golden color, white and stable head. Aroma is banana, banana and a decent character of bubblegum and clove. Taste is the same, just without the thick and sometimes heavy character of a classic Weißbier. I really love the refreshing character of this brew.

Bottle. Clear gold. Aroma is heavy on banana with a spice background. The taste adds honey. The carb is extremely high and the overall feel is very light and crisp. Not really my thing but, well made overall. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a light gold with a thick white head. Aroma of sweet malt, bananas, bubblegum and spices. Taste follows, light and smooth, really drinkable. Nice hot weather beer
Pale gold, highly carbonated with a thick white head. Banana, spicy aroma. Taste is banana bread and spice, sweet; dry finish

Pretty standard but muted weissbier aroma: banana, clove, bread. Decent carbonation and a creamy mouthful. Taste follows the aroma. Theres a pilsner element which provides crispness and some subtle barley-esque bitterness. Even more refreshing alternative to hefe.

Bottle - Banana, clove and pale malts. Clear fizzy gold with a rich bubbly white head. Banana, clove and a refreshing sweetness that finishes light. A nice style that I prefer to some of the other Weissbiers.

Very bright beer, aroma is a little fruity but very much like clean walnut plank. Finish is very dry, sparkles are "yeasty" more than CO2. Exceptionally clean, bright beer that is just as complimentary to fried scallops as it is to watching the game. If you like Heffs more than brown ales, you might like this even more. NOT a great beer if you like Stouts or IPAs.

Pours a crystal clear light golden with a massive head and lacing. Light nose of yeast coupled with lemon and banana. Light medium body with a smooth texture that is attacked by the effervescence of this well carbonated ale. The flavor profile begins like the nose then progresses to a subtle clove spiciness. The finish is clean with a nice clove twinge that lingers. While outstanding in its own right, it tastes like a light version of Allagash White.
500ml Flasche. Ins Glas ergießt sich ein klares goldgelbes Bier, viel CO2, viel Schaum. Geruch hefig, leicht malzig fruchtig. Geschmack hefig, fruchtig, im Abgang leicht würzig.
Bottle pours clear yellow with big head. Aroma is light malt and spices. Taste is similar with a clean dry finish

0.5l bottle from Schipool, shared with Inbreak @ hotel room in Amsterdam. Wants out of the bottle! A really big nice slowly puffing away fluffy white head on top of a, yeah, crystal clear pale golden body. It still smells just like it should with that nice charismatic Weihenstephan yeasty sweet banana and wheat-sweet nose. A little bit of hay and corn are also most definitely present here. Oh, thats good stuff. Lots of wheat and hay but also a lovely banana sweetness. Its light oily and quite slick on the mouthfeel and the carbonation level is just above average. Really easy to drink. The first one on the Borefts 2013 adventure. 26.09.2013
Golden body topped by generous white head. Wheat, banana and bubblegum aromas. Sweet grass & wheat flavors accent a well-carbonated light body.
Medium foamy white head, clear golden colour, sweet banana creamy smell, creamy medium creamy carbonation and bitter, a bit malty and soft sweet banana notes

Bottle pours clear golden yellow with white head. Aromas of bananas and fruits and yeast. Similar flavors. Pleasantly sweet with mildly sweet finish. Medium mouthfeel and carbonation. Delicious and very drinkable.
Aroma of yeast and dried fruit, a full well laced head that dissipates quickly. Heavy carbonation and a clear amber gold colour. Taste of sour dough with a slightly sour palate.
Pale yellow with some white head. Good retention. Malt, citrus, spice, wheat. Thin body, a bit chewy. you can really taste the alcohol. Smooth brew.

Bottle 0,5l. Pours a golden colour with a small head. Aroma of apple, pear, banana, clove. Same for taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 50cl. Big white head. Clear. Aroma is wheat, banana, yeast and straw. Taste is lighter. Banana, wheat and butter.

Bottle. Pours a slightly cloudy yellow.

Aroma. aroma is that of banana and cinnamon. 

Taste. is similar to aroma.

Overall. good beer, but not as good as their hefeweizen.

DATE TASTED: December 31, 2013... GLASSWARE: Weihenstephaner weizen glass...OCCASION: home fore New Years Eve and hoping this beer delivers like champagne... APPEARANCE: as advertised, crystal gold, mildly effervescent base; thick, cumulous white head; good, persistent, wavy lacing... AROMA: banana, clove, bubblegum and yeast; unmistakably wheaty... PALATE: bubbly, beefy body--yet light and fluid; crisp and clean, with an almost medium-bodied presence...TASTE: bubblegum esters front and center; apple, pear and some clove--an enjoyable experience... OVERALL: a fantastic filtered version of the vividly unfiltered offering; a great combination of drinkability and character; champagne indeed! its refreshing zest pairs well with light cheeses and crackers...
Bottle asda. Golden straw colour white head soon dissapears. Aroma is wheat, yeast and banana. Taste similar with sweet malt finish. Good body medium body and carbonation. Overall decent stuff.
Classico gusto di banana e pane, con qualche nota rinfrescante e citrica. Classica birra da pizza, ben fatta ma senza pretese di eccellenza sopra la media.
Pours a pale golden colour with a vague white head. Strong banana and wheat taste. Sort of a bubblegum taste, pleasing.

500ml bottle, pours clear pale golden with a large off-white head that reduces quickly. Aroma of wheat bread, banana, clove and a hint of spices and lemon peels. Taste is lightly sweet and bitter. Palate is light bodied with a smooth texture and lively carbonation. Mild and refreshing with a little too extended taste of banana. Im not a fan of wheat beers, but this is an okay beer for the style.
Bottle @ Chrisos pre-GBBF Shindig. Gold pour with a small head. The nose is apple, pear, banana, clove. Mashed banana nose, some lemon cake. Sweet, clean. Light body, soft carbonation. Quite good.

Pours a slightly hazy golden color. Thick foamy white head. Muted banana and yeast round out the taste. Easy drinker. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Half litre bottle from Systembolaget. Tall foamy white head. Body is brilliant, bright straw colored. Nose is banana with a candy-fruity twist. Some crisp wheaty notes, too. High carbonation level, light in body. Taste is dry/sweet wheat malts. Lemon and banana fruitiness. No phenols noticable, low on the hops. Crisp, light fizzy finish. Very refreshing, maybe a bit one-dimensional.

(Bottle): Pours a clear pale gold with a white head. Aroma of yeast, banana, clove, spice. Flavour is very wheaty along with yeast, herbs, grass, clove, banana. Its nice but seems like a regular hefeweizen but reigned in.

Light clear yellow pour with medium sized white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, cloves. Taste of wheat , yeast, cloves, sweet corn, faint hops. Light bodied and medium carbonation. Toned down filtered hefeweizen, but sure hit the spot after long hike. pretty good thirst quencher.

Near pint bottle into weizen glass, clear golden color with fluffy white head. Aroma of wheat, some bread and light yeast (clove, banana, bubblegum). Taste is the aroma adding some fruitiness and grass. Light body, moderate carbonation, soft with clean finish. A toned-down hefe but a good toned-down hefe.

Picked up a bottle fairly cheap in Asda and thought I would give it a go. It pours a pale blonde totally see through, reminds me a little of white wine. Minimal bubbly white head which soon goes. Smell iswheat, yeast, banana and ever so slightly herby. Taste is very similar to the smell and not as sweet as I was expecting. Mildly bitter in the finish. This is a refreshing beer and quite drinkable. One I can imagine enjoying more on a warm summers day.
Bottle at the Fiddler, Den Haag. Pours clear golden with an off white head. Aroma of yeast and light fruit. Flavour is moderate sweet and light bitter. Light medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

16.9oz Bottle A - Pours clear golden straw with two finger white head. Good head retention. S - Big Bubblegum. T - Mild wheat malt and a bit of citrus. M - Light bodied. Crisp with a smooth texture. Slightly slick. Clean finish. O - The first light beer...Hefe Light.

A thirst quenching Weiss beer. 
  V

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50cl bottle from drink shop.
Pale gold color with white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast and a little alcohol. Taste of yeast and wheat. Some herbal hints too.

Pours clear straw lager blond, two finger white head

Smell banana and gum

Taste sweet wheat and fluffy clove

Light body

Pretty good. Prefer unfiltered.

Good weizen aroma: fruits, spices, yeast, wheat, sweetness and some dryness (almost like something is burning). Pours straw with nice head. Very small head never dissapears. Medium-soft carbonation. Taste: sweet, wheat, some sourness. Finish: sour with hints of wheat and sweetness. Overall: rather light beer. This one really tastes and looks like castrated hefeweizen. Still Im not sure why one should drink this, when regular hefeweizen costs same and tastes a lot better.
Quite estery - easy drinker - clean palate - quite gassy - pleasant for a change from my usual hoppy pale ales.
Unusually tasty kristallweizen where many of the classic flavors managed to remain despite the filtration.

Appearance: Clear golden/amber with very thick white head. frothed over onto worktop.
Aroma: Clove, nutmeg, bubblegum, cinnamon, mineral, hay and bread.
Taste: Low sweetness, medium bitterness and sourness.
Palate: Light rough texture, light body, prickly carbonation, astringent lingering spicy and malty finish.
Comments: Very tasty.

From a bottle. Pours very clear gold with a tall bubbly white head. Tastes like lemon, banana, herbs, vegetables, dough. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like bubblegum, banana, wheat, herbs. Smooth and very good.

Bottle. Pours clear gold with thick, fizzy white head. Aroma is banana, bubblegum, wheat, cereal malts, and light lemon. Flavor matches the nose with sweet malts, banana, wheat, light fruit esters, and faint toast; crisp, dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.
Bottle at home. Pours clear golden. Aroma is banana, some citrus and malty. Taste is moderate sweet. Medium body with soft carbonation. Well balanced.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2013 This is the second beer I?ve had from the world?s oldest brewery, and both are top-ten material. This one has a little more bite than the hefeweisen, so it tanks a little lower. Other than that it?s pretty much perfect.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 26.09.2013, 0,5l bottle shared with Palme @ hotel in Amsterdam:
Nice creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly fruity, light malts, banana, bubblegum, dough, harsh wet hay, hints of citrus. Taste is wheat, hay, yeast, grass, citrus peel. Medium bitterness. So boring as a beer style as usual. One of the few beer style that should never have been invented at all.
Bottle pours clear pale gold with big white head. Straw, banana, caramel, bread. Body is lightly sweet and bitter. Light carbonation on smooth medium body.
Golden with nice soft head. Aroma yeast, banana. Taste well balanced hops malt, banana, yeast. Light body text smooth, carb aver. Finish banana yeast.
