Bottle. Pours a clear amber, white head that doesnt linger. Aroma is light to moderate malts, wheat, light banana, yeast. Taste is moderate sweet. Short finish.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2013 Bottle: golden-yellow with insane clarity, covered by a foamy, white, and well retained cap - nice lacing left behind. Aroma is full of clove, banana esters, mild taffy... Kind of light compared to the regular hefeweizen, but still a good amount of yeast. Taste also has lots of clove and banana, perhaps the two heaviest yeast flavors, under which lies some sweet, biscuit & bread flavors from the malt lie. Lots of dry, toasty wheat in the finish as well. Very nice beer, almost like a slightly lighter version of their amazing Hefe.

500ml bottle from Appellation Wines, Dalry. Pours clear gold with a thick white head, high carbonation keeps the head around. Classic weiss banana and clove aromas. Very fresh and crisp. Good creamy texture, short finish. Nice.

Pours a clear pale yellow into the glass leaving a nice white head.

Smells of classic German hefe profile. Lots of spiciness with some banana and a little clove.

Very light crisp flavor profile. You can taste the spice from Noble hops and it finishes with a little banana flavor with just a touch of clove.

Very light mouthfeel with high carbonation levels.

An outstanding example as I would expect from Weihenstephaner. Not overpowering on the clove which is usually what kills most beers of similar styles for me.
Just tried this one, not as good as some of the other Weihenstephaner offerings, but an ok beer.
This beer is a little bit flovourless and I will not be buying it again. I did not like the taste.
Pours clear golden with very thin head. Mild hops aroma, tastes almost fruity, thin in the mouth and well carbonated. Not that bad.

Nymålat i porterrummet och nyoljat köksbord som luktar i hela lägenheten. Således optimala förutsättningar att bedöma doftregistret i en weiß. Fin klar färg vilket jag inte är van med när det gäller weiß men det gör väl inget. Sedvanliga dofter av nejlika och mogen banan. Lättdrucken och fin. Till en lunch bestående av oxfilé. Passade helt ok även om en tung porter säkert varit bättre.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Light golden in colour, high carbonation, large head. These Weihenstephan guys know how to make wheat beer! I was all ready to dismiss this as another dull Kristall, another wheat beer with all the flavour taken out. But this was actually quite tasty, yeasty wheat flavour, some apple and clove, pleasant quenching finish. Id still prefer a fully cloudy hefe but this was nice.

12oz bottle. Pours a clear gold, color with a big, pillowy white head, that leaves sheets of lace behind. Aroma is sweet banana and clove esters, and a touch of herbal hop notes. Flavor is slighlty more subdued than the aroma with notes of clove, with just a touch of banana. As the beer warms, you lose more of the esters, and get a more herbal hoppy bitterness. Very clean and smooth, with a light body, higher carbonation.
September 2010. Pours pale yellow with a white head. Crisp and clear. Aromas of banana, spice and malt. Lemon and clove flavors.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Clear golden beer with a big frothy head which collapses into a very small one. Wheaty malty aroma with some banana. Flavour is wheat malts and banana esthers. Everything a little less than in unfiltered version, except zero yeast. Medium body and very nice soft mouthfeel. Suprisingly good for a filtered wheat.
Pours clear light yellow with white head and no lacing. Aroma of bananas and cloves. Taste is the same with a carmel malt back end. Refreshing.
Really enjoyed this bear. Very clear, crisp and refreshing. Add this to my favorites.

Fruity crisp delicious refreshing Classic German weisbeer. Hints of honey and caramel in the finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Beautiful clear light brown color with good yeast/wheaty aroma. Taste was so smooth and crisp. Wheat, light banana, sweet, yeasty, very pure and quenching. Excellent kristallweizen.
Clear straw with high, tight head. Bananas prominent throughout with a bit of vanilla coming thru in the finish. Very good, creamy mouthfeel.

Bottle at Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 2013. First Krystal Weiss tick. Crystal clear yellow with a fluffy persistent white head. Aroma is prominent banna bread yeast esters. Clean wheat and bready malt. Crisp finihs.
Flasche 50cl. Wunderbar perlendes und erfrischendes Bier, malzig, säuerlich, obergärig.
Bottle from Theatre of Wine, Greenwich. Yellow/gold pour with a white head. Banana, red apple and pineapple aroma. Banana and pear drop flavour. Quite sweet but pleasant. Long sweet finish. Nice.
Bottle. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, some banana and cloves. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some toffee, malt and wheat. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle. A clear, golden beer with a dense small off-white head. Banana, bubblegum notes and some, grassy, piney hints. Very soft on the palate, medium body. Sweet flavor with banana and some bubblegum and cloves. Pleasant finish. Certainly a pleasant kristall. 130906
Clear yellow golden color with a foamy white head. Malty, lightly sweet. Caramel and nuts, then a punchy finish.

Serving: 500 ml. bottle from Total Wine Sterling. It pours a clear gold color with a large head of stark white foam. The nose has a good dose of clove and slight banana. On the palate, the wheat comes through a little more with a hint of dough, heavy clove, and medium banana. Finishes very clean. Light body with a snappy finish. Very refreshing and highly sessionable.
light golden color with a good head. Taste is fairly light but flavorful ...hard to place the taste though, Slightly fruity, but also wheaty...decent and smooth but nothing to write home about.

Tap @ Bavarian Bier Cafe. I actually prefer this (just) to the highly famed Hefe. Perhaps because it was on tap? Clear, pale yellow with frothy head that dissipated to allow the banana, bubblegum and spice to come through on the nose. Big flavours again of banana and bubblegum, a touch of clove, grass, citrus and a delicious sour element from the wheat. Well balanced sweet/sour/bitter elements throughout the palate. A great refresher at the end of a summers day.
Clear pale gold color. Nose balanced more towards the clove and gentle banana with some salty wheat. Flavor similar, soft, with gentle clove, banana and salty wheat. Low on the citrus.

Bottle pours very pale yellow with large foamy head. Aroma slight spice, banana, malts and grass. Taste follows aroma with some clove. Medium palate. Finish dull, very slightly bitter like bubblegum with all the sweetness out. Alcohol not apparent, easy drinking.

Bottle at Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 2013, 10/08/13. 
Clear pale golden with a thin off white covering.
Nose is toasty malts, light spice, touch of banana, clove, weiss light.
Taste carries more clout but still weiss light, nana, yeast, clove, toffee.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, dry in the execution. 
Drinkable stuff but not having had a K Weiss for some years it reminds me why I always head to the full monty and not the little brother!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Typical weißbier aroma with a gorgeous colour and head. Indeed crystal clean in looks and taste with banana notes and finish. Summery but interesting enough for winter.

50cl BB 10/04/2014. Thankfully pours none too cristalline clear-filtered, still full of WSt Seizen taste, with a slightly leaner mf. Fresh peaches, ripe citrus, almond malts, medium banana. A delight.

Bottle, 500 ml, poured into a weizen glass at home. ABV 5.4%
As it says, crystl clear body, with a deep golden yellow colour, and a huge snow white head sitting on top. Good retention and medium lacing left on the glass. Steady, continuous activity in there.
Great aroma, with tons of banana and bubblegum and a bit of clove on the background.
On the taste the clove moves forward, very notable and covers most of the other flavours, only releasing the bubblegum on the aftertaste.
Medium body, good carbonation with a bite.
Nice weizen, I dont find any difference from the hefes except the clarity.

Mmm, det här är ju gott, det råder inga tvivel om men när man vet att det finns en ofiltrerad variant så blir det svårt göra den rättvisa. I vilket fall så bar smaken toner av krydda, banan och citrus, kroppen är okej och balansen närvarande.

500mL bottle into my New Belgium Globe. didnt all fit in though. Very large white head, mostly tiny bubbles. Nose of light banana, not much clove, and hints of vanilla. Bright clarity, deep yellow to orange color. Flavor is initially grainy with some notes of banana. the carbonic bite quickly takes over and finishes slightly dry. A lingering light tartness leaves you with a slight dry sensation. overall, good, but not one I would drink more than one of. much prefer the more intense flavors of fresh and unfiltered hefes
Pours a very clear and pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is malt, wheat, yeast with some fruit. Taste is medium sweet of fruit and wheat leading to a yeasty finish. Decent.
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is wheat, malt, banana. Flavour is wheat, malt, banana, orange. medium body. OK beer.
Poured from a cold bottle. Clear golden color, white frothy head. Slight apple sour smell. Light banana and Cinnamon taste.

Bottle from systembolaget. 
ar: earthy, spicy yeastiness, coriander, wheat, bread, hay, grass, citrus, herbs, bubblegum, very powerful for a kristall, banana, grains, corn. 
ap: golden, clear, sparkling, frothy medium white head. 
T: light but noticable sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, yeast is evident, lots of corny notes, herbal hoppiness, lots of spicy notes, bread, grains and hay. 
p: medium body, thin feel, lively, astringent, sweet and slightly warming finish. 
T: impressive!

Bottle at home. Pours clear golden with billowing head that dissipated after about 30 seconds. Well carbonated. Aroma is full of bananas and bubble gum. Taste brings immediate banana followed by the acidic twang of the carbonation. More doughy, yeasty notes follow from there. Palate is lively, though slightly watery. Finish brings a little astringent bitterness and more dough. This is my first kristallweizen and it definitely conforms to the "castrated hefe" description from the style information. Still pretty good though.

@basunen: trevlig lagom vetedoft. Inga särskilda skumbananer. Smaken är lätt, trevlig utan att sticka ut på något sätt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Clear light golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of grain, banana, bread, light corn, clove and earth. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of grain, bread, vanilla, banana and earth. Light to medium bodied with medium to high carbonation. Quite nice.

On draught at Apex. Super clear golden color with bubbles and more bubbles. Aroma of banana, clove, and light malty biscuit. Taste is reminiscent of German hefeweizen, but more clear and crisp. Sweet malt and banana finish.

Flaska från SB. En bra weiss kristall, om man nu vill ha det. Förlorar mycket i karaktär jämfört med Hefe men fortfarande god. Stiltypisk med skumbanan, citrus, säd och lätt syrlighet och viss sötma och anningen nejlika. God.
If I have to drink a Pilsner it will be a German one. Not a fan of Pilsners they are too sweet for me. This is no exception. I guess this like German Budweiser.

Bottle, 50cl - Clear golden beer with a large white head. Aroma is spicy with notes of wheat, bananas, tropical fruit and hay. Flavor is malty with notes of spices, wheat, tropical fruit and yeast. Balanced and refreshing beer, though nothing special.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours clear straw.colored with a huge white small-bubble head. Aroma has wheat, ham, light banana and clove. Taste is sweet malt with a very light spice clove finish. Very easy drinkable but a bit too bland. Carbonation is lower than expected.
Bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a longlasting white head. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy banana aroma. Fruity wheat malty spicy banana flavor. Has a wheat malty spicy banana finish.
500 ml bottle. Crystal clear golden with massive white head. Aroma is malty, wheat, bread, yeast and lemon peels. Taste is very wheaty, yeast, bread and citrus.

Pours a huge frothy white head that mostly diminishes. Body is light yellow and clear, sparkles are visible. 
Aroma contains light malts (light bread, hay, molasses), light hops (citrus fruits), light yeasts (dough, leather) and banana, grape, raisin, pear, and clove. 
Flavor starts off light acidic, then goes to sweet and light acidic, to finish in sweet, light acidic and faint bitter. 
Body is medium with creamy texture and soft carbonation. 
A good refreshing beer but I prefer its unfiltered brother Hefe Weissbier. The Kristallweissbier is more bitter, less sweet and contains less fruits then the latter.

Draught @ Weihenstephaner Berlin am Hackeschen Markt, Berlin
Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, banana and floral. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter. Body is light to medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2013 Bottle. Clear light yellow pour with a white head. Doughy aromas. Mild cereal, grain, and yeast notes. Light, clean, and refreshing. There is no doubt Getman beers are made to be consumed in German Beer gardens during the the spring and fall when the sun is shining and the weather is mild.

Bottle. Pours a über-pale straw yellow, clear, big rocky white head with excellent retention, mad lacing. Nose is yeasty funk, some metallic meets leather (headbanger?) and some cloves, hint of nutmeg. Mouth is light bodied, a little too light to slightly watery, but big on the banana, clove and fizzy wheat dryness, bread on the back end. Finishes quietly. Really refreshing (83 degrees and 90% humidity at 10:30ish on a summer evening here in Chicago... this was a perfect beer for the weather). Really nice.
Really a nice wheat beer, just sort of on the watery side. I expected a lot better from this brewery especially. Aromas and flavor are bland clove and banana with a bitter toffee finish. Meh.
Clear light golden, white head. Banana, light hops and some wheat dominate taste and aroma. Not my thing.

Pours kristalklar yellow with high white head
Aromas of wheat, coriander, citrus, bread
Nice refreshing balanced taste. Somewhat sweeter than expected

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice refreshing beer. Light. Nice golden color. Upscale lawnmower beer. Serve cold.

Poured from bottle. Crisp yellow/golden color. Small white head. Aroma is spice and banana, fruity, my wife says juicy fruit gum, and I think she is right. Fruity sweet banana taste, like the gum. Wow. A little too sweet for me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50cl bottle from the brewery. Pours a crystal clear straw colored body with an inch thick, foamy and frothy, white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a moderate lacing. Aroma is lightly sweetened and grainy wheat malts with a light citrus, some banana, and a light clove. Flavor is nice. Lightly sweetened, bready wheat malts with a nice vanilla note and a balanced clove and banana element. Touches of citrus towards the end before this finishes clean and a tad sweet before leaving a fairly lengthy aftertaste. Light-medium body and a soft, lively carbonation. Overall, a really nice kristallweizen. Clean, smooth, and very easy drinking. I like the touch of vanilla that the yeast gives off. Good one.

I can see why these are called Crystal Wheat beers. This beer pours a crystal clear gold colour with a huge fluffy white head. Aroma is wheat malt, bananas, and spices. The flavour is refreshingly sweet but not overpowering.

A sea of ferns, everywhere, for as far as the eye can see. Great, gnarled trees reached upwards, in clumps, tangling branches, entwined. As we marched the clink of mail on steel echoed across the silent valley, masking the gentle roll of water sliding into the wooden carcass of the ship. Fear gripped the bravest heart. The horde awaited.
Kristall baby! Gotta love these, basically a better breed of lager. Is that racialist?

Bottle at home.
Clear yellow coloured with a small white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel, spices and bananas.
Fruity flavour of caramel, bananas and hops.
Hoppy finish.

Head: off-white, big, creamy, avg. retention. Colour: yellow, clear.

Aroma: banana, clove, some sourness. Taste: more spicy than sweet, clove, some fruit, some CO2 sourness. 

Smells like a real weisse, but the CO sourness is a bit disturbing. As expected, the lack of yeast, loses it some body, but gains in drinkability.

Pint nine bottle shared. Poured a light hazy yellow color with big white frothy head that lingers  nice bright wheat aroma with malt. The flavor is sparkling clean or should I say evervescent. Nice malt black one followed by the wheat and carbonation. Very good.

Yellow clear pour.  Big white head that lasts.  Aroma of eggs yeasty dough spicy rye.  Tastes sweet and spicy and wheaty and bubblegumy and like ozone.  A bit syrupy on the palate, but it also has a nice lactic mouthyfeel.  Deserves to be drunk.

Bottle. Pours a clear gold with plenty of white head. Decent retention and some thin lacing. Aroma is wheaty, sweet, grainy/cereal, mildly fruity. Flavor is wheaty, very sweet, mild banana, with a sweet, banana, wheat finish, almost little too sweet for my liking. Moderate carbonation, light to medium body, and crisp texture, quite drinkable. A light, sweet wheat beer.

16.9 oz bottle to half-pint glass (shared with the Mrs.). Looks solid; a transparent gold with fluffy white head that dissipates into lacing fairly quickly. Smells doughy and wheaty with a touch of clove and banana; similar to a hefe, only milder. Tastes like it smells with a nice, crisp mouthfeel. Not bad.
bread, banana, lightly bitter, pale, clear, white foam, medium body, lively,

Bottle from Asda; clear straw yellow pour with substantial foamy white head, bready & banana aroma, clove spice taste with banana a hint of citrus all the wit characteristics in abundance, refreshing carbonation crisp mouthfeel.

16.9oz served into a Weizen glass.

A - Pours 3 fingers of white moundy suds and slowly sinks into a small collar. Brilliantly clear body with active streaming bubbles.

S - Spicy yeast, green banana, clove, white bread, sweet pale malt.

T - Clean flavors of banana bread, clove, yeast, wheat, green pear, and a dash of lemon. Floral hops combined with the carbonation adds a very crisp finish.

M - Moderate prickly carbonation, light to medium body, very clean feel.

Very clean flavors with excellent carbonation. The nose is mellow compared to the flavor. This would hit the spot on a hot day.

Serving type: bottle

04-06-2012

Pours clear pale yellow with pillowy white head.  Smell is some clove and banana, grainy, dough.  Taste is similar and like the Original just on a diet.  Just more grainy and less bursting flavor.  Ok.
50cl bottle. Pours bright golden with a white fast diminishing head. Aroma is weary, malty, banana. Flavor is malty, citrus, a bout lemony. Interesting beer, refreshing.

Bottle at home. Pour is pale straw/lemon in appearance with a big white head and good lacing. Big wheaty aroma - straw, light citrus, a touch of clove, somewhat doughy, and banana. Taste is citrusy - light lemon and banana - heavy wheaty, straw, somewhat floral, and grassy with a touch of spice on the backend. Medium body with huge carbonation. Nice Summer beer.
not bad, a rather typical german wheat beer but undoubtedly a good one. there seems to be a bit to much alcohol present here but otherwise a tasty sparkling treat.

500ml bottle. Pours a clear light golden colour, foamy white head of fine bubbles which slowly diminishes and nose is wheaty with banana, bread & yeast. Taste is sweet, malt, wheat, banana with notes of bubble gum and spicy light bitterness.  Foamy mouth feel, light bodied, well carbonated, dry finish. Quite drinkable.

Pours perfectly clear the color of light straw yellow with a tinge of something green.  Champagne effervescence and a billowy white head that is loathe to recede and just stays with a thick collar and cap. Soapy wet lace. Very beautiful.  Nose is yeast, banana, clove. fruity lemon and peppery with a little skunk.  Taste is light as a feather and follows the nose.  Banana, sweet grain, bubblegum, a touch metallic and just a little bitter to end.  Malt comes forward as it warms but never becomes too sweet.  Finishes dry with a hint of apples and pear.  Soft, creamy and earthy.  Delicate.
UPDATED: APR 22, 2013 Bottle at home. Pours a pale gold with generous, quickly dissipating white head. Bready aroma. Clean, crisp wheaty taste. Lively, light mouthfeel.

Type: 500ml bottle 
Glass: Pilsner glass 
From: K&B Wine Cellars in Allied Gardens (San Diego), Calif. 
Price: $3.99 
Purchased: April 19, 2013
Consumed: April 20, 2013
Misc.: Part of the bottle reads Brewed under the purity law, of 1516.

Poured a golden straw clear color with 4-5 fingers of pillowy head. Average-to-below average wet watery lacing. Below average-to-minimal retention on the top.

Completely different smells from skunky malts to banana and cloves. The banana and cloves (hefeweizen) seemed to take over. Grassy malts as well.

Tasted much smoother than the smell. Hefeweizen notes - banana, cloves, sweet sugary lemon notes, a bit of Circus Peanuts dominate here. Skunky, grassy, bready malt backbone wont go away though and is what ends up on my tongue when its all said and done.

Light body. Thin-to-oily texture. Average carbonation. Long, refreshing finish.

Another good beer by Weihenstephaner, but not my favorite by any means. The others Ive had were better.
On tap at hessin house..trying to enjoy this while the boot keeps getting passed to me.. :(     :)   aroma of a hispital...taste is pretty ok...i think..im drunk right now but its not offensive

Good German beer that's easy to drink.. Has that classic German taste... Almost a smoky aroma.. Good beer to share with everyone 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

EIn simples Bierchen, das mir von A bis Z nach Vanille roch und schmeckte. Leicht erfrischend und etwas zu süß, aber irgendwie auch dünn und dumpf. Ich wollte es mögen, aber am Ende nur gehobener Durchschnitt.
Clear golden colour with steady head and medium body. Nose of yeast. Taste of fresh and sparkling yeast, fresh malt, green grains and champagne. Very easy to drink and very refreshing.

Nice blond, somewhat whitecolored beer. Somewhat fruity and sweet aroma. Full taste of wheat, and no bitterness at all. The aftertaste is the same, but doesnt last long.

Mooi blond, ietwat witkleurig bier. Ietwat fruitig en zoetig aroma. Volle smaak van tarwe waar geen bitterheid in te bekennen is. De nasmaak is hetzelfde, maar blijft niet lang hangen.
16.9 oz bottle.  Golden and clear with a white head.  The aroma and flavor is bananas, yeast, spices, herbs and wheat malts.  Light to medium body with a fluffy feel and nice carbonation.
Clear yellow, lively carbonation. Large fluffy white head. Light aroma, banana and clove. Crisp, light, muted hefe flavors. Nice lingering banana.

Sampler on tap at Central City. A blatant attempt by me to score another style category, but this was quite refreshing and enjoyable. Pours clear straw golden with a thin eggshell head that left behind some thick lace. Fairly complex nose involving soft, peppery clove notes, touches of citrus, and spicy noble hop notes. Fairly sweet with a decent balancing bitterness. Light and crisp with a medium length spicy finish. A nice easygoing brew and, to me, more enjoyable than a lot of hefes Ive had. Im not generally a supporter of filtering, but I liked the results here.

My first and only Kristallweizen to date, I have little with which to compare this beer, save for weizens of other styles.  Pour is noteworthy for its very light gold color and large, bubbly white head.  Nose is very typically wheat as is the flavor.  A little spice lingers in the aftertaste but, otherwise, this is not terribly notable.  Overall, a decent offering, but not one Id likely seek out again.

Mar 2012 - tasty, complex, sweet aftertaste like the hefe but not as nice as the hefe, seems a little too carbonated which detracts from the flavour
Aug 2012 - had a cold one, this one had a slight lager taste, but still a sweet taste and more rounded deep aftertaste, the coldness dulls the flavours, As it warmed up, flavours came out.

Bottle. Clear light golden, big, frothy white head. Sweet, muscat, candy aroma. 
Tastes sweet, a little metallic, a little like sweet white wine. Light body, a little sticky, long finish.
This review is exported from olutopas.info with no comment. Original rating date  8.7.2010

1 Pt. 0.9 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Pours a very nice and clear light gold with a nice white head and tons of carbonation. Aroma is predominantly  yeast, grain and fruits. Taste a nice balanced combination of sweet fruits, malts and spices. Great beer very refreshing and enjoyable. Also nice dry finish.

Appearance: clear light gold color, very large white head that lasts a while

Aroma: banana, intense aroma, lemon, 

Taste: banana, bread,  slightest bit of hops at the end 

Palate: moderate c02, very frothy, very slight hop aftertaste 

Overall: delicious, not very complex, very drinkable, one of my favorite breweries 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pale golden yellow, medium large white head.  Aroma wheat, banana.  Light body, some carbonation.  Flavor also wheat, estery, bubblegum.  Bit of lemon.  Fairly sweet but nice slightly dry and sour finish.
Pours a clear yellow gild with thick white head. Aroma is banana, wheat and yeast. Taste is comparable.

$3.99. To stemmed glass it pours a yellowish golden with an eruptive snowy white head two to three fingers in length. Aromas of wine lees, wheat bread, German yeast and some brief spices. And, guess what? Tastes the same.

500 ml bottle into signature weizen glass, bottled 7/24/2012.  Pours fairly crystal clear golden straw color with a nice 2-3 finger dense and fluffy bright white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts.  Spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with plenty of streaming carbonation.  Aromas of big lemon, pear, banana, clove, wheat, pepper, bubblegum, floral, and yeast earthiness.  Fantastic aromas with great  balance and complexity of fruity/spicy yeast esters with nice strength.  Taste of lemon, pear, banana, clove, wheat, pepper, bubblegum, floral, and earthy yeast spiciness.  Lingering notes of banana, light fruits, clove, wheat, pepper, bubblegum, floral, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a bit.  Damn nice balance and complexity of fruity and spicy esters; with a good amount of robustness; and zero cloying flavors present after the finish.  High carbonation and medium bodied; with a crisp, smooth, and moderately prickly mouthfeel that is fantastic.  Alcohol is very well hidden with almost zero warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is a fantastic kristall weissbier!  Great balance and complexity of fruity and spicy esters; extremely smooth and crisp to drink.  A highly enjoyable offering.
Bottle at Bar Central, Stockholm. Clear golden colour with a thick white head.  Sweet citrus, malt aroma. Flavour is very much citrus, sweet, malty.

Lovely wheat beer. As this was filtered I expected less flavour but in fact at similar ABV this beer packs more flavour than the Erdinger Weissbier I have just previously finished. Looks like a pale lager but tastes a whole lot better. Sweet aroma somewhere between banana and pear drops sweets but with a peppery quality. Lovely sour wheat beer tatse with a dry finish. Very refreshing.

Bottled August of 2012.
Appearance: Great looking beer, crystal clear golden body with lots of carbonation in the body with a pillowy white head on top.
Aroma: The aroma is light with floral hints along with bubblegum, banana and a touch of cloves.
Taste: This is balanced nicely with some malt flavors a touch of bubblegum, banana, and cloves. This is very easy to drink, I enjoy it.
Palate: Light and lively on the tongue.
Overall: I prefer Sixpoints Apollo, but this is excellent too and a great bargain.

Sweet on nose, malty, a bit yeasty fruity. Pours pale yellow, sparkling and bubbly. Taste is,sweet with nice herbal hoped bitter. Dry mouthfeel, flowery aftertaste. Quite decent, xri kable sample. Was e,pecting more.

50 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100603.
Pours clear golden color with a small head. Aroma of wheat, fruits, some mild hops and grass. Flavor of wheat, hay, buttery notes and fruits.
UPDATED: JUN 24, 2013 Bottled 0.5l ; Devon ; UK ; Wheat,yeast and fruity aroma ; Yellow color with huge lasting head ; Sweeter taste with yeast notes ; Very pleasant beer.

500 mL bottle from the LCBO, served in a branded weizen glass. Pours clear straw-golden with a large, fluffy white head and champagne carbonation. The head fades slowly to a thin cover and leaves a small amount of fine lace. The nose has big notes of wheat, lemon, clove and banana. The flavour is somewhat sweet throughout with dry wheat notes and just a hint of herbal, bitter hops. There are light notes of clove throughout. The finish is long, moderately bitter and spicy. On the palate, it is light in body with a smooth, milky texture and plenty of carbonation. Overall, this is a decent krystallweizen with elegant notes of banana and clove. Not the most complex of beers, but a great summer thirst quencher. 2012-09-12

Extremely clear light gold in color. Large head, good lacing. Good head retention, miniimal carbonation. Slight smell of cloves. Light tasting slightly malty with a hint of banana, smooth finish. Excellent drink-ability, a good session beer. An great alternative to American Macrobrews.

Colour is almost like lager, kristall is a bit strange weissbier to me. Aroma has these ordinary weissbier qualitys, some banana and sweet fruits. I dont know if this beer is too cold or what it is,  but  carbonation is almost too aggressive on this beer. Damn this carbonation! Its clearly too powerful, this would be great if it wouldnt be so carbonated. Its a shame really. I bet this is just too cold, I need to try this again when its not so cold.

Bottle from Whole Foods El Segundo. Lovely banana aroma with some light lemon and a bit of yeast. Very pale straw color, fluffy white head, and huge carbonation bubbling up. Mild bready and fruity initial / mid has some good lemony notes and a tinge of metallic character / smooth malty finish. Thin body. Smooth, crisp, and very clean. Very good stuff

It pours a light yellow and gives a nice one inch foamy white head in my weizen glass. The head dies down to a light cling film over top of the body. Some light carbonation is seen rising. The smell has the yeast up front with big wheat malt coming through as the beer warms. Some light clove makes a slight presence in the smell as well. The taste is balanced between sweet and bitter through the "kristal" malts and previously mentioned flavors. The aftertaste has an acceptable wheat bite. The palate is medium with some harshness on the tongue. It leaves a sticky finish. It is mostly drinkable. Overall, this is good for its style and good for me, however, probably better in the summer.

500ml bottle poured into pint glass. Lemon coloured with short lived creamy white head. Bananas to the fore in aroma and taste. Something else going on taste wise which I cantt put my finger on. Faint licquorice, lemon and maybe mango. Surprisingly creamy in taste and on the palate. Almost perfect carbonation. Very good beer and not at all what I was expecting.

Poured from a bottle into a weizen glass, the appearance is a clean clear gold with white head which reduces to a thin layer, the aroma is citrus, hay, crisp light with some tang. Nice refreshing feel.
The normal weissbier is great and so is this one. Its a lot creamier in the palate than youd expect. Has that great Weihenstephaner aroma and flavor. Perfect weissbier. From t Fust in Amsterdam.

500ml bottle. Pours clear yellow with magnificent thick white head. Aromas of banana and citrus. Highly effervescent. Taste is refreshing with a touch of citrus.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A nice clear golden yellow body, a nice frothy white head that faded down to a thin coating, nice lacing.  Aroma had strong white notes, a good mix of clove, banana and some black pepper.  Flavor was initially mildly sweet from the wheat.  Banana and cloves really went well together and complemented the wheat notes almost beautifully.  Body had some nice carbonation.  Smooth and easy to drink.

Pours clear gold with a medium fluffy white head that quickly dissipated.  Aroma is banana, yeast, clove and earthy.  Taste is sweet with a tinge of citrus bitterness, more of a crispness then bitter.  Light bodied with a smooth texture.  Excellent.

Drunk from an old Schneiders .5l glass. Some of the most ferocious ubiquitous beading I have ever seen. Super pure white big big 2 or 3 inch rocky head tops the light yellow crystal clear body. Takes an awfully long time to pour. Has an almost liquorice nose with a restrained  slightly peppery spiky clove to taste but not at all over the top.
Body has a beautiful lightness of touch & is far removed from the cloying quality other beers in this style often suffer from.
Im not a session, or sessionable type of guy but I could drink this all day.
Hugely enjoyable. Love it.

50 cl bottle @ Majarannan Sauna. Rated on 04.06.2010
Aroma has some banana esthers, wheaty notes and distant floral notes. Flavour feels a bit odd with banana esthers, wheat, citrus and hints of cardboard. Quite good for a kristallweizen. Still I see no reason to drink this as the non‐filtered Weihenstephaner is much better.

Crystal clear golden-wheat colored body, large white head, quickly receded leaving behind minimal lacing.  Nose is wheat, banana, and clove. Flavor is similar.  Simple but pleasant. A slightly dumbed down version of their hefeweizen. Medium to light bodied, appropriate carbonation, refreshing finish.
Bottle->SA. Straw color with frothy white head, high carbonation.  Aroma: yeast, bread, banana.  Taste: banana bread with clove kicker.  Interesting.
Drinkable Kristall and true to form, but does not really shine.  Give me a hefe any day.

Bottle for Christmas.  Clear  yellow, highly sparkling, with a huge, frothy head.  Aroma is very strongly lemon and lime.  Lovely thick, smooth mouthfeel, quite lively.  Taste is sweet banana, vanilla, caramel and yeast.  This is absolutely delicious - one of my favourite wheats.
Clear yellow color with nice bubbles. Lemony aroma with light malts; creamy palate is malty but crisp and bright with yeast an lemon zest flavours.

Bottle from Peckhams Union Square. It pours clear golden yellow with a thick white head. The nose is sweet banana, wheat, nutmeg, clove. The taste is wheat, pithy lemon, orange peel, dough, banana and spice with a very dry finish. Medium body and effervescent carbonation. Pretty smooth and drinkable, but I cant say Im a great fan of the style.

Pours a clear golden yellow from bottle with fluffy white head and decent lacing. Aroma of german yeast, banana, spice, sweetness; typical germam weisse notes. Taste follows, thin on the mouth with bubbly carbonation. Easy to drink and refreshing, but not my favorite.

Bouteille 500ml. De couleur jaune et claire. Nez de levures fruitées (bananes, moyen dagrumes) et moyennement épicées (clou de girofle), moyen de blé, léger de gomme balloune et de céréales fraîches. Moyenne-mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture légèrement crémeuse et aux petites notes aqueuses. Moyen goût de levures fruitées (bananes, léger dagrumes) aux notes épicées (clou de girofle) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de blé ainsi que des céréales fraîches et légèrement sucrées puis en finale lon retrouve des notes herbeuses. Post-goût moyen-court, composé dun léger goût de blé et de levures fruitées (pelures de bananes).

500ml bottle. Pour is brilliant clear gold with a huge cloudy white head. Few fine bubbles rising in the glass. Lovely sweet banana, clove and wheat nose. Taste follows the nose, bright and fresh weiss. Thin bodied, soft carbonation. Rising sweetness in the finish. Incredibly drinkable. Lovely.
Bottle. Pours a deep golden straw. Fluffy white head. Typical wheat aromas of bananas and spice. Taste shows heaps of wheat malt sweetness. Medium mouthfeel. Not my favourite style but not too bad.

Great weizen.  Clear, yellowish cold appearance with a healthy head.  Fruity, banana aroma with some subtle spicing.  Flavor is well-balanced, not much bitterness, but evenly distributed with the sweet maltiness.

Shared from a bottle .5 l bottle at home.  Pours a crystal clear pale gold with a pale frothy white head.  Sweet yeast aroma.  Smooth and balanced. Not a hint of bitterness. Not the beer of choice for hop heads.

Golden colour with a big white head. Mild sweet wheat and some banana notes in the aroma. Medium body. Balanced sweetness. Rich carbonation. Banana and wheat flavour almost like an hefe weisse. Probably the best kristallweisse I have tasted.[Bottle at McKays in Troon, Scotland]
5.4% pale golden colour with a thin head, sweet aroma, usual nice wheat beer taste, good.

Crisp, sweet, fruity nose with strong banana notes, as well as clove, orange, and grain. My impression of it was definitely not that of a toned-down W.H.Wb. Sharp, fruity tasteperhaps a bit tangier than that of its non-filtered sibling. Medium, oily mouthfeel with soothing carbonation that doesnt get in the way.

Aroma is bubblegum and banana. Appearance is transparent straw yellow with fast disappearing head. Taste is similar to aroma with bubblegum and banana, but also maybe apricot and some magno as well as hints of floral esters with a very mild bitterness. Palate is pretty simple, hints of bitterness around the mouth is about it. Overall, a refreshing beer, but nothing too complex.

Half Liter Bottle from Germany. Weihenstephaner continues to impress me. This is a delicious weizen. Wheat, hay scent with hints of perfume and pils. White, bubbly foam head with a bubbly golden pour. The feel was similar to the look, bubbly with a crisp finish. And the flavor was a wheat/pilsener mix, grain and wheat sweetness with a touch of a bitter finish.

Clear golden colour with larger white head. Aroma of yeast, malt and banana with a flavour to match and a sweet finish. 

--- BeerItsNice

Weihenstephaner Kristall Weissbier has an extremely thick, rocky, dense, white head and a clear, yellow-golden, bubbly appearance, with heavy lacing left on the glass. The aroma is predominately of coriander, with some background white bread. Taste is of coriander spice, white bread, sugar, and there is just the faintest bitterness. Mouthfeel is light to medium, and Weihenstephaner Kristall Weissbier finishes somewhat crisp, mostly dry, refreshing, and easily drinkable. Overall, this is a most excellent beer. RJT
Smells like a pilsener crossed with a hefeweizen, with a bit of skunk. Tastes similar, but feels light and crisp with a nice carbonation. Very drinkable.

Bottle. Banana, yeasty wheat malt, and light clove aroma. Clear golden  yellow with a ginormous, thick creamy white head. Sweet banana, wheat malt flavor. Very clean tasting. Light to medium body. moderate carbonation.

Bottle. Nice clear color,long sweetish taste,medium head and long palate. Fresh beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle, clean golden color, with a fothy bubbly white head, very nice banana, ripe apple, fruity, doughy yeastiness nose, with some light pear, white peach, spicy vanilla accents, within a pale, wheat, bready malt aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a good yeasty spicy cinnamon, apple strudel, doughy, vanilla character, with a light pale, wheaty honeyish maltiness flavour, leading towards a fruity apple sauce yeastiness, doughy, vanillaa, honeyed wheat maltiness finish.
500ml bottle. Clear golden color. Small white head. Sweet, grainy, what, syrup in aroma. Too sweet, malty, grainy, minerals in flavor.

Cloudy yellow gold with a thin white head, ok lace and tons of bubbles. Bananas, clove, bubble gum on the nose. Flavor is all wheat with a touch of spice and ripe fruit. Light body, effervescent, and a lingering wheat malt sweetness.

banana, hay, citrus, basement aromas, golden, clear, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, lively
Bottle.   Best before 06. Jun 2013
Bottle. Pours clear golden with a white head. Notes of vanilla and banana. Sweet and smooth. Elegant, but maybe a bit too nice?

Has a big banana/clove scent with a little skunkiness. Taste has some spice and clove, clean body and refreshing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at SBWF.
Pours clear straw yellow with a white head.
A very clean, light and drinkable brew.

Bottle. Clear yellow, high carbonation. Aroma is yeast, straw, bready malt, banana a hint of almond. Light body, yeasty and slightly sweet with a dry refreshing finish. Good on a hot day or with something spicy!

50cl bottle courtesy of and split with 77ships @ Delirium Hoppy Loft. Thanks Eugène for helping me get the very last beer style on RB.
Bière dorée, col blanc moyen crémeux.
Arôme reste très semblable à une Hefe avec qcq phénoles et esters.

Palais fruité ester, léger banane le tout compléter par des notes houblonnées amer, girofle et esters banane, le tout compléter par un malt léger. Ce dernier reste discret en ajout minime dans les tons pilsner - pâle malts.

Au final, une bière solide, très dans le style allemand sans pour cela transcender le style. Le filtrage enlève un peu de volupté habituelle tout en conservant le profile unique de la levure et des esters.

500 ml bottle shared @ Delirium Hoppy Loft. This was originally just intended as a mere style tick but man this was a pretty big surprise to me, pretty damn good, I actually liked this way more than their hefe. I did try their hefe expecting to be blown away whilst I tried this hoping that it wouldnt be too bad. Honestly a filtered hefe is not something that sounds terribly appealing. Small gusher, did not expect that. Pours fittingly crystal-clear, rather pale golden with a white head. The nose is rater mellow and soft but rather enjoyable, mellow wheat with a touch banana, soft with some complimenting spices, mild cereal. Taste is soft banana, wheat with some soft corn pure and tad corn cereal, white sugar and some light bubblegum, it is very light, highly enjoyable and very easy to drink, lovely soft, mellow sweet flavour. It is not watery by any means but drinks like water, very easy, light. Possibly the first filtered beer I truly enjoy and certainly the first instance when I like the filtered version more. As an everyday or bbq beer this would be pretty sweet.

Poured into a tall glass. Three fingers of head. Clear, golden color with lots of bubbles.
Smells like apples and wheat.
It also tastes like apples, and banana with a slight bitterness.
Crisp texture, moderate carbonation and medium body. Clean finish.
Delicious.

Pours a very clear golden with moderate carbonation, two finger head that persists and leaves moderate lacing. Bright toasted hops and cereal. Mild floral hops, but hardly any hop notes. Sweet and tart on the palate with medium to full body and sticky mouthfeel. Medium slightly sweet finish. Very drinkable beer. 

Addendum: I can appraeciate some clove and banana as well.
Pours light golden color with white head. Wheat, yeast, banana clove aromas and flavors.

This beer pours as an effervescent, clear golden liquid with a white sticky head. The aroma is of wheat and hay, with a hint of banana. The taste is a bit watery, slightly sour and salty. This is a light bodied beer with a slightly slick palate, lots of bubbles and a short bitter aftertaste with wheat. Overall, I found this beer a bit watery but otherwise it had good wheaty features.

Drank at the 2012 Oktoberfest des Québecois on September 9. Pale blonde, small head. Light malt aroma but fragrant, notes of barley sugar. Light taste of pale malt, a little sweet, aftertaste a little dry. Good summer beer!
This is great. Not quite as delicious as their hefe, but the piercing mouthfeel in this makes up for that.

Pours pale yellow and very carbonated. I had to let the head settle in between trying to pour... Nose is heavy of wheat, citrus and lemon. Very flavorful with an almost sour flavor to top it off. A little floral for me on the finish, but overall a very good beer!

Very nice especially considering its filtered. Pours golden straw color into the glass with a white head but dont let the color fool you the nose is big on malt, clove, and banana characters. Flavor is wheat and banana notes. Not as yeasty as an unfiltered but still very respectable.
Pours a clear gold with minimal white head.  Smells of banana, clove.  Taste is standard for a wheat beer, sweet, spiced, lightly bitter.

Bouteille de 500ml, merci Patrick. Superbe robe dorée couverte dune mousse blanche crémeuse. Le nez comporte une forte dose de blé et dépice. Il y a de la banane et du girofle. Même filtrée la levure a laissé sa marque. La bouche est délicieuse, classique dans le style avec son blé et ses épices. Facile à boire même au déjeuner. 7/10

Indeed crystal clear yellow with white foam head. Foam diminishes and slightly lacing to glass. Aroma is malty. Taste is sweeter malt, with some small bread, toast, leaves. Short aftertaste. (Velp 201209)
0.5l bottle. Golden body, white head. Aroma of spicy banana. Taste is the same as the aroma. Not bad, but not as good as their hefeweizen.

Pours a light golden color with a big generous fizzy head... the bubble action in this was spectacular.... Aromas and flavors match well. Bright bubbly beer with lots of spicy clove, round malty wheat and banana. Touch too sweet for my liking but a refreshing quencher at a great price.

16.9oz bottle poured into a large wheat beer glass. Pours a clear gold with a very active, but short lived, two finger head. No lacing to speak of. Aroma and taste are biscuit, cracker, a slight hint of banana with a clean dry finish. Solid beer but I prefer the hefe.

bloody lovely in every department!
one of the finest looking beers ive seen for a long time.   crystal clear with a billowing white head. soft and prickly in the mouth.
banana. metal. slight clove. plenty of grain, biscuit and crusty bread.

bottle. beerritz. leeds

Bottle 500ml.
Pours clear blond with high creamy white head. High lacing. Aroma is of bananas, crisp malt, flowers?. Taste is of bananas, malt, flowers. A decent beer.

3/VIII/2012 -  50cl bottle from Exchange Shopette (Ramstein Airbase) @ Nadines place - BB: n/a - (2012-820) 
Clear pale orange beer, creamy white head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: banana, bit medicinal, spices, chemical, paint. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: quite some banana, cake, bit of grains, little sour. Aftertaste: grains, hay, some citrus, green banana, cookie dough.
Clear blonde body with a tall white head. Aroma is citrus and floreal. Taste is obviously lemon. Refreshing. The best Kristallweizen I had so far

Pours clear golden with medium white head. Aroma: bananas and plisener malt.  Some yeast in the taste. Light, malty sweetness. No aftertaste and no bitterness. Really drinkable and refreshing. Pleasant white beer.

Bottle (500 ml). Clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma of banana, clove, wheat and coriander. Taste is medium sweet with malt, banana, clove, coriander and a slight acidic presence (wheat). Light to medium body. Its a first time I drink a Kristallweizen, so I dont have any comparison but I think its on par if not better than most of the belgian witbier that Ive tasted.
Draught at Weihenstephaner Berlin Am Hackeschen Markt. Clear yellow - white head. Banana. Minerals. Light metallic notes. Sweetness. Light hay. Light bubblegum.

50 cl.  Une bière meilleure avant le 15/02/2013.  Un liquide qui présente une robe jaune scintillante sur laquelle flotte une neige abondante et éternelle.  Pour le coup doeil cest une réussite totale.  Un nez qui nétonne pas mon nerf ofalctif avec ses effluves de banane et ses doux parfums de girofle.  Une bouffée de blé et de malts blonds.  Des saveurs qui ne sortent pas de lordinaire avec un filet de tout et de rien.  Très peu de définitions savoureuses qui touchent la sensibilité de mes papilles.  Un goût qui est cependant loin dêtre déplaisant ou catastrophique.  Peut-être est-ce lapanage de ce type particulier de bière de blé?  Je ne peux répondre à cette question.  Je pense bien boire ici ma première kristal à vie donc je ne dispose daucun comparatif.  En bouche, un corps presque moyen avec un apport plutôt modéré des bulles et une texture qui est sur le point dêtre  aqueuse.  Une finale assez courte qui se fait construire quelque fois par la levure et quelque fois par les céréales.  Une affaire étrange qui flirte beaucoup avec la pils et avec leau.

A-- Poured a light gold color with a big white head that lasted a while before disappearing into a small white layer on top.

S-- Bananna, clove, citrus. Quite a good smell.

T-- Pretty solid. pretty well balanced

M-- Light and well carbonated.

D-- drinkable but got a bit samey near the end of the beer. I thought it was pretty front forward in drinking, better in the beginning than in the end. Good beer for sitting on a balcony in the summer.

16.9 oz bottle pours yellow with a white head.  Aroma of sweet malts.  Taste pretty much all malt.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The beer is a crystal clear light golden hue. The beer is moderately effervescent. The head is thick, fluffy, white and generates a decent amount of lacing on the glass.

The aroma is very similar to that of Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier, with scents of wheat, banana, and clove.

The taste is quite nice, and again, similar in many regards to the unfiltered version. The flavors are there, but perhaps a bit more subtle than the Hefeweissbier. The beer is not as refreshingly delicious either, as the unfiltered version packs such an enormous flavor punch that it completely masks any hint of alcohol.

The feel is smooth and clean, with a slight hint of alcohol in the very back. Carbonation level is medium to high.

A great beer overall. I definitely need to do a side by side compare and contrast session with this and the Hefeweissbier. Weihenstephaner just might be the best brewery in Germany.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-16-2010

Bottle from Sainsburys. Very pale almost clear gold. Beautiful to look at almost flawless. The aroma is a mild sweet smell. Quite fizzy. The taste was a little disappointing, but still good just not as good as a hefeweizen. You can taste the malt with  a touch of spice.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: NOV 19, 2014 pours clear bright golden with a towering white head, very good retention and lacing. loads of bananas, wheat, cloves, hint of acidity, very nice malts - light toastiness, grass and pepper. bright carbonation, light body- oily and honeyish, decent grassy citrusy finish. very good.

Pours a clear very light yellow color with a thick foamy head that lingers a long time.  Smells like hefe with a wheaty, banana, and bubblegum aroma.  Also smells like berries a bit.  Taste is very sweet, almost like liquid bananas.  High carbonation mostly hides the slight alcohol burn in the finish.  This beer has just too much banana flavor for my liking.  But if youre a fan of hefes but prefer it filtered, this is the beer for you.

My first Kristallweizen. Rating no. 1006. Clear yellow body with a thick white head with good retention. Aroma is the classic banana, cloves and wheat, leaning more toward cloves than banana. Aroma is very similar to a hefeweizen. Flavor is crisper than a regular hefeweizen with less depth a hint more maltiness. Body is much dryer, less creamy and thiner than a hefeweizen. I wanted to try the style, but I cant see why someone would pick that over a creamier and more flavorfull hefeweizen.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden body with much bubbling going on beneath the big foamy head. Aroma is mild banana and bubble gum notes, with hints of wort. Grainy bubble gum tones in the taste, along with sweet pale malts. Medium body and carbonation. Very sweet and rather one-dimensional, as is expected with this style, but not exactly bad either.

500ml bottle. Pours a crystal clear pale yellow with a large lasting fluffy white head. Aroma and Taste of wheat, banana, some citrus and grassy notes, with some mild bitterness. Palate is a light to medium body, a crisp clean mouthfeel with good carbonation. Finish is a combination of wheat, sweet citrus and banana flavor, a bit of tart notes with some bitterness on the end for balance. Overall a very good, crisp and refreshing brew. Nicely done

pours light yellow with a thick white head. little champagne like bubbles give off some ripe fruit , banana ester, and astringent hop smell. Has a cif ithampagne characteristics to it. pilsner style malts. Would like to see more of a spice characteristic to it on the finish.

Decent enough summer quaffer. Pours pale straw crystal clear with an initial massive foamy head. Aromas of clove, lemon zest and maybe a hint of banana in the background with a tiny spicy finish. Lots of lively carbonation with a light body in the mouth.

On tap. Nice foamy head, leaving plenty lace. Perfectly clear golden color. Nice banana, clove aroma, great after taste. Light sweet, little zest. Crisp, smooth lighter carbonation, dry finish, great mouthfeel. Tasty, and very easy to drink. Im a fan of this one.

Nice, clear golden colour with a dense, large & persistent head. Aromas are more potent than the palate. Banana, sweet bread & bubblegum domaninate the nose. Maybe a bit lacking in body & flavour. Good carfbonation keeps this beer alive. Slight spice on the finish. I had this with a medium yellow pea curry, and it lifted the spice & cleanesed nicely. A good match. Im not really as impressed by this as their other offerings though.

50cl. Bottle. 
Poors clear yellow with good white head. 
Aroma is banana, malts. 
Taste banana sweet, fresh bitter. 
Mouth-feel thin. 
Good beer.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2012 Bottle. Clear golden yellow color. Foamy white head. Wheaty and bready aroma. Malty flavor up front with bready and fruity grains, then switched to bitter hop like character. Palate was clean and sweet up front, and finished bitter and crisp. Very drinkable. I enjoyed it.

Very light, very clear, yellow pour with a touch of green?  I dont know if its the lighting or the room but I swear theres a green tint to this beer.  A ton of foamy, bubbly clingy head. Very weak nose belays a very pleasing and somewhat strong mouth. Goes down ridiculously easy. Mellow citrus and spices and a touch of yeastiness. Very slick and easy to drink. I wish this one was more readily available. Great beer for a long hot day. Rather enjoying this.

Bottle.  Pours crystal clear with a puffy white head, some nice lacing. Aroma is a little on the bready side with some extra grain.  Taste is a little spicy with some fruity esters.  A good lagerish feel.
Bottle: A terrible way to ruin an awesome Hefe Weissbier, I just dont understand kristallklars, its a mystery to me. Food Pairing: Fat Free / Light / lean chicken bratwurst.

Good. The beer smells herbal and medicinal with some sweet cracker like malt aromas.  Beautiful, clear golden with a large white head. The taste is an herbal minty mixed with some bubblegum and finishing with some clove spiciness. Crisp, dry, and clean. Delicious.

500 mL bottle. Part of a Weihenstephan taster pack.  Pours a pale straw yellow with a thick white head, lots of lacing. Weak aromas of wheat and citrus. A hint of banana and spice.  Super light and easy drinking, lots of carbonation.  Clean on the palate with no lingering taste. Quenching, but a little anemic for my tastes.
Bottle in Seattle. Clean crisp yellow pour, big foamy pure white head. Dry yeasty sweet wheat nose. Champagne-sparkly yeast and carbonation. Richly sweet, but drier finish. terrific

On tap @ APEX. Pours a clear golden yellow with a nice frothy white head. Aroma is very light. Banana, cloves, other spices in their, but its very light. Pretty thin mouthfeel with decent carbonation. Light bodied. Overall, great beer! Really hit the spot

0.5 l bottle, from Auchan Titan, Bucharest.

Clear golden liquid, long white head.

Aroma has fresh notes of banana, cereals, yeast.

Bittersweet taste, lively carbonation, medium body.

Pours a slightly clearer golden yellow colour with a huge frothy white head. Aroma is pretty much banana with cloves and spice, a little faint though. Taste is moderately sweet throughout with a little more bitterness than the hefeweizen. Light body, decent carbonation and a thin mouth feel. An exceptionally good hefeweizen.

Pours straw yellow with a fizzy white cap. Standard aroma of banana and clove. Flavour more or less follows suite. Nothing ground breaking, but tasty and refreshing. Good summer beer, this would be a great way to introduce people to wheat beer.
Crystal clear dark yellow.  Effervescent.  Tastes sweet like creamy corn.  OK but not great.  Very light and pale wheat beer.
Bottle.  Pours a pale yellow color with white head.  Grain, wheat, and yeast aromas.  Flavors of clove, wheat, banana, tastes like a lighter version of a hefeweizen.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2012 Very pale clear gold with large white head. Pleasant, rounded flavours of sweet fruit, particularly banana with a seam of minty hop bitterness. Banana popsicle finish. Aroma is fresh mild and sweet.  / UPDATE a really hard style to make interesting, which this example does. Great for what it is!
Bottle 0,5ltr:Clear golden coloured brew with an less full taste than the unfiltered version, hints of banana and ofcourse a good summer thirstquencher.
Clear pale yellow. Pure white head, great retention. Solid aroma of clove and banana from the yeast. Wheaty, with some light spiciness.
Pours clear gold with a lot of white head.  Smells of wheat and yeast. Tastes like a really light hefeweizen.

500ml bottle.  Pours a clear pale yellow with a huge white head.  Aroma is yeast, banana, clove, honey, citrus, and faint black pepper.  Taste is yeast, with mineral notes, banana, and some heat from the spice.  Spicier than usual actually.  Im a sucker for weissbier, and this delivers.  Another excellent beer from Weihenstephaner.

500ml bottle. Pours a clear yellow body, good white head. Aroma of classic wheat beer: coriander and yeast, grassy hops, a bit earthy. Taste is crisp and spicy, wheat, grassy, banana. Plenty of carbonation.

Fifth beer tried from this self-proclaimed "Worlds Oldest Brewery". Always imported by the LCBO - thank you. Best before date on back label (at bottom) writes: 15/02/2013. This filtered wheat brew pours a light golden colour with a big creamy-froth white head that has great retention and thick lacing. At first pour, a beautiful spicy yeast nose shows reminding me of Unibroue. After breathing a bit, the spices disappear and the hop (grassy, rusty) comes out with hints of lime. Crisp mouthfeel, but still medium-bodied. Mild wheat taste and notes of banana and cloves. Pretty refreshing cold for a warm summer night, but a tad mild overall for a 5.4% ABV. A bit too clean.

Pours a clear yellow gold. Bubbled over when I Opened it.  Taste was mellow and bubbly with a tart tangy finish. Unremarkable except for the clarity. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Utobeer. Colour is clear amber lager with big foaming head. Aroma is potent as soon as its out of the bottle. Lots of banana, bread, freshly baked cake, in fact is banana bread or cake. Taste is sweet malt, banana, cake. Delicious lager.

Not a bad brew. This is my favorite Weihenstephaner, methinks. Lot of head to it, but thats not a problem. Super easy to drink and very light on the palate, its got a good level of spice to it, but keep it subtle.

Pour from a 500ml bottle, very lively carbonation right out of the bottle big big foamy head.  Straw light yellow,  aroma is wheaty, banana, doughy.   Light smooth taste, with a sweet/sour finish.   Not a bad light looking/tasting beer, it has character, a fish dish would be interesting pairing.

clear golden with two finger head. this definitely isnt bad, but compared to the terrific hefe, everything is just muted a bit. still easy to drink with plenty of banana esters and wheatiness, but id definitely prefer the unfiltered version.

Bottle. Pours clear yellow-orange with a medium off-white head that dissipates with some lacing. Aroma of wheat, lemon, orange, and a bit ogf grain. Flavor is wheat, lemon, slightly sweet but crisp and clean. A bit fizzy in the mouth, but otherwise a great summer wheat beer.

Pours a clear golden yellow with a big frothy white head.  Aroma is german malts and a small hint of noble hops.  Taste is clean, well fermented, crisp taste of a great malts, slightly sweet and a small hop bitterness.  Would you expect anything else from Wiehenstephaner?

Brilliant, clear pale gold with big, foamy, white head / Stylish nose of bread, banana, and citrus / Medium body, creamy, somewhat sweet and fat with fine-bubbled carbonation, resinous, with subdued hopping / Flavors of banana, orange peel, resin, lemon, and bread / Not my favorite style, with its borderline cloying nature, but this is a fine example and more restrained than many.

Bottle from LCBO.  (Crystal-)clear pale yellow, with a big foamy white head.  Pleasant aroma of banana and spice.  Full Weizen taste - banana, spices, lemon, and a slightly dry, almost sour finish.  Medium bodied with high carbonation.  Great summer beer.  Not much appears to have been sacrificed in order to get the crystal-clear appearance.

Pretty decently done for a style whose description gives me suspicion. Why bother to filter? Seems like this would have been better without the kristal element. Theres some wheat here, but its light on the palate and short on the aftertaste. Decent, but since its easy enough to get better weihenstephaners why bother? Bottle

500 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a clear, bright, light golden yellow colour with large, puffy white head.   Aroma is banana, tropical fruit, light clove.  Flavour is sweet biscuit, banana, apple and mild clove.  Body is on the light side.  Decent.

Bottle from Ninas Mini Market. Clear golden yellow colour with a big foamy head. Sharp yeast clove aroma. Spicy clove flavour, banana aftertaste. Sharp bright & fresh. Undoubtably a good beer but I much prefer a hefeweizen. Kristals just dont seem right to me.

Pours clear pale yellow with lots of bubbles on the glass and more than an inch of rocky white head.  Aromas are clean and subtle, yeast being the main character, but with a bit of bright fruit + citrus behind.  Mouth brings out a little more flavour, but it is a step down from the hefe to be sure.  Refreshing.  Banana starts to kick in a bit as it warms up.

500mL bottle from the LCBO. Pours a clear pale golden colour with some foamy white head that dissipates slowly. Smell is yeasty, with some spice, maybe cloves. Palate is a bit light and watery, carbonation is muted though theres some definite champagne qualities to the bubbles. Taste is pretty excellent, a definite wheat beer, very refreshing and a bit of a tart aftertaste. Would be delicious on a hot day.

lots of big soapy head poured in german wheat beer glass. carbonaed n going fast clear looking.  smells freash,yeasty,tad spice,ect.  Taste sweet,bannanas,spice?,yeasty/bread,water,clean,tad minty mabye. Different take on a German wheat beer ,not worst or best German wheat.

Bottle: pours clear gold with a decent puffy 3 finger cap which lasts and laces well. Sharp effervescence. Aroma is mild but has the bisquity-cloves-banana character of a hefeweiss. Easy to drink. Spritzy, dry, fruity biscuity malty, clean dry sharp finish. Enough flavor and character left to satisfy. About as good as gets for a filtered Hefeweizen.

500ml bottle 
5.4% ABV 
I tried this beer on May 30, 2012 after purchasing from the King and Spadina LCBO outlet in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  The beer poured a translucent light gold colour with a generous bubbly snow white head that quickly dissipated.  The aroma was mild wheat, some hops, and some spiciness.  The mouthfeel was medium bodied and medium carbonation.  The flavour was sweet wheat malt, some spiciness and some fruit tones in the mix.

500ml bottle. Clear golden colour with firm huge creamy white head. Intense wheaty aroma. Taste is initially wheaty, slightly carbonation induced metallic, with the carbonation losing ground a more differentiated, balanced slightly sweet and tart wheat flavour gains weight.

Clear straw gold colour with a big cap of foamy white head. Typical wheat aromas of banana and clove. In the flavour the banana dominates with spices in the background. The carbonation is quite prickly in the mouth and finishes crisply.

500 ml bottle from LCBO, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. 
App.:  Clear (crystal clear...haha) golden with a fluffy bright white head.
  
Aroma:  Sorta bright, tangy and fruity, nice banana/clove esters, grains/cereals, boiled cereals, some wheat character, better than expected for a filtered Weizen.
  
Palate:  Medium body, slightly relaxed effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Similar to the nose, minus the bright fruity note, nice banana esters, cereals, wheat, decent; dry with minimal bitterness and a banana cereal finish.

Better than expected.

0.5l bottle from LCBO. Pours a transparent light yellow, with a sparse, white head.  Aroma: Hops, wheat, spice. Palate: On the lighter side of medium-bodied, watery, thin, smooth. Taste: Slightly sweet, fairly savoury. Very light. Would be fantastic on a super hot day.

500mL bottle from the Lickbow. Ah yes, the elusive Kristallweizen, finally I can notch this style on my figurative belt, but which I really mean my RB statistics. Its not as if I havent had clear wheat beers before, but the apparently special tag for a Kristalweiss has previously eluded me as well as many others. You would think that filtering a Hefeweiss would pretty much remove one of the central things that makes a Hefeweiss an interesting beer, but of course, Weihenstaphaner pulls it off well. These guys could ferment a beer in a babys diaper and it would probably still be less revolting than one would imagine. Okay maybe that was a dumb comparison. But they rock at producing awesome examples of styles which I would otherwise pass on, like their Dunkelweiss, and this is no different. Aroma has some nice sharp hops hiding under the sweet and vaguely yeasty elements. A tad spicy as well. Flavour is actually kind of rich, at least in the context of what I was expecting (not much). Pale and wheat malts are delicious, with some depth. Not overly carbonated, with the pleasant result that I can actually taste things. Finishes with that quintessential dry weirdness of wheat, but without the fruity characters you would get from Hefe yeast. But the fantastic malt body really makes up for the fruity-void. This beer is a 9/10, would bang. This rating is probably longer than it really needed to be.
500ml bottle from the LCBO. clear golden,white head. nicelight wheat, hefe nose. typical hefe flavour only lighter and dryer. i could get into this style, i find it much more re-freshing then a hefe.
500ml Bottle. Golden pale in colour. a very refreshing beer. a well made beer.
Pours clear bright yellow with a good vibrant head.  Aroma of wheat and yeast. Not the greatest fan of wheat beers I am discovering but this was very drinkable and mild compared to others I have had.
Crystal clear weiss, that looks good, that tastes good, although there are some slightly better ones on the market.

Pours clear, bright golden with lots of foam. Has a nice wheat aroma with a good amount of yeast, banana, an earthiness. Not the cleanest aromas. The taste comes through with lemon, cloves, banana, and of course the wheat and yeast. Average mouthfeel with pretty high level of carbonation.

I recently enjoyed an American take on the kristallweizen style and it occurred to me that Ive never reviewed an authentic German brew of the style, so what better beer to opt for than Weihenstephaner Kristall Weissbier? Its best described as a wheat beer for lager drinkers as it has only the basic qualities of a traditional wheat, but without nearly the complexity or energy.

I poured a 500ml bottle into an official Weihenstephaner glass.

Appearance: Bright pale gold, crystal clear with plenty of visible carbonation present. Forms a huge, bright white, foamy head which eventually dissipates but doesnt leave much lacing on the glass.

Smell: A classic Bavarian wheat beer with half the aroma plus a hint of lager-like quality to it. Slight banana and lemonpeel, otherwise very mild.

Taste: I didnt know what to expect with Weihenstephaner Kristall Weissbier, but I was genuinely surprised when the palate seemed so overtly mild. It has a clean, slightly lemony, slightly watery taste up front. It slowly transitions to a more familiar wheat beer taste with light banana flavor and a subtle citrusy juiciness. Theres a biscuity maltiness in there, too - reminiscent of a Munich-style lager. The finish is crisp and clean, although thats a somewhat redundant statement since the majority of the palate is clean. 

Its not that this is a bad beer (far from it), its just much more mild than Id expect. Its possible I had an old bottle, but who knows? I found I was able to enjoy this drink since Im so familiar with the style and can concentrate on the subtleties in it that are flat-out overt in a more traditional wheat beer. Lager drinkers and general newbies will likely enjoy this beer more than seasoned veterans.

Drinkability: I drank this beer outside on a hot sunny day - the ideal setting for this type of beer. It went down very smoothly even though it was noticeably fizzy across the tongue like a lager. The mild palate and clean aftertaste made it quite refreshing. Its weight of 5.4% actually seems a little high since Weihenstephaner Kristall Weissbier seems so overtly mild overall. It does the job a wheat beer should do, and thats what matters.

Bottle. Pale clear yellow with pretty white foamy head. Smells like bubblegum, clove, and sour apple. Very lightly sweet balanced by a dryness. Moderate carbonation, faint sweet finish, light bodied but not crisp.
From the bottle poured a beautiful, clear, yellow brew with a thick, foamy head. Aromas of citrus,and bubble gum. Delicate flavors of bubble gum, malt, and a touch of citrus.
Bottle courtesy of Smith4498, Pour is light pale straw yellow, and nose has a belgian style smell, taste is very crisp and bubbly not bad

Pours a light gold with a frothy white head. Nose is awful- smells funky & dirty. Taste is sweet grassy and light much better than the smell. Not something Id likely search out again (not really my style) but it was certainly worth trying once, and it is a viable option in a pinch. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Golden color, decent head.  Wheaty aroma.  Taste of wheat.  Nice and crisp palate.  Strange aftertaste.  Overall a nice effervescent beer.

Hihetetlenül pezseg él és nagy szép tiszta sárga ezért jár max pont a megjelenésre. Illata konkrét és erős búza enyhe akácvirággal fanyar savanykás felhanggal. 
Meg kóstolva banános, édes, szolid komló aroma. Utóíze gyenge és selymes. Jobb, mint a "trübés" verzió!

wasnt what i was expecting.got this in a five pack of five different wheat beers.obviously the kristall means clear.for a wheat i was expecting cloudy or some sediment.pours yellow and looks just like a lager.aroma is malt bannana and clove.flavor matches the aroma but the aroma is much more defined than the flavor.medium carbonation with a sweet malty finish.wasnt what i expected but good none the less.
Pours fizzy and yellow. Nice wheat aroma, citrus, lychee and light hops.  Light to medium bodied with a light , but refreshing taste.

This beer was drank, as I reviewed it, on a Sunday afternoon at home (19 Nov 2006). 
Pint bottle, poured into a Franziskaner Weissbier glass, looks good, large head, which stayed a while, shrinking, but staying. light, bright golden colour with bubbles rising up the beer, bursting through head. 

The aroma is of wheat and bannanas, not as strong as other Weissbiers I have tried, but still in the nose. Maybe the process that clears the beer also takes away some of the aroma? 

Refeashing, clean taste, with wheat winning the battle of flavours over bannana and vanilla, but only just. 

Taste stays, getting more bitter as the mouth dries, take a long time between sips to feel this sensation. 

I would drink another one, but I will not go looking for it. I would like to try a few more Kristall Weissbiers (I have drank others, many years ago, on tap and in bottles) before I can say this is one of the best or not. If my memory serves me correctly, this fits in around the middle of the style for taste and enjoyment.

From bottle (6/8/11). Light banana, clove, and high amount of citrus. Wheaty acidity and some oxidation. Clear with creamy, foamy lacing head. Medium body with medium-high carbonation. Starts wheaty with some banana and citrus. Fairly clean with light banana, bready notes. Light bitterness and clean after, watery.

Bottle.  Pours a light golden yellow with a large head that was slow to settle (and made it hard to finish pouring).  The taste is spicy and sour and kind of burns the tongue.  Ok, but not my favorite.
Very good beer but lacks some of the character of the unfiltered hefeweizen. Good summer drink.

Pours a clear golden color with medium-sized white head.  Moderately carbonated.  Pleasant grainy wheat aroma.  Nice wheat notes, somewhat bitter but not overpowering, full creamy mouthfeel and bitter finish.  Im glad I tried this.

50cl bottle. Pours a light yellow liquid with big white head. The foam does never disappear. Nose : hay and caramel notes. Some citrus notes. A bit funky. Sip : Low density with low to medium carbonation. Sweet with interesting hay malt flavors, develops delicate hop bitterness. The aftertaste is little bitter and sweet. Nice balance. Good beer.

Bottle from ASDA in Hamilton cons 2012-04-17 Uddingston
wee gusher!
AR: foam bananas, carbonation, yeast
AP: clear coppar with greenish tone, high golden white frothy/stouthy head
F: heavy yeast, foam bananas, high carbonation, wee apple cider, black peppar, rose peppar, citrus

0,5l bottle from Sörspecialista, Budapest. Clear pale yellow color with kreamy white head. Wheaty aroma with some fruits. Sweet, but refreshing. Much lighter aroma, than Wheienst. Hefeweizen. It reminds me to a pale barley lager. The deliciuos fruity, citrus yeast aroma also appears, but lighter of course. Medium sweet taste. MEdium body with lively carbonation and silky, creamy texture. Grainy finish. Not so caracter, than his "hefe-brother", lighter, more drinkable and refreshing. Ideal for drinking with the friends after a hard day.

transparent yellow color with decent head. Aroma is more yesty fruits such as peach. Taste is light refreshing grainy malt. loved on one of the first super sunny days of April. clean palate with full carbination.
Bottle. Light gold with fluffy white head. Aroma of banana and yeast. Flavour starts sweet and spicy before a bitter citrs finish.
Clear golden colour. Aroma/taste found in the hefe are minimal in this beer. Also got some metallic taste

Bottle 0,5l. Pale yellow clear body with white foaming head. Aroma is banan, citrus, apricote, plums.. Palate nis slick, little oily, with medium full-bodied mouthfeel. Carbonation is soft and smooth. Aftertaste is sweet wheaty, berries and fruits. Finish is sweet no dryness or bitterness. Overall one of the better Kristallweizen Ive tried.
Cloudy golden color. Citrusy hops blended with a banana palate for a nice smooth flavor. Very enjoyable.

Bottle- Pours a clear light golden color with a large head that fades slowly. Has nominal lacing. Aroma is a mixture of banana, spices, fresh grain and a bit of malt sweetness. Taste is a blend of banana, clove, spices, fresh grain and some malt sweetness. Nice bitterness and a dry finish. Light body, lots of carbonation, smooth with a nice clean feel. Good example of the style. Well worth checking out.

pours a clear golden colour with a nice foamy head unleashing all the classic weihenstephaner yeasty banana/cloves aromas. flavour is like a tamer version of the hefeweis and mirrors the aroma. l cant fault this beer but it is definitely at the lighter end of the weihenstephaner range.

Soft crisp banana yeast aroma. Clear pale yellow  with a gold tinge. Starts with a healthy 3 finger head. Tastes like a hefeweisen crossed with a pilsner. Has that familiar bready taste with that crisp pilsner finish. Clean refreshing in the finish.
Ehh. Was really intrigued by the style but honestly it goes down like aHefe robbed of its best essence and replaced with some alkaline water. Drinkable but not truly enjoyable

Bottle. Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is bubble gum, banana/clove hef yeast, wheat and hay. Flavor is wheat malt, slightly tart yeast and a faint hop bitterness. Light body with lively carbonation and a dry, clean finish. Pretty good beer, easy drinking with a good amount of flavor.

Bottle in Berlin. Pours crystal clear pale straw coloured with a big creamy snow white head. Aroma is wheaty and fruity. Taste is more wheat, but with the addition of that lovely banana, light sweet, this one was a real threat. High carbonated, crisp and clean, a winner for me.

Appearance was clear golden with huge 3 finger white  rocky lasting head, slight lacing. Aromas where sweet biscuity malts with a touch of grassy hops. The yeasts where the stars with bananas, spice, estery  cloves and funk.Taste was sweet honey malts upfront and slight citrusy hops in the back. Palate was smooth creamy carbonation with a meduin body. Average length classic finish. A  great Kristall...

Bottle. Rating #983. Clear yellow with a bit of gold to darken it up a little and a real nice fluffy white head. Nice aroma, light banana and wheat and grain. Flavor is similar, sweet banana and more wheat and some mild bitterness. Tasty. (2250)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Pours pale stray yellow.  Head is frothy at the start, but diminishes quickly.  Banana and light malt on the nose, with a hint of vanilla.  Medium to light sweetness, very carbonated, hint of bitterness at the very back of the throat.   Very refreshing, nicely balanced German wheat beer.

Giolden clear color.
Some good banana aromas.
Refreshing but not as tasty as the hefe-weisse beers.
Lucks of body and wheat flavors.

Clear medium yellow color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, wheat, light to moderate yeasty, banana, gum.
