Flavor is light to moderate sweet with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. Poured clear yellow with a white head. Grassy and grainy aroma. Less full than the hefe weizen. Mouthfeel is heavy carbonated. Flavour is faint, little interesting. A bit bitter with some sweetness in the end. Reall nothing interesting here.

Served in a tall pilsner glass.

Monster head on this one, yellow and crystal clear with tons of rising bubbles, good lacing. 

Tons of yeast in both nose and taste, sweet and clovey too.  Very flavorful, this is my new favorite Kristalweizen!  

Very clean on the finish with a bit of residual yeasty flavor, very light body, great full carbonation.

Definitely a great example of the style, will absolutely have this one again and again.

[Bottle from Westholme Stores, Goring] Im not normally a fan of wheat beers, and I must admit I bought this one simply to be able to tick off the style.  However, I was to be pleasantly surprised.  It pours a clear gold with a large white head and a light fizz.  On drinking its smooth and sweet, and somehow has hints of both a good wheat beer and a top-notch pilsner about it - grass, honey and lemon all come through, with a superb balance between them. Theres a pleasantly mellow banana and clove flavour lurking behind.  Finishing slightly dry, it manages to be both refreshing and comforting at the same time.  A top notch beer this, and the more I drank, the more I enjoyed it - well done!
Pours a nice clear straw yellow with thick white head, lots of lacing.  Aroma obvious of wheat and a very clean yeast and slight spices.  Flavor matches well and tastes extremely clean.  Not bad.

Bottle from Tesco
Pours a clear burnished gold with quite a strong clovey nose. Theres some banana flavour but the spicy wheat flavours and smooth body just isnt there, that yeast and protein has been removed to create th clearer beer; so it almost becomes an unhopped lager. Its refreshing enough but give me a proper hefe any day.

A wonderful Weissbier.  Pours a clear yellow with a huge frothy white head.  (My first bottle almost exploded)  Aroma has bread, straw, and some hops.  Taste is on the sweet side with a long grassy finish.  Not much carbonation and a medium body.  Very refreshing and drinkable.

On tap. Pours a clear yellow with a thin white head, quite effervescent. Aroma of light fruits (apple, pear), banana, and bready malt. Flavor is bready initially with a tangy citrus finish. Lots of fruit in this one which was tasty. Light, crisp, sweet, easy drinking. Much tastier than I had anticipated.
7/4/8/5/14 (3.8/5)

Pours straw yellow with a monster white foamy head that stays for a while. Aroma is wheat, light fruity esters and a touch of spice and clove. Flavor is lovely but light. Almost a little tartness along with notes of the aroma coming through.

Bottle from Asda
Very light straw....crystal (!) clear....frothy pillowy white head
Aroma - light cloves...hint of nutmeg...spicy....sweet light malts...aromatic
Taste - Cloves...light nutmeg....some wheat.....light light pale lager malts ...bit peppery...hint of banana...bit watery.....not as good as the original
Palate - medium carb...thin body.....quite sweet. Finish of light spicy cloves...bit of banana...bit medicinal
Overall - Easy drinking but considerably blander than the original version. Its quite pleasant and refreshing but its a bit watery.

literaly, crystal clear gold with a huge white head leaving vast amounts of whorled lace....Aroma is banana, wheat and cloves.
Taste is sweet wheats, malt and banana....very dry, almost a champagne like feel to it at first. Gets sweeter and stickier as it warms. Very enjoyable.

Currently drinking while typing. After poured into a German Stein you have a good aroma of grass, banana, apricot, wheat, countryside summertime and very gentle booze. Lovely looking beer, one that you could murder on a hot summers day! Crisp clean filtered golden yellow sparkling liquid with a soft and fluffy bright white pillowy head which slowly dissipates. The taste is great, full of that lovely Weihenstephaner wheatiness which is so flavoursome, though the Kristall Weissbier isnt as flavoursome as the unfiltered original. Full of summer vibes, incredibly grassy, banana, bubblegum, fresh with a lovely wheaty aftertaste which harnesses a little nuttiness too. Crisp fresh feel in the mouth, full enough for a Kristall Weissbier, gentle but lively carbonation and that great initial foamy head during the first few swigs. A very good brew but given the choice I would much rather have a bigger flavour with an unfiltered version.
Pours a light clear yellow. Lots of foamy white head. Light banana aromas. Heavy carbonation. Very smooth with banana notes and some sweet dough flavors as well. Very nice beer.
barnyard, leather, cooked vegetables, hay, cereal, orange, cloudy, frothy, rocky head, medium sweetness, very bitter, lightly sour, salty, full body, average carbonation, bitter, creamy, long finish,
Pours clear golden with heavy carbonation.  Malt, banana, and a little spice in the aroma.  Sweet taste with some banana and citrus.  Good, easy drinking beer.

Just picked up a few pint size bottles of this. Has a light, crisp, spicy, taste, with a wheaty aroma. looks like it was filtered though as this is a very clear beer. Perhaps that is due to being the bottle version.
n.

Bottle.  Pours yellow with a large, white head.  Wheaty aroma with a hint of banana.  Light flavor with wheat, orange, banana and a hint of caramel.    Fairly light flavor but refreshing and easy drinking.
Pours clear gold with a huge white head and a ton of lacing. Aroma is banana and a hint of clove. Taste is the same but the clove is more pronounced here. Very effervescent. Refreshing.
Bottle. Clear fizzy yellow with resilient white head. Banana nose. Light caramel flavour with familiar Hefe notes. Clean finish. A very refreshing brew.

(Flasche) Das Weizen ist klar filtriert, hell und sonnengelb mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist leicht süßlich bis malzig. Im Hintergrund lässt sich ein bisschen Hopfen erahnen. Der Geschmack ist ebenfalls leicht, leicht süßlich mit einer leichten, gut erkennbaren Bittere am Gaumen. Im Nachgeschmack bleibt dann nur noch die Bittere. Zusammengefasst wurde dieses Bier durchs filtrieren um seinen Geschmack beraubt.
Clear golden color with a big fluffy white head. Aroma of yeast. Flavor is yeasty with some fruit.

A - Bubblegum and banana
A - Light and clear with thick frothy head
T - Sweet with a touch of a tinny dry bitter
P - Oily, which coated the mouth and creamy
O - Quite nice

500 mL bottle from Beers of Europe poured into an Erdinger glass.  Golden and fizzy, with a bubbly head.  Smells of hops, malt and a hint of banana.  Wheaty, with a hint of smokiness and banana.  Pretty reasonable.

Bottle. Clear golden colour with a thick white head. Aroma is mostly banana with a little hay in it. Smells more like a (normal hefe) wheat beer than is tastes. Light body. Very refreshing. Its more a summer drink for me.

Tap Hoppy Monk El Paso, TX-pours bright golden yellow with a small fizzy white head.  nose is lite banana lite smoke and dusty esters-has a touch of diacytl?  flavors are sweet banana lite dms grains and some sweet grainy diacytl as well.  Overall however, this isnt a bad beer and can be chugged when cold.  However, as it warmed, the flaws came out a bit more.  the body is fairly crisp and has some decent roundness to it-medium.  finish has notes of a fairly prominent note of sour banana long into the finish with lingering grainy malt tones.

500ml bottle - pours Light gold with rich white foam and some lacing.  Nose is wheaty and yeasty.  Taste is sweet.  Aftertaste is skunky.  Dry and yet effervescent.  Look under: wheat beer with nothing extra.  I could see myself drinking this as a substitute for Champagne when making a toast.

Clear straw yellow pour thin white head ... aroma of banana, wheat, grassy and fruity yeast .... taste is of fruity yeast, wheat, little sour lemon, sweet malts, grassy and banana ... dry and wheaty finish .... refreshing and easy drinking not a bad brew at all
I have had both on tap and in a bottle. Reminds me of a lighter hefe, but I still find it pleasant.

Pours a crystal clear yellow color with a small white head that fades quickly. Aroma is bananas, cloves, and wheat. The taste is lemon, bananas, everything I love about a good hefe, perfectly fresh, super refreshing. Mouth-feel is ultra-carbonated and dry. What a great beer and style number 59 for me.

Bottle Kris Wines, London. Shared with Slothez. At last I get to complete the full set of beer styles ! Poured a clear pallid gold colour with a reasonably sized lingering white head. Nose had traces of wheat, bananas and pale malts. Very characterful and interesting flavour  which had similar traits to the nose with additional notes of lemon, yeast and spices. Dried out towards the finish. Refreshing and drinkable. I enjoyed this way more than anticipated and this might even be my new favourite German style....Cheers Kris !

Not a huge beer but it is very good for the style. AROMA: Strong yeast, tree fruit, cloves and spices; APPEARANCE: Crystal clear honey, small head and champagne effervescence; TASTE: semi-sweet and a wee bit sour;  PALATE: lively carbonation, light body, creamy texture and short mild finish. Very nice

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2012 Location/Date:Bottle on November 18th, 2011.
Appearance: Pours a clear gold with lots of bubbles. 
Aroma: Aroma is a refined wheat, banana, clove.
Taste: Wheaty, banana with some clove, a lighter hefe.
Palate:Light nody, a little fizz, abrupt finish.
Summary: My first rating of a German Kristallweizen..and what I think is a good example of the style(although I swear Ive had one before). A nice alternative to a hefe, somewhat lighter and even easier to drink.

I approached this with some caution given comments about "castrated" wheat beer: 500ml bottle poured cold. This is really good, and I wouldnt hesitate to recommend it.  Usual weissbier aromas, pours bright gold with a thick white head. Weissbier flavours too, but less of the claggy bubblegum stickymouth, more dryness and a more delicate spice presence so the clove and nutmeg dont overpower. Only criticism? Quite gassy.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2013 Poured a bright clear straw colour with a huge, longlasting head. To my taste, its more than just a filtered weiss. Nice aromas of lemon, coriander, banana and a touch of bubblegum. Loads of flavour, with lemon, spice and coriander. Carbonation is pretty nuts, with heaps of fine beads. Good with food too. Excellent beer.

Has the nose of a Belgian wheat, very pungent. Very light color but with lasting head. Tastes and feels filtered, ie slightly thinner. Maybe my palate is off today but do sense some sweet caramel? Very refreshing, puts most standard wheats to shame. Enjoyed with fries...how American of me.
500 ml bottle. Pours a light golden with a white head and plenty of carbonation. Similar to a hefe. Slightly sweet with a hint of banana and maybe some clove.
Poured a pale yellow with a fairly big fluffy white head.  Pretty much the Weihenstephaner Hefe, but a little watered down.  Not too bad of a beer.
bottle. clear golden with massive head. aroma of banana, clove and pepper. flavor of candied banana chips, light clove, some nutmeg, and a touch of lemon and black pepper

500 ml bottle.  Pours clear golden with a huge, foamy, white head and lively carbonation.  Aroma is of yeast, wheat malt, cloves and banana.  Light, creamy body.  Wheat malt, yeast, a lot of cloves, banana and some bubble gum fill the mouth.  Medium, spicy finish. All attributes of good Hefewizen are present in this brew except hefe in the bottle.
I loved this beer, very nice wheat characters with a subtle hop backed by a little malt.

Bottle. Clear golden, medium head. Medium yeasty aroma. Taste is sweet, wheaty and yeasty. Finish reveals some light hops. However, it is all kind of muted. Im not very fond of the Kristallweizen style - no need to filter out the tasty parts yknow.
Very distinct flavor, old-fashioned considering the claims of being "the worlds oldest brewery". Its a traditional German beer, and I have to believe they are legit, authentic.
Clear, bright yellow colour. Aroma is a little bit musty and spicy. Flavour has a delicate maltiness, a hint of sweet banana and some clean almost numbing spice.

The beer that completes my quest for all 73 beer styles on ratebeer (10/22/11). Aroma of doughy bread, clove and banana. Appearance is well carbonated gold with foamy white head. Flavor really resembles the Hefeweizen, but perhaps a touch lighter. Palate is a mountain of effervescent bubbles; also quite chewy. Delicious.

Completely clear pale golden, bing fluffy white head. Nose is weak yeast and fruity notes. The taste is yeasty-wheaty with fruity notes (mainly banana) as youd expect from a weizen, but the body is thinner than usual and the mouthfeel crisper, pricklier. A very drinkable and refreshing beer.

Bottle.  Pours a clear, light golden color with a very large white head.  Subtle aromas of yeast, cloves and banana.  Wow...very smooth and clean tasting.  No bitterness or grainy flavors.  Nice controlled taste of yeast, butter and faint hints of banana.  Creamy texture and well carbonated.  Simple enough to drink all night but yet delicate like a good wine to sip slowly.  This one exceeded expectations.

Pour golden orange with yeast sediment white head. Aroma tart, banana, clove, light pepper, wheat. Taste wheat, banana, mild spice, clove, sweet grain. MF medium crisp body fizzy carb. Tasty brew easy drinking with good flavor wouldnt go out of my way for more.

As clear as beer comes. Rocky white head on a golden, sparkling body. Lager yeast and wheat malt aromas. Heavier on cloves than toward banana or bubblegum. Initially soft and creamy to taste and then a flush of carbonation and mild bitterness. That lovely cloviness stays present throughout into a soft, filling finish. An excellent quaffer and a delight to behold.

Poured from a 16.9 ounce bottle into a weizen glass. 

Appearance: Pours a clear light gold with an enormous 5 finger cloud-like fluffy white head.

Smell: Sweet grains with banana and clove in the background. The aroma is like a slightly subdued version of their hefeweizen.

Taste: Sweet grain and clove up front followed by banana in the middle before ending with just a touch of phenols at the finish. Aftertaste is very light with just a bit of banana.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied with a fairly high amount of carbonation.

Drinkability: Excellent drinkability. Goes down so smooth, you could drink this all night.

Overall: Very good beer overall. Its hard to go wrong with anything Weihenstephaner offering. This is no exception.

Bottle. Very pale yellow and very clear. Slight wheatiness but less than I had expected. Quite low on body strengtyh considering its reasonably high strength. Only my third of this style and it did nothing to convince me that I was missing anything.
Altho this is a nice beer its no wher near as nice as there heffe wies beer which is much better but still nice

The bottle says "crystal clear" and boy do they mean it. This beer pours a perfectly clear, apple juice like golden yellow with a two finger, quickly dissipating head. The aromas arent very present whatsoever, and certainly not when compared to their other beers. There is some light yeast and also this aroma reminiscent of sparkling soda. The flavor boasts the rich and sweet yeast similar to their Hefe but in a dialed down manner. It is very, very light in body and drinks very well. Its almost a watered down and lighter version of their Hefe which makes it one of the most drinkable and sessionable beers around. All in all, this is yet another good beer from Weihenstephaner.

Poured perfectly, light gold with a nice head that faded slowly.  Smelled weak but of yeast, corn, sweetness.  Tasted very light with some fruity notes of oranges, peaches, and some slight clovey tastes.  Decent Beer
Aroma of clove, bubblegum, and banana peel.  Pours amber with a massive fluffy head.  Tastes pleasant with passionfruits, banana and spices.  Mouthfeel is superclean and refreshing.

500mL bottle.  Pours clear yellow and gold, lively, with a medium-sized fluffy white head.  Aromas of sweet corn and straw, caramel, and some bubblegum.  The flavor is corn and sweet malt, mild bubblegum, and yeast.  Smooth.  Alright.  [819]

Bottle.  Pours a light yellow with a large head.  A lot of carbonation.  Aroma is not too pronounced, but I detect banana.  Flavor is light.  Again, banana and a little clove.  The bear basically is a light version of the hefe weissbier.

clear pale yellow, rocky white head, nice lacing... very traditional aroma, wheat, clove, quite spicy, some light banana.... Lightly lively, medium thin body, traditional flavor, some spicy, mild, some banana, mild, very summery, yeasty...

Pours a clear pale golden yellow, with a large off-white head. Super-transparent -- I can see fingerprints through the glass. Mild banana bread and clove notes on the nose. Flavor adds a bit of a mild hop note, but keeps things on the sweeter side, with a touch of butterscotch and mild wheat. I actually like this better than a full-fledged hefeweizen.

Bottle in weizen glass. Similar to the Weihenstephaner hefeweizen, but cripser and a clearer lighter colour. Theres a great banana aroma here, slightly metallic taste, but very fresh, sweet and wheaty tasting. Great beer.

Clove, banana in the nose.  Pours and looks much like a Duvel, with a huge pillowy white head.  Very active carbonation.  The taste is extremely clean and refreshing.  This is an excellent beer and needs no explaination as to why its tops in its style.

Clear yellow golden body with huge white rocky head. Very malty aroma, with sweet bread, candy banana and cereal. Maybe all propose cleaner... Easy drinkable beer with medium to light carbonation. Nice but unsurprising. Aftertaste is very tasty, light fruity notes of orange and pear. Well brewed but not very special. (50cl bottle, 1,75 EUR)

Bottle at Cloisters. Pours clear as a bell, a blonde colour with a thin white head. Aroma of yeast, cloves, banana and blueberries. Flavours of banana, cloves and wheat. Moderate CO2 prickle. Quite yeasty overall. OK but too fizzy for me.
Bottle: Pours golden with a decent fizzy head.  Smoot yeast aroma.  Very fizzy drink full of malt flavor.  Very good.

Pours extremely clear very pale yellow with a huge white head...lively...good retention and lacing.  Aroma is spicy...clovey, bubblegum, citurs...yeasty.  flavor follows suit with nice spice and yeastiness...hint of fruityness...banana...filtration took nothing away from flavor here!  Mouthfeel is very lively and the finish is nice and clovey.  Very nice.

Poured into a .5L weizen glass.  The beer had a huge pure white head that took a long time to subside.  There were tons of tiny champagne-like bubbles shooting up from the bottom of the glass.  Overall a very nice, light, refreshing beer.  Tasted very similar to a hefeweizen (not surprisingly) but with a crystal clear appearance.

Draught at BrauhausSchmitz:  Aroma of yeast, banana, wheat, slight spice, and some clove.  Poured pale yellow/light piss in color with a large, creamy, dense, white/off-white head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Clear.  Sparkling.  Flavor is lightly sweet.  Tastes of banana, clove, light caramel, wheat, slight spices, slight honey, and slight milk.  Light to medium body.  Thin, then lightly dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Light to medium sweet, banana, slight spice, slight milk, light clove, finish is lightly dry.

16oz bottle from Picks poured into my Weihenstephaner glass. 

Pours a very light straw-yellow with about 1 finger of frothy bright white head. 

Aroma is malty, mostly hay and slightly caramel. A slight grassy hop aroma also. 

Taste is lightly sweet and lightly sour. 

Thin bodied with a thin texture. Very fizzy carbonation and not much to speak of on finish. 

Overall, its not too bad. A little too light for my taste. Nothing I would seek out again but something to try once. Maybe good for drinking outside on a hot summer day.
Light wheat aromas.  Light citrus, bubble gum and banana flavors.  Overall a pretty decent heffe.

50cl bottle.
Decent white head.  Nice and refreshing..  clear beer, I think, cant see it through the bottle
Bottle. Pours clear, golden yellow, large bubbly head that lasts throughout. Aroma of clove, banana. Easy drinker with a bit of a banana finish. Not my favorite style, but good nonetheless.

Bottled. Pours clear, yellow with a large, white head. Fair lacings. Nose of yeast and banana. Sweet flavour with grain and banana. Ligh to medium bodied, watery texture and soft carbonation. Nice and very drinkable.

Out of a bottle.
Pours a golden hue with next to no head.
Sweet bready malt and bearly a hint of banana.
Taste like hef without yeast nor spice.
Light to medium on the palate and strong carbonation (you can feel it on the tongue).
Probably a summer beer (tasting done in the winter).
Will not be buying again.

Sörspecialista, Budapest. Áttetsző, halvány arany szín, és igen komoly tömör fehér, igencsak kitartó habkorona jellemzi. Illatában nem özönlenek el azonnal a búzasörök jellemző aromái, sokkal eldugottabban vannak jelen, ám mintha több mindent lehetne kiérezni, mint a szűretlen társainál. Mangó, szőlő, citrusok, sárgadinnye, banán és enyhe fűszeresség érződik egy nagyon eldugott élesztővel egyetemben. Ízében is ezek a meghatározóak, gyümölcsösen édes és fanyar, kissé csípős lecsengéssel, kevés komlóval és hosszan tartó lágy gyümölcsös utóízzel. Nem túl száraz, közepesen testes és élénken szénsavas búzasör. Talán nem olyan jó, mint a szűretlen változat, de egyben kissé más jelleggel is bír, és bizonyítja, hogy egy szűrt sör is lehet igazán kiváló.
Dont really taste or smell much difference with their hefe weissbier. Maybe this one is a little better, but one bottle is more than enough.
Bottle from Chans in Panama City.  Sweet banana and light malt aroma.  Light but creamy palate.  Tastes of banana, bubblegum yeast, cloves and lemon.  Little dry in the finish.
Colour was as it should be. Smell and taste were quite sweet, candy. Mouthfeel wasnt bad for this style. Beers like this taste too much for a sugarbomb to me. In its style: not bad.

Bottle - Pours pale yellow with a huge foamy white head. Smells like a hefe, but dialed down. Less clove, less banana, and less overall flavor. Taste is about the same, but again, less bold flavor. A bit watery, but very sweet and crisp. Enjoyable, but I think Id just prefer a hefe.

Pours a brilliant gold with a fast disappating white head.  Aroma is clean banana with a hint of woodsy hops, no yeast presence.  Taste is just like a hefeweizen but with less yeast and spice, tasty.  Body is medium and creamy with fizzy carbonation with a slightly bitter finish.  Overall a good beer, but I personally prefer the hefeweizen.  Bring on the yeast!
A good kristall wheat beer. Refreshing taste from the worlds oldest brewery

Pours a deep golden straw color with a huge fluffy white head that sticks itself to most of the glass. Endless carb. streams come from the bottom of the glass. Smells of clove and spicy wheat malt along with hints of sweet malt and banana. Taste is light and refreshing with lots of clove and spicy wheat malt. Lemon, sweet bready malt and banana play a supporting role as well. Creamy firm mouthfeel, medium body and an ample amount of carbonation. Great light summer type beer.

Chevy Chase Wine and Liquors (and beer), DC 500ml ($4.19): Pours a light golden colour with a white head that leaves a lacing for quite some time. Aroma is a whole lot of cloves and some wheat. The taste is a little bit on the sweet side, but that gives the beer some body. There is also a very mild touch of hops somewhere in there, which comes out toward the end. Banana flavor is there, but perhaps in less force than would be in a proper weissbier. Way better than the Spanish Peaks crystal wheat that I had.
Clear gold body, huge white head, tons of CO2. Aromas of bananas and freshly cut grass. Lively taste, sweet and crisp. Semi-dry finish, some yeasty notes in the aftertaste. Good stuff.

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2013 Bottle at the London Hilton Windows. Pours clear, bubbly gold with a white, foamy head. Clove and yeast nose. Medium sweet flavor, crisp malts, mild dough, some spice. Medium bodied with lively carbonation. Crisp malt finish, yeast in the throat, mild sugars. Not quite as doughy and yeasty as a standard hefe. Good stuff. (3.8)Bottle at chrisos Pre-GBBF Tasting 2013 - London. Pours clear, very pale yellow with a white foam head. Sweet wheat in the aroma. Sugary flavor with white bread, wheat, white sugar. Light bodied with average carbonation. Sugary finish, more basic wheat, faint hay. Very simple. (3.3)

Bottle purchased for the rating.  Pours a crystal clear golden color with a medium white head.  The nose is pale malt, light banana and mild spices.  The flavor is much of the same; pale malts, wheat, banana and mild spices.  somewhat spritzy.

Ein durchaus hefiger und fruchtiger Geruch umschwirrt hier die Nase. Das Bier startet wie ein "normales" Weizen, wird dann aber schnell lasch und etwas sauer. Fast pilstypisch wird ein herber Ton im Mittelteil wach, verliert aber neben dem weiterhin hopfigen Geschmack und der dezent fruchtigen Note an Bedeutung. Dieses Kristalweizen sollte lieber den Namen "Hefe Weissbier Gold" heißen. 	 
Test vom 15.1.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 11,11,11,11,7,11 - 10,80

Beautiful, beautiful beer.  That being said, everything else, while solid, is pretty run-of-the-mill.  Which, I guess, is a jackass way of putting it, since Weihenstephan, if anyone, can claim to have set the standard on all the myriad wheat beer styles.  But, even if this Kristall Weissbier was the original recipe, the idea has been improved since.  This bottle tastes classic wheat beer, bananas and cloves, but with a grainy cleanliness (terrible way to describe something, but its all I got) that dries and thins the brew.  Finishes sparkly but missing a needed yeast component to round out the flavor.  (12/08)

Pours a crystal-clear pale golden, with a light foamy white head. Aroma was fruity with notes of citrus and most notably banana. Flavor was un-mistakingly of german wheat origin, with a flurry of banana and bubblegum notes. Very easy to drink. Very good.

Appearance:  crystal clear light gold with beautiful fluffy white head; medium carbonation.  Aroma:  light banana, citrus and clove, with hint of pine and sweet grains.  Taste:  lightly spiced, wheat, bananas, mild cloves.   Finish: 	short, clean, crisp and slightly sweet.  Notes:   Flavors are almost like a cross between a saison and a HW.  Even more drinkable than the regular WS HW.  Extremely refreshing.  An excellent session beer with mild flavors and a great finish.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Similar to the hefe but not as cloudy in colour, less cloves and banana on the nose, and more citrus in the taste. Much more refreshing and easier to drink a few on but not as true to the style
Bottle. Clear golden colour with a large white head. Aroma and flavour of wheat, banana, spice and bubblegum.

1 pint 0.9 oz bottle. Light and crisp as expected, this German wheat still has a lot of good  things going for it. Pours with a spritzing, yet creamy white head, moderate carbonation, and a translucent buttery golden body. A fair amount of fruity, yeasty, spiced banana notes, along with grassy and light floral/herb hops in the aroma. The feel is crisp and nicely carbonated, making it much lighter and less creamy the their standard hefe, but still allows for some solid flavors to come through. Buttery grains come out up front, with more spicy yeasty/fruity notes coming after. Also, some grassy herbal hops and pale pils malts. A balanced, spicy finish. This worked very nice as a German version of the lawnmower beer. Not bad at all.

(16.9oz bottle).  Pours clear light yellow with massive creamy white head.  It almost looks like a carbonated apple cider.  Aroma is wheat, clove, apple and ripe banana, but not as much as an unfiltered version.  Taste is sweet with the typical weissbeer flavors.  Slight bitterness on the end.  Medium bodied with a creamy texture.  Light bitter finish.

Bottle. Big, foamy pure white head on a clear light gold color. Lots of banana in the aroma, faint citrus, light fruits, and slight sourness.  Flavor is much the same, but somehow seems all muted and too much banana and a certain sour cleanness that doesnt add up well for me.  LIghter body with bubbly carbonation.
Effervescent and l light. Very enjoyable and refreshing banana and wheat flavors. I would like to do a side by side with the Hefe to see if there is a noticeable difference.

Bottle.  Pours a very clear golden body with no haze and a fresh tightly knit white head with good retention and specks of lace.  Aromatically quite fruity.  Spicy wheat like tones, bubblegum and pear notes.  Nice spicy yeast tones and a mild pear sweetness.  Soft and clean with a mild sweet body with a drying bubble gum esk sweetness that turns spicy and dry.

This poured a completely clear yellow color with a white head. Aroma was a subdued german hefeweizen, light spicesand grass. Flavor was much the same,a a bit bland and lagerish with light spice notes too. Not a fan of this style.

I kind of, sort of, rate to style.  If I did, I imagine this would be a 5 since it is pretty damn good.  Sweet bananas, the brown kind that border on inedible but are delicious, and some clove spice.  Not distinctly worse than the Hefe Weissbier, and I might not be able to tell the difference in a blind tasting.

Why not go right to the best right? First one I have had of this style and it was a pretty good beer. I think Weihenstephaner is an awesome brewery and its awesome because they are so cheap. This beer tastes similar to there other offerings, its quite banana like, notes of yeast, a little grainy at the back, The only thing that didnt really work for this beer is their was a funny taste in the finish, it tasted similar to metal, but all in all a good beer.
Nice light German beer. Has a light pour. Decent head. Loved it. Great beer for 2 bucks

last beer style tick... clear straw, decent head, looks to much like piss... cloves, grain and skunk, sweet backbone, sweet but boring... sweet skunk water, no bad but I might as well be drinking water... not my thing

0.5l bottle. poured with heaps of tight frothy head, light and clear, golden pour.  Aroma of hay and citrus, with spicy finish. hardly carbonated at all. lots of long smooth mouthfeel. slightly sweet with a little amount of bitterness. not bad. better than the Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier.

50cl bottle. Golden beer with nice carbonation and a beautiful lacy head. The nose has a subtle banana aroma followed by vanilla custard. The taste has vanilla ice cream with ginger biscuits coming after. Despite the filtration, the palate shows good structure, a creamy texture and a fairly refreshing finish for this style of beer.Overall, an excellent example of a weiss beer.

Sörspecialista, Budapest
Kristály tiszta, szépen gyöngyöző és világos aranysárga a söröcskénk. Habja mint egy magashegységen levő hósipka, fehér, kemény, hatalmas és nagyon nehezen olvad el. Illata egy jó pár déli gyümölcsöt juttat az ember eszébe, kissé parfümös, édeskés és picit fanyar, szeretne az ember beleharapni. Banán, mazsola, ananász, füge, lime, ezeket mind érezni lehet az első kortynál. Mintha ezeket mind egy tálba darabolták volna, amibe aztán öntöttek egy kis virágmézet, élesztős malátalevet és egy kis komlót. Lágy, könnyű teste van és pezsgősen buborékos. Utóíze is igen gyümölcsös, édeskés és kissé, de kellemesen fanyar és picit száraz. Veszélyesen könnyen csúszik, igen kiegyensúlyozott és nagyon üdítő jellegű sör. Remek!
This one isnt that impressive, just like the regular lager, really missing on those clean wheat notes. Very smooth nevertheless

Bottle with a slice of lemon
Aroma - strong wheat with citrus 
Appearance - clear gold, tiny bubbles, thick head
Taste - floral wheat accented by the lemon
Palate - lively, a little dry, crisp with a lingering finish
Overall - like it very drinkable, well balanced
A subtler, dryer version of the hefe.  Pours golden from the bottle with a big pillow head and lots of effervescence. Taste of wheat and banana is subtle and it finishes clean.
Big, fluffy, white foam and a golden, crystal clear body.  A bready and honey-like flavor without the deep, yeasty personality of its brother.
Clear golden with a huge white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, moderate banana and yeasty. Flavor is rather sweet. Sweet and slightly acidic finish. Soft and a little watery. 190311

Bottle (500ml): A nice banana & coriander mix upfront along with cloves and possibly melon or lemon in the background. Very clear & light yellow in appearance with a nice, pinky sized white head that holds well thoughout & leaves some gentle lacing. Great tasting and much like Hoegaarden in taste. A nice blend of coriander, spiced clove & citrus fruits mirroring the smell quite well. There is also some banana in there too. Nice, crisp & refreshing to drink with a nice, light fizz that makes you come back for more. A very nice beer in the style of Hoegaarden and generally very pleasant. Very wel balanced & flavourful with a smooth finish, nothing negative about this one. - - -

500ml bottle in a weizen glass.  Pours very light, clear golden with a fluffy, white head.  Aroma of wheat, spices, and some dough.  Flavor very light allowing the wheat/spiciness to come through.  Light texture.  In my earlier beer drinking days, I would have given this a great score.  Its good for its style, but not what I want anymore.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2011 Poured from 500ml bottle into Weihenstephaner Weizen glass. Great looking head that stays around. Nice and clear and bubbly. Smell of bready and wheat. Nice taste of wheat, crisp mouth feel. Great Beer.
Poured from a bottle into a tulip glass. Aroma is sweet and clovey. Taste is cloves, wheat, citrus fruits. Thus is a lot like a sweet hefeweizen. Very light palate but still wonderful.

Pours a clear pale gold with a large lasting foamy white head. Aroma of banana, yeast, wheat and light spices. Flavor of banana, Bravian yeast, some light spices and a light, short sweet  finish -- quite refreshing. Very Crisp and smooth. I would drink this any day of the week, and twice on Tuesday! AirForceHops... thanks again.

Poured a clear straw/golden with a decent white head. Carbonation continues to rise throughout the entire drink.
Not a very strong clove or banana aroma. Might have got stripped out when crystal clear-ing it. But there is a bit of banana coming through. And just a hint of bubble-gumish type aromas. 
This is where the banana really comes into play, in the taste. Not as strong as the un-clear version though. And big sweetness in the taste. But in a good way, not cloying.
Prickly mouth-feel. This beer is very carbonated and leaves a sensation and taste somewhat like sparkling mineral water in your mouth. Not the best thing to have left over after the sweet banana taste you just swallowed. Slightly detracts from the overall experience.
Not bad. But not the best. I could drink a few of these while mowing the yard. But the mouthfeel I get from the carbonation wouldnt make me want to drink more than that.

Bottle from Warehouse Wine and Spirits in Spring Hill, FL.  Pours a slightly hazy yellow-gold with a very energetic white head.  This head billows and subsides, but never quite goes away.  Nose is bread, wheat, sugar, slight banana, and yeast.  Flavor is similar with a crisp wheat lightness and slight banana and sugar.  Crisp and interesting with a medium body and a sweet finish.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2011 translucent gold, billowy white head, creamy and oily medium body, high carbonation.

aroma: sulfer, banana and clove bavarian  yeast esters, tart grassy wheat, stale noble hop bitterness.

taste: lots of tart wheat, some noble hop bitterness, clove bavarian yeast esters, a sulfuric mineral edge, and a bit of funky skunked noble hop flavor.

Pours incredibly pale, under shimmering incandescent lights in the night it could almost be mistaken for water.  The head is huge, fluffy, and awesome.  The aroma is indistinguishable from a hefeweizen- mild banana and clove.  The flavor/palate is more distinctive.  I think its lighter bodied and much more mellow/watery yeast flavor components (especially clove and somewhat banana), but perhaps its just the clear beer playing with me.  Anyway, it was good and refreshing.  As the beer progressed and warmed I notices more fruity/sweet components that kept in interesting till the end.  Still, This is a style Ive been putting off trying again and again, and with good reason- I dont know why would would ever prefer this to a hefeweizen, or better yet, a weizenbock for this time of year.
Pours a very pale yellow color with a very large foamy white head.  Nice aroma to this one.  I smell wheat, some bananas, and some yeast.  Kinda like a yeasty banana bread.  Very good.

Crystal clear yellow in the glass with a thick white head.  Faint aroma of yeast spice, similar to the hefeweizen but not very prominent.  Crisp and refreshing on the palate.  An easy-drinking beer, would be great for the summer.
Very light gold color with medium white head. Nice huge banana aroma with strong spices. Flavor is strong with sharp malts and good spices. Very good overall
It is a shadow of the regular Hefe Weissbier but it is still good. It has notes of lemon and banana.

Tükrös aranyszínű főzet, egy terjedelmes és krémes fehér habbal a tetején.
Édeskés illata gabonás és citrus-gyümölcsös.
Kortyolása csípősen indul, testessége sima, amely selymesen betelíti a szájat és nagyon könnyűvé, élvezetessé teszi a sör elfogyasztását.
Édes-fanyar aromájában előfordulnak a búzasörökre jellemző gabona/kenyér és citrusos jellegek, erőteljes gyümölcs ill. enyhe fűszeres aláfestésekkel.
Fanyar befejezésében a citrusok mellett a komló is be-bejelentkezik, végül egy gyümölcsös-fanyar utóízt hagyván maga után.
Ízletes és igen könnyen iható egy darab.

500 mL bottle. Pours a clear, light gold with lots of bubbles and a large, foamy, white head. The aroma is citrus and pine sap, wheat, and bread dough. The flavor is lightly bitter up front with a very sweet backbone. The finish is bitter and slightly tart. The palate is light, highly carbonated, acidic and astringent. Overall, a subdued beer, but still amazingly good.
Pours a clear golden with big frothy white head and decently lively carbonation.  Aroma of clove and wheat.  Slightly sweet and slightly bitter.  Palate is incredibly clean goes down very easy.

Last style I havent reviewed, picked up for me as a Christmas present by Leems. Thanks, Ben! Poured golden with a thick white head and an ass-ton of carbonation bubbles. Smells mainly of banana with some wheat and a light bit of clove to it. Taste is much the same, still primarily banana and the body is quite thin and bubbly. Tastes pretty much like a watered down version of their Hefeweissbeer. I prefer that brew, but this one was fine too.

Bright gold, clear with lots of bubbles and a thick, lacy head
Nose is sweet vegetable malt w/ some background earthy hops
med body and very fizzy and creamy
big vegetable malt taste
carbonation really bites into the tongue
I think this is a bit heavy for a kristall weisbier.
UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 Rather clean, not a good or strong a flavor as Weihenstephaners other offerings but decent enough.

0,5 l bottle, bought at Sörspecialista.hu.
Clear yellow bodied one with a nice froathy, huge and stable white head that never disappears fully. Weizenbier aroma with a lot of tropical fruits, banana and figs, spicies, vanilla, bubblegum. Medium bopdied one, but good gravity, fruity tastes like figs and honey, banana and lichie. I do not understand this style, but this is a good one in this style! Yumm, I could slip it for hours!

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2011 Bottle @ home. Quite light clear pale yellow appearance with a small off white head that disappears very quickly. Sweeter and a more pronounced wheat aroma than other Kristallweizen like Erdinger. Medium bodied wheat based body with a delicious sweetness and mild citrus flavor. Quite well carbonated. Probably the best Kristallweizen Ive ever tasted. 

Update: On tap @ Hessen Haus in Des Moines. Excellent, excellent!! Best kristallweizen in the world.

Interesting aroma in which clove predominates followed by banana, but there are some other phenolics approaching burnt plastic but not quite so offensive.  Polished straw yellow liquid with pillowy white head.  Again cloves and banana lead in flavor with strong bready character from the wheat malt.  Relatively dry finish.  medium body.
Good for the style I would say. Smells very much like a hefe-weizen and tastes reminiscent of one.  I prefer the hefe version but as I said for what this is it is quite good. Serving: Bottle

500mL bottle, pours completely clear pale golden with a white head. Light aroma of banana, citrus and wheat. Flavour of sweet wheat, banana, yeast, light citrus and earthy notes. Doesnt hold a candle to the Hefe, but its decent.

Pours a totally clear golden amber, with a mountainous foamy head and constant stream of bubbles from the bottom of the glass. Smell is wheaty, yeasty, and earthy. A small fraction of the banana smell present in this beers hefeweizen counterpart. Taste builds on this with a light malt sweetness and hop present. Mild bubblegum finish. Mouthfeel is thin and fizzy, very thirst quenching.
Hefe-weizen lite.  Aroma, taste and mouthfeel all like the best hefes, only less of all aspects.  Good, but others are better.

Pours a clear, pale gold with a tall, fluffy, white head. Aroma is banana, clove, very light spicy and floral hops, a touch of hay and bready yeast. Light nutty notes come out as it warms. Flavor is raw grain and underripe bananas up front, giving way to clove spice, floral hops, stale white bread and soft water notes to the finish. Palate is light bodied, somewhat slick up until the off dry finish and moderately carbonated. Overall this was a fairly enjoyable brew, didnt overly impress, but I could see it having a wide appeal at a lower price point.

Bottle: Poured a clear golden color weizen with a huge pure white foamy head with good retention and excellent lacing. Aroma of light banana ester and light sweet wheat malt note is pleasant enough. Taste is dominated by banana ester with a light wheat malt backbone and medium sweetness. Body is a bit light with great carbonation. Refreshing and well brewed though not as tasty as its bigger cousin.
Pours a white yellow, with a very white head.  Aroma was yeasty with bananas.  Flavor was light and sweet, with wheat, fruit and more yeast.
Live up to its crystal name.  Pours very clear for a wiessbeir while sacrificing only minimal flavor.  Light tasting and refreshing.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2016 The head is a thick white dissolving in to a thin ring with lacing that is spotty. The color is crystal clear medium yellow. The nose is bananas and floral. The taste is crisp wheat with a slightly sweet malt with banana. The hops are a necessary balance done well. It is a great drink. 1/2 liter bottle in a 5 variety pack with a glass. Great drink. The following is from the original posting: Enjoy! And Merry Christmas!
its a citrusy beer and has a light yellowish color to it some people ad a lemon to it i think its fine with out good beer
A clear, yellow pour with foamy, white head.  The aroma is mostly wheat with tinges of lemon and grass.  The taste is light, slightly sweet, and refreshing with a crisp finish.  Good for the style.
Not as good as Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier, still really good beer. Smooth but rich aroma.

Poured a clear pale yellow with a very large white foamy head.  Aroma has lots of wheat and banana, similar to their hefeweizen.  Slightly skunky and fruity.  Taste is a little watery, but there are some good wheat flavors.  Slightly skunky and a little too much carbonated.  Finish has lots of good yeasty banana flavors.  Overall a very good kristallweizen, probably my favorite.
(bottle) clear pale gold with large white head. Aroma of bananas, hint of clove. Flavor is clove, banana, some wheat. Smooth mouthfeel.

On tap at the Union in Clarkston, Michigan in August 2009.

Pours a straw color with a nice white head and a good amount of lacing as it goes down. The nose has a slight sweetness from the malt and hints of clove, banana, and bubblegum coming from the yeast. The taste is quite similar with the yeasts characteristics really shining through. Light body with good carbonation--this one is quite drinkable.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 10-04-2009

Pours golden color with a good-sized white fluffy head that left some lacing. Aromas and flavors of banana, cloves and wheat. Pretty lively carbonation and crisp finish. Definitely the best Kristallweizen I have had, but thats not saying much.

Huge head when poured. Lots of carbonated bubbles rising through the beer. At the beer begins to settle its  clear appearance shines. The beer has a moderate body with a taste of mild straw and very light banana.
Bottle. Clear yellow with a big fluffy white head. The aroma is wheat, banana and citrus. The flavour is banana, candy, clove and citrus. Long banana candy like finish. Refreshing but still sweet.

Pours clear yellow with a huge snow white creamy head. The aroma is crisp wheat, pilsner malt, and hints of banana and bubblegum. The flavor is very crisp with clove, banana, hints of tart lemon and honey. A little tea like. Very refreshing. Maybe a tad lighter and more tart than the hefe.

500mL bottle.  Pours sparkling clear pale gold with a fluffy white head that settles down a little.  Estery, earthy, spicy and phenolic aroma with a little wheat.  The wheats noticeable in the flavour, a little leafy, low bitterness and sweetness.  Light-medium bodied, average carbonation, smooth and creamy, fairly short finish.
UPDATED: JAN 27, 2011 This beer is nearly perfect. I can drink this regularly and want more and more. Great taste, and seems like it tastes better every time.

Served from a bottle from the new BevMo in Point Loma. The appearance is a crystal clear pale gold with a nice foamy white head. The aromas are full of crystal malts, frutty esters, banana, and some cloves, some bubble gum. The flavors follow the nose to a tee. The mouth is lightly creamy and slightly drying. Although I love my beers with a lot more dark malts this is a great weizen.

There are reasons why this is the top rated German Kristall Weissbier in the world. 500 ml bottle in Germany. Pours a wonderful clear gold with a hugh lacy head that lingers. There is a lot of action in the glass with this one.  Aroma is an intensive banana and yeast smell. Very smooth banana hefe taste. If I was blindfloded I would have guessed it as a Hefe. Palate is short and crisp but goes through a group of flavors. Outstanding!!!!
Wheat and lemon aroma.  Taste is bright and lemon on the front end followed with the strong wheat beer flavor and a smooth finish.
500ml bottle.  Pours clear golden with a large fluffy head.  Aroma is nutty yeast, banana and wheat.  Lemon starts on the taste, yeasty dry finish.  Lots of carbonation.
bottle pours bright gold with a medium white head.  Aroma is grassy, hay, some wheat.  Flavor is rich sweet wheat and a lingering bubble gum finish.  Nice easy drinker.
Clear, pale golden color with white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast and citrus. Taste is the same. Quite nice.
bottle.  Pours a clear, pale gold with a white head.  Nose is of lemon, wheat and bubblegum.  Taste is of lemon, wheat, banana and Belgian yeast.  Mouthfeel is medium and creamy.  Nice.

Bottle 50cl. A clear yellow beer with nice head. Smell is very perfumed and typically wheat and banana. Aroma is medium sweet, malty and wheat, very smooth, very pleasant, drinkable with nice fruity aftertaste.

Fantastic, fruity/yeasty aroma.  Beautiful golden color with a thick white head.    Lots of carbonation.  The flavor is good.  To me this tastes like a combination of a german wheat beer and a tripel, mixed together.  Its ok, not amazing.

500ml bottle. Poured with a big & fluffy, disappearing white head leaving an OK lacing astride a pale yellow body with moderate carbonation. Wheaty, yeasty, banana aromas. Similar on the tongue with plenty of up front yeasty, estery notes, a banana, light bubblegum sweetness and a delicate, short-lived bitterness. Lacks a bit after the swallow. Light body, a touch thin on the palate but crisp & refreshing with medium-full carbonation to bring it back.

From the 25 fl. oz. bottle.  The pour is golden-yellow with a long-lasting half-inch or so of foamy head and clinging lacing. A bold aroma of wheat and a bit of yeast. The taste tends to be more spirited with a good dose of wheat, malts, and a clean hoppy finish.  A very nice beer.

Bottle. Clear pale gold with good white head that disappeared quickly. Nice interesting estery aroma. Wonderful mouth feel with medium body and frothy fine carbonation. An initial lightly grainy falvour gives way to bananas and citrus notes with a long finish of very mild hoppy bitterness. A nice weissbier.
Pours a very clear yellow with a large white head. Aroma of wheat, banana and yeast. The taste is quite sweet & smooth with flavors of banana, wheat, & spices. I really like this beer.

Very clear, yellow color with a light, fizzy white head.  Yeasty wheat aroma.  Very clean, crisp characteristics.  Nice, light sweetness with a bitter finish on the tongue.  Light grain presence.  Really great for a weissbier!

Pours a clear pale gold with a large lasting foamy white head. Aroma of banana, yeast, wheat and light spices. Flavour of banana, other fruit, yeast, some sweet candy, light spices and a light, short bitter finish -- quite refreshing. Very Crisp and smooth. I would drink this any day of the week, and twice on Tuesday!

Aroma is clove, slight banana. MIld. Gold, light apricot color. Thick white head. Heavy carbonation, looks like a champagne. Taste is very refreshing. Strong clove, some banana. Peppery. Palate is medium light. Starts off with some body but the carbonation really lightens and brightens it up. Clove and banana linger. This is a very nice beer. It is a great drinker and like the maker says, very refreshing. Everyone hates American Lagers, but at the same time they are wonderful when its 100 degrees, your sweating, and you want to pound something fast and refreshing. This beer is refreshing in that way.... it quenches.....but with marvelous German Hefe flavors. Very unique in a way thats easy to miss.

500 ml bottle @ home. Rated @ 26.6.2010.
Pours a clear golden colour with a frothy white head. Nice lacing. The aroma is very wheaty as its supposed be with a hint of banana. The flavour is medium malty and sweet with wheat, banana and spices. Medium bodied, oily mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Pretty much like a Hefeweizen.

9/7/10.  Thanks, jtclockwork!  My 2nd kristalweizen!  Clear, golden pour with a giant, tight, fluffy, creamy head (its really wonderful).  The aroma is big sweet bananas, vanilla, and cream with a hint of spice and soft malt backing.  Sweet banana flavor with more phenolic presence than the aroma, though the body is a bit thin and the flavor a little watery.  Must be from the filtering.

Bottled.  Pours a deep and bubbly straw color.  Faint aromas of hay and crispy fields.  One of the most refreshing and simply satisfying beers Ive ever had.  A great perky wheat beer with a satisfying finish and draw.

Very easy to drink. Its a pale gold to yellow with an excellent head. In every other category, its a muted version of the Hefeweissbier. It has the great spiced wheat character and a somewhat drier feel. On the other hand, the beer drinks just as easily if not easier than the Hefe. Its a great beer for a light lunch.
Crystal clear pale yellow with a huge foamy white head. Lots of tropical fruit,  banana up front, wheat , clove & spice in the background. Lively in the mouth and great on a hot day.
Light yellow / clear, good head.  Plenty of carbonation and the aroma is lots of bubblegum with a taste that matches.  Very good wheat beer, though I miss the yeast taste.
Pours clear golden with thick white head and some lacing.  Notes of wheat and citrus.  Taste is well balanced and reflective of aroma.  Crisp and refreshing.

Bottle. Pours clear pale yellow, thick foamy white head, decent lacing. Nose is banana, spice, lemon, cold cream, but all quite light, not nearly as intense as a good Hefe, especially the spice. Flavours are very light spiciness, banana, citrus, wheat. Kristall Weizen is the worst thing you can do to a good weizen.

0.5 l bottle from Alko. Golden color, very sparkling. Gently spicy aroma with clove, pepper and vanilla, also honeyish malt comes through. Honeyish malty and bready flavor with bitter clove, pepper, vanilla, banana and hint of apple. Slightly sweet, no hops. Fairly good for a kristal weizen. Good balance between spices and banana.

Bottle from Alko.

Clear golden yellow with a big, fluffy white foam. Typical aroma and taste of a German Weizen. Banana, yeast, spices, some sweetness. A very good Kristallweizen.
500ml, white foamy head. Pale yellow color.  Chalky weisse aroma with apricot. Thin palate. Fresh citrus flavour, with chalky tones, sweetbitter end. Refreshening.

500mL Bottle -- Pours golden-yellow with a medium white head.  Nice bright nose.  Aromas of hay, bubblegum, banana, honey, tangerine, and yeast.  The alcohol is quite noticeable.  Mild spicy bitterness last through to the finish.

Bottle. Aroma is lemon, cloves and bread dough. Appearance is a bright yellowish golden color with an inch of sea foam head. Taste begins with strong clove and lemon citrus flavors followed by bananas, cereal malt and a little bit of bubblegum towards the end. Mouthfeel is very dry and crisp with heavy carbonation. The yeast and spice flavors are relatively mild in comparison to a Hefeweizen. In some ways, its similar to a Munich Helles Lager in its crispness and overall refreshing drinkability.

16.9 oz bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours a clear bright gold with big frothy white head.  Very active champagne-like carbonation shoots up the from the bottom.  Aroma is banana esters, wheat, and spices.  Taste is lightly sweet with wheat and citrus flavors.  Very crisp and light mouthfeel, extremely quenching.  I could drink a few of these on a hot day!

Beautiful golden color with a massive creamy head - looks great in a weissbier glass. Banana, wheat and some spicy tones dominate. Surprisingly complex for a kristall, very drinkable. Personally, though, I prefer hefe.

Very well made beer - obviously. Lots of sparkling carbonation and the banana and clove follow closely behind. Doesnt have as much character as the weiss, but would make for a good dinner drink or as a substitute for your dom p.

(500 ml bottle from Bootleggers) Pours bright yellow, surprisingly with a bit of haze. Tall white head in my weizen. Nose initially has a phenolic/chemical/fiberglass resin quality but that begins to lessen as notes of citrus, wheat malt and yeast emerge. Mouthfeel is wheaty-smooth but with less body than a regular hefe. Flavor initially does have quite a bit of the fiberglass resin but as that lessens there is a peppery citrus, wheat and yeast flavor that is quite refreshing.

While these guys make one of the best Heffes, I wouldnt have bought this if not to attempt to try all beer styles.  However, this is pretty good stuff.  The heffe was better, this is lighter, in color, texture, and spirit, but they have an awesome yeast strain running over there.  The yeast flavors really shine in this beer, and while a bit unchecked by anything else, it is a wonderful beverage.

50 cl bottle. Poured clear golden with a fluffy white head. Aroma is wheat and banana. Flavour quite similar, some spicy notes also. Ends quite sweet. Prefer the hefe weizen version, but this one is also very refreshing and drinkable.

Enjoyed in a weird hotel room in Los Angeles.  Aroma is very yeasty, not bad, but like cleaning out the bottom of a fermenting bucket when homebrewing.  Appearance is a very clear gold with lacing head.  Taste is unique, like a mixture between a Hefe and a lager.  Its pretty good but maybe Im just not in the mood for it right now.
From a bottle,white head,bananna,clear,yellow,this was very decend beer and look forward to trying out more Kristallweizen styles

Golden pour, medium creamy head. Aroma of banana, citrus, spices, basicly a mild hefe. Flavour is bitter with a fruity spicy sweetness.
Crossbreed between pils and a hefe. Very nice summer beer.
Bottle. Clear golden colour with a huge foamy white head. Malty aroma with notes of wheat, banana and yeast. The flavour is malt, spices, wheat and banana. Medium-bodied, quite high carbonation.

Bottle. Clear golden pour, foamy white head. Aroma of clove, banana, some spices, typical weihenstephaner yeast and slightly bready. Flavor is sweet fruits with banana, some spices, more bitter in the finish and quite creamy. Lively carbonation and a creamy texture. Nice.

Wonderful hints of banana clove and spice.  Very crisp an pleasant on the palate.  Lovely deep orange/ golden hue with a very tight white head.  Drinks very smooth with a cleansing of the palate.  Fine example of the style.

Aroma- clove and hints of banana are predominant with a little yeastiness.
App- Champagne like; clear with little white bubbles that rise quickly
Taste- Fruit, including citrus and banana, spice, and a touch of bitterness at the end.
Overall, a wonderful beer for its style!

The beer has a intense golden color with small hints of yellow.  The scent is that of subtle roasty flavor finished with small hints of fruit. This is a great because of how much it well impress others like myself who thought imports have to pocess a pale like characteristic.

Aroma: Yeast, which is weird because this ale should be a filtered version of the much acclaimed hefe. Upon second whiff Im picking up the clove and herbal notes of the Bavarian Weiss. 
Appearance: Took me three trys to get this beer into its proper glass and with all that effort I now have a "Krystal" clear champagne-like hefe with a huge frothy head! With the time Ive spent admiring this ale the foam has faded but I still have a solid inch. The bubbles are racing up the side to replenish as fast as they can. The clear body is slightly unusual, but thats the intention for this one. 
Taste/Palate: Wow! Big fruit and yeast with strong acidity and a wonderful carbonated spritz! The ale begs to be sweet but the reigns are on which gives robust flavor and body but with a graciously light mouth-feel. Bavarias response to the clear beer trend. I could drink this beer all day!   
Overall: Well, the oldest brewery in the world seems to still be in business for a reason. Im a fan of Weiss beer and this filtered version does not disappoint.

when i first saw this beer i thought how good could a filtered wheat ale be, german especially.  I then found myself buying 3  more of these the next day.  this is a near perfect beer except for the carbonation level in my opinion.  the balance of flavor is spot on  with the usual culprits predominating.  a must try
in a glass.  pours golden yellow with small amount of head.  fruity aroma and yeast too.  medium mouthfeel. small citrusy taste and some spice like other hefes.  definitely a thirst quenching flavor.
filtered weissbier, very nice in the summer. clean and crisp in body with very little offense when eating. reminds me of a beer hall experience  in germany.

500 ml bottle. Clear pale yellow colour, thick white head. Fruity, mildly spicy aroma, with wheat and yeast. The flavour is wheaty, spicy, with banana, citrus and a mildly bitter finish. Quite ok, but I prefer Hefeweizens.

500ml bottle. Pours an attractive clear gold, with a strong, lasting head. The aroma is a typical weissbier, with plentiful banana and cloves. The initial bitterness hit is quite strong for a weizen. This leads into a ripe, fruity banana flavour, and a crisp bitter finish. A quality weizen.

500 ml bottle. Finland.
Clear pale golden colour with massive fluffy white head.
Wheat, fruits, banana, rubber and yeast in aroma.
In flavour there is sweetness, fruits, banana, maybe peach, bitter hops, wheat and some rubber. Rather tasty for Kristallweizen but unfortunately the concept of Kristallweizen is beyond my comprehension.

Golden beer with big and white head. Lot of bananas and wheat, some sourness and overally aroma is quite balanced. Bananas, wheat, sourness, thus normal and succesfull nuancees are found from the taste but still flavour is slightly tame, because of lack of yeast. Nice to drink even with high carbonation. Good and fresh wheatbeer with typical nuancees, but still something is missing without normal softness of hefe.
1 pt. 9oz. bottle.  Pours pale goldden with a nice white head.  Aroma of wheat, spice and fruit.  Sweet with a little citrus and banana.  Pretty decent.
Pours like apple juice. Nose is floral spices and spruce. Tastes like honey and light toast. Very light bodied. Rated 6/29/02
A bit disappointing. Crystal clear that a head that did not last at all. Watery in texture and flavour. Will have to give it a go again to see if it was just a dud one I got
Draught. High creamy and long lasting white head. Clear golden body. Lovely banana apple pear aorma. Sweet banana flavor. Low carbonation. Long sweet aftertaste.

1 pt., 0.9 oz bottle into pilsner glass. Aroma is packed full of banana esters--more so than any other beer Ive ever had. Smells like extremely ripe bananas. Clove is also present. Pours a kristall clear yellow with a thick head which dissipates in a few minutes, leaving a centimeter of foam and decent lacework. Taste starts out salty-sweet and finishes a bit citrusy sour. Nice lingering tangy aftertaste. Full-bodied, high carbonation which dissipates a bit at the very end of the glass. Great beer.
Pours "kristall" clear if yeast is left behind. Large foamy white head giving off a sweet bubble-gum aroma. Small taste of bananas and cloves making a sweet clean drinkable beer.

Very similar to their Weissbier,  Pours with a light haze golden color with nice long lasting white head and a little lacing.  Mild banana esters and a malty/wheat flavor.  Has a thick mouth feel with a slight hop bitterness and a touch of alcohol in the  aftertaste.

Bottle courtesy of Nate.  Pours clear with huge white head.   slightly skunky nose, spice and lots of wheatiness.  Nice malty and yeasty flavors, banana, wheatbread, slightly spicy with cloves and coriander.  Pretty decent.
Pours clear golden with a thin white head and some lacing. yeast and citrus aroma.  thing body.  banana, clove and bubblegum flavor.  light finish.  very refreshing.

Bottle via trade with HogtownHarry, thanks! Very pale clear yellow pour with a pillowy white head that sticks around for a while. Aroma is very wheaty, more than it looks. It is also citrusy with something fresh and herbal, mint-like, very little of the clove-like spices traditionally associated with wheat beers. Taste is slightly sweet but has well balanced bitterness. Palate is very effervescent and leaves a very refreshing taste.
Pours clear yellow with a fluffy white head and a light floral aroma. There is a light malt flavor with a champagne-like sensation and some hop bitterness.

bottle poured a bright clean golden color with a cascade of carbonation off the bottom of the glass and a thin white head. actually a nice looking beer in the glass due to the clarity. aroma has light sweetness, yeast, banana, and some wheat. mouth feel is light and refreshing but not as crisp as I would have imagined. flavor gets some wheat going, banana spiced yeast, wheat, and grains.

[bottle] Sweet, citrusy banana cream pie aroma. Clear gold under a dense, rocky head that eventually drops when the high carbonation subsides. Sweet and sour banana, clove and faint coriander flavour. The flavour is fairly delicate but not weak and very well balanced between refreshingly sour wheat and sweet malted barley. Light to medium body, lemony finish.
Bottle. Huge head with excellent duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are wheat malt, yeast, hops and grass.

Pours a clear, bubbly light gold with large white head into tulip.  good lacing lingering throughout.  Wonderful aroma typical of a German hefe, but more subtle. Fits the style very well, I can see why it is at the top of these offerings.  Id say a more toned-down hefe with a bit less of a wheat and spice presence both on the nose and in the taste.  I find this beer quite enjoyable - wishing I had another bottle.  SALUDE!
Pours out a crystal clear gold, aroma and taste are similar to the hefe except more subdued.  Exceptionally smooth and easy to drink.

17 oz. bottle.  Pours a crystal clear gold indeed, with fizzy white head.  Sweet aroma of clove, wheat, bubblegum.  Taste has a crisp carbonated bite, wheat flavors on finish, lightly spiced, sweet corn.  Simplicity has its virtues, would have no problem drinking a ton of this, though its ultimately unremarkable.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2010 16 oz. bottle- Pours clear golden with a nice thick head, in fact it looks like pale lager only with a perfect head, aroma is totally German Hefe, wheat, citrus, clove, and bananas. The flavor is lighter than their Bavarian Style Hefe, but still retains that great flavor, my main gripe is that its a bit watery. I believe Wheat beers should be unfiltered, they are one of my favorit styles, especially Bavarian Style Hefes, this is just not as good as its cloudy cousin.

Bottle.  Pour is Kristall clear with a bubbly white head.  Aroma is fruity with notes of spice and a light sweetness.  Flavor is also lightly fruity and spicy.  Kind of like a toned down version of the unfiltered style.

Light straw/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of wheat/yeast, bananas, & some clove; Flavor of wheat, clove, bananas, citrus, and spice; Nicely balanced; Quite refreshing - a solid brew overall.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2010 Bottle.

A - Clear bright golden color. Big, billowy white head with good retention and lacing.

S - Lots of wheat that gives it a bready aroma. Also has fruits (apple and banana), and spice (clove), with hints of other fruits and spices.

T - Similar to the smell. A lot like a subdued Hefe, with a bit less wheat flavor and a bit more hop presence.

M - Crisp and fairly light bodied. High carbonation.

D - Really drinkable, light and crisp and refreshing. The flavors are really nice. Easy on the palate but enough of the nice Hefe flavors that I want to drink more.

Notes: Really nice beer, but I would probably just go for their normal Hefe. That isnt a slam on this beer as the normal Hefe is amazing and this is a lot like it. I guess if you wanted a clean/lighter version go for this.

Bottle at The Federal, Durham. Poured into a nice dimpled stein, its a very appealing looking beer. In fact, it was because it looked so inviting from across the room that I ordered one myself. Rich golden pour with abundant rising carbonation and a thick, 2-finger head. Soft nose of yeast and crystal wheat along with a hint of banana and bread. Full mouthfeel, very pleasant and satisfying, with the carbonation quite active but not overpowering or getting in the way of the flavors. Spicy and dry flavors at the outset complement the breadiness, but theres something about the brew that makes it wash out towards the finish, in a fairly pronounced way - docked a point for that. Still a nice refreshing quaffer.

Bottle from the Eastchase Majestic.  Pours an extrememly pale, almost colorless yellow with a giant bubbly white head.  Bottom of the bottle produces a few floaters.  Aroma is clove, grain, banana, wheat, and spice.  Not a lot of flavor.  Banana, wheat, and a little yeast spice.  Very easy drinking.

Bottle. Pours a light golden pilsner color with a huge white fluffy head and tons of bubbles. Aroma is banana runts/peel, wheaty and bubble gummy. Some grain and clove spiciness. Flavor starts nicely with a strong wheat and yeast character, but develops some harsh grains and slight blandness in the finish where there isnt much more flavor present. Medium body and a zippy carbonation. Refreshing as promised but Id still like a standard hefeweizen more

Pours a pale clear yellow with lively carbonation and a thick, lasting white head.  Very nice grassy aroma with hints of banana and spice.  Flavor is mild, with banana and a little bit of citrus, some spiciness and slight, crisp bitterness.  Light and refreshing.  Very drinkable.

Bottle from bu11zeye - thanks Markus!  Clear yellow, large white frothy head, plenty o lacing, macro look.  Aroma of heavy grains, banana, grassy hops and clove.  Effervescent sucker goes down super easy with banana, clove, yeast and some apple notes.  Finishes up much drier than a normal hefeweizen.
A crystall clear pour big white head hints of clove.taste smooth and refreshing.

A: The pour from a 500 ml bottle is a clear, light golden color with a fluffy white head.

S: Strong aromas of clove and banana are the primary aromas. A hit of wheat and yeast to give off a bready aroma is also there.

T: A very clean, crisp wheat beer. The clove is the strongest flavor with a bit of banana, yeast, and an ever so slight bitterness. While this is a "lighter" beer, theres plenty of flavor.

M: Quite light on the tongue with very lively carbonation.

D: Ive really been missing out with these German wheat ales. Such an easy drinking and flavorful beer.

500 ml bottle; pours pale light gold and clear; billowing white head lingers for a long time and pumps out sweet, gassy aromas of lemons, honey, light banana and clove; yeasty, crisp lemony wheat; light texture with a fizzy sweetness in the mouth; light lemons and banana; a little citrus too; super drinkable and refreshing going down; light, yummy and little bubblegum in the finish; great stuff and would love to drink fresh from the source some day

Bottle 500ml. Not bad, but not so interesting. Aromas of apple and caramel. Taste is sweet, with light bitterness, and average length. Palate is fizzy, with a thin-to-medium body. Yellow colour, bubbly, with a thin head.
sweet, malty, light, and slightly fruity. certainly not the body or meatiness of a hefeweizen. bottle from ABC liquors, miami

Pours a very clear yellow color with a large white head. The aroma is biscuit malt with some banana and bubble gum. The flavor is more of the same, with pronounced banana, bubble gum and citrus notes. A very flavorful beer. The mouthfeel is medium and is very soft. The carbonation is low-medium.

On tap in Richmond Virginia.  Pours a clear golden with white head.  Taste is light clove and banana.  Not as much flavor as the unfiltered Weihenstephaner, but the best German Kristallweizen I have had.

500ml from Central Market.  Pours a clear straw colored body with an effervescent, fluffy white head that recedes quickly.  Aroma of spicy cloves, ripe bananas and malted wheat.  Flavors of cloves, yeast, wheat and some banana.  High carbonation with a lively mouthfeel.  Very clean, refreshing finish.

Bottle. Clear pale golden colour withnice  white head. Aroma of malt wheat, yeast and banana. Taste is sweet, banana, some citrus, light malt, with a slightly bitter dry finish. A very crisp and refreshing,nice beer which goes well with seafood.
Elegant styled wheat beer. Juicy mouth-feel but not sweet.. Lovely citrus, banana, and wheat flavors. Great beer. Eeeasy to drink.

Poured out of a bottle into a tulip glass. Aroma was typical hefe; spices, banana, a touch of bubblegum. Appearance was stunning, a gorgeous gold color. Unfortunately, the taste and palate left something to be desired; I got grain and little else, and it was fundamentally neutral. If it had tasted as good as it smelled and looked, it would have been phenomenal. As it was, it was average.

Bottle. Gold with a small white head that laces and is retained very well. Nose has wheat, cloves, coriander seeds. Banana is there, but - happily to my taste - faintly. Taste is mildly sweet with some citrus. Palate is lifted a lot by carbonation on the tongue. Perhaps Kristallweizen is not a waste of time after all - it not only works as a pleasant thirst quencher, it has some character.

bottle @ fransican well, cork. my first foray into kristallweizen beers, and im happy i chose this one. it was amazing at the first sip how the flavor really came through. citrusy and maybe some banana, but absolutely delicious, good carbonation, again very happy i chose this one, will defintely have this again.

Location: 12 oz bottle from Norms, 12/28/09 


Aroma: Fruity aroma of banana along with some wheat

Appearance: Clear golden color with a big, soapy white head

Flavor: Taste is sweet and wheaty, much like the nose 

Palate: Body is light, and quite crisp, with a smooth mouthfeel, a little water

Overall Impression: 
This is my first Kristallweizen rating, and its a solid beer for sure, though not earth shattering by any means.  Definitely a style for all the wheat beer fans out there.  Probably a good beer for a refreshing drink, but not anything particularly exciting.  Overall, Id call this one refreshing and crisp, but not great...

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2012 bright banana and citrus aroma, very wheat-y and crisp, clove throughout. 
pours clear watery straw with huge fluffy white head.
flavor is a bit more watery than usual, but still has citrus and cloves.
bodys very thin and watery, no real finish, but its nicely crisp and dry with a banana finish.

500 ml Bottle @ HomePours a clear golden with a lasting fluffy white head. Has a lively fruity aroma and flavour, with hints of wheat. Doesnt have any noticeable bitterness. Lively carbonation with a light body. Lasting finish with lingering fruitiness. A good beer, I would recommend it.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2010 (pint bottle - glass)  Pours a clear golden yellow liquid with a thick head that eventually dissapates.  Aroma is of a wheat malt and a banana, clove yeast.  Taste is a balance of malt and yeast with little detectable hops.  Taste also has notes of banana, clove, licorice and bubblegum.  It is medium bodied and has an average carbonation.

16.9 Oz bottle. Pours very clear light golden with a good thick head with solid retention. Dominant banana aroma, bit of malt, no hops. Wheat on the tongue with a banana finish, no noticeable bitterness. High carbonation with medium body.
fein weisse aroma, rocky, hazy, pale, medium bitter, lihht sweet and sour, medium body, average CO2, long finish, dobrá penka
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text: ( 500ml bottle) pours very clear golden, nice lasting white head, effervescent bubbles emanating from the bottom of my glass. Nose of cereal grains, banana and spices. Taste of ripe bananas, wheat, and spices with a dry finish. Very carbonated, nice body but slightly off flavor in the finish here. Very drinkable clear wheat beer.

Poured clear and gold with bubbles streaming towards an almost creamy white head.  Spotty lacing.  The aroma is cereal, wheat, light spice and a touch of citrus.  The flavor is spicy wheat and some citrus.  Clean and easy drinking  Really pretty damn good.

Bottle from Winooski. Pours clear pale amber with a big white creamy and foamy head. Nose is very citrusy with notes of wheat. Taste is mainly wheat with some citrusy notes. Quite fruity on the finish. Strong wheat presence. i think his may be the best wheat beer Ive had. Quite refreshing and fresh. Finish is a bit dry compared to others wheat beer. Nice beer, I liked it a lot !
Bottle from coldbrewky. Pours crystal clear, reminds me of a pilsner. Super bubbly. Light and crisp, tastes of bananas and coriander. Nice! Thanks Steve!
Bottle - Pale yellow with a large dense head.  Great big spicy yeasty aroma dominated by cloves.  Nice smooth mouth feel, more spicy cloves with a hint of malt.  Dry lingering finish.

Bottle pours clear gold with a creamy white head.  Aroma shows notes of lemongrass, bubblegum, and a trace amount of banana.  Flavor is filled with wheat bread, citrus and a little bit of soap.  Overall body is light, crisp and finishes on a slightly sour note. Slightly more simplistic hefe.

good clean beer.  the aromas are nice and subtle, mainly resin .  Looks great in the glass, very clear golden color.  Taste is quite refreshing, slighlty light but with enough flavor to taste.  lots of light bread, some spice.

Pours absolutely clear golden yellow with ample head but no lacing. The flavor is similar to a good hefe with a sweet banana aspect but lacking the yeast flavor, the creamy texture and with little there on the finish other than a little sour. More crisp than the hefeweizen but lacking in flavor.

Kind of enjoyed this one...the sourness was a bit refreshing.  10 karat brew with a nice 1/2 inch ivory head.  Lots of lemongrass, yeast, and citrus both in aroma and flavor.  Medium mouthfeel with ample carbonation.  Good beer.

Bottle. To not belabor the review - this looks, smells and tastes like a dumbed-down version of their Hefe (which I guess, is kind of what it is). Aroma and flavor both have nice faint notes of classic hefe yeast, banana and clove, but they just linger in the background and the overall effect is a fairly thin, lightly flavored brew. Its certainly drinkable - but not overly flavorful.
24th May 2008. 15 months past BBE date. A pale beer. Clean light malty tones with a subtle touch of sour caraway. Subtle banana tone. Crisp and dry.

i really like this wheat. pours bright yellow with large white head. aroma is very fruity and extremely similar to juicy fruit gum. drinks the same and makes me think im eating juicy fruit. extremely tasty and crisp. almost chuggable.

bottle. Clear golden yellow, large white head. Very intensive aroma of banana and bubblegum. Rather light-bodied for the strength. Shy malty background with fruity banana flavours and shy hints of bubblegum. Shy finish with a small amount of hoppy bitterness.

Bottle. Clear pale gold with good white head that disappeared quickly. Nice interesting estery aroma. Wonderfoull mouthfeel with medium body and frothy fine carbonation. An initial lightly grainy falvour gives way to bananas and citrus notes with a long finish of very mild hoppy bitterness. A nice weissbier.

From bottle, LA Beerfest. Pour is perfectly gold, with light elegant carbonation.  Aroma is faintly banana, wheat, and mild herbal hops.  Flavor is much the same, a light, banana-y, thin Hefeweizen.  Its like if you take Weihens original Hefe, through it through a filter to extract much of the body and flavor from the beer.  The result is simple, much less flavorful, and ultimately quite boring.

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 500ml bottle into a Weizen glass. There is no freshness date on the label but there is a bottle number 0079 on the back label.
