Appearance: The body has a clear golden color with lots of beautiful carbonation steaming up to the surface. The pour produced a very tall, aggressive and tight foamy head. It has a bright white color with great retention and lacing.

Smell: Its nose is full of fruity yeast with notes of banana and clove. There are notes of pale beady wheat as well and just a touch of citrus.

Taste/Palate: The flavor is very bright and fresh with plenty of fruity yeast. There are notes of banana, clove and a slight hint of citrus fade into dry crisp wheat malt notes. The finish is very crisp and snappy with some wheat tang and citrus quickly leaving the tongue. The body has a solid medium feel with cleansing active carbonation.

Notes: This was my first Kristalweizen and I was very impressed with the bright clean flavor and good solid yeast flavor. There was much more yeast character than I was expecting in this crystal clear German wheat beer.

500ml bottle served in a weiss glass.  Crystal clear golden pour with a thick head of creamy off-white foam that slowly settled.  Very nice lacing.  The aroma had fresh banana, bubblegum, and bready yeast.  The flavor consisted of light wheat and banana.  Minimal yeast spiciness.  The mouthfeel was slightly sharp and crisp.  Moderate carbonation.  Decent, but this was pretty mild on the yeast esters for my tastes.

Clear semi hazy golden yellow color with a small head. Aroma has some sweetness, yeast, fruit, banana, and faint spice. Nice carbonation. Flavor is bright, crisp, spice and yeast with some fruit. Nice body.

50cl bottle into signature weizen glass. Pours clear bright yellow with a thick collar of foamy white head that mostly persists. Nose of bread, bananas, lemon citrus and soft spicy hops. Palate is medium bodied with a lively mouthfeel and a crisp refreshing sweetish finish. Smooth and easily drinkable. Probably the definitive Bavarian filtered wheat beer but this is not a style I am particularly fond of. I would suggest sticking to this brewerys Hefeweizens which have a thicker almost chewy palate and more complex yeasty flavours.

Bottle from the Village Bottle Shop. The aroma has fruit and spice. Pours light gold with a thin, fluffy white head. Light, slightly creamy palate. The flavor has more fruit, spice, citrus, bread and light warming alcohol. Not very much hop flavor here. This is a nice, enjoyable beer that is better than most wheat beers Ive tried.

Pours a light clear yellow with a slight fizzy white head. Aromas of light banana, caramel, slight skunk, and spices. The flavor kinda resembles bubble gum all in all. But on a more serious note, you got bananas, spice(ginger), some yeast(even though its clear as pee), and just a touch of caramel. Its one of those beers that would be perfect in a keg for a wedding or party to have a tasty beer and just as refreshing.

A very clear golden beer with a massive white head. There is a lot of carbonation activity with some bubbles moving slow & some fast, & this beer does look real good. The aroma has some straw, & cereal like qualities. The taste is a little watery at first that leads to a slightly creamy finish that has some hints of banana. This is a very refreshing thirst quencher, & will get this next summer.

Bottle from Grapes of Mirth. Clear yellow/gold pour with a medium white head. Banana yeast aroma that is somewhat subdued by crisp hops and malt. Corny and grainy malt flavor with some banana yeast and a crisp finish. Finish gets a little more peppery as the beer warms. Dont love it, but as my first example of this style I think I like it better than the typical hefeweizen.

Bottle from the rip and run.  Pours a medium golden that is crystal clear and full of  carbonation that lasts and lasts but doesnt put out much of a head.  No lacing.  Nose is of light malts, as is body.   .  I noticed no bananna but found some biting citrus just prior to dry finish.  Wheat is elusive but present.  Nice finish for the day.
Bottle.  pours a golden with a nice white head.  Notes of banana, clove, some light flowery notes, perfume.  Good.

Bottle from The Party Source.  Pours clear gold with a resilient large white head.  Light aroma of wheat, banana, clove, and mild floral notes.  Flavor is also light, with banana, malt, grain, and a squeeze of lemon.  Light bodied, crisp, a lot of carbonation.  Dry finish.

50cl bottle.   Clear gold with a big fluffy head that lasts.   I still dont get the clear thing, but hey, they are one of the best wheat beer brewers out there so they can do it if they want to.   Sweet, perfumey, floral aroma with ripe banana and some wet wheat and lingering spice.   Seems muted compared to the original.   The flavor is light sweetness from the malt and some banana, but not much else.   Seems a little flat in profile overall, and the mouthfeel is a bit stripped, predictably.   Lacks any hop character.   I really dont see why they even bother with this as the regular is so good, but it tastes well made, albeit adulterated.

Clear golden pour with a strong lasting head.  Light aroma but what is there is banana and light clove; the standard German hefe.  Taste upfront is a little bitter with a slight dryness coming immediately after.  Some feeling of sweet grain and lemon juice are also apparent.  Not necessarily the taste of lemon but the same feeling from the acidity. Even after it warms the taste remains mostly bitter.  I fail to find the merit in this.
Bright golden yellow, large and fluffy white head.  Aroma of banana and grapefruit.  Medium malt, well balanced.  Bitter finish.  Refreshing.  Lighter than the hefe version.

HELLO Carbonation! Wow, tons of it... pours out light golden color, similar to coors or bud. Aroma is that typical hefe... but here its mostly cloves with a little bit of banana. Flavor -- You definitely notice that the mouthfeel is a little bit lighter than the unfiltered version. Overall its pretty crisp with flavors of clove, some caramel and banana. Clean palate. Really liked this

Bottle.  Poured pale yellow with thick white head.  Little Lacing.  Aroma of clove, spice and bananas.  Clovey/spicy flavour, but delicate.  Some wheaty and banana notes.  Light finish with a little spice.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text:
Vibrant golden straw pour with a huge head that is constantly fed by very active carbonation.
Aromas of wheat, bubblegum, very faint banana, not much else. Nice, but lacking.
Similar flavours of floury wheat, banana and a faint hint of white grapes. Again, enjoyable, but not particularly exciting.
Moderately light body with fine carbonation.

500mL bottle.  True to form, it pours a crystal-clear pale-gold with a fluffy off-white head.  A crisp, wheaty aroma that features banana, bubble gum, clove, spices, and lemon.  Goes down crisp and refreshing with a good bit of carbonation.  The flavor starts off with some banana & Golden Delicious apples and finishes with a touch of lemon.  Sweet wheatiness and a light spiciness throughout.  Tasty.

Pours a clear yellow with a rocky pure white head. Aroma is somewhat light wheat, sweet malt and some yellow fruit.  Flavor is definitely wheat, a lot of bannana. Light for a wheat which is right on for the style.

Pours a really mice crystal clear lift golden color with a fluffy white head and good carbonation. Aroma is cloves banana bubblegum. Flavor isactually pretty typical wheat beer just not cloudy at all. Decent.

Pours a clear golden yellow color with a big foamy white head that lasts through out leaving chunky lacing in the glass. Crisp light fruit aroma with wheat, apple, citrus peel and banan notes. Very carbonated up front with crisp citrus fruit and slightly sour finish. Flavor similar to aroma with hints of golden apple, lemon/orange/grapefruit peel and banana. Crisp sour fruit presence with a slightly dry finish. Very refreshing!

Clear yellow pour with a half finger tight froth. Banana and clove round out the aroma with some tropical fruit notes and sweet wheat malt. Flavor is banana again, with lots of citrus and wheat grain. Palate is a tad watery, but good for the style, leaving a bubbly film on the roof of the mouth, Crisp and highly refreshing.

Light gold pour with an good looking frothy white head. Aroma holds lots of banana, grain, light spice, and some tropical fruit, almost like a mango or guava quality. Flavor again has lots of wheat malt, with banana still present but mellowed out some as compared to the aroma. Also some floral notes in the flavor. Palate is crisp and clean, though a bit watery, but I feel that lightness is whats to be expected from this style. Very refreshing, great beer for a hot day.
Bottle. Big frothy white head, Light pale yellow color with citrus and floral notes of light banana. Bitter lemon start with smooth balanced finish, dry the whole way through.

Clear golden yellow color with a tall soapy white head.  Aroma of spice, wheat, and banana.  Adequate lacing.  Very light with a crisp, wheat flavor and clove.  A little different and enjoyable due to its crispness
Light, but not as bad as I thought.  Kind of like a lighter hefe.  Fruity, a bit watery, clean.  Very light.

Appearance: Pours a clear pale yellow color with a large white head. The head quickly disappears and leaves a thin head on top. 

Smell: Citrus, banana, grains, and wheat. Also a bit of a floral and clove smell.

Taste: A little sweet. As far as flavor it is not that great. I get wheat and banana.

Mouthfeel/drinkability: Light bodied and very crisp and clean.
clear yellow with a massively huge fluffy white head, it has slightly spice aroma and relatively fruity flavor.  smooth and easy drinking.

8/05/2009:  Weihenstephaner Kristall Weissbier...  Aroma:  Like a hefe crossed with an American Wheat beer - Wheat and slightly sour with delicate spice and a hint of bubblegum, but lacking the typical Hefe yeastiness and rich banana.  Appearance:  Beautiful, near perfect pour into my Aynger 0.5 l weizen glass; crystal clear appearance; pale sunshine golden yellow color; puffy, lasting white head thats two fingers deep and has stiff peaks; fast and furious carbonation, generous amount and quite lively; hanging puffy lacing on the glass. Flavor:  Lightly wheaty with dry biscuit malt in the middle along with a subtle level of clove and bubblegum, crisp and grassy finish.  Palate:  Light and refreshing, airy mouthfeel without being overcarbonated.  Overall:  I guess it was about time to sample the only beer style on RateBeer than I had not yet checked off the list.  This beer is supposedly the best of the style, but I have never been a big fan of either the Weihenstephaner brewer or the German Kristallweizen.  There is nothing wrong with this style or particular beer per se, but lets be honest about this...  German Kristallweizen : German Hefeweizen :: Pale Lager : Pilsener.  Why not just drink the "real" thing?!
One Pint, 0.9 fl. oz. bottle (5.4% ALC/VOL / 1049) from The Party Source in Bellevue, Kentucky.  Rating #689 for this beer.

Bottle.  Pours a golden color with a nice big fluffy head, kind of like what one would expect at a beer garden tent at Oktoberfest.  Aroma of malts, anise, cloves and grass become apparent on the pour.  Similar taste.  Analogous to a Belgian tripel.  Light to medium bodied.   Crisp finish.  Pretty good.

Yes, checking off another wheat beer style.  500 mL bottle.  Pours a bright transparent yellow with a big bubbly white head.  Aroma is a straightforward blend of cloves and bubble gum.  Light clove flavor with wheat.  I like the aroma, but the excitement stops there.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2010 Pours a "kristall" clear golden yellow with a massively soapy head that lasts and leaves branches of lace. The aroma is earthy, crisp, wheat, with clove and a little banana. The flavor is similar, but very light and crisp. Smooth palate with a clean finish. The perfect summer brew.
Bottle. Pale golden color with tall white head. Tastes of banana, clove, bread. Refreshing and wonderful.

500ml bottle. Pale straw in colour with a massive rocky snow white head . Clear and well carbonated with strong banana and bubblegum aroma with a hint of spices and fruit. Smooth and very drinkable with a banana flavour that is light and fluffy in the mouth.

(bottle)  Aroma is typical of German wheat beer, with  muted banana.  Poured a brilliant crystal clear golden colour with substantial wheat head.  Flavour was of sweet malt and clove.  Very filling for a wheat beer, and surprisingly flavourful for a filtered Weissbier.
this beer has a very light look yet, it maintains a lot of flavor. the taste is rich is sweet malts with a tropical fruit overtone. palate is highly fizzy. very good.

Very light, fizzy pour.  Aroma has a touch of floral hops, plus some rich, malty tones, which is surprising for such a pale brew.  There is a wee bit of corn and cheese too.  This tastes very light and crisp, with some wheat malt, and is clearly a summer beer.  This appears to be a milder, filtered version of their magnificent hefeweizen, and  a little lemon goes nicely with it.  This is a good light brew, and surprisingly, it is ratebeers number one beer for the style.

NIce hazy orange yellow color with rich whie head. The taste is the good old  classic german beer taste. Its similar to the paulaner taste but a little more easygoing. Very nice though. Surely worth a try.

Pours clear gold into the glass with a small white head.  Aroma still has some banana and clove present.  Flavor is wonderfully refreshing with a clean malt and wheat giving way to a crisp hop presence.  This is a highly quaffable beer that I will now make sure to keep around!
Bottle at ABC beer tasting. Poured a pale gold with a foamy white head. Flavor was sweet and malty. Dry and a bit sweet with a malty and hop undertones.

Bottle as shown. Pours a clear yellow golden with a medium frothy white head that leaves behind good sticky lacing along the glass. The aroma is yeasty wheat with banana and citrus. Medium mouthfeel with a bubblegum flavor with clove and banana with a nice dry finish. Easy to drink, a very good Kristallweizen.
Pours light gold with white bubbly head that lasts. Not much on the nose maybe a earthy banana. Flavors are of effervesent herb, yeast and light banana. Very crisp, refreshing beer!

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2009 What a delightful beer this was, my first and only Krystal Weizen; from Belmont Station in Portland.  It began with a rocky white head, two fingers thick above a body that was clear and gold.  Aroma was, well, tghe best I can come up with is that it reminded me very much of an Abbey Dubbel or Tripel; lots of spice and also some fruity notes.  The aroma totally belies the colour; one whiff and youre expecting to be looking a something much darker and thicker.  Taste was like the aroma, i.e., rewarding.

16oz. Pours a crystal clear gold even when served the traditional way (half pour with a swirl and then pouring the rest). Large white head. Yeasty aroma but not as intense as its big brother the original hefe. Spicier but with less banana. The flavor has more clove and bubblegum and less banana and no vanilla caramel notes like its big brother. Still a fantastically refreshing beer. My first of the style and I really dig it! Terrific german brewery here.

500 ml bottle. Clear pale golden color, white head. Banana aroma and flavor, with some other fruity notes and some spicyness. Medium body, medium carbonation. Pretty similar to the hefe, but clear. Not really a selling point on its own.

Bottle.  Pours a clear almost hazed bright yellow with a medium to large white head.  Grain, but not overly cereal smelling, lemony citrus.  Light body but with ample carbonation.  Slight sweetness, citric tones, and a hint of banana.   Finishes light and a bit yeasty with a of banana.
On tap at Hessen Haus. Pretty similar flavorwise to the hefe, but a bitter duller with some more vomit. Not bad though, but no reason to get it over the hefe.

500 ml bottle. Pours a huge fluffy lasting white head, over a crystal clear pale yellow (SRM 5) body....nose of bread yeast, apple, clove, lemon, some banana.....tastes early of mild wheat malts, then clove, apple and lemon dominate, with clove lingering.....mouth feel is light, carbonation fairly high. A  wonderfully complex effort considering how light the ingredients really are.

Im not a huge weiss beer fan, but I like to kick back with one every now and then to keep it interesting.  This seemed like a very full bodied and flavorful weiss.  Lots of clove and banana esthers.   Would like to try this with a touch of lemon wedge.

bottle. Pours a syrupy bright yellow color with a huge bright white head. Head recedes and leaves a filmy lacing on top. Nose is bananas and light pepper with some clove hints and a sugary sweetness. Palate is syrupy and full with a light effervescent. Flavors are light banana, some nice sweet malt notes, sugars, and a clean finish.

Bottle.  Pours a large, creamy, pitted, white head with a clear, golden colored body.  More Bavarian countryside malt aroma - wheat, hay and straw accompanied by a big-time clove presence.  Rounded out by some vanilla and a touch of banana.  Medium body with lively carbonation.  Lightly tart, metallic finish.  Very tasty beer.

Bottle. Looks fanatastic-pours with a huge rocky white head and a lively light yellow body. Big yeast driven aroma and flavour profile being oriented more to banana than clove. A pleasant lively mouthfeel and a slightly acidic finish. A great beer.

Bottle  Pours a clear yellow with a big white head.  The head has average staying power but I see bubbles popping rapidly.  Laces fairly well.  Aroma is sweet with hints of fruits, Pepper, and wheat.  Has a decent carbonation and a pretty good mouthfeel.  The taste is good with plenty of spices.  Very clean.  Has a medium body and a watery texture.  A pretty good finish with a good aftertaste.  Not a bad beer.

500 ml bottle from Canals Hainesport. Pours a super thin pale gold, very macroish, with an above average size bright white fluffy head. Aroma of cloves, banana, wheat, slight pepery notes. Watery bodied with very strong carbonation, especially for how watery this one feels. Flavor is like a weissbier light, slight wheat and clove but seems watered down.
Pours a clear golden body with a white, lacing head.  Smells of banana and yeast.  Flavors is of yeast, banana, and dirt.  Finish fades fast.

(bottle) pours a sparkling, clear golden colour with a white head. aroma of clove, banana, wheat and overripe fruit. flavour is the same, very mellow, the wheat being particularly dominant. perfect carbonation, could use a little more body.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2009 Bottle 50 cl. Pours a clear pale yellow with a medium white head and an aroma of wheat, yeast and dough. The taste is high on wheat, with some notes of yeast, coriander and white bread. A nice beer but not the best by this brewery.

Clear yellow pour with a thick foamy white head that had surprisingly good retention and leaves lace. Aroma is yeast, clove, wheat, and spicy bread. Taste is yeast, some tartness, ripe fruit, and banana. Overall very crisp clean and refreshing. The absolute perfect beer for a hot day.

2009 Bottle.  Perhaps Im just not used to Kristallweizens, but this didnt strike me as a 78% quality beer.  Aroma of yeast and wheat.  Looks very pale yellow with much carbonation.  Tastes like a light wheaty lager, but still very good.  Palate is a bit watery and very effervescent.  Good for a hot summer day.

500 ml stamped 1438. Shaving cream head sits atop clear light golden bottle. Very few bubbles ascending; looks almost like gel. Initial flavor is very good, with citrus, subtle banana and spice. Less banana on the tongue than in the nose, however. The finish is abrupt. Refreshing, and seems to have more flavor as it warms.

Bottle from BevMo.  Pours a brilliant clear golden color with a medium white head.  Aroma of banana, clove, grain, and yeast.  Flavor is pale malt, lots of banana and clove, yeast, with mild sweetness.  Fairly light on the palate with a dry finish.  Excellent summer beer.

this is quite nice and spicy with clove citrus and perhaps some coriander. fresh grains and grassy the beer is soothing with its tastes of spice and banana. nice mouthfeel that is bright complex and appealing. lovely honey sweetness brings out a well made brew. nice aroma.

Bottle. A clear golden color with a huge fluffy white head that lasted quite a while. Aroma is yeasty,banana, clove,and citrus.Flavor is bready,yeasty,more of the Belgin yeast,clove,banana, grass,and grain.Crisp mouthfeel,high carbonation,light body. A good drinker on a nice Spring day,kind of like a spiced Lager.

Bottle thanks to lb4lb.  Aroma has notes of yeast, white fruits, bread.  Pale clear yellow with an average sized white frothy head that lasted and left some lace.  Flavor is musty, sweet and dry.  Palate is light bodied and lively.  Not bad but not note worthy either.

Admittedly, wheat beers of any kind arent my favorite. I can appreciate what they offer, and the fact they they are extremely quenching on a hot day, but most of the time theres not a lot to hang your tastebuds on (unless of course you get a top notch German hefe). I wouldnt call this one top notch, but its still good. 

The beer pours out a pale yellow color, brilliantly clear with a extra large, 4 finger thick head. Pillowy, bubbyly and foamy would be the best way to describe it. The head disipates rather quickly, and leaves behind some spotty lacing, but the clarity of the beer is nice. Aroma has lots, and lots of bubblegum, a bit dusty, crackers and a touch of banana. Flavors carried some spicyness, a bit of mashed banana and bubblegum while still having some grassy character to round it out. Finish is crisp with no lingering bitterness. Good beer to help put out the heat, or just drink while relaxing.
Sweet and mildly spicy grain aroma. Clear golden color with a medium white head, Sweet light grain beginning that gets a little sour in the end. Light palate with fine carbonation at the end.
for a wiess bier which is not my favorite style very good. A filtered version clear as can be with hints of banana. very ligfht on the palate

Source:  16.9 oz bottle purchased from Greens in Atlanta on Buford.Appearance: Poured a clear yellow color with a two finger, bubbly white head.  Aroma:  Notes of banana and clove, with bubblegum and a hint of grain.  Flavor: Bready with banana and clove, but only in slight amounts.  Kind of bland, but represents the style well. Palate: Medium/light body with solid carbonation and a watery mouthfeel.Overall:  Good for the style, but not my favorite.

Very nice brew!  The aroma says hey Im a hefe, bubblegum and yeast.  The appearance says, I should be a pale lager.  The flavor says hmmm, good like a hefe, but muted like a poor hefe.  I acknowledge however that it is good without the classic hefe like character.  Its really smooth.  Good stuff!

(Bottled) Clear paleish golden with a medium, firm and white head. Aroma of wheaty banana, but also some tripel-style pale maltiness with alcohol hints. Pear-banana-fruity flavor with some clove spiciness, and faint hints of cardboard. Almost medium body with quite high carbonation. A quality weizen stripped of its natural complexity. No match for the real thing as such, but might indeed suit white fish or salads.

Bottled 50cl. It pours a clear pale golden beer with a tall white head. The nose is slightly smoky with banana, sulphur quite a lot of cinnamon and cloves appearing. I like the cinnamon characteristic. Quite unusual. A lot of banana, pear, cinnamon, nutmeg, caramel and cloves showing up in the flavor. Very drinkable. Sweet finish. Really pleasant.

Light, clear gold color with a big, rocky, white head.  Grassy, lemony aroma with lots of sweet banana esters and some cracked wheat.  Sweet corn and wheat malt flavor with lots of clove, honey, lemon, and banana.  Finishes faintly like sour milk.    Medium body with plentiful but soft carbonation.

Pours an absolutely clear pale gold with a frothy, impressive white head with some lacing. Light wheat & lager-malt aroma. Light wheaty taste with just a touch of the banana and none of the spice. Slightly creamy with good carbonation. Quaffable, but by no means something Id buy again.

Bottle from BevMo!  Nice golden straw color with a pure white head. Aromas of wheat, banana, and sweet corn. The flavor is light and crisp, yet with enough body to be satisfying with wheat, banana, and a touch of sweet malt at the end. A very nice effervescent clear brew that would be great at on a hot summer day.
Bottle. Large foamy white head. Clear and light gold body. Smells of wheat, coriander, clove, orange peel. Crisp and refreshing wheat taste. Watery mouthfeel.

Bottle.  Stale yeast and airy nose, whereas the regular Weihenstephaner just overflows with lovely banana, clove, and wheat aroma.  Clear yellow-golden pour, heavily and consistently carbonated.  Light, crisp body, just a touch of malt, the overall feel is very clean and refreshing.  Suddenly, in the taste, the initial staleness has disappeared.  Aftertaste is lightly yeasty and malty.  Mild and extreeemely refreshing!  Im not at all a fan of Kristallweizen, but Id not mind having this several times more - this is probably the best in style. [3.4]Ok, this is just fing delicious, no husky graininess or astringency, no signs of aggressive filtering, just the ideal light beer for game-watching and volume drinking.[3.6]

500 mL bottle from Wine Warehouse in Charlottesville, VA. Pours a clear golden color with a large frothy head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma is strong banana and clove with lighter notes of apple and pear. Taste is toasted bready malts, banana, bubblegum, pear and clove. Strong carbonation with a bristly, full mouthfeel.

Bottle.  Pours a pale golden, very effervescent with a creamy white head that laces nicely.  Aroma is sweet, faint banana sweet.  Flavor is mild banana sweet upfront a sweet malt body that finishes dry and a hint tart.  Light, refreshing and quaffable.

Pours as crystal clear pale and golden as a bud light, with an enormous fluffy white head that leaves plenty of lace. There is plenty of bubbly effervescence coming up from the bottom of the glass. Aromas of copper banana and some spiciness. Flavor is bubblegum some sweat some banana and just a mild little spiciness. Overall its sweeter than I like a beer to be but thats fairly typical of the style. The mouth feel is very light and smooth.
pours  pale yellow with a big fluffy head. Smells a bit floral with a bit of yeast and fruit. Ultra clear  and a bit thin on the mouth. Not bad really.

Pint bottle pour into a pint glass.Had a nice flowery/citrus aroma that was strong but not over the top.Nice color almost a banana yellow,decent white head.Wheat and spice flavors with a little fruitiness.Very easy to drink good flavor mixes well doesnt hang around too long.Really good beer would not hesitate to drink again.

16.9 oz Bottle-Clear yellow color w/a moderate, quickly dissipating white head. Spiced wheat aroma. Solid wheat, fruit, spice, banana, citrus. Kind of a light, thin mouthfeel, especially compared to their Hefe, but a solid beer overall. Easy to drink, alcohol was well hidden.
Lovely wheat beer.Creamy malt, smooth and a  crap load of the customary  banana ester vibe .Salty,bitter and attacking on the palate.Raspy id say .
Pours a golden color with a large white head. Aroma of banana, cloves, wheat, malt. Flavor is banana, clove, citrus, wheat. Nice easy drinking beer. Very refreshing.

Gorgeous pale golden colour, with an immaculate clean white head. Typical wheat beer traits of cloves and banana, with a lovely creamy mouthfeel. A good swill around the mouth reveals a hint of orangey citrus. Refreshing, easy drinking and just the right amount of fizz. Great stuff.

Bottle 50cl. @ home.Clear medium yellow color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, wheat, light to moderate yeasty, banana, gum. Flavor is light to moderate sweet with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20081130]

Bottle.  Pours a bright golden in color with a pure white head.  The aroma is clean and fruity; flavor is lots of banana, light spice of clove.  It has a medium body and light clean finish.  I am starting to like kristalls better than standard Hefes.

The color of golden wheat with continuous upward bubbling and a thick, airy, sea-foam head. Deep crisp aromas of wheat and musky cloviness with a prickly spicibess and clean yeast to it  Upon aeration, a touch of banana appears. Somewhat confused swirl of wheat, sour banana, clove and clean yeast flavors as well as hints of herbs and spice. Refreshing with a sour-tart finish
My first kristallweizen.  Pours clear yellow with a modest white head.  Not much to it; the flavors are hinting of banana and yeast.  A little spicy.

Clear yellow with a white head.  Aroma is malty, earth, grass, lemon, cloves, and fruits.  Crisp, very refreshing mouth.  Flavor is spicy, fruity, some clove, light yeast.  Excellent thirst quencher on a hot afternoon.  (Bottle at Domicil, Pattaya)

1 pt 0.9 oz bottle:  Aroma has a really nice hefewiezen scent to it.  Bananas, clove, bubblegum, a bit of lemon, and overall a really nice floral aroma.  Appearance is a clear golden color with some really nice lacing and a large foamy white head.  Taste is Taste is interestinga bit of tart lemon, wheat, somewhat metallic, bubble gum, and coriander.  Palate has a nicely carbonated mouth feel, lingering fruitiness in the aftertaste.  Overall, Not that bad at all.  I would drink this more often as a easy drinking summer beer, if it more prevalent in my area. Cheers!!

Brewed in Germany........ Pours a faint yellow color with a super foamy white head and some enticing carbonation in the glass. Aroma of malts, spices and cloves. Taste is of bananas, wheat, cloves and a hint of lemons. The mouthfeel is zesty with a pleasant dry finish. Pretty interesting brew !!
Light lager like clear yellow, thick billowing white foam that lasts.  Aroma is spicy, malty, some citrus and lemon.  Taste is more coriander spice, lemon zest and a drying finish.
Bottle at Bier Koning. Beautifully clear with large head. Fruity nose, also of bananas. Also in the taste, with wheat thrown in. Nice and tangy.

This is the first German Kristallweizen Ive had before and its quite good. The aroma was average and it was amazing how long this beer bubbled. The flavor was admirable with tons of clove notes. Overall this beer is very good and I would defiantly buy it again.

Bottle into weizen glass. Pours crystal clear yellow-gold, big fluffy white head, extremely effervescent. Nose is yeasty, bananas and lots of cloves in this one. Taste is tangy wheat, some bananas, cloves, kinda sweet towards the finish, dry. Finish is extremely clean and crisp, drops right off the palate. Mouthfeel is light and crisply carbonated. Obviously, the original is a fuller, better beer, but is a nice beer in its own right.
Bottle. Clear yellow with a white head. Wheat, banana ester and spicy aroma. Flavour is wheat, banana and clove. Refreshing beer.

Aroma is a little skunky (in a good way) and musty.  Pours crystal clear with a lot of fluffy head. In the flavor I can detect notes of clove and bananas. Partially sweet, and ending on that sweet note. Finishes on almost a nutty note.
Bright yellow in color with a decent sized white head. Aroma is of orange peel, bananas, peaches and nuts. Flavor is bananas, lemon zest and light wheat.

From BevMo at $3.69 this poured hazy gold with fat white head and good lacing.  Nose was of caramel malts and some grain.  Light and clean mouthfeel. Flavors are o banana, citrus, and clove. Nice finish. Easy to drink beer.

This was my first ever tasting of a Kristallweizen. I was curious what my favourite style of beer (hefeweizen) would taste like without yeast. Poured a nice clear gold with a typical weizen head...thick, foamy, and slowly dissipating. Banana, clove, and mild yeast and spices in the nose and flavour. Mild and sweet finish. Nothing bad to say about this one really, except I much prefer hefeweizens.
UPDATED: OCT 10, 2009 A little note of the tropics on the nose, with a classic golden body and a short, foamy white head, this is a great fizzy brew, crisp, satisfying.

Bottle.  Yeasty lemon and banana aroma.  Clear yellow-golden body, enormous thick fluffy white head.  Flavor is very crisp and refreshing, with lemon, a little banana, and light sweetness.  Excellent.

I was looking at the styles I hadn’t had and noticed I was missing a Kristallweizen. Kristallweizen? What the hell is a Kristallweizen? I went to Binnys and asked.  "Its like a Hefeweizen without the hefe." I was told. Reminded me of a different encounter I had with CaryTheDude and poor descriptions of beer. Pours a very clear golden with lively carbonation and a big, thick, white head. Flavor of spice, clove, some citrus, maybe a bit of apple. Clove and banana flavor, also some apple and spice notes. Light and bubble mouthfeel. Pretty cool. I guess its clearer than hefes?

Bottle. Poured a lovely slighty cloudy golden colour with a thick white head. The aroma is full of spices with a hint of cloves. The taste is full of spices cloves and a citrus. The finish is very sweet on the palate.

16.9oz bottle pours a slightly cloudy pale gold with a large white head, decent retention, good lacing.  Aromas of bubblegum, bananas, yeast, lemon zest and a little spice.  Flavors lemon zest, white pepper, and some spice.  Palate is clean and crisp.
pale yellow pour with a thin 1 finger white head.  nose of clove and some bananas.  thin on the palate with a flavor that resembles the nose.
Clear gold pour, white head.  Aroma is full of malt, yeast and some spices mixed with bananas.  Flavor is clean and malty.  Some spices and yeast.  Very good.
Clear golden with a large white head. Sweet yeasty aroma with hints of banana and wheat. Flavour likewise and it finished sweet.
This poured from a 500ml bottle.Poured a golden color with a large white head.The aromas were of yeast and bananas.The taste was of wheat,clove,light citrus,banana adnof course yeast.Not bad.

500 mL into a Franziskaner glass. Pours a clear yellow with a good white head and terrific lacing. High carbonation. Aromas of cloves, yeast, bananas. taste adds some coriander and vanilla. Long, spicy finish. For a filtered wheat beer this is not bad whatsoever.

Familiar aromas of the hefeweizen  clove banana and a strong smell of wheat ceral grain  Unlike the Hefe it has a crystal clear appearance  It is straw gold, with lots of bubblees and a large white head  The flavor again has the spiciness from cloves and the fruity sweetness of banana that a hefe does  Strong flavor of wheat  Maybe a little thinner in body than the hefe  The finish has a decent amount of hops  and the finish lingers on the palate a while  I am not a big Hefeweizen fan  but I do not see this as a big departure from that style  As for this beer I found it relatively enjoyable
golden color with a large white head that lingers more than most.  Banana with lots of cloves.  Lots of carbonation.

Pint bottle...  Poured clear golden with an easy foaming white head.  Aroma of cloves and yeasty characters.  Highly carbonated which was really refreshing that complemented the fruity, sweet characters of the brew.  I love wheat beers like this even during the winter, as
most prefer them in the summer months.  Crisp hops and lemon-citrus flavors with banana, and yeasty strains at the finish.

Bottle.  Poured a clear golden color with a thick, fluffy white head that diminished to a thick layer.  Aroma of banana, clove, and some wheat.  Crisp, moderately sweet entry with some citrus fruit (orange and light lemon) that transitions into a crisp wheatiness with some banana and spicy clove.  Lacked the doughy yeastiness of the hefe, but had a bit more carbonation.  Overall a very decent, easy-drinking beer.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2008 Pours a very light see-thru golden with a few tiny bubbles and a big snow-white sudsy foam on top.   Aroma is a bit tangy, lots of sweeter banana, a little bit sour but pleasant (older bottle), and some metallic notes.  Flavor is quite good, tangy banana, light wheat, very lightly spiced.  The banana flavor is dominate but in perfect moderation.  I love it.   Medium/light bodied with crisp clean carbonation, light wheat creaminess.   Fantastic beer! Very drinkable!

Poured into my Franziskaner weizen glass. Light gold color with a gorgeous 3 finger white head. Tons of lacing and good retention.

Aroma is fresh lemon with a big clove note. Pithy unripe banana is also there.

Flavor is banana and vanilla, like a smoothie. Clove is toned down a bit.

Lively carbonation and light, refreshing body. Nice summer beer. The smoothness and well-craftedness harken back to the unfiltered version of this beer, and are hallmarks of Weihenstephaner.

375ml bottle.  Pours a clear light gold with a 3 finger rocky snow white head and great lacing.  Nose is coriander, clove, bubble gum and banana.  Taste is much the same with some white pepper in the finish.  Mouth feel is fairly light.  Decent refreshing brew.

Golden clear body with loads of soapy dense white head
Lots of wheaty banana on the nose with some mellower vanilla notes
Clovey nutmeg spice banana flavor. 
Pillowy mouthfeel, very light and fluffy.

This beer poured a nice golden color with a fluffy, pillowy white head that lasted throughout.  Aroma was dominated by banana with hints of vanilla and spice.  Not a whole lot different in taste from the hefeweizen, but the mouthfeel is different.   Pretty good beer.

Bottle. Pours a brillian straw color with a fluffy white head that stays until the end with generous lacing. Huge smell of bananas with a clove undertone. Maybe a hint of vanilla. Tastes similar to the regular weissbier but, cleaner and dryer. Not as full of flavor but, still good.
Clean medium plate. Pretty easy drinking. Another good weissbier.

This beer has a nice light golden color.  The head is rather nice, it’s thick, dense, and it lingers.  Some nice lacing adding to the appearance of the beer.  Flavor is definitely spicey, but not overpowering.  It’s a nice brew.

A pale sraw colour with a fine pearl head this beer had tropical aromas of Banana, honey and mango. 

Highly refreshing and very palatable this is a very easy to drink beer. There is little residual bitterness and is not heavy on the stomach.

Flavours of wheat and fruit make this a summery beer and a top notch one at that.

bottle. Pours clear golden, with a huge frothy white head. Aroma of wheat, with clove and banana. Flavor was as advertised in the aroma, with hefty wheat, nicely complimented by banana, yeast, and spice. Active, effervescent carbonation. Very flavorful for a Kristal.

1 pint something, my first taste at a Kristallweizen, and to tell you the truth I cant tell the diffrence between this and the regular hefe-weizen. Poured clear golden body with huge white head with very large bubbles rising. Bananas, a little alcohol, citrus. Clean , crisp mouthfeel, a little lemon and a nice balanced bite at the end. Great beer for the summer.

Bottle. Moderate aroma of grain, light herbs for the hops, moderate musty and barnyard for the yeast, with clove and vegetables in the background. Head is huge, rocky, white with good lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is sparkling clear gold. Flavor starts lightly sweet and acidic then finshes lightly acidic and very lightly bitter. Palate is light to medium, watery and has a lively carbonation. I didn’t expect the depth of tastes in this beer because of it’s clarity.

Aroma is a faint malt scent with a bold skunk scent in the back.  Color is a bright gold with average carbonation and a loose white head.  Taste is light sweet and spicy.  Starting with a light body it goes down easy and crisp.  Finish comes in with a light sweet maltiness, a hint of coriander and just a touch of orange.  After taste is clean.  This is a very good Kristallweizen and even though there is skunk in the aroma there is none in the taste.

Bright clear yellow with fizzy white head.  Nothing much to look at, really.  Aromas of bananas and clove and some wheat and grassy hops.  Not so much yeast, which my nose wants to detect.  Feels over carbonated.  Seems easy to drink; a summer day beer.  Still, nothing amazing.

I’m at a loss as to why this style exists, are people afraid of unfiltered cloudy beers? I’m going to give this beer the same rating i gave their Hefe cause its the same beer, and it tastes identical, its just looks like a lager.

bottle 500ml 6,2e at St Urho’s Pub Helsinki EXP 030609 pale yellow creamy white head fizzy. Pleasant kick of phenols and banana from first sip. Malty grain hops in aftertaste tasty one. I had ignored kristall wheat beers  years thinking lack of taste and preferred  unfiltered ones.

Pours a pale translucent yellow. Profuse white head. Looks like a pils almost. The nose is very wheaty, yeasty, citrusy, sharp lemongrass. The flavor is very wheaty, crisp grassy hop flavor, yeasty, bready, lightly lemony. Very refreshing mouthfeel and very quaffable.

500 mL bottle.  Golden and active with a small, dissipating white head.  The aroma is not much different than their straight weisse.  The flavour, however, is milder - perhaps a side effect of tastebuds being overwhelmed by the high carbonation.  Quite crisp and refreshing.  A good situational beer.
Bottle. Pours a pale, crystal clear yellow with a frothy white head.  Aroma is banana & cloves. Clean, thin dry palate. Flavor is wheat, light spice & light hops. Good warm weather beer.

La migliore kristallweizen tedesca assaggiata fino ad oggi mi fa un pochino ino ricredere sull’inutilità dello stile; effettivamente sviluppa, soprattutto nel sapore, un carattere piuttosto personale nei confronti della sua sorella non filtrata, che si risolvono in un agrumato pungente che sacrifica la pastosità della hefe per acquistare una grande piacevolezza beverina e dissetante. E’ anche un prodotto di discreta qualità, per dire; le due cose vanno bene.
Pours a clear gold with a huge head. Big aroma of banana, wheat, citrus, spices. Nice palate, nice flavor.

Pours a clearish bubbly golden color with a medium sized white head.  Smell is crisp malt, wheat and light hops.  A bit lager like.  Tastes like a pale lager brewed with wheat.  Some light yeast flavor.  Decent, easy drinking if not a touch overcarbonated.
Kristal Clear yellow hence the Name.  Banana and mild spice nose with a high carbonation level helps provides a nice crisp clean taste. An excellent summer beer.

16.9 oz. bottle.  Pours a crystal clear gold with a large white head that is fed by a steady stream of tiny carbonation bubbles.  The head lasts through two-thirds of the glass and leaves some patchy lace.  Pleasant aroma of wheat and orange.  The flavor is wheat with some mild orange, lemon and banana.  A bit of sweetness in the flavor as well.  Nice crisp finish.  Very refreshing and enjoyable.

Bottle: Clear, pale golden, big, persistent white head; moderate clean wheaty-citrousy nose; sweetish-sourish flavour, fizzy and light bodied; sweetish-lemony finish with a little tartness coming late. Don’t like the style very much, but I like this example.........

clear golden with a head that  is absolutely bonkers... gargantuan.  Wheaty lighty citrusy with yeasty metallic notes to smell.  A slightly watery body, yet has light spiced and clovey features which makes for a drinkable and quenching brew.  Not expecting a lot of depth here, but surprised at the amount of substance.  Still good for what it is.

(6/17/08) Bottle at Schwarzwaldstuben in Berlin. Clear golden with a medium white head. Aroma of wheat, clove, banana and a bit of bubblegum notes. Sweetish flavor with some banana and some spiciness. Medium-bodied. Definitely good, but still not close to its unfiltered brother

On tap @ in de Wildeman. Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma of banana, wheat. Flavour is banana sweetness, wheat, some dough. Crisp finish, a little bitter even. Full mouthfeel, lots of carbonation. Very refreshing.

500ml bottle from Holiday Market, pours a clear pale yellow gold (straw) with a fluffy varied bubbled head, very effervescent!   This beer was effervescing till the very end, such a nice pretty beer to look at, medium aroma of bananas  and cloves with pilsner bread fragrances, some lemon citrus, faint smoke phenols in the background, mouth feel is light, lots of carbonation on the palate, this stuff is nice to look at and taste, presents itself very well, I recommend you try it if you havent.

(bottle): Pours a very light golden yellow color, very clear, not cloudy at all, and lots of bubble action. Big foamy white head, frothy, very lasting. Malty, sweet, light flowery aroma. Some alcohol, but a lot of malts. Reminds me of a belgian. Light, banana taste. Floral. Very clean aftertaste. Very light taste, soft mouthfeel. Nutty. Tasty, but not as much as it warms up, more..eh.

On tap at Concordia Alehouse in Portland, OR--Poured a cloudy golden-yellow body with a decent white head.  Nose of mild clove and bananas and bold wheat and yeasty esters.  Flavor was sweet with citrus and appley notes.  Crisp, robust, and mildly minty.  Not my favorite beer from this great brewery, but well worth the try.

Bottle. Pourd a hazy golden yellow (mine was not crystal clear) with a big fluffy white head. Aromas of bananas and wheat. Exceptionally crisp and clean. Just great tasting beer. I cant wait to have another.

Fantastic beer - I am a big fan of the regular Weihenstephaner Weissbier, and was very curious to try the Kristall version.  I was extermely impressed with how much of the robust aroma and taste were preserved in this clear, filtered version.  Pours clearr gold with a solid white head that hangs around.  The aroma has hints of banana and bubble-gum.  The taste follows through with the same flavors, and the finish is nice and long.  Overall a great beer!

On tap at Papago Brewery.  Poured blonde with a trim bit of white foam.  Plenty of wheat, citrus, and cream (perhaps even a little peppermint), but unfortunately this just wasn’t an enjoyable combination on my palate.

Bottled. Pours honey with a big fluffy white head. Aroma is malty, fruits ( ban, orange, slight lemon) and spice with a tinge of sourness. Flavor is some bread and banana with spices. Body is well malted for the style and for most styles for that matter. Smooth and malty with some nice lighter fruit flavors and bread.

Weihenstephaner Kristall Weissbier is a crystal clear, very sparkling, light golden beer with a huge fluffy white head that has excellent retention and leaves excellent lacing.  The aroma is of light grain, melon and banana bread.  It is medium bodied, smooth and soft with a clean, wet finish.  There are flavors of lemon, banana, muffins and nuts.  It would make an excellent brunch beer!

Pale beer with a white collapsing head.  Aroma is wheat and banana.  Flavor is clean and sweetish, with a bit of yeast and banana.  Finish is clean with a touch of sweetness.  Good wheat, but I do prefer unfiltered.
nice bright golden color. taste is relatively disappointing. weird mix of fruit and sourness. not so good for me.

Bottle from Sam’s Clybourn. Super pale and fizzy looking, like a light lager. Nose is a bit crisp with some banana. Taste is rich and bold, strikingly so given the appearance. Decocted malts, very sweet and fruity. Some of the hops actually came through a touch. Nice beer, interesting in contrast to the Hefe. Nice.

Appearance: Pale golden. Lots of white head, quite longlived.
Aroma: Quite fruity, artificial. Some wheat. Alcohol when warmer.
Taste: Fruit, wheat and alcohol. Just alright. Dry.
Info: 500ml bottle, 7/6-2007, 171/500

The impression that this beer left me with was something unexpected.  I initially did not like the taste of the beer...something I regarded as pungent in aroma and almost skunky in taste...however as the beer warmed, it mellowed as well.  Crisp, light malt and cedar wood.  Very unique and refreshing

Bottle (500ml) shared with tupalev & jerc -- courtesy of GregClow. Pours a clear pale gold with a large lasting foamy white head. Aroma of banana (but thankfully not too much), yeast, wheat and light spices. Flavour of banana, other fruit, yeast, some sweet candy, light spices and a light, short bitter finish -- quite refreshing. Average bodied. As usual with this brewery, a solid version of the style -- great stuff.

Bottle shared with Greg Clow, Hogtown Harry, Blankboy, and Jerc, courtesy of Greg.  Very nice aroma - lots of wheat, some yeast, very fresh - nice.  Medium yellow, small white head.  Nice taste - yeasty, lots of clove, good wheat/malt base.  Full flavoured, medium body, nicely carbonated.  I cannot speak for this style specifically, but this was a very good beer.
Bottle: Clear yellow in color, not much head.  Flavor is refreshing, light, medium carbonation. Simple but good.... Good summer time brew.
The aroma was plain, not too impressive. Pours golden yellow, typical head. Fizzes nicely in the mouth, a little spice can be detected to balance out the alcohol. Tasty.

Big German 500ml bottle..  Pours clear golden yellow, white foamy head.  Strong banana aroma.  Lots of spiciness.   Nice German yeast flavors, big dough.  Chewy wheat presence.  Huge flavor.  Rich and complex.  And its clear.  Finishes with a mild spice.  Maybe some nutmeg in there as well.  Overfall, dominate to the style.  This one was for the German soccer team who just killed Portugal 3-2.  PROST!

Clear yellow with a fine sized rocky head. The aroma is pleasing enough, wheat and a little spice, but is quite soft. The flavour is a little sweet, and also has wheat and spice, making this a rather two-dimensional beer. Ok, but really dull, I simply lost interest in drinkng it half way through.
Pours a very clear yellow i mean very clear, smells like a hefeweizen without the cloudiness but it still has all the flavor.

Clear golden with lots of sparkle and a thick head.  THis has a light cinnamon spiciness with vague fruitiness (banana, pear).  Suprisingly full body yet only vaguely malty.  Lightly spicy (nutmeg) and fruity (pear).  Good for what it is.

In the 0.5L bottle from HyVee CB. Pours an almost fluorescent yellow it is so bright. Huge white head. This has a clean straw-like classic german aroma. The body is surprisingly thick for such a light looking beer. This is simply outstanding and thirst-quenching on a hot summer day. I loved it.
Pale gold pour with uneven frothy head; strong estery aroma of clove, banana and spices. Taste is honeyed sweet and yeasty with spices, more clove and banana; quite heady. Very good mouthfeel.

Better than expected. Not a whole lot different from many hefeweizens. Lively on the palate, and the wheat and carbonation dominate, there was still a lot of fruity and spicy elements. Poured a clear light-gold...very neat. Will try more Kristall Weissbiers after this experience.

2008-06-11. Pale yellow with a small white head. (3+) Mild yeasty aroma, estery. Sweetish mild yeast, pleasant esters in the flavour. (7+)  Smooth average plus palate. (3+)  A bit light overall, and I personally prefer the regular Hefe, but this was quite flavorful - much more so than most other Kristalls I have tried. Pleasant. Bottle shared by GregClow

Strong aroma of flowers, dry fruits, hint of citrus. Large white head, diminishing. Krystal clear straw colour. Little lacing. Simple, bold, and clean flavour; initially fruity and slightly sweet taste with touch of acidity. Pleasant long bitter finish. Great mouth-feel; full-bodied, dry texture, with lively carbonation. Yes, a good summer beer... but is winter right now.

Bottle. Rich aroma with herbs, spice and hops. Golden in colour with a frothy white head. Subtle hint of herbs and spice. Overall a little disappointing from the aroma and appearance but still a good German beer.
500ml bottle, pours a very clear light amber. Excellent estery but clean aroma, good flavour. Truly a perfect example of the style, nothing more to say.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2009 Very clear golden color and pours out with a big fluffy white head. Aroma is fruity (banana & lemon) with some hay. The beer tastes fruity and a little zesty with some spices. A bit watery and thin however. Not nearly as good as their regular hefe but still decent and definitely refreshing on a hot day, which it is here today. Re-rate 3/31/09. Still not quite as good as the hefe or dark wheat but my initial rate was too low. Bananas and cloves in the aroma with some fresh cut grass. Fruity flavors up front with some soft spices following. Refreshing and enjoyable. Gotta bump it up a bit.

500 ml bottle, via BA kkipple.  Pours a perfectly clear straw yellow with a nice foamy craggy bright white head that had pretty darn good retention.  Nice grassy aroma with a touch of light honey and crisp wheat.  The flavor is fairly light, but even without the yeast theres a good bit of yeast influence that still remains.  Some light clove and banana linger for a short while on the finish.  Mouthfeel is crisp and light as expected with a nice lively prickly carbonation.  A very nice beer, I havent had a whole lot of Kristallweizens, but this one does show that you can strip away the yeast and still leave behind a flavorful beer.

.5L bottle served in a weizen glass. If I didnt know what beer this was I would think it was a nice pilsener, it is an effervescent golden liquid topped by a large bright white head composed of fine bubbles. That is where the similarities end however, as soon as it nears my nose I get a huge whiff of banana and bubblegum esters. Thirst quenching wheaty-banana flavor. Slightly fuzzy palate. Very nice.
very nice and fresh kristal weissbeer. golden with a thick white foam head. fruity a real summerbeer

Golden in color that left a think white head.  The aromas are on the sweet side with fruity scents along with flowers and rock candy.  In the mouth it is very refreshing with the wheat showing through in the midpalate.  Great for a hot day but not that complex or flavorfull.

Beautiful clear pale golden in color.  Immediate nutty cereal notes in the aroma, sorta like Total brand or Wheaties.  Aroma does tend to shift to a more fruityness as it warm up.  Flavor is awesome.  Very clean malty taste with a lingering bitterness at the end.  This is my first Kristallweizen and Im hooked...

Pours a beautiful sparkling golden color with big, rocky head and superb lace retention.  This is a filtered wheat beer and thus the color is translucent, a somewhat unusual  novelty for a wheat beer, which is traditionally cloudy.  Medium bodied with good carbonation and satifying mouthfeel.  Sweet, light aroma with hints of fruit, hay, and citrus.  Very Appetizing with a fruity, banana-like, bubble gum taste that gives way to a gentle, tapering finish with a Juicy-Fruit gum aftertaste.  This self-proclaimed "Worlds oldest" brewery makes a very fine filtered wheat beer (although this very modern interpretation is far from being the worlds oldest wheat beer recipe).  There is a wonderful retention of complex esters and phenols in the beer, despite filtering, that, no doubt, contribute to this beers unique taste and aroma.  Try with grilled meats or sausage.
500mL bottle. Pours a clear yellow body with frothy white head. The aroma is light, maybe some banana. The taste is smooth, again with notes of banana.

Bottle. Clear, bright golden colour with a large snow white head - beautiful! Fresh aroma of lemon, clove, a bit of banana and yeast. Crisp, refreshing body. Fresh and clean flavour with notes of banana, lemon and light clove. Maybe it was the relative freshness  (BB date is 26.02.09, so Im guessing its less than three months old), or maybe its just a great beer - either way, this really impressed me.
Bottle: Light golden yellow w/ a large white head. Lemony, yeasty aroma w/ some clove hiding in there somewhere. Flavor pretty much follows the aroma. Light in the mouth, yet creamy too.

Pours a clear golden color with a thick, dense head. Aroma is of mild fruits and some spices. Flavor is very sweet and fruity, but not so much that it is overbearing. Very crisp finish. One of my favorites.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2010 Bottle. Crystal-clear with thick capping of white foam. Mild fruity aroma with pear, banana, and a hint of nutmeg and vanilla. Soft mouthfeel, slightly cloying. Sweet banana flavors. Estery. Mild hop on back of tongue. Boring, but not bad. 6-3-5-3-12Re-rate. Looks like a pils, clear and deep gold with nice thick stable foamy head. The aroma is un-pilslike of course. Lots of wheat malt and a light fruit salad with underripe bananas and white grapes. Thin watery finish. Gassy. Finding that it is not just the thinness I dont like, its a little too acidic. The flavors are also bland and uncompelling. Too much acidity is not balanced by enough grain power. But still its drinkable. 6-3-4-2-10 = 2.5.

Appearance: Pours a clear, bright yellow body beneath a monstrously huge head.

Smell: Sweetish malted wheat aroma with supporting, though somewhat restrained notes of clove, citrus, and banana smoothies.

Taste: Slightly tangy, somewhat sweet wheat malt flavor. Subtle flavors of bananas, clove (though this ramps up upon warming), and sweetened lemon juice. Very low bitterness. Ultimately finishes sweetish with a lingering clove spiciness.

Mouthfeel: Medium-thin body. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: A fine, refreshing kristal.

Really good brew from a brewery that I have yet to find anything that I dislike.  Lighter and more summer day drinkable than the other nes I have tried.  Light hint on the aroma and the taste.  Finishes mostly clean, summer in a bottle!!!!!!!

500ml bottle...Quite pretty, reminds me of a lemon meringue pie...a fluffy white head, and a cloudy lemon like body...aromas of light clove and some spiced orange...in general smells sweet and light...light body , tasty...flows well down the throat...some clove and light sweet fruit essences--like a plum....a good german wheat, refreshing

500ml Bottle- Light golden in colour with a foamy head. The aroma is rather fresh and floral with bananas being notable. The taste is very clean although perhaps a little too clean with bananas along with a herby element being noticeable. Very refreshing and not bad at all.
golden appearance with strong white head but completely clear.  flavor is subdued compared to the weissbier.  a wheaty malt component.  never had the style, but no real purpose in my opinion

Rated:04.06.2007
Bottle brown, 500 ml
Looking very bright light, bright gold, big , strong, thin head. Appearance is very nice, carbonation is vivid and giving outstanding effect. The head is of nice, milky, white colour. Flavour is similar to the aroma. Wheaty, strong smell of wheat and molted barley, being more lively thanks to intensive effervescence. Nice lacing. The aftertaste is metallic and medicinal, on palate the beer is dry.
bottle, clear golden color with solid eggwhite head, light banana nose and a clove, spice and fruit flavor, very mild weiss
Bottle. Pours gold with a fluffy white head. Aroma has clove and a light fruity note. Medium body. Flavor has notes of cloves and other spices and well as banana and apricot. Pretty good.

500 ml bottle thanks to Dchmela- Pours a clear sparkling gold with a finger of white froth. Nose is of grain and lemon custard, banana, floral and spice notes. Tastes quite citrusy with a good dose of banana and a bit of clove, which leads into a bubble gum creamy finish. I liked it! Thanks Dave!

Gold filtered body with a nice white head and good carbonation that affects the feel.  Clove and banana aroma.  Clove dominates the flavor with some tangerine.  Wonderfully refreshing and crisp.  So very well crafted.
Pours clear gold with a frothy white head.  Aroma of wheat, bananas, and cloves. Taste is really clean ligth taste of wheat and citrus.  A Asftertaste is slightly metallic.   Very smooth beer.

This is my first kristallweizen, and I must admit, I was a bit surprised by it.  Pours a crystal clear gold color with a foamy white head.  Lots of the hefe aromas, with the yeast seemingly gone.  Grainy flavor, with a bit of citrus.  Highly effervescent on the palate.  Really quite good and refreshing.
Golden in color with a foamy white head.  Wheat in the smell with bananas.  Carbonated with light wheat taste.  Light citrus taste as well.

50 cL bottle, trade with DerDobbelbock. Pours clear yellow with a dense white head. Wheaty, estery and banana aroma. Flavour is initially light caramel malty followed by a light estery flavour going into a nice wheaty note. Light orange fruity accen too. Ends estery and light fruity. Another fine kristallweizen brew, thanks Sebastian!

this is my second german kristallweizen: i am looking for a light wheat that is great for a quick quench, like a berliner weisse without the high acidity, but with typical ABV--this has medium acidity, and has a nice lemon and banana flavor, with a little sweet spice; this is at least much better than Tucher Kristall Weizen... for the best german kristallweizen, this is it? lets go, brewers!

Bottle. Pours clear pale yellow with huge creamy white overflowing head. Lively spicy aroma, mainly clove with some yeast. Refreshing middling sweet , long lasting taste; clove predominates. Mouthfeel is lively and palate cleansing.
Golden pour with a thick white head.  Aroma was banana and strong purple grapes.  Banana,  grapes,  spice,  wheat,  earth,  and lemon flavor.  Finishes very clean.  Sessionable as all get out.

Fine wheat aroma, with spice and banana, golden, pours a huge rocky white head. some lace. Up front wheat flavour, subtle spice,  banana notes, slight mineral tone. Light bodied, balanced, refreshing. Splendid version.

500ml bottle, served chilled. Pours a clean golden body with creamy white head. Spicy aroma, quite clove like with subtle fruitiness. Moderately carbonated with a smooth, slightly creamy texture, possibly a bit subdued body from what id would expect. Decidedly phenolic body, pepper and cloves driving on the palate balanced by some sweet maltiness and unripe banana, some tart citrus character coming through on the finish. Particularly approachable, and drinkable weizenbier, maybe not as flavoursome as its hazier brothers however.

only two more styles to go and this is one of them.  I had no idea what to expect. light golden with high carbonation to moraigne style white head.  Very sweet aroma with huge cloves and banana.  creamy mouth, wheat.  taste exactly as it smells.  peppery tongue.

Bottle of my first Kristallweizen.  Pours a clear (believe it or not) yellow with a white head.  Nose is wheat and grains with bananas.  The flavor is sugary with lemon and wheat that come through the sweetness.  Finishes crisp and dry.  This could be refreshing on a hot day.  Decent.

Bottle pours a clear golden color with a very dense white head.  Aroma of banana, spices, and wheat.  Lots of wheat in the flavor along with some banana and other fruit.  Finish leaves some feeling of spice on the tongue.  Lively, carbonated mouthfeel.
Bottle. Great taste. Aroma, spicy, smells slightly of cloves maybe. clear golden color. Highly recommend.

Pours clear light golden with huge white head. Aromas of banana, clove. Flavor is slighly sweet with hints of clove. Light body with prickly carbonation. Very refreshing and not filling. A good beer that is worth trying.
Light golden color, tranclucent, ok head retention. Light but obvious aroma of banana and clove, taste much the same. Mouth feel was crisp, medium-high carbonation...pretty good beer...
...if this was not filtered, it might be better than the Hefe, but its a close second.  Cleansing, with a spicy clove like taste, with no presence of alcohol.  A great beer, try it.

Pours a pale yellow. Not much of a smell but what is there is good. Great wheat taste with a bit of spice finish. Definitely has a clovey taste. Leaves an amazing taste in your mouth. It feels creamy but it is very light. This is a beer that you could drink after running a marathon and feel completely refreshed. I would definitely buy again. Heres to another 1000 years of brewing for Weihenstephaner.
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text: Wow, pleasantly refreshing. Pours all foam. Settles down to light golden in color with a 3/4 inch head.  Smells like sweet wheat malt but light. Taste is full and much stronger than the translucent appearance would let on. Flavor is of full bodied wheat, slight citrus and banana, bubblegum. Flavor is a bit sweet, (sugar?) Texture is carbonated at first, fizzy, and subsides rapidly. A surprisingly good beer, would go great with sausage and kraut.

Bottle. Clear yellow colour with a beautifull mostly lasting white head. Powerfull aroma of grain, lime peel and a touch of banana. Flavor likewise. Almost sparkling on the palate. Pretty lasting finish. This is the perfect summer-beer.

Thanks to dchmela for helping Eric and I to get this style. Pours a amazingly clear gold with a nice white head. The aroma is pretty light; some apple and citrus. The taste is like a good champagne, fizzy and dry, with citrus and apple elements with a really dry finish. Not bad at all. I enjoyed its unique qualities.
Bottle from and shared with Douglass88. Light golden, clear with a dash of almost white foamy head. Tastes like a sparkling pear water with a "touch" of grain.
500ml bottle. very light golden color with frothy lasting head. crips slightly spicy flavor. very clean like the name says, "Kristall"

A careful pour produces a frothy, initially four-finger thick, pale tan colored head.  The beer is brilliantly clear, with lots of carbonation bubbles streaming through a bright, yellow gold colored beer.  The aroma has the characteristic notes of clove, a touch of banana, a hint of spiciness, some dusty crushed malt aromatics and soft bread-like notes.  It seems to be missing a tart wheat component to it and leaves me wondering if this is enhanced by suspended yeast in the traditional Weizen mit Hefe.  As a substitute though there is a spicy note that I dont usually get, really it is a black pepper note that is both slightly woody as well as spicy.

Sweet tasting and well carbonated, the beer foams up as it hits my tongue.  Smooth flavors of clove, a touch of banana up front, noticeable sweet (almost honey-like) grain, touches of peach.  The carbonation combines with other notes to produce a peppery finish to the beer; in the near finish it competes with the sweet grain and clove notes, but in the long finish it becomes much more noticeable.  As the carbonation subsides the feel of this beer becomes much more creamy; it is still quite easy drinking and most definitely quite quaffable.

The Hefe definitely adds some complexity (whether you pour in the sediment or not), but this is a pretty nice beer.  I definitely like that the clove and some of the banana flavors are easily noticed and I find that that interesting pepper-like note adds a bit of intrigue to what might have been only a decent Weissbier.

Purchased: <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Liquors, Tucson AZ

bottle: pours a very clean very light golden hay colour with a extremely white soapy head. aroma is a slight toasted grain, some wheat, slove, banana, and apple. flaovur is  clean bitter to start with small amounts of clove, wheat, banana. finishes very dry and a slight acidic. very carbonated and slight aftertaste.

Apr. 2007 - Okay, I have to admit that this beer was mistreated (accidentally frozen, then thawed in warm water to too warm temperatures).  Beer pours yellow, crystal clear with nice two finger head.  Strong fruity aroma with wheat.  Light wheat flavor, ripe fruits, bubblegum, lemon.  Very sweet.  Okay, but not the best offering from one of my favorite German brewers.
UPDATED: JAN 25, 2010 Bottled. I had never ad a kristallweizen until I had one of these - it was perfect. And by perfect I mean perfect.  Poured a perfect gold, tasted the same, and etc.  Great beer.

Aroma is spicey wheat with banana, and citrus hops. Pours with a large, white, creamy head with decent lacing. Clear light yellow body. Taste is vanilla and wheat spiceyness. Dry texture with lively carbonation and a slight bit of alcohol on the finish. Quite drinkable.
Clear yellow pour.  Frothy white head.  Typical wheat aroma with taste that is very carbonated and taste slightly of bananas.

16.9oz bottle-pours a foamy white head and pale yellow color.  Aroma is wheat/light malt/grain, spices-clove/cinnamon/nutmeg.  Taste is wheat/light malt/grain-caramel, spices-clove/cinnamon/nutmeg (although stands out front a bit too much), secondary hops bite.  Good carbonation.
A clear light straw color with fizzy white head.  Flavor is mostly lemony citrus with grain and floral notes.  Hints of banana and hops.  Nice light beer that is quite refreshing.

Very light color, with a champagne-like head.  Sweet smell of candy and fruit.  Taste didnt quite connect with the aroma, I was expecting more sweetness, but it was good.  Mouthfeel was like a more lovely American lager.  A decent beer, but probably wont buy it again.

Clear light yellow.White head.Yeast,spice,slight hint of banana and bubblegum,cotton candy in the aroma.I am not detecting as much fruit in the aroma as I expected.Well carbonated,nice light texture,dry and smooth.Very refreshing,very drinkable.Good job.

Yellow or straw colour,more straw,head medium dissappears quickly not much cover,carb mild.Aroma fresh grain like,hops,a floral sweetness.Flavour fresh,wheat,sweet nothing of much note,finish dry and sweet,alittle sour but not bad.

500ml bottle. Pours golden with large fluffy white head.  Smells like a weizen. Taste is unique and smooth.  Slightly bready, noticable amounts of banana & spice, slight clove, and yeast are present. Super balanced.  I could suck on these puppies all night. This is a style i hope to try more of

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2008 Thanks hopscotch, this completes my beer styles. Filtered wheat appearance, and I guess that would be like a ubiquitous pale yellow american lager. Friendly weizen aroma with a touch of butyl, in a good way.  Much more enjoyable than most hefeweizen, more towards the enjoyability of a witbier, with out the haze. Plenty of well desired fizz and carbonation. More friendliness than I expected for this style. Has a very mild bitter attribute that I cannot identify. A just plain good example of a pale yellow beer. Much more enjoyable than the typical pale yellow american beer!
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: (50 cl bottle at Haket, Göteborg) Clear pale golden color, frothy white head. Sweet estery scent. Estery and malty taste. Medium mouthfeel, low bitterness.
Pours golden with a big white head.  Aroma is bannana and bubble gum.   Taste is the same flavors, like a hefe but a little bit smoother.  Very good, my first Kristallweizen and I like it.

16.9 oz bottle-A clear golden with a nice two finger white head which has an aroma of wheat, yeast, and a little citrus. Taste of this light bodied brew comes across as some nice weizen characteristics of banana, clove, and some yeast but then it fades off on the back end. Im glad Im trying the #1 rated Kristallweizen. A nice smooth tasting weizen.
500ml bottle. Fruity wheat aroma. Lively and light mouthfeel. Bright gold colour. Refreshing taste - lighter and less in your face than many wheatbeers. Very nice stuff.

Pours light golden color with a thick fluffy white head. Slightly fruity, wheat, banana, yeasty, bread aroma. Nice light body, wheat,  yeasty taste. Very refreshing, yet I feel like I am not giving anything up taste wise. I have it paired with a turkey sandwich on a warm day in Florida and it is a perfect compliment.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2008 500ml brown bottle. Light  yellow colour with a thin white head. Light to medium bodied with average to high carbonation. A dry wheaty beer with sweet banana flavours. A refreshing drink and quite good.
UPDATED: APR 7, 2008 Clear gold - thin white head. fairly high carbonation. Wheaty with citrus, banana and fairly prominent cloves.  Sweet.but not not overly so.

Bottle 500 ml 
Appearance :Kritstall I style but cant escape fine hazing. Golden ale with large white soft , pillow like top 3+ Nose :Refreshing fruity wheat nose ,  light tart grainy feel with sweet sugar plums , red apple and sweet yams. Flavor/Palate : Short thin front but with log lasting classical wheat middle. Soft grainy character with refreshing somewhat sharp burst of citric wheat. Thirst quenching brew that makes excellent session wheat. Out of bottle this classic is good would love to try on tap at source.

500 ml bottle
I picked this up at a local store after finding it on the shelf following a recent expansion.  Given the price ($2.79) I didnt have too high of an expectation especially since it is a kristallweizen.  Still you dont get the chance to try these very often so when I ran across it I decided it was worth checking out.
Aroma / Appearance - A fast growing head surged to the top of my glass before slowly settling into a thin layer of white.  Underneath was a transparent yellow body that look like most pale lagers.  Tart lemon, wheat and a hint of sour drop candy combined to form an pleasing but basic bouquet.
Flavor / Palate - Citrus and freshly mowed grass merge then almost immediately disappear.  The light aftertaste reminds me of the crumbs at the bottom of a bag of banana chips.  Its not bad though Ill stick to hefeweizens to get my regular session fix.
The bottle looks old-styled, but good. The beer is very zippy and fruity, not too sweet. Really a good beer.
Pours a clear gold. Aroma is sour with slight citus. Taste is a lot different than the nose, wheaty and dry. Finish is crisp and dry.

pours a clear (duh?) pale gold with a soft fluffy off white head. it sticks around for quite a while...aromas of wheat, bananas and pale metallic malt. really refreshing flavor...wheat, lemon, yeasty spices and some grassiness. finishes spicy and dry with lingering yeast and banana. light to medium bodied with crisp carbonation. id really like to try this fresh on tap when its 110 outside.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2008 This is a very nice, tasty, yet crisp, light, refreshing beer.  It is gold with a huge, hard-to-control, dense white head that is thicki, long-lasting, only slowly diminishing to a permanent smaller head and it leaves nice lacing in even rings.  The aroma is very aromatic but light in body, being light grain, pine, herbal, with a metallic hint.  The taste is like the aroma, with definite, persistent, strong flavour, but light and crisp.  There is a faint bubblegum element in the middle, before a crisp finish and a long, mellow grain aftertaste.  It has light bitterness.  In the end, a delicious, refreshing beer that is highly drinkable, light & crisp but very flavourful.

Typical banana, clove deal.  A bit of peach as well.  Sort of a candy sweetness that I didnt expect.  Thick perhaps even gummy mouthfeel.  Light carboantion.  Needs something to balance the sweet malt and slightly tart wheat.  Hops?  None apparent.  Pretty OK, but nothing exciting.  Other than appearance, this is no different from a hefeweizen as far as I can tell.

A clean light yellow pour. Aroma out weighs the look by a longshot. A much morer agressive flavor than the look would indicate. Palate you would swerar should be thin but is very solid. A surprising beer that had to have been filtered.

I wasnt blown away by this Kristallweizen like I thought I would be.  It was way over-carbonated for me, and the flavor was not anything memorable either.  One thing that I can say though, this was a beautiful beer to look at while drinking it.  100% clear, with a nice white head.

The aroma is intensely wheaty.  Mostly dry and a little spicy, even with a hint of smokiness.  I get some of this spicy wheatiness in the flavor too - except that it is pretty thin and watered down.  Its OK for me.

Ive finally rated all the styles (I dont count low alcohol and malt liquor) - hugely effervescent, clear golden beer, with a gigantic, frothy, bright white head that continues to grow even after the pour - the beer looks so lively that it just begs you to drink it - strong banana aroma, with strong wheat malt earthiness and subtle hints of orange and spices (clove is dominant, of course) - the carbonation is not as prickly as I expected - very light bodied beer - light honey sweetness and very faint wheat character - a hint of phenolics way in the back - very light clove spice and faint flower flavors - not much going on here - its a shame, it start ed out so well, then I had to go and taste the stuff.

(bottle) Clear, pale golden colour with a huge and quite dense foamy white head. Slightly dusty and sweet wheat-malty aroma with a touch of nutmeg and shy fruity notes. Light-sweet, slightly acidic flavour, light to medium bodied with a lively carbonation. Good wheat-character, light fruity taste; dry-ish, slightly sweet and sour finish. Pretty refreshing and clean, but also without ups and downs. I prefer the Hefe-Weizen.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2008 This is a beautiful beer. It pours a light sparkling yellow with a foamy bright white head. Now I am already a wheat beer fan so it didnt take much to impress me. It has all the aroma of a wheat beer and the typical sweet malt, hops and herb flavor delivered in a light and drinkable platform. Im huge fan.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2010 This is the second time Im rating this beer.  Im being a lot more gentle on it this time.  Its really an unusual drinking experience that I have a hard time describing.  Its less "grainy" than an ordinary Hefeweizen, and Im not sure if I like that or not.  The nose smells like a hefe, but the taste is more sharp and pilsnerish, yet it still tastes like a Hefe.  Its really confusing to my palate.  Maybe this style serves some purpose as an adaptation of Hefe to really hot weather, but if its that hot I usually just reach for a Kolsch.  I dont think I like it as much as a regular Hefe, as much as it confuses me.
500ml bottle.  Clear yellow liquid.  Very high in foam.  Very good carbonation.  Some Citrus and clove notes.
Pours crystal clear into a Weizen glass.  Fluffy white micro weizen head.  Clove and banana aromas and flavors.  Crisp -- I miss the full flavor of the wheat.  Still very good.

I quietly wished I had gotten a keg of this for my last party as it was very tasty in my pint glass this evening. It would have paired well with the Pils and offered a nice contrast to the rich Southern banquet we staged before Lil Cliff came on for 3 stellar sets. It looked like a weiss with its lacing and brilliant gold color. The first taste was lightly carbonated with the usual bananas and vanilla, but the taste ended with a snap of hops! This would be a great beer for Thai and Sushi too.
Pours transparent gold with thick fluffy head and nice lacing.  malty/fruity aroma, wheat flavor. clean and crisp. highly palatable!

1 pint bottle- poured a transparent blonde color, monster sized head formed, nice.  Aroma of small malt and fruit.
