Hits the mouth with a small wheat body, heavy fruit note that carries to the finish.  Good beer for early in the morning or to put an end to an evening after bad ones, because this one is good!

Pours clear blonde beer. Big foam head. Nose of vanilla, malt and pine. Carbonation is evident. Palate is smooth and crisp. Notes of wheat and citurd. nicely balanced and as enjoyable as the Hefe Weisse.
Bottle. Nice golden colour. Some fruit notes, citrus tastes. Decent beer that Id try again.
It had a hazy gold color and tasted much like a light beer. It was very crisp and the flavor was full and great!
UPDATED: OCT 3, 2007 Pours a light, cloudy yellow with a white head.  I had this at a bar in Helen which was great because it is a german wheat ale in a German city.  I drank this out of a Weizen
A fantastic German weissbeer. Pours a hazy straw color with great lacing and a fluffy white head. Tastes traditional but has some fruit notes, a very smooth finish and great aftertaste.
Pale gold with a nice white head. very nice aroma, taste of lemons and fruit. Yeasty foamy mouth feel. Pleasant after taste. I may go for another one.

Pours a clear straw color with no head after the little bit that first shows quickly dissipates. Nose is yeasty with a touch of lemon. Taste is sweet and evenly so. Even as it warms the flavor stays constant. Mouthfeel has a good carbonation to it and an even feel. Highly drinkable.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2008 Name: Kristall Weissbier
Date: 05/18/2005
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting

Appearance: clear pale yellow, whispy white head, 
Aroma: light spicy aroma, 
Flavor: flavor has a hint of sweet banana covered by lots of clove, 
Overall: a nice drinking filtered hefe

Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20
Rating: 2.6/5.0Score: *4
-------- />
The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

Absolutely clear uriney yellow.  Steadfast white foam.  Nose of wheat, wet carpet, garlic.  A very slight metallic twang and onion sweat.  Such a clean taste.  Fresh cut grass, minerals, salt.  Sweet bananas.  Sweaty and crisp with a compost stench in the mouth.  Deteriorates quickly with warmth, and momentary hints of discount vodka become more commonplace.  Alternatively refreshing and entirely intolerable.  Mild spice at the end.  Acidic palate with a citrus soda crunch and a distant sour smack.  Hard to take any impression from this.  Decent, maybe.

(Bottle) Pours a clear golden color, with a large amount of white head. High carbonation. Aroma of some citrus and yeast. Taste is clean, with some fruity notes and light spice. Good mouthfeel. Somewhat soapy taste, especially the head. Pretty good.

With so few authentic kristallweizens out there, this one was a refreshing summer beverage.  It pours a very light golden color, almost looks like a light offering from an American mass domestic, but the pour produces a beautiful frothy white head.  The head lasted for quite a while on top of a mildly fizzy beer.  The aroma delivered the pleasant and expected estery and fruity notes, predominantly banana.  Taste of wheat, but a nice crispness to it and finishes clean.  Its rare to have a tasty beer that really quenches your thirst AND provides a balanced flavor as well.  Nice with lemon chicken dish.
Thanks Immy for this one. 16.9oz bottle. Pour clear golden color with full foamy white head. Aroma of wheat and yeast. Taste of wheat, spice and lite lemon with clean finsih.
Bottled. Pale yellow colour, big white head. Aroma is hops, some wheat and quite much earthyness. Flavour is wheat, banana and some hops and malts. Very boring kristallweizen, but still refreshing.
500ml bottle, pours a clear golden color with little head, kind of a light flavor some bananas and wheat, very crisp and clean, pretty good for the style, just what it says, its crystal clear.

Pours a golden color with a white head.  Aroma is of wheat, hay, grain, and slight banana.  Flavor is pretty light with banana and cloves up front and finishing with wheat, clove,  and yest.  Not really that good and wasnt quite what I was expecting on this one.

Bottle. Pale gold with a big white head. Aroma of bananas, grain and yeast. Flavour of more bananas with some spice. Very smooth drinking with a pleasant dry finish. Probably my favourite Kristalweizen.
I was pleasantly surprised at the flavor of this beer, the aroma with hints of banana nearly scared me away. Carbonation is over the top.  My first Kristall.
(Bottle) Pours golden. Incense, banana and clove in aroma. Light flavour of banana, clove and wheat. Round and buttery mouthfeel. Light to medium bodied. A very nice kristall.
Yellow with a klasting white head. Banana, spice and lemon in the aroma. Dry and fruity flavour.

1 pt. bottle

poured clear with a moderate frothy head. light golden in color
aroma was lemon/citrusy with hops and a touch of clove
tasted very hoppy, again with lemon and clove, and a touch of banana. it tasted just a tad soapy.
mouthfeel was a little over-carbonated for the style. it bites a little in the back.
overall, not terribly drinkable in my opinion. Itd be good with white sauce on pasta, or seafood, but not with bar food.

Prod. 7426. Bottled. Beer is clear, light pale yellow with a moderately sized, frothy, white, mostly and quickly diminishing but lasting head.

The aroma is malty with light notes of dusty toasted grain; Hoppy with light notes of lemon zest, resinous herb; Light notes of banana/clove, tropical fruit, trace of mineral.

The flavor is light/moderately sweet, moderately acidic/dry, lightly bitter with an average-length, lightly acidic, lightly sweet, unclean-tasting finish.

The body is light, the texture is watery and the carbonation is lively.

Not nearly as good as Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbeir.  The color is pale straw and very transparent.  Wheaty aroma, with a very slight hint of banana.  The flavor is much the same.  More crisp and dry than their Hefeweissbier, much less yeast flavor.  Some hints of the banana and pear notes which are so prominent in the unfiltered variety.  This isnt bad, but I probably wont buy it again.

Poured lager-gold with 5 cm of white head. Good lace. Aroma of wheat.  More wheat and banana on the tongue; not much else. I couldnt detect any yeast at all. Thin body on a spritzy, very carbonated mouth-feel. This is what it should be; a straight-up beer with nothing else interesting going on.

Clear straw yellow with a big fluffy head diminishing to nothingness very rapidly (I could hear the bubbles fizzing and busting).  Full wheaty esters.  Clovey banana, apples light sweetness. Not a fan of yeast, but a bit sharp.  Fizzy thin flat beer.  No real body here really.  Uninteresting wheat.  Creamy banana, sharp appley tartness.  A good bit of diacetyl.  No lingering flavor, easy drinking.  A bit unclean.  A lingering toastyness is clearly misplaced in this beer.
Extremely drinkable and pleasant weizen. Not so spicy as some weissbiers, but with a pleasant sweetness.

Bottled (BB 05/2008)
Clear golden color, big white cloudy head. Wheaty banana aroma. Fruity banana flavor, but toned down, short finish. Its good as Kristallweizen can get but take the yeast out of world class hefeweizen - you get just a decent refreshing beer.
bottle.  light yellow translucent pour.  slight white head.  grainy banana scent.  great summer time beer.  happy to find at the corner beer store.
Bottle, Clear straw color with a huge head. Fair lacing. Aroma is wheat, bananas and pale malts. Maybe a bit of lemon. Easy drinker. Fizzy. Thin texture. Light body. Really not too bad.
This beer had light body, thin feel, creamy,  very good head, frothy and rocky.  Not one of the best styles out there, but good nonetheless.

Bottle.  Very transparent gold color with a big head that at first sat at about four fingers... dying down now, but still a couple of fingers high above the surface.  Lots of carbonation.  Aroma is grassy and grainy.  Maybe Im picking up a little lemon or banana or something sort of fruity.  Flavor is really odd, in that when Im looking at the glass full of beer my subconscious is telling me pilsner or light lager, but then on the first sip I pick up a big wheat presence with all the yeast and bananas in the world.  A little bit of spicing, too... coriander?  At any rate, it is a well balanced beer, to say the least.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Thick white head which descents quite quickly. Aroma of wheat and a bit of some nice scotch speyside whisky! Flowery and grassy, altho quite weak when cold. Smooth yet lively carb and overall flavour. Nothing really stands out, but its not too yacky. Rather flowery and white wine like dryness. Quite good.
Reminds me of a filtered Hefe.  Similar banana and yeast flavors and aromas but pours a clear golden color.  Big white head on this one.  Enjoyable for the summer months.

Nice and golden with a good head. The aroma is wheaty with notes of banana and clove - and the same goes for the flavour, that is sweetish. Normally the Kristall versions are much weaker in flavour than the normal Hefe, but in this case its almost as good, and it surprises me just like the alcohol free version did - great beers! 2370
My first kristall. I really like this beer. Pours a yellow honey color with a big white fluffy head. Small bubbles and carbonation. Wheaty and watery and refreshing. Nice, hints of bananas.

This beer does exactly what it wants to do very well.  Delicately refreshing with a great flavour profile.  Not difficult to drink at all.  When you pour it, it just looks like you should drink it and it should refresh you.  Great Crystal.

pale gold with big full fluffy head. strong bananas on the aroma with a little yeast and spice. slick light body. extremely fruity, bananas and apples with a little grain, citrus and a slight pepperness

Bottled.
Very pale yellow. Huge white head.
Yeasty and spicy and pretty sweet, but too little of everything.
Bottle at Haket, Göteborg. Golden color, big white head. Nice fruity wheat aroma, quite alot of bubblegum. Fruity bubbelgum flavor with what and malt. Wheat finish with bready notes.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2008 500ml bottle from Asda. Straw colour with a thick billowing white head that disappeared very quickly; spicy aroma with traces of clove and banana; fruity taste; with a dry spiced finish. Refreshing.
Bottle at Haket Göteborg: Clear yellow colour, with a nice white head. Aroma is flowery,malty,sweet ,some banan is there too,and citric. Flavor is almost the same, thin body,short finish.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2013 Bottle at Haket, Göteborg, Sweden. Clear pale yellow, large fluffy white head. Mellow and rich , candy-like aroma with notes of bananas. Light in body with a lively carbonation. Swet start but a mared bitterness in the finish. The best kristallweizen Ive had.

Bottle served in my Paulaner weizen glass.  Highly effervesant, clear, yellow with a huge white head.  Im wondering if the bottle is infected because the beer is crawling out of the glass.  Banana and clove esters are detected in the aroma.  Banana in the flavor with a touch of bitterness in the finish.  Quite a bit more body than what I expected.  Not bad.
Clear yellow with large white lasting head. Fruity/whaet aroma. Banana & wheat flavor. Light sweetness. Good lacings. Medium to live carbonation. Crisp & clean - very pleasant!

As you would expect, its pours crystal golden clear, forming a nice white foamy head.  Aroma of wheat, lemons, spices, malts with a bit of hops.  Clean, smooth, fresh beer!  Excellent brew from our friends in Germany.  Flavor is nicely balanced, could easily be a sessionable brew, delicious beer!
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text: Gold and clear in the glass, with a rocketship white head.  Musty aromas are reminiscent of malty, grainy American ales.  Very light and crisp with a substantial amount of malt flavor.  A nice beer.
From bottle pours a hazy amber color with a good amount of head.  Nice sweet flavor with a quick finish.

Bottle. A quite pale golden with a small bubbly and foamy white head. The beer has a million bubbles fighting to get to the surface. Nice hefe aroma, banana, some dryness from spices and wheat maltiness. Nice creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is full as well. Sweet, some banana, a light flowery bitter touch. Reminds me of their ordinary hefe, but that is a nice reminder :o)

This is my first kristalweissbier!  And I was very impressed.  This beer was one of the most attractive beers Ive ever seen - it was a sparkling golden color with a towering white head of miniscule bubbles that faded to an attractive lace.  There was a lot of carbonation and bubbles coming from the bottom of my glass.

Aroma was lightly sweet and citrusy and spicy, and also quite good.  Flavor was slightly clovely with some subtle sweetness and a malt backing.  Very nice.  This beer has a substantial mouthfeel...in a good way.

I would highly recommend this beer.

Bottle. Aptly named; crystal clear, sparkling apple juice appearance. Wheaties and banana and spices aroma. Wheat, fruit, sweet/tart flavor. Tastes much like the non-filtered variety but lacks something. The palate is a bit thin, though it is thirst quenching.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2007 500 ml bottle.  Pour is clear golden with a big , frothy white head.  Lots of carbonation bubbles.  Aroma is a wheat, banana, clove, bubblegum and candy sugar (purple nerds?) .  Tons going on in the nose, and perhaps a bit too much.  The taste has mostly sugar up front, though the wheat body and banana flavors come through towards the finish.  Pretty quick and clean finish.  Overall, nothing too special in this one, though it was refreshing, and was really good with Schnitzel.

Its no surprise that this was voted the winner at the Australian beer awards this year. Not because it is an outstanding beer, but because its a beer that looks like every yobbos favourite pale lager while actually having a decent taste. This poured with a medium sized head and had huge carbonation bubbles flying from the bottom of the glass to keep it there as long as it could. Plenty of banana in the aroma, but not much clove until tasting. A rounded creamy mouthfeel that serves to exacerbate the sweet flavour.  Theres a touch of bitterness there too, but its barely discernable. Definitely one to try again in the summer months given its reasonably priced, but nothing to rush back for.
Really fizzy, goes down easily.  However, it lacks a lot of the awesome yeasty flavor from the standard Hefeweizen.

Very similar to their hefe, big ol banana and clove dominate the aroma and flavor. Slightly lighter on the palate, but still retains that high carbonation, big crispness on the palate giving it a lot of personality.

500ml Bottle (Gallows Bird, Espoo)
Amyl acetate, expanding into banana, and floral. Taste is crisp and refreshing, but shows a lack of fullness due to the filtering.
Clear yellow, small bubbly head. Very light aroma with a touch of grassy, spicy noble hops. Thin in flavor, fairly sweet and malty. A decent bit of sting from the CO2. Rather boring.
Pilsner color. Bread, wheat flavor with more sweetness than I expected. Thin body.

look like poale lager, with very firm head, and the carbonation is very lively as if it was boiling all the time. very nice yeast and wheat aroma, ti is still hefeweizien but it is like deprived of something nourishing, very refreshing but not as good as the hefeweizen, flavour is bit metalic, medicine

Clear, bright, golden yellow appearance with a large, rocky, white  head and modest lacing. Aroma is full of the typical fruity esters and spices, especially cloves.  Smooth, clean taste, slightly medicinal, with a sweet, wheaty, banana laced fruitcake flavor.  Lingering finish from the light bodied, moderately carbonated mouthfeel.

poured a rich clear golden with a big foamy white head. aroma, wheat, yeast, banana , bread, some citrus. flavor, besides what I listed in the aroma, I got some bubblegum and hints of gloves. this is a nice refreshing beer, will be something I will have after working out in the yard or sitting by the fire pit just relaxing. good beer.

Light aroma - banana and yeast. Clear golden color with high white head. Medium bodied, definite banana, carbonation fizzes away, it thins out, the banana continues with light sweetness, and the finish is dry and remains of banana. Theres yeast throughout, but the fruit is the main thing. Decent clean finish. Some definite spice in the nose and finish after the bottle is down about a quarter.

All the elements of a weissbier without the fullness of the classic unfiltered. Still, this was refreshing. Clear, sparkling golden body with big, frothy white head. Aroma of banana, dough and grain. Sweet flavor and lightly bitter in the finish. Thin body and somewhat watery texture. Comfortable, spritzy mouthfeel, perfect for summer.
Aroma reminds me of breakfast cereals, Kix, specifically.  Not really sweet but hints of sweetness.  Very nice.

Nice golden straw color with pure white head.  Aromas of wheat, banana, and sweet corn.  The flavor is light and crisp, yet with enough body to be satisfying with wheat, banana, and a touch of sweet malt at the end.  A very nice effervescent clear brew that would be great at on a hot summer day.

Bottle. Pours clear golden with nice streams of bubbles, and a large fluffy white head. Aroma is wheat, yeast, bubble gum, and a little banana, finishing quite dry. Flavor is light wheat, bubble gum, a hint of lemon, and a bit of banana. Kind of a lighter and more effervescent version of their Hefe Weissbier. Very nice on a summer day, and the plentiful carbonation manages to be champagne-like rather than soft-drink-like, so isnt overbearing. Recommended, and a step above most refreshing summer beers.

Rated 1/1/06:  Picked a bottle of this up during a visit to my fovorite beer store. Had no idea what to expect especially since I am not familiar with kristall weissbiers. I was able to conclude that it was German weisbeer. The appearance was fantastic, very light golden in color with plenty of carbonation. The bubbles seem to be infinite. After a couple of glass fulls I was still confused as to the unique ingredient. It wasnt until I began to read the reviews that I learned that banana seems to be the main influence here. Interesting to say the least it is an extremely unique beer. So far I can take it or leave it. Of course it is the middle of winter in Ohio so perhaps I will re-visit this one when it is at least 70 degrees outside and I can sit out on my deck and feel refreshed.
Bottle. Pours yellow and clear. Aromas of cloves and dough with some bananas. Light body, quite refreshing with tastes of yeast, citrus and cloves and a hint of bubbelgum. A good summer beer.
Pours a clear golden with a huge white head. Aromas of bread dough and bananas. Yeast and a slight malt flavor finish dry and refreshing.

Bottle. Served in a weizen glass. The beer pours a gold-tinted yellow color, with a two finger white head, and vigorous carbonation. Clarity is very high. Fizzy, yellow? may fool the BMC drinkers, that is until they smell it. The aroma is very yeasty, spicy, and wheaty. There also seems to be a bit of a skunkiness. Flavor is wheat, yeast, and mild esters. Mild tartness. Full mouthfeel, probably due in large part to the high level of carbonation. I am not sure if it is the fact that it is a kristalweizen, getting old, or just a poor example of style, but the traditional hefe yeast character is just not present, almost seems like an AmWheat.

Pours golden and clear, as it should.  Huge puffy head that goes away fairly quickly, but sadly leaves minimal lacing down the cglass.  Aroma is estery and yeasty, with some banana and clove.  Flavor is sweet, and prickly on the tongue.  Not as good as there unfiltered hefeweizen, but you gotta respect stuff from the oldest brewery in the world.

Feint bananas and citrus on the nose.  Clear blonde with a thick white head.  Dry citrus and banana, its missing flavor, must be the missing yeast!  Carbonated like a good german wheat.  I like my yeast.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2007 VEry pale yellow colour, with a light fresh hop aroma, anda crisp light hop flavour.
Tk 2... bottle at home ... very pale yellow ... light wheat and bublegum and banana ... soft very fruity ... touch of banana and little pineaple.
Pours with a nice golden color and a pretty thick white head.  Aroma is slightly sweetish spice.  Flavor is a really good citrus flavor thats actually refeshing!
Nice golden beer with a fluffy head. Very lite with a hint of lemon and clove. Very subtle drink with no aftertastes at all. Excellent beer that I will drink again.

Bottle. Thanks to bockeyhorsey. Poured a golden body, cycloned to a huge head. Aroma is of spices - corriander. Lite flavor with the spices working its way on the tongue. Very easy drinking and smooth. The taste is lite and so is the flavor, but it comes out with a satisfying citrus flavor. A good beer for a warm day like today.

This beer is a treat! Aroma grassy, fresh, delicious with hints of spice. Pours clear lemon yellow with huge white head, bursting out of the bottle. Cloves and root beer, citrus, some sweetness, smooth palate, tiny bubbles dance in the mouth on the swallow. This is very very good. I think I just found my new favourite beer.

Pale gold out of the bottle with a fizzy white head and a sweet yeasty nose.  Sharp yeast and lemon notes with some banana and clove spice.  All the flavor a weizen but not the mouthfeel.  Tastey beer and good with food.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2008 When the brewery thats been around for hundreds ofyears longer than the United States claims a specific beer as its specilaity, you can expect greatness.  
Almost Everything about this beer demonstrates its superiority, its  effervescence, sweetness, dry finish.  
Its exceptional.  I noticed it lacks the enticing aroma of the brewerys Hefe but it is still excellent.
You dont like this bottled beer, you dont like weizens and you shouldnt rate them.
Light clear gold in color with a two finger head, no lacing. Lemon and orange aroma. Balanced blend of hops, grains, bubble gum. No aftertaste.

This stuff is great.  Like the name implies, it pours crystal clear light to medium amber.  It is more carbonated than most, has a very pleasant fruity nose, excellent tasting with wheat and citrus notes, very pleasing aftertaste.  Dont put a slice of lemon in this, it doesnt need it.

Bottle 50cl. Poured a clear, pale yellow, like a light pilsener. Blooming white head. Very pleasant aroma: sweet with hints of banana, cloves and the classic bubblegum. Similar in taste, very refreshing with the excellent distinctive weiss taste, slightly sour and highly enjoyable. Perfect mouthfeel; full yet soft and light. Brilliant tasty weiss, its difficult to decide whether the kristall or the hefe is better...

Bottled at Monks Café, Stockholm.  Clear golden, small head. Soapy estery banana aroma. Sweet with clean mouthfeel. Some butter and fried banana. Some of the yeast flavours has survuved the filtering, but some seems to have been replaced by soap.
Crisp and strong. This beer should be opened only at weddings and funerals, and any time I want to get drunk.
Clear and clean with a crisp wheat finish.  Not overpowering or abundantly yeasty, rather it is smooth and crisp.  Very tasty and good during a warm summer night after a good round of golf.

bottle . . pours slightly cloudy tan . . not mus head . . aroma is yeast, ripe banana, spices . . tastes almost like it smells . . bananas, bubblegun and wheat . . subtle alcohol . . nice clean finish! . . this could be either/or . . you either love this beer or dont like it . . i enjoyed it! not bad!
Bottle.  Aroma of grain / yeast, bubblegum, and spices.  Light bodied and nice to drink on a warm day.  However, the aftertaste is unappetizing.

Pretty good aroma; clove, bubbelgum, and banana.  Clear and golden; large white head.  First for the style; really not as good as most hefes.  Dry finish.  Decen to good palate.  Refreshing, but maybe just not a favorite style of mine.
Lacks a strong nose. Cloves, bananas, yeast. Pretty typical wheat beer. Drinkable, as alcohol should be.

Bottle. Nose is tons of yeast and grassy wheat. Extremely clear yellow, thin white ring of head with heavy carbonation filtering towards the top. Taste is same as the nose, wheat and yeast. Exactly spot on for the style, but I dont care much for the style. Palate is smooth and punctuated by a slight dryness in the finish.
Light yellow, bubbles come up like crazy, light fluffy head. Aroma of lemongrass and wheat. Strong wheat flavor with hints of citrus. Very tasty and refreshing.

Beautiful beer! Literally. Must be poured like I got it here at Bodega downtown La Crosse, in a tall weisse beer glass - then it looks so efervescent; almost glowing. Great offwhite foamy huge head with lots of lace. Immensely satisfying yet light and refreshing. Lovely typical esthery aroma, great fruity carbonated flavor.  Body to match. Brilliant yellow gold color. Im enjoying it with salted roasted giant Chinese soy beans. *burp*

Crystal clear gold body with a huge, pillowy white head.  Aroma of banana and clovy, like a hefe.  Flavor has more of the same, with a hoppy bite and lots of effervescence.  Finishes sweet and tart.  My first sample of an interesting style.

Pours suck a pale yellow it is almost void of any color at all. Large expanding foamy head. Aroma is light fruit, pear and apple, with notes of wheat. Foam sings like a bowl of Rice Krispies. Very light and smooth drinking, bit of an oily feel, with a bit of spice in the flavor with preludes a gentle warmth. Very nice.

500ml bottle:
Yellow straw colour beer, with a huge frothy pure white head, generous carbonation visible.
Wheaty nose, sweet with hints of lemon, some spicy esters also apparent.
Light flavours of spice and banana esters, wheat is at the fore smooth, rolls along the tongue effoertlessly , some citric elements come into play, fast dry finish.
A very drinkable beer from Germany and my first Kristallweizen..

poured into a tall goblet.  pours a clear golden yellow with lots of bubbly carbonation.  has a full white frothy head, aroma of sweet wheat.  taste is good and wheaty, very light and refreshing.  sweet on the front, with a wheaty middle to finish.  a filtered hefeviezen, good, but I like unfiltered better.  German beers are very reliable and crisp, though that is there standard.....

Pours a lovely yellow golden hue, aromas of bananas, lemon sorbet, flowers, cereal, and yeast rise out of frothy white head, mostly lasting, sheets of fine lace.  Pale biscuity malts, banana, yeast, quiet dry palate, faint hops, yeasty twang.  Skinny, but flavorful.
UPDATED: OCT 9, 2007 Maybe it is me but I am not a Kristall Weissbier fan, it seems like they make a flavourful weiss then suck all the flavour out it. Page 489 of Michael Jacksons Great Beer Guide.
Pours crystal clear pale pale yellow with big, dense, lasting head. Lively carbonation. Slight clove aroma, slight banana aroma. Mouthfeel is a bit watery. Not great.
Carbonation was good with compact bubbles. Color is crystal clear gold. Aroma was banana and citrus. Flavor is not overly sweet. Not bad. Mouthfeel is very smooth. Very light body.

An excellent Weizen. Poured to a thick white head which quickly disappeared back into the glass. Color is light golden brown. Aroma is nice. Mouthfeel is smooth with little aftertaste. Flavor is great for a hefe. Do not use a lemon.

Pours a crystal clear pale yellow.  The head is huge, frothy, and of decent duration.  Carbonation is good with tight, compact bubbles.  Aroma is initially strong with banana but soon gives way to a more fruiiness and finally a dry spicey quality.  The flavor of the first few sips is fruity and then lighly spiced.  Eventually this gives way to a more dry and somewhat champagne like feel.  The feel overall is light and crisp.
My least favorite of the Weizen family.  All the unfiltered goodness has been filtered leaving me with a bland, banana-y, thin-palate, weak brew.  Sigh.

Poured a pale yellow with a huge white fluffy head that lasted quite a while. Great lacing. Very sweet citrus smell. Tast was not overly sweet. Citrus, banana, although very slight...Very yeasty up front, and slightly bitter, dry finish...Very drinkable beer. Really, no aftertaste at all. Would be a great summer brew...

Light color with substantial white head.  Crisp aroma of banana, wheat.  Taste is of light grains, banana, spices.  Body is a bit on the weak side with a thinness to it that goes beyond the lightness of a Hefe.  Decent, but probably not my style.

Pours colden yellow and clear. Smell is baked bread and doughy with some light fruit scents in the background. Taste is light and crisp with a yeasty taste to it but accented with spice and bannana also a hint of bubblegum at the end. This stuff is rediculously drinkable and I took repeated swallows with no dificulty at all. Perfect for session beer and after cutting the grass on a hot summer day, could also see this being amazing as the sun is setting on a beach trip! Will buy again!
Not a bad thing.  I put a lemon in it, so that cut down on the bitterness.  Little bite to it, and not as warm and full bodied as I wouldve hoped.
Heavy hoppy aroma. Huge creamy white initial apperance. Good lacing. Mostly lasting. Clear body. Light yellow body hue. Moderate sweet initial flavor. Watery palate.

Very nice, very refreshing Teutonic beer.  Amber and fizzy in appearance, but dont let that put you off.  With its slightly fruity, but dry aftertaste it slips down a treat: es scmeckt so so gut!  Sehr gut, in fact!  Vielen Danke!

500cl - Aroma of a sweet yeasty pastry, Euro hops and a touch of lemon.  Pours transparent light yellow, tons of cascading bubbles, a huge fluffy head and great lacing.  Flavor matches aroma, a bit milder.  Palate is smooth and creamy.  Pretty tasty although I perfer the fuller flavored hefe.

Really heavilly carbonated - fizzed all over the table. Very pale golden hue, very clear. Strong smell of bread filled the room when the bottle was opened. Pours with a nice big head - strong lacing. On tasting - sweet malt with a hint of bubble gum. Light with not much body, but a good flavour of freshly baked French bread. Has a metalic flavour in the after taste, that gives way to a nice maltyness. It lacks the creamy texture of the hefe, but I would have another one.

[bottle] Beautiful  clear golden yellow color, with a fluffy white head. Fruity aroma of melons, banana and tangy wheat. Flavors are sweet and fruity, almost wit-like, in a way. Astringency from the wheat seems to be greatly reduced due to the filtration, which makes this brew very drinkable, in my opinion. Perfect for sessions.

Bottle from Santa: Pours a very bright yellow color with a pretty large white head. Smell is very sweet. I smell something that resembles something like a banana, but much sweeter, maybe some candi sugars. Taste is similar, banana flavored. I dont taste a lot here, but this is decent.

Light gold color, white fluffy head.  Has an aroma that is kind of grassy and sweet.  The taste is hoppy and of cinnamon.  The aftertaste is sweet and caramel.  This is a very tasty beer.  The aftertaste doesnt last long, and is not alcoholic at all.

Bottle from Sams. Pours golden orange with gangantuan marshmallow white head. Beauty. Banana, grainy malts, sweetness on nose. Flavor is similar with a little bit of lemon and lime in there with the banana, wheat, and hop notes.  I think this would be great with some hot  wings. Its pretty darn good by itself.

Not a huge fan of this one, a little too pilsner tasting for my tastes.  But it does live up to it,s name, you can see clear through it and it resimbles a beer colored champagne.  Head was MASSIVE, i cant express this enough, very champagne like.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2007 12 oz bottle via Secret Santa (thanks Lou18!). This one pours a cystal clear golden blonde with a huge dense white head. Nose is wheat, bananna, vanilla. Taste is the same with some added fruitiness, some strawberry, canelop, and a tiny dash of ginger. Wonderful sweet finish. Not cloying. Perfectly balanced. moderate carbonation. Medium body. Best wheat beer i have had. Do not care for this style normally but this is world class!
Pours golden from the bottle with a good head.  Smell & taste of coriander.  Light, tastefull & refreshing.  Good brew.

Aroma of lemon zest and coriander.  See through golden color with a forthy white head.  Lively carbonation in this one.  Light fruit flavors--apples and bananas are mixed with spices.  Very wit-bier like.
Aroma is of bananas and spice.Pours very light with little head.Light fruit and spice stick out in the flavors.Palate was medium.Well carbonated With a spice finish.

0.5L bottle. Clear golden color with tall pillowy bright white head. Aroma of sharp hops, sweet lager malts and banana. Lots of flavors. Much like the aroma I get sweet malts, a hop bite, banana but also some Munich type grainy malts. A malty sweetness lingers into the aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours clear, pale yellow with a tremendous smooth white head. The aroma is a bit on the yeasty side, with some banana and zest, and a bit of hay and raw grain. Sharp tartness is the first thing to hit the mouth, then a dry gaininess, along with some zest and subdued saltines. The finish is sweet and a bit grassy, maybe a bit artificial. Decent, but not something I would normally drink
This is a uplifting refreshing beer, Its got great carbonation, and a creamy medium head...Pale yellow colour, Almost apple-honey hints in this one, has some lacing also..

50 cl Bottle. No yeast at the bottom. Golden clear colour with a nice huge white head. Nice aroma of yeast, bread-like and little banana too. Very yeasty flavour with notes of wheat and little fruitness.

"Crystal" clear golden body with huge white head with very large bubbles rising.  Bananas, a little alcohol, citrus.  Clean , crisp mouthfeel, a little lemon and a nice balanced bite at the end.  Great beer.

Pours a five finger white head that fades quickly to a thin layer leaving some lace.  Clear amber color.  Light carbonation and light-medium bodied. Lemon/yeast nose.  Starts sweet lemony, with wheat and yeast flavor, finish is squeaky clean.  Would be a great summer beer.  $2.99 for a 500ml bottle from Johns Grocery Iowa City, Ia.
clear gold.  large creamy/fizzy white head.  boring pale grain malt aroma.  flavor is of banana bread and sweet creamed corn.  crisp and light.  a lighter version of the hefe.  very nice!
A real good kristall. Still has a fine aroma, coriander and pepper. Yeast too.
Botle. Really a good kristall. Almost ad good as the best hefe. Creamy white good fully lasting head. Heavy yeasty aroma and flavor. Creamy palate.
Bottle. Clear golden colour with a huge mostly lasting white head. Aroma and taste of yeast, malts ajnd citrus. Good Kristallweizen.

this beer is amazing in look defenetly hints of bannana in the smell and taste. 
a little bitter on the after taste. 

The color was really beautiful.

I saw this in the beer store and was Hmm I havent tried this one yet, I was a little hesatent about it. but now after finally opening it (4 days later) I am pleasently surprised with it.
Beautiful golden color with wonderful conditioning and good lacing. Banana, clove and white pepper  note are very subtle. Lovely spritzy mouthfeel just dances on the tongue.

500ml bottle.  Filtered and golden honey hued.  Spotty white head.  Banana and perfumy yeast nose.  Light and flavorful.  Clear but the nuances of the yeast are still apparent, but not as dominant as in an unfiltered weizen.  Still nice banana flavor as well as the slight citrus and grainy light roasted grains.  Crisp and easy.

From Bottle, poured golden with large head. OK at first it looks like budweiser(I got scared) Yeasty sweet aroma with a tiny hint of banana. Taste a stong carbonation with a dry taste. Wheat tasting but not as wheaty as I like it. Its a filtered wheat beer and its not bad. I like the Brewer alot.

Looks I guess as good as a filtered wheat could look, with a nice fluffy head. Aroma seems to claim this is a real, serious weizen,  at least at first pour. It is spicy and full of cloves, with a lively yeast character. It dies down as the beer sits and warms and becomes slightly sweet and corny. Taste is way too sweet and unrefined, lots of cooked vegetables, cabbage, and kind of boozy. Not really dissappointed in this as I only got it to tick off the style.

One pint 0.9 oz. bottle from Holiday Wine Cellar:  Pale straw color with a humongus bright white head. Aroma is sweet and lightly hop spicy. Flavor starts sweet and wheaty with a light taste of lemon and a spicy  bitter finish with a fruity aftertaste. Light bodied, crisp and clean with lively carbonation.

Pours to a nice golden yellow with good carbonation and a medium white head, which dissipates very quickly and leaves no lacing. Aroma and flavor were very strongly bread and wheat, with clove spice playing a big part in the taste as well. Unfortunately, palate was much too dry, and even slightly metallic. But a good beer.

Bottle. Thanks to WB or DB one of them hooked me up with this at the Madness and I finally remembered to drink it.  Aroma, banana,apple and wheat.  Poured a golden yellow with a fizzy head.  Flavor was good, lively wheaty banana apple mixture and a tad of yeastiness. Palate was quite lively and light.  Overall I liked it, so much so it would be a good beer to keep around.

Clear, dark yellow with a frothy white head. Lively carbonation. Nose is full of spice, banana, yeast and wheat. Very crisp and clear. Flavor has a lot of the banana esters with a good backing of the yeast. Bittering hops and some citrus, a little lemon. The mouthfeel is a touch fuzzy and it finishes off with a good deal of banana and yeast. Tangy, almost.

500ml bottle. Incredibly clear yellow with a big foamy white head. Wheaty nose, light banana, lemon and clove. Fairly light bodied, a very easy drinker. Flavor is everything from the nose, plus a touch more spice (coriander?) Really pleasant, I liked this very much!
A great beer for summer, lots of carbonation, takes a minute to settle, nice warming spiciness to it. Abit of sweetness to it, very easy drinking! nice brew!
From 500mL.  Pours a crystal clear dark yellow with tight foamy white head.  Nose is banana, lemon and light wheat.  Flavor follows with a crisp finish.  A very enjoyable and drinkable beer.

500ml. Pours bright gold with sparkling carb, and a big frothy bright-white head. Sweet and sour nose--grassy, and apple-tart/acidic. Nice mild grass and spice palate leavened with a bit of cleansing tart. Great, clean, drinkable stuff. Seems quite subdued compared to what we think of in wheat beers out here, but I suppose thats just that Continental refinement showing.

Bottle (500ml).  Very pale yellow, champagne-bubbly, huge foamy lasting white head - its a summer day and that looks like fun to drink right now.  Smells a lot like a mild belgian wit - banana, candy malt, yeast and soft mild spices in plentiful supply.  Wonderful light fruity taste, spicy, much softer and milder than a wit - incredible summer session drink.  Light of body, soft, sweet mouthfeel, very light carbonation, light on the palate and quick finishing - very, very pleasant.

16.9 oz bottle.  Clear pale yellow with a big, white foamy head.  Green tints.  Sweet wheat, lemon pepper and pumpkin pie.  Classic.  Predominantly banana with sourdough bread.  Tight, tangy carb provides a nice zip and lightens the medium body.  Good, but I prefer the regular.

Big pillowy head.  Clear golden color.  Light wheat flavor with slight hints of banana with wheat/straw like aroma.  Slighty sweet with a slight sharpness.  Smooth finish and mouthfeel. Fizzy on the carbonation.  Overall very good.  Light and refreshing.
Clear straw with big fluffy head.  Laces  Aroma wheat and very spicy (lots of cloves) and a bit of banana.  Flavor is zesty clove with some sweetness behind it.

Sparkling clear body w. loads of visibible carbonation.  Big fluffy white head.  Nose is wheaty & yeasty, some noticable sweet malt, oranges & clove.  Flavor is light clove, yeast, lemon, orange, wheat, light toasted malt.  A bit sweeter than I expected.

bottle from asda, poured a very light yellow with a fluffy white head but no lacing down the glass, strong banana aroma, quite refreshing even to get a whiff of. straight away very dry in the mouth, not bitter dry but a zing kind of dry, you can almost chew on the yeast in this beer, it works as an excellent thirst quencher, its been a warm day here and maybe it would have tasted even better in the garden earlier but still a very nice drink all the same

UPDATED: APR 1, 2009 Outrageous banana perfume and tingling effervescence. Pronounced flavours of apple and banana. Maybe a few vinous notes as you drain the vase. Snow-white head, with some circles of froth. Sparkling, fragrant and assertively fruity. Theyve been brewing beers like this for 966 years, and it shows. If theres a better Weissbier, Im still looking for it. (948417/4.2)
UPDATE: Bottle with Octo at The Penguin. Pleasant peppery banana aroma with a pilsy mineral softness and sweetcorn. The usual banana and clove effervescence, but less so. Quite a shock of hops in a dry finish for the style. Nice beer, but punching way above its weight in my top 10 Im afraid.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2007 I decided to give this beer another go, considering the last time I had it, it was the first beer after one of the worst bouts of sickness Ive ever had. Anyway pours more gold than yellow, with a tall foamy white head. Aroma is spicy yeast, banana, clove, hay, and dough. Flvaor has all the elements of a very nice hefeweizen, just toned down a notch. After a day spent clearing out my apartment, this beer goes down very nice.

50 cl bottle, from BevMo LaJolla.  Pours clear light yellow with a large, fjluffy white head.  Fruity and yeasty aroma, ripe summer fruits with hints of banana and floral hops noticible as well.  Flavor is pretty good, but a little unbalanced to the floral hops for my taste, again fruity, a bit of spice from the yeast and a tart, slightly metallic hop finish.  Light body and crisp carbonation.  I have to say I prefer my weissbier unfiltered.  Not bad, but lacking in the full character of a non-filtered weiss.

Bottled. Pours a clear pale amber with a large, fluffy, but diminishing white head. The aroma is  a bit indistinct, but some cloves and banana are present. The body is light with fairly powerful carbonation. The taste is hugely dominated by cloves, but has some a bit of fruit and bread. Crisp spiced banana finish.

This poured clear pale golden, with a collapsing white head. The aroma was yeasty. Has a nice mouthfeel and a crisp flavor of yeast, banana, and a bubblegum sweetness on the palate. Enjoyable, yet kristall weiss beers dont have as many flavors as original weissbiers, which are cloudy. Maybe the filtering removes some of the other flavor aspects.

Clear golden body with a huge head and decent lacing. Aroma is bananas, bread, some clovey notes and a hint of grass. Flavor is like drinking a liquid banana. But with a well balanced beer in the background. Hella better than the Erdinger one I had a few days ago. Very enjoyable for what it is.

Sparkling clear goden pour supporting a tall fluffy white head.  Banana, clove, hops and summer garden aroma and a classic but toned down hefe flavor profile of the same (cloves, banana).  Crisp hoppy finish.  Good looking and refreshing.

Nose of wheat and bananas with a spicy note; slighty hazy-gold with a huge, long lasting white head; Flavor of wheat and bananas, with a spice note and a bit of hoppiness for the finish. A great summer beer when its 110 outside!
This beer pours a golden yellow with a LARGE white head.  Very pleasant aroma with a zesty flavor.  Nice beer and very drinakble on a summer afternoon!  Cheers!
UPDATED: MAY 13, 2007 clean beer from "the worlds oldest brewery", foamy soft head, dry finish. Nice for a change every now and then.
In Bottle while in Florida, last winter - pours very clear yellow. Almost flat. Probably good with a meal, as noted, but on its own, its no comparison to a nice Hefe or Dunkel Hefe.

Clear yellow, lots of carbonation, and a foamy white head.  Lighter aroma of wheat, bananas, and bubblegum.  A clean taste of banana, yeast, wheat, and some citrus.  Dry finish.  Very refreshing, light beer.  Nice.
what a stupid marketing ploy.  this is a weihenstephaner hefeweizen without the yeast (duh).  totally clear, slightly less banana aroma, slightly less flavor overall.  retarded beer.

Pours a pale gold with tiny fast-rising bubbles with a medium frothy white head, diminishes somewhat.  Aroma is sweet wheat yeast (dough) and malt (straw, hay, grain) with notes of hops, bananas and spices.  Wheat, dough and malt flavor, slightly acidic, some sweetness then slight sourness at the end.  Light bodied, fizzy-foamy and slightly dry palate.
You want weissbier? This is it. Beautiful aroma and a flavor which makes you breath the smell of the German fields where the ingredients flourish...
Clear and extremely bubbly - has a big white, foamy head.  This one has a crisp, light flavor...great for summer.

Pale gold and crystal clear with a foamy white head. Big fruity hop aroma heavy on the banana, as youd expect. Light maltiness and more fruit coctail flavor featuring, what else, banana. The beer has a very long finish but is crisp and clean on the palate. It was the perfect beer for the record-breaking heat today.
bottle, light and clear, nice and refreshing, the finish is slightly tart, but all around great beer, and it just really taste fresh and light.
Clear golden color with a big big white head. Spice and banana aroma. Banana , citrus, wheat flavors. Slightly metallic. mildly astringent finish. B

Sample at Whole Foods Market. Pours a clear pale gold color with a thin white head and fair lacing. Wheaty aroma along with a noticeable banana smell. Medium-bodied and smooth with flavors of wheat, banana and light spice. The finish is clean, wheaty and a little watery. Light spice and wheat aftertaste. Fairly enjoyable overall.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2006 Bottle 45F Weizen Glass. Very fruity aroma with good amounts of yeast. Very big citrus aroma, maybe a touch of soapiness.  A wonderful light golden color with tons; and I mean tons of bubbles that rush towards to top at fantastic speeds it is nearly hynotizing. A great white head that is constantly replinished by the multitude of speedy bubbles.  Flavor is of citus, and wonderful sour breads similar to blackforrest bread in its sourness, Great taste very fantastic, sweet and sour but finishes dry leaving you wanting more.  Palate is smaller but with a huge amount of carbonation, this beer is still bubbling away.  Easily quaffable, perfect for that worker who ends his day hot and thirsty. I can;t think of a cleaner or more refreshing taste, this is your hot weather beer. Ganz gut.

16.9oz bottle.  Pours a crystal clear light golden with a large white head.  Aroma of metal, banana, powdered sugar and bubblegum, and dust.  Taste is very metallic and dusty, getting a little in the way of the banana nad wheat, though not quite.  Some lemon in there somewhere too.  I didnt figure the kristall would be better than the hefe, and  was correct.  Not bad, not terribly wonderful, either.  A little too carbonated, light bodied, though not watery.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: I was expecting to be let down by this "new" style that was purchased solely for that reason (and to fill an online shopping cart up to an even 12). However, this came out prety darned good. The nice light crystal clear golden yellow color with bubbles steadily rising to the top was beautiful in my Weihenstephan Weizen glass. The initial head was too much for the bottle to fit quickly into the 0.5L glass, and the head lasted the whole drink, although at a thinner level than the initial showing. Lacing was low to average. The aroma was somewhat American wheaty (musty?) with bananas and spices coming through. The flavor was excellent with bananas and cloves over top of the mildly citrus wheat base. Mouthfeel was light to moderate and this was a very nice summer beer. Good stuff, even without that lovely cloudy hefe appearance.
Bottle sampled with Stegosaurus. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma of sweet malts, yeast, and slight bitterness Great smell. Flavor is fruit, citrus, sweet, and spices.

Pours incredibly clear pale straw with an enormous white head. The head fades, but leaves plenty of lace behind.  Big bubblegum, banana and clove nose. The flavor is loaded with bubblegum, some clove and light lemon. The malt is light, but some sweet breads. Medium/light body with biting carbonation.

(500 ml bottle: $2.99 at Hollingshead Deli in Orange, CA) I didnt expect much from this Kristallweizen, not because its Weihenstephaner, but because I havent found one in the style that I liked so far.  Until now, that is.  Very pleasant spice and moderate banana immediately set the tone early, and I cant stop myself from just sucking this first pint down like Im dying of thirst.  Its mildly sweet and shows no bitterness at all.  I think the beer tastes better when its cold because Im finding that as it warms up, the breadiness of the malt is coming out more and slowly pushing aside the wonderful spice, banana and bubblegum that I was digging earlier.  Spice and bubblegum aromas mimic the flavor.  Body is light-medium, with significant levels of carbonation keeping the palate refreshed and the stomach burpy.  Relatively clear, yellow body is capped by well over an inch of bubbly, white head.  Retention is above average as the head maintains a thin layer for most of the session.  Lacing is patchy.  Easily the best Kristallweizen Ive tried, though admittedly I havent tried all that many.

Wonderful appearance. Big, fluffy, long-lasting white head. The golden shade is so pale its almost not to be seen at all. The aroma is incredibly strong - the strongest Ive even encountered in a wheat beer - and smelling of crisp.... well... wheat beer. The taste is full. The aftertaste long. A fine beer I will surely return to.
Pale and hazy with a thick whte head.  The aroma is sweet and fruity, and very wheaty.  Light, dry and very drinkable (and Im not a wheat beer fan).
user_location: Peoples Republic of Athens, Ohio, USA

text: UPDATED: AUG 6, 2007 Pours clear, bright pale yellow with a full, semi creamy froth.  Decent head retention. Good residual lacing w a full silky canopy. Aromas of crisp banana cream.  Medium nectar w/ ample residual effers. The texture is somewhat creamy yet retains its snappy cripness. Flavors are bright, crisp, and clean w/ a defined banana spice character although not overdone . Well balanced and very refreshing with a slight lemon rind and peach pit bittering on the finish. Highly recommended.

Bottle from Morrisons 12-05-06. Nice light golden colour very clear medium white frothy head. Wheaty in taste just a little bit of banana detected, but in truth didnt really grab me, I suppose it was reasonably refreshing but a bit too clinical for me.

From a 16.9oz. euro brown bottle with a freshness date on the bottom of the back label. Made a very good appearance, poured a clear pale golden with a large frothy, foamy white head that slowly settled into a thin foamy lacing, good carbonation. Had a cracker wheat malty and clove nose with whiffs of banana and fruit, pears and freshly sliced green apples. A crisp, carbonated smooth light bodied mouth feel, very good drinkability. Pear fruity and crackerish maltiness taste, crisp and sharp, followed by clove, light spice and subtle banana, a soft hoppiness towards the end and a dry, spicy wheat malty finish.
An excellent Kristal Weizen from one of my favorite brewers, tasty and highly quaffable.

I guess Im just not that into Kristalls.  Whats the point of brewing a wheat beer if youre going to filter out all the good yeasty, banana and coriander flavors.  I have no idea why these beers are brewed as theyre like Kolschs with a twist of metallic flavor.

Pours very light clear bright yellow with a white head that doesnt stay around very long.  Clean crisp wheat aroma with some spice and acidity - the elements of citrus, but somehow it seems to break the two elements up.  From the looks of it I would have guess light bodied, but it is more medium.  Carbonation is just right.  Light syrup feel as well, but not cloying.  Taste is crisp with smooth malt with a light amount of spice and possibly banana, then a bit of yeast with a hint of dough and finishes with a spritzy hoppy taste.  One of the most refreshing beers Ive had.  Full of flavor, but very unobtrusive to the palate.  This would be a great beer to have with food, especially lighter fare.  Recommended beer.

The color was yellow and was real bubbly like most wheat beers. the aroma wasnt worth talking about.  It seemed to have a slightly more bitter taste( not much ) and slightly more smooth. I think this is comparable to a paulaner hefe. I will buy this again.

Tasted 17/04/2006. 500ml bottle from Rumbles, Wellington.
Pours a pale-yellow gold with a solid pure-white head atop. Carbonation not as visible as I expected, loads of tiny bubbles but certainly not volcanic.
Classic German weizen aroma of sweet bananas and wheat (expected spice didnt eventuate).  Tart wheat with some background lolly-like malt in the mouth, up front.  Fierce carbonation comes to the fore now, making the beers aromatics and flavour explode in the mouth - much like creaming soda.  More tartness and some clove in the dry finish.  Lightweight without being watery thin.  Powdery residue remains on the palate, yeast attributes lingering.  Not one Id drink everyday but this is a good refreshing ale that is very well made.

Really cool, I loved it. Pours macro clear yellow, with a great head and the most amazing bubble trails rushing up and crashing into the bottom of the head. Aroma is hefe all the way, banan clove. Flavor is a bit weak, but still good. Banana, clove, bready and sweet.
Clear watery yellow with a white head, lager like. Aroma had some whaet and a hint of banana. Taste was wheaty with a little banana again and some pepper with a thin finish.

16.9 oz bottle - Pours crystal clear and golden with a moderate to large head that fades away after a few minutes.  Very noticeable yeast and citrus aroma, flavor is lightly sweet with considerable citrus flavors.  The palate is lively and a bit thin, but not terribly so for the style.  The finish is light and refreshing.  Its really quite tastey.
The usual wheaty aromas and look.  A good beer but nor the best weissbier Ive had.  Citrus with a clenan finish.

500ml bottle: poured clear golden yellow with a big fluffy white head. Strong yeast aroma and the esters are quite big. The usual: banana, clove. Seemed to have a light chlorine taste midway into the taste followed by a sweet banana finish. Definitely a good beer.

Poured Worlds oldest beer into 0,5l weiss glass.  Crystal clear yellow beer with fluffy head.  Strong wheaty aroma.  Exploding fruity esters followed by a strong hoppy bite.  Refreshing and outstanding.

Bottle 03/07/2003
Clear golden coloured and creamy on the palate. Some sour fruit aroma. Lasting hop finish.
UPDATED: JAN 12, 2008 Glorious! A beer that cheers me up. Many happy memories.  A rare pleasure, this. Delightful.

Clear and light gold, gassy and bubbly. Little sweet taste, a few hops, little yeasty. Bananas. Was a little too lagery to be called a true weissbier, but a good beer, drinkable, if just a tad too sweet.

Only slightly hazy golden color, big white head. Aroma of creamy banana, spicy, wheat, delicious. Taste is more watery, slightly sweet and crisp. Bit sticky palate. Very good for a kristallweizen, though I prefer most hefeweizens.

Good tasting, crisp and refreshing, but I cant in good conscience say that its any better than any other hefe.  It is crystal clear and light cold.  There is some mild bubble gum aroma.  Its nice that a 17oz bottle is less than $2.  Im looking for to the Weihen normal hefe.  I basically bought this to cross off the style.

0.5 liter bottle poured a clear pale yellow with a large, lasting white head. Aromas of wheat, yeast and a bit of citrus. Palate was light bodied and smooth. Flavors of wheat, lemon and a hint of honey with a crisp, clean finish.
pours yellow with a decent sized white head, aroma of sweet malts, yeast and floral hops, flavor is citrusy, wheat, presence of fruit, good body, nothing great here but not bad.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2009 In the aroma I detect bubble gum, banana, incense, malt, yeast, and floral hops. The appearance is golden with a medium head that is foamy and about what I expected. There is cheese in the taste to go along with the wheat, fruit, sourness, and mild bitter hops. The palate is just right for this one. The aftertaste is clean. This is refreshing.
Clear bubbly light yellow with a big white head. Aroma of yeast, wheat and bananas. Flavor of yeast, wheat, citrus, bananas and some spices in the the finish.

"I wasnt really sure what to expect from this style. Pour a light golden color with lots of bubbles rising to the top. Head was nice and last the entire beer. Aroma was of bananas, spices. Flavor was nice and crisp bananas and a hint of citrus. Good beer. "
Not a match for their Hefe Weisse. Pleasant enough, but more a refreshment than an outstanding beer!

Bottled.  pours piss yellow and clear with a frothy white head.  Strong phenol aroma, mostly bananas ,mostly.  With some spice.  Yeasty with some banana notes.  Finishes peppery.  Well made but rather boring.

Bottled, 500ml. Yellow orange clear with white head. Strong spicy (cloves), esthery banana like flavour, a little too over the top for me. Is this added spices methinks. Challenging throughout without being refreshing enough. I enjoyed it, but not in a returnable way.

500 ml bottle.  I just had to give this beer a 5 in appearance.  Super crystal clear as I had expected.  Lagre head that lasted for ever due to the constant stream of bubbles swirling around the glass on the way from the bottlom to the top.  It was really fun just to watch this beer.    Aromas were a little weak, yeasty and a little banana, but not as much as I expected.  Flavor was better.  Some bubblegum and more banana, funny that it tasted so much like a Hefe without looking like one.  Pretty good actually.

Brilliant pale yellow, large head, good lace. Banana aroma, with a sweet bready element. Very carbonated (even toward the end), but also very flavourful-- bubbleggum, vanilla, banana, and sweet spices. Excellent.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Wheat aroma with banana notes. Similar to a standard weissbier. Light gold in body. azy with lots of bubbles. Good sized, white head that is mostly lasting. A little lace. Initial impresion is that there is quite a bit of flavor for a weissbier. Fairly well carbonated. Excellent. Served a little cold. Although this is only my 1st or 2nd Kristal, this is what I would imagine to be a very good example of the style and I see now that it has a 100 percentile for the style.

shared a bottle with illini08.  great hefe aroma, unfortunately it was downhill from there.  the usual clove, banana and bubblegum aroma but the filtering seems to have taken out some of the flavor along with the body.

500 mL bottle.  Poured a very clear gold with a small white head.  Tons of carbonation floating up the glass.  Some of the bubblegum/banana aromas you would expect from a regular hefe, but its missing any malty or spicy aromas.  Flavor is just the same.  A decent wheat, but its missing some of the body and flavor of its unfiltered counterpart.
Poured a clear yellow with some lacing.  Some spices are there with a tart hop finish.  Good for a wheat beer, but no Hoegaarden.
Pours a nice golden yellow.  Aromas of of citrus, fruit,  and a little yeasty.  Flavor is crips, almost pilsner like.  A little hops at the end.

Bottle. Poured a gorgeous golden with a nice fizzy white head that mostly dissipated. Lemons, banana, and fruit at the nose. The flavor showed banana, earthy, and clove. Light body and dry texture. The more I had, the more that burning rubber got into my head for both the aroma and flavor. This kind of wrecked the drink for me because with every sip all I could think of is the smell of burning rubber.

poured a clear golden color with a medium white head.  Aroma is fruity with a yeast and wheat dominance.  Flavor is very heavy on the wheat flavor with a yeast addition.  Medium to light mouthfeel with good carbonation.

Thanks to Yogi_beera.  I have now tried a kristalweizen.  Mommy....why did they take the yeast out?  This is just really not the same and nowhere near the level of their regular hefe.  The same banana/fruit/wheat flavors, but much of the body and all of the doughiness and chewiness is gone.  Alas.  =(

I sampled the 500 ml bottled variety.  This beer pours pale yellow andas the name suggestscrystal clear, with a huge white head.  Lacing was average.  In my opinion, this lighter style misses the mark as compared with other weissbeirs with bottle yeastespecially the hefeweissen offerings from Weihenstephan.  Body and mouthfeel are markedly different.  The aroma is also quite muted.  There is a bit of malt and bread in the nose, but just a whiff of the expected citrus aroma.  Palate entry is dry and the flavor spectrum reveals a hint of the citrus and spice typical of hefeweissen styles.  The brief dry finish reveals traces of alcohol.  This beer would be quite thirst quenching in the right setting, but I rate it average overall.

16.9 oz bottle.  Pours a light gold with a nice sized head. Aroma is very light.  The taste is a little bitter, hoping this wasnt an older bottle that was not preserved correctly.  Clinged to the palate.  Overall, I cant say I enjoy this style.

Clear gold with the expected large white head. Pleasant flavor but lacks some of the acidity and mouthfeel that its counterparts "mit Hefe" have. Drinkable enough, and refreshing, Im just not a big fan of Kristall.

Typical wheat beer aroma. however looked clear and lightweight compared to ints counterparts, this put me off from the start as it looked weak. Gave it a go though. Fizzy palate. Prefer more typica weizens.
clear golden color with a white course head.  smells a little fruity at first.  dry and carbonated taste reminds me of champain.  litely hopped smooth flavor.
(Bottle 50 cl) Pilsener golden and clear with a very, very white head. Classical dry, lightly sulphurous without much character really. 050501

50cl bottle from Asda. I may have had a bad bottle given the other ratings, but I found this disappointing. Clear pale gold with thick tight white head. Aroma is of a corny undertated wheat beer with bugglegum/banana faint hints with also with a lot of corn. Some unpleasant burnt rubber too. Then it disappears quickly in mouth leaving corn and banana. Nowhere near as good as their hefe weiss.

Bottle.  Lemony, sweet, banana-clovey grassy aroma.  Some sweet candied bubble gum notes are also in the aroma.  Transparent golden color with a frothy white head.  Slightly citric start, but more overpowered in the middle by a slight metallic flavor turning a creamy and slightly roasted malty in the middle.  Finishes a touch astringent with some of the more classic banana and clove notes.  Somewhat dry to finish.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2007 Pours clear yellow with a foamy white mostly receding head. Aroma is estery with notes of banana, clove, lemon, and honey malt.  Taste is bready, lightly sweet, with mild yeastiness. Mouthfeel is light bodied and  fizzy. Finishes tart and lightly acidic. Not too much of a downgrade from the original version. I still dont like this style, but this might be the best.

Im not really a huge fan of this style, but this one was pretty good... more wheat came through in the flavor than in most of this style.  Good with food and also something good to drink if you dont want to get filled up too quickly.
Pour is a clear yellow with a huge white head.  Aroma is wheat and some vanilla.  Flavor is yeasty and clove but not that outstanding as a regular hefe.  I dont get this style.

Sampled from a 16.9 oz bottle, this beer pours to a huge whipped egg whites head atop a fizzy light yellow gold body.  The aroma is almost lightly sour bananas and a light banana nut bread.  Smells sorta fake but still good.  The flavor is wheat, lemons (no I didnt add it), banana.  The finish is strange.  Tart.  Decent palate.  I understand its supposed to be filtered, but I wish they wouldnt.

500ml bottle. Im not usually a fan of kristalweizens (hence I havent rated many) but this one is pretty reasonable - not too emasculated by the filtration. Mid gold colour with a big fluffy head. Plenty of estery banana in the aroma. Soft, vanilla flavour. Starts sweet, but a touch of citric bite develops in the aftertaste. Creamy mouthfeel. It may be a touch on the flabby side, but, overall, pretty good.

Poured out of 16.9 ounce bottle. Looked like a Bud draft with double the head. There were traces of clove on the initial sniff. Nothing like an unfiltered hefe-weizen. Very plain, drank in down rather quickly to get it over with. This brew would serve a better purpose bathing Brats in a rolling boil.

Appearance:  Translucent light yellow with an abundant white head.
Aroma: Slight banana aroma(esters), bread and yeast.
Flavor: Very Light,moderately sweet
This beer would make an excellent thirst quincier.  Light,much tastier than an American Standard Lager.  On a hot day, I think I would seek this one out.

Clear gold, generous white head. Fresh wheat sack nose with the esters up front. Growing banana as the temperature goes up. Very clean flavor profile. Round yeastiness, quite fruity. As good as a slightly above average hefe in the nose. A bit thinner and less powdery in mouth, smoother carbonation than the agression I expected. Lemon pie, crusty breadiness and pleasant tart wheat flavors. Despite its general blandness which is of course okay for the style, this eludes me by managing to be fairly elegant. I hate to say it frankly. Id feel like ranting on the "pride in filtration" nature of kristallweizens tonight, but since the style realistically wont exist anymore in a few years, I guess its not worth the effort. This might remain my favorite kristallweizen when I tell the tale to my grandchildren a few decades from now.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2006 From a bottle.

Pours a clear pale yellow with a huge whipped-egg-white head. The aroma is wheat and lime; the taste is dry, somewhat sour as expected, and slightly more astringent then I would like. The beer is highly carbonated on the palate.

Fairly nice.

Bottle.  I love the hefeweizens so I knew this brew, my first kristall, would be fairly similar.  It was similar in aroma and flavor, but I missed the cloudiness of the hefe.  The flavor of banana and clove was there, though I missed the more yeastiness of the hefe as well.  Overall, a good tasting wheat beer.
Poured a clear (duh) pale yellow.  Typical wheaty aroma and flavors but the banana was light.  Nice balance and pretty tasty.  Not overdone with the yeasty esters.

I had just sanded and repainted my basketball pole.  As I cleaned up I heard my 19 year old daughter and her friends playing basketball (She has not done this in over a year) I went out just in time to see the ball hit the pole and make a large mark on the pole as the ball got a good coating of paint.  I just went back in and poured this lovely Weiss beer and sat on the back deck and enjoyed it immensely.

I opened this bottle and the next thing i knew i was wearing the head. After the first drink i realized that this is a beer i wont soon forget. It was much like the hefe, but so much lighter and crispy tasting. No evil aftertaste. I still was tasting a little clove in there. great kristall. Ill be buying more of this for sure.
Straw-colored body with a thick white head.  As would be expected, wheatiness dominates the palate but doesnt overpower.
good session beer, not as wheaty as id have liked.

Bottle poured a pale golden with a huge, foamy and fizzy white head which took awhile to reduce. Yeasty (sweaty) aroma was dry with a goodly amount of incense and low notes of banana. Aromas perfectly mimmicked in the flavor with a touch of malt and light acidity. Soft carbonation, dry in the mouth with a slightly chalky finish. Im gaining a better appreciation of Weissbier and Kristallweizen is a nice diversion from the murky Hefes.  
<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Liquors, Oak Forest, IL<font size=-1>

Bottle at Andys. Poured a crystal clear yellow in color with a nice fluffy white head.  Hoppy and malty aroma. Banana and clove notes. Spicey. Yeasty. Sweet. Malty and hoppy flavor. Crisp and refreshing. Spicey. Finish is smooth. Drinkable. Nice beer.

Clear pilsner-like straw body, very tall white head. Generous yeasty and fruity  aroma. Tastes sweet and clean, some banana and clove, rather mild, nice finish. I prefer my hefeweizen unfiltered but this wasnt bad.

Bottle. Clear golden color with a medium sized white head that quickly dissipated.
Mild aroma of banana and clove. Flavor was the same as the aroma, but even more mild and a bit thin. Clean and refreshing, but boring.

Smells great - almost like belgian whites. If it werent for the appearance this beer would receive all top scores. Havent had this style before but it reminds me somewhat of belgian whites too. Surprising, yet gratifying.
UPDATED: MAY 19, 2007 Aroma is mild, but I get a little banana bread. Very lively with a lot of gas release. Golden color. Huge head. More banana. Doughy. I dont get much clove flavor.
Bottle, very pale clear yellow pour.  Very large aroma of bananas and cloves.  Flavor was the same, but a little thin compared to the aroma, and came across as a bit bland.

Pours a golden color.  Aromatic notes of spiciness and banana.  Tastes of banana, clove, yeast.  Nicely carbonated its a decent brew but has a bit of a metallic aftertaste in it.   I prefer Weihenstephaners hefeweiss over the kristal.
Bottle. Clear straw colored beer with a touch of gold. Big shite head. Some clove and spice aroma. Sweet flavor with spice and some fruitiness. Easy to drink. Light wheat bite. Crisp.
Clear pale gold. Good head. Reduced clove and esters than the regular. The body is very light and so is the flavor. Keep your filters away from my wheat beer dammit.

a sim rate:
The aroma is very sweet. Banana-ey. Its very smooth and theres not much to the palate. The taste is banana as well, with almost bubble-gum undertones. Nice, smooth beer. Not just an ordinary lager.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2006 Bright golden yellow, transparent, great white head, highly carbonated. Laces glass surprisingly well. Aroma has a nice combo of banana, spice and candi sugar. Flavor starts with all fruity esters, fades into a semi sweet wheatiness with a finish of mostly banana and clove. Very clean/semi-dry finish. Very easy drink well done IMO.
Poured an effervescent clear gold with a fizzy off-white head.  Hefe aroma of bananas, cloves, spice.  Clean hefe taste with a touch of hop bitterness and a dry finish.  Crisp.

Bottle: Clear pale golden yellow with a small quickly diminishing white head and plenty of visable tiny bubbles rising to the surface.  Aroma has plenty of yeast, wheat, and a hint of almost tart spicy banana.  In fact, the aroma smells exactly like something Ive smelled before...and then I remember that Ive brewed with their yeast.  Taste is light yeast, banana, subtle clove, sweet wheat, straw, effervescent mild lemon, pear, and a hint of honey.  Finishes dry with light banana/pear/apple and that signature yeast flavor.  Light bodied, very lively carbonation on the palate, which almost stings the palate when held in the mouth, however its not a bad thing in this beer.  Very refreshing.

color is yellow gold and clear, with a tall creamy/pillowy white head that lasts.  aroma is yeasty wheat malt, light banana, faint clove, and light lemon spritz.  high carbonation and snappy mouthfeel.  flavor is tangy wheat-malt, a little yeasty, a bit if lemony finish.  still havent figured out how this calls for a separate style of its own.

16.9 oz bottle - Pours beautiful crystal clear golden with a fantastic fluffy white head of about an inch and a half that lingers and laces well in a weizen glass.  Carbonation rises from the bottom like a filter in a fish tank.  Aroma is yeast, malts and cloves.  Flavor contains notes of clove, bananas, yeast and a touch of lemon.  This is quite light and crisp on the palate.  Feels almost like champagne in the mouth.  Quite bubbly.  Looks a lot like a pilsner but tastes much more like a hefe.  A little more crisp though.  Pretty good stuff.

Very beautiful pour with a weizen glass. Looks like champaigne, only with a thick layer of pillowy white head and with great retention. Lots of bubbles from the beer. Smells of dough and sweet malts, maybe some clove. Thin bodied with flavors of wheat, pear, banana, and clove. Thinner bodied compred to a hefeweizen but has some great tickling mouthfeel with all of the bubbles. Finishes with some bitterness and lemon spice. Very refreshing and very good. My first Kristalweizen but Ill be sure to try some more.

Beautifully appealing beer in my tall weizen glass ... bright golden and active with a big cushy pillow of a head.  It has a crisp malty aroma.  The flavor is a nice cross-breeding ... crisp malt of a pilsner with the mellow yeast and doughiness of a weizen.  Exceptional.
Crystal clear body as the name implys.  Big whiote head.  Smells of bread dough, and banana.  Nice flavor with a blast of fruitiness at the end.  Feels very lively in your mouth.  Good stuff.

500 ml bottle.  Very pale golden colour with a thick white head.  Aroma is very good, clove, apple, lemon, banana appear along with some wheaty spice.  Flavour is also very good, apple, pear, spice and a touch of sweatiness.  Body is quite thin, but this is a very refreshing brew.  Spicy finish.

Very lively pour!  Pale almost clear golden hue with about a 4 inch white head (this was not aggressively poured).  Long head retention.  Vinous aroma, not unlike champagne.  Wheaty notes were also strong.  Light and bubbly mouthfeel (well-carbonated, but ideal for the style).  Flavors of wheat, some spices, and a malty sweetness were present.  Some banana and a subtle bitterness were also present.  Finish was quite refreshing, and carried through the banana and some spices.  Very solid brew, especially for this time of year.

Excellent head that lasted quite well. Personally wasnt particularly keen on the aroma. Appearance absolutely gorgeous though. Taste was spices and citrus with a hint of bitterness, but the finish was disappointingly insipid.

Light yellow golden cloudy beer with a great white head as a result of the wheat malts used in brewing. Strong aroma of banana and cloves. Some slight citrus notes in both the flavour and aroma. Flavour is also dominated by banana and some nice noble hops. Soft bitterness and yeasty flavours throughout.

Clear gold with a thick creamy white head. Nice bananas and cloves in aroma, and nice clean wheat, fruityness and a bit of lemon in taste. Just perfect for summer. Bottle dated best before 30 Sep. 2004, but this still taste fresh.  believe this is from Piscator, which I thank for all the great trades we have!

Big thanks to beerhandy who sent this beer, of a style I have yet to rate, as an extra in a trade. Poured a clear, see through gold color with a huge (5 finger) white head. Strong banana aroma with some wheat. Tastes of light spices, some lemons, wheat and bananas. The banana taste was not as strong as the smell. Medium sweet. Lively and fizzy body.

Almost over expiration date. Still okay. :) Decent aroma of wheat and bananas. Clear, golden coloured good sparkling. Nice looks, good white head. Taste is sweet, slightly bitter, fruity (bananas) and wheaty. Very pleasant and well balanced. Absolutely refreshing.
Golden, yellow coloured brew. Large white head. Sweet flavoured with a bit bitter, carbonated taste. Its a nice brew.

Bottle.  Pours a very clear golden with a thin white head.  Not much head retention.  Really good sparkle in the glass.  Aroma had malt and banana.  Same went for the taste.  The banana worked well.  Pretty good.
Bottle. Clovy aroma. Almost clear yellow colour. Small head. Weak wheat flavour, not much spice. Aftertaste is wheaty and watery.
Bottle. Clear amber with large rocky white head. Aroma of malt and banana. Medium body smooth texture. Sweet flavor with medium bitter finish. Refreshing but average.

its 30 degrees Celsius outside, so this is absolutely ok. aroma: malts, bit banana. taste: more banana, cloves, bit of citrus. medium body. finish: little sourrish, more banana(love that taste). good thirst quencher.

0,5 l bottle. Clear golden with a quite substantial white lasting head. Aroma of dough and banana. Malty flavour with distinct banana citrus note and clove. Lively, but not biting carbonation. Pleasant wet, very coating mouthfeel. Slightly bitter smooth finish. Refreshing. A very good beer.
Clear golden colour with a white head. Wheaty, yeasty aroma with some banana sweetness. Banana sweet flavor with perfume hints and a dry finish.

Pour is mostly a clear lemon, almost artifical yellow, topped with two fingers of clean neat white head. Aroma is a rich with reserved wheat and light pine orange. Flavors are composed of wheat, a load of banana ice cream, and supple yeast. Sweetish and a little watery. Residue of sweet clean cane sugar and wheat. Very bready. Carbonation is average and lacing is decent. Nice qualities and well balanced, seems a little one dimenionsal. Decent summer beer. Thrist quenching for sure.

Bottle, Weihenstephaner Glass: Pours a clean golden hue with a large fuffy head and good lace. The aroma has notes of clove, lemongrass, banana, floral and aromatic esters. The yeast character is here just not as strong as the hefe, a rarity among Kristals. The taste starts with fruity and lightly acidic nature with the yeast dominate. Sublime spice oin the short finish. Not as lively nor has the depth of the hefe but still quite refreshing. Overall a solid bier and if I was to drink a filtered weizen, this most likely would be the one.
Bottle from Asda. Clove, lemon, banana aroma. Perhaps slightly tart and acidic. But I prefer the Hefe.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2005 Anyone for fruit salad? Apparently its all down to the house yeast but this is probably the fruitiest beer-without-fruit that Ive come across. Poured a clear lemon colour with a towering and enduring head, and big champagne bubbles. The aroma screams bananas, wheat and cloves. The flavour profile is fruit salad: bananas especially, with a hint of blackcurrant and some Granny Smith acidity. Appetisingly bitter. Very spritzy in the mouth. Ultimately it feels a little insubstantial compared to the hefe but thats probably a matter of personal preference.
