pale gold white head that fades to light lace covering the beer.Aromas of bannana and a perfumy ester almost honeysuckle,sweatbread.Taste is  wheat
some sweetness, bannanas with  clove
medium mouthfeel.

Pours a clear pale golden with a thick, frothy, long-lasting white head.  Aroma has a nice wheaty sweetness and a touch of clove and peppery yeast.  Starts with a light caramely sweetness and a well balanced peppery, yeasty spice.  A really fresh, enjoyable, flavorful beer that doesnt really seem to have suffered by being filtered.

Looks like a pilsner though without much head. Lighty sweet aroma of banana, yeast, some spiciness, maybe a little pineapple. Very crisp and spritzy on the palate with a fast finish. Flavors of the aromas with some maltiness and a hint of caramel. A bit on the watery side. A few solvent like notes. Over all quite refreshing.

Detected spicey and sweet aromas. Gold clear body with big head that soon became no head. Sweet flavor with a little spice to make the beer heavy on the palate, which was good. Good beer with out the spice flavor this may of been just another swill beer.
Pale gold pour with big, white sudsy head.  Aroma of big hopcit, banana.  Tastes hopcity, with banana, spices, and bubblegum hints.

Robe blonde surmontée dune mousse blanche qui semble persistente. Arômes de banane, de levure et de céréales. Saveurs de levure, de bananes, de malts caramélisésé Léger goût dagrumes, citron en acidité. Présence évidente du corps. Houblon floral. Saveurs longues en bouche.

18 Nov 2004 - Nice fruit malt, slight earthiness and banana aroma.  reasonable head, clear dark yellow with good suds lacing.  Earthy banana flavour and some light spirit.  Slight tangy finish but a bit thin.

When compared to the hefe this misses out somewhat. Perhaps the whole cloudy but fine nature of that beer is what we expect compared to the kristal . The same diacetyl is there with a hint of bubblegum but the mouthfeel and flavour are all a bit too offputting. too much fizz and afterburn to be an enjoyable beer. A shame as it comes from a very good stable of beers.
user_location: Potts Point, New South Wales, AUSTRALIA

text: Fizzy head, dies quick. Very pale dark yellow, clear color. The aroma is amazing- creamy, bannana and cloves, with balanced bubblegum sweetness. Taste comes off very ciderlike, with lots of apples. Sweet. Finish is quite lacking in that it doesnt really exist. Also quite watery. What a great aroma though.

This beer has a beautiful creamy white head with steadily ascending tiny bubbles.  The whole activity is quite nice.  Unfortunately the color is Budweiser yellow, kind of ruining the effect.  It has a pronounced banana flavor and a crisp clean palate.  Its a fine German beer made to the original 1516 purity laws.

Reviewing as I drink it.....
The appearance turns me off from the jump. Pale yellow color reminds me of mass produced domestics. Almost zero head. Aroma is citrusy with a lil bit o skunk. Tastes pretty good. Citrusy wheat flavor with some added spiciness to it. Still Im just not completely satisfied with this beer. Way too fizzy.
Pours dark yellow with a small head.  Taste is hard to isolate, but theres definitely some fruitiness to this beer.  Definite malt and some spices.  Nice.
From A Bottle.Dark yellow in colour,small head,fruit aroma,taste is fizzy,spicy, malt and banana.
Aroma of bananas and deep spice.  Prickly mouthfeel, champagne-like.  Taste is usual, jungle fruit and heavy spice overtones.  Somewhat watery middle.

Golden with a short lasting head, somehow doesnt look as good when clear.  Aromas are still the same old banana and spices  with some Autumn fruit - pears and apples.  Flavours are refreshing and dry with banana, cloves and some citrus.  The carbonation somehow seems more pronounced in the kristal beers.  Still a good summer drink.
Citrusaroma, almost honeyish, like clover honey. Slightly herbal bitter af first. After a while a slight estery fruitiness comes up. Certainly not bad, but the hefeweizen is better.

bottle. poured light yellow gold and very fizzy with a white fizzy head. aroma of champagne, chardonay, lemon, grass, hay... initial wheat, yeast, lemon grass taste...a very effervescent palate, light astringent, refreshing...not a whole lot of character but enjoyable and very refreshing...would be nice for spring, tastes like April.

500ml bottle.  Pours crystal clear sparkling pale yellow (hence the name, eh?) with a nice creamy white head that sticks around and looks great for a while.  Pleasant sweet yeasty wheaty aroma.  Taste is smooth and flavorful, yeasty and a little sweet but dryer than most hefeweizens.  Nice body and palate, not heavy but full and malty for a weisse. I like it!  Very nice!
Hoppy aroma with hint of sweet flowers. Clear yellow colour with desent head. Sweet malt flavour with added hops. Flat palate.

Bottle. translucent golden colour with lots of carbonation. Explosive white fluffy head. Creamy yeast aroma, banana and spiciness. A little more subtle than the regular hefe. body is a little bit thin and watery. yeasty and sour and high in carbonation. Its refreshing but not really my kind of weizen.

Biscuits and bananas, I say!  Thats the aroma, not some strange curse, that emanates from this clear golden brew sporting a rocky white head.  Sweet doughy malts and banana is what greets your tongue as you drink, leaving a delicately fruity (banana and pear) finish.  Not bad, but Ill never understand why one whould want to filter a good hefeweizen.

Banananana and pear aroma from stately head, waveringly lacing to the edges like amateur skaters.  (?)  Mouthfeel is malty, with subdued carbonation in the body.  I agree with szkot that its light for wintertime, but imagining a warm summer day, I feel that this could be a big winner.  Perhaps a bit sweet and busy for a session beer, but a few couldnt do any harm.
Pours pale yellow with a medium head.  Smells slightly of cloves and banana.  Taste is typical for the style.  Perhaps a good beer for the summer, but seems kind of lacking during the winter.

Its just not a wheat beer without the protein haze! Admittedly the first Kristall I have tasted, and what better way than Weihenstephaner (one of my favourite breweries). Poured into a Weiss glass, a beautiful fluffy inch of foam formed upon a transparent pale gold body. A clean aroma, yeasty-bread like and banana esters, quite sweet. Aroma was a little light on, possibly due to filtration. Good body, well rounded flavours and well balanced in the mouth. Banana and vanilla tones, quite subdued and relatively smooth, led to a medium, sweet aftertaste. Sessionable, but not complex.

Pour is golden with a smallish white head that lasted for a while...smell is sweet with light fruits (faintly) and some yeast...a little spicy...taste is a little sweet with bananas and some malty overtones...finish is nice and a little chewy...great example of this style...

Bottle. Pours a pale golden, light straw color with a very large continuous white head. Extreme carbanation. Good strong clove, spiced, yeasty aroma. Some flower scents. Very nice banana flavor. Fresh, smooth. Sweet vanilla finish. Didnt really see a big difference between a regular hefeweizen. Very enjoyable beer. Suprised.
UPDATED: NOV 23, 2005  This is so good, one feels like they have cheated on their spouse after finishing a glass of this sinfully tasty brew.  Crisp, clean, filling, and downright heavenly.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Bottle from Cost Plus. Popping the cap on my 62nd of the 65 beer styles! Opening the bottle gives a slight impression of skunkiness. Poured in a tall weizen glass, I get a pale straw color, very little haze, with a thin head. Still, theres a little weizen taste of banana and clove, and a bit of German hop, otherwise a very light beer taste.
Not as complex as the hefe version but this is a very attractive beer, head dies rather too quickly tho, fresh fruity aroma and a clean refreshing flavour...lovely beer.

Bottled:Aroma has strong notes of wheat, is fruity and sweet. Clear golden color, big head, fizzy carbonation. Soft malty, medium sweet, some clove notes, light peppery. The finish is something weak and light astrigent.  O.K. Kristall, but i prefer the Hefeweizen style.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2016 (Villa Market 133 baht)
Clear gold and looks a lot like a bog standard pale larger. Wheat beer nose but more subdued than the Hefenweizen. Palate confirms with a flavour profile that seems slightly dilute (again when compared to the stablemate) but still a handy drop. Clean, friendly flavours and classy easy drinking.
Great aroma, very inticing.  Clean taste of wheat and light subtle hop flavor.  Clean finish.  Nice carbonation, pale color and clean long-lasting white head.  Nice wheat beer.

Bottle - 500ml. Nice golden body topped with a decent foamy head. Pleasant malty/hoppy aroma with evident flowery and citrusy notes. Well-balanced hoppy taste with grainy hints. Theres also a strong presence of yeasty flavors. Decent hoppy/bready finish. More than drinkable...
bottle. clear watery yellow with awhite head. banana aroma. sharp wheat banana taste, not much finish; a bit of pepper and lingering banana. very crisp overall.

Light golden color.  Large sustained white head.  Aroma of banana and subtle cloves.  Flavor is more banana and a smooth sweet maltiness.  Finish is long and lightly crisp.  Would make a great summer thirst quencher.  Very nice for its style.
Bottle. Very light body with a thick foamy head. Smells like cardboard. Tastes like cardboard and bananas. Do people actully enjoy this shite?

Very pale peach color with thick white head. Very strong nose of candied banana and light spice, almost like a fruit salad. Light weight with a dryness offset by the precieved sweetness of banana. Fruit ont eh palate with light spice and a watery(in a good way) lightness. Crisp clean and very enjoyable!

Light tasting compared to its phenomenal Weihenstephaner original counterpart (Hefe Weissbier), which I must admit I liked much better.  Nonetheless, this still is a great beer, another solid release by a favorite German brewery of mine.  Initial taste is complex, transition is smooth and light, with a crisp finish.  Lacks depth and complexity, but more than makes up for it with subtle, silky texture and sweet flavor.  Again, I am very impressed.

Bottle.  A very strong sweet banana/apricot aroma.  Clear golden color with lots of bubbles and a head that wouldnt stop.  More typical Kristall flavor - light malt and banana.  One of the top examples of a Kristallweizen.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2008 Nov, 2004.  Washed down a curry most excellently. One of the better curry drinks Ive had. Rather less attractive when drunk on its own afterwards. This is a beer which serves a purpose - and that purpose is most certainly not to be sniffed and savoured in isolation! [2.9]
Oct, 2005.  A clean and fresh beer. Pleasant enough. Very light. But Im not keen on the medicinal wheat flavour so that will always keep down any marks I give for wheat beers.  [2.7]
May, 2008 A lager like beer. Pale yellow. Crisp, lean, dry. Clove notes dominate.  Its like a fairly dull lager but with addition of clove notes. [2.5]
I was not impressed at all. Tastes like Duvel Lite if there was such a thing. The hefe tastes far better than Kristal

My first Kristal.  A castrated hefe might be a good description.  The light lager color is nowhere near as beautiful as the cloudy hazy yellow of a hefe.  Not as sweet or citrusy as a hefe.  Still a good beer, but not perfect.

Somehow I had managed to not rate this, must be all  the alcohol killing brain cells. Kristalweizen are kristalweizens, yeah its filtered etc, but its still good.  Hefe-, Dunkel-, Kristal-, all your bases are covered

Bottle. Clear pale golden colour with bubbly white head. Aroma of malt wheat, yeast and clove/banana. Taste is sweet, banana, some citrus, light malt, with a slightly bitter dry finish. A very crisp and refreshing, highly carbonated beer. Good stuff.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2011 The regular hefe from Weihenstephaner is my favorite wheat beer so I was really eager to give this one a try. +++Sampled from a 16.9 oz brown bottle the beer poured a crystal clear straw color with a fluffy white head. There was a sweet wheaty aroma. The flavor was sweet and wheaty with minimal citrus. Tastes ok but really is rather lacking in character compared to the original. This is the most disappointing product I have had from this brewer.

Light gold in colour.  Aroma of wheat, malt, citrus and yeast.  The flavour had some citrus (mostly lemons), some bananas, malt and a slight sweetness.  Dry mouthfeel and a lightish body.  Finishes tangy with a mild bitterness.  Not to bad.  Thanks for the beer piscator34.

Aroma: sweet, wheaty and some decent hops. Apperance: crystal clear orange gold with a smallish head. Flavour: initial sweetness giving way to wheaty and clove notes with just a hint of banana. Finishes with some hop notes and is quite thin.
Essentially a muted version of the Hefe. Not as clear as some of the other kristalls I have had. Nice enough but the style seems a little lacking in distinction as far as I can tell.

Light yellow and clear color, big vanishing white head. Lively carbonation. Nice fruity, dynamic and clean banana aroma, differs from "traditional" banana aroma. Aroma is also crispy, soft and refreshing. Flavor starts sweet and fruity, ending is lasting banana with some dryness. Crispy beer with excellent carbonation. My first Kristalweizen, very nice experience!
Bottle.  Clear pale lager colored.  Big foamy white head that lingers.  Good lacing.  Clove and bananna in aroma along with wheat malt.  Taste has hints of bubblegum and clove.  Crisp and clean.

Hmmmm, well I think that the word gimormus(giant and enormus) is appropriate for the sized head I got on the poured it.  Very foamy indeed.  Sparkling golden in color, which I suppose is good for the style.  Sadly I think the bottle had started to turn before I opened it.  I was expecting some bananas in the aroma, but didnt get a single one.  It definatly had a skunk rectum aroma to it.  But then then taste was more to my liking.  It did have some banana in there as well as some lemons or something of the like.  Also maybe some spiceyness but not much. The taste was rather refreshing but I dont know what to make of this one, maybe my nose is just way off. Overall, it wasnt all that bad

Pours a clear pale straw yellow, with a huge, pillowy, meringue like head. 
Head recedes quickly, but reapears with a little agitation. 
Banana cream pie dominates the aroma, with just a dusting of clove. A little bit of bubble gum as it warms.
Body is light.
Flavor is lightly citrus (lemon), wheat, bananna and spice.
 A slightly metalic and band-aid finish.
Not very complex, but a nice refreshing beer.
Bottle. Lots of clove and banana in the aroma. Quite a soft cleaning tasting weissbier. Refreshing but I prefer the cloudy stuff.

Bottle pours a crystal clear pale yellow, large foamy white head, light carbonation, with sporatic lacing.   Cloves, over ripened banana, bready, and assorted spices on the nose.   Wheaty up front, but somewhat astringent.   Fades quickly to a slight spiciness.   Good body, good mouthfeel (not as full as their non-filtered variety).   Finishes light, cloves, slightly like a dark wheat bread.   Pretty tasty...

Pint bottle.
Appearance: crystal-clear pale yellow color, with a large, looming chalk-white capper of foam.
Aroma: fresh and airy, a trifle citric and sour, but mostly lacking in vital weissbier aroma characteristics.
Nice, light, crisp, tangy texture/ mouthfeel, very light-bodied, good malty flavor, practically no hops that I can taste. Good flavor.
Have to admit a prejudice, though: I just can't get behind filtered wheat beers, especially when they come from an excellent producer such as Weihenstephaner. That wheat texture is so refreshing and rewarding in the best examples of the style, when I taste a non-HEFE weissbier, I can only think of what I'm missing.
There's a plasticy, bubblegum taste, too, just to the left of the vanilla/clove combo we find in great (and not-so-great) Bavarian weissbiers.
In this heat, though, it'll so, but it will be largely forgotten, especially as I down it quickly in order to get at the Weihenstephaner Dunkel Weisse in the fridge!

Bottle pours a light lager color with a large head and no lace with bubbles that are widely spaced, like a Bière de Garde.  The aroma is clove and yeast.  The flavor is moderately wheat like, clove, and sweet.  The palate is pretty rich and smooth.  Overall, I prefer the unfiltered variety, but this one works.
drops and powder texture. Malt, lemongrassy and cloves and banana and yeast. Light gold and white head that settles in. A natural carbonation.Lightly bitter.

Pours a clear golden color with a medium white head. Smells sweet and strongly of wheat. Strong wheat flavor, some sweetness. A tiny hint of metal to finish. Very drinkable. I think this style should replace pale lagers in the US. It would be the perfect pounding brew and it would taste really good.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2005 Im not a fan of Kristall Weissbier. I dont see what the point of it is. That being said, This is a reasonable beer which retains most of what we love in a wheatbeer. Sweet, spicey, banana flavours come through. Mine had a slight metallic aftertaste.
Very pale with huge head. Plastic, yeasty, clean aroma. Sweetish spicy banana palate. Sterile.
Pours almost clear yellow with a monster dishwater head.  Aroma and taste of freshly cut grass and lemon.  Dusty.
Real Gold Coloring.  Cappacino Head.  Grassy, Flora Aroma.  Like Drinking Freshly Cut Grass...

Bottled.  Gargantuin, white, fluffy head with minimal lacing.  Head is dominated by yeast: heavy earth tones, musk, dough; banana, clove, caramel.  Upon tasting this, Im not certain the bottle has been properly cared for prior to my obtaining it...flavor has a definite sour note, metallic and generally things that shouldnt be in beer.  Dominated by metal. =[  This sucks.  In the finish I can taste the banana clove with sweetness and that is nice and balanced, but the beginning to middle is dominated by bottle cap flavor.  Light to medium body, lively, effervescent carbonation and a crisp, dry finish.  Might be a very nice beer without the bottlecap flavor, which does die down as it sits, so I rated it "if that werent there" kind of thing.  True to the style, refreshing.

500 ml bottle.  Not quite absolutely crystal clear, but haziness is only mildly present; very light yellow, massive fluffy head.  Nose of banana, spices, bit of lime and a hint of sweet chocolate.  Velvety-smooth palate, almost like a nitro tap...this is a beer to quaff in large quantities, not sip.  Lightly citrusy and banana-tinted throughout, touch acidic but mostly smooth and invigorating.  Not an amazing beer, but somehow a delight nonetheless.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2004 Poured a kristal clear, light golden color with a large white head  and also left some nice lacing on the glass.  Spicy banana is certainly the #1 aspect of this aroma, also followed by a sweet wheat characteristic.  Light lemon citrus taste, nice sweetness, lightly spiced.  Certainly the type of beer that would refresh you.  I did not have high expectations for this, yet I was pleasantly surprised by this brew.  Rerate: I had this tonight after a wit, and caramel bananas is what comes to mind.
Pours pale yellow with a thick lasting head with great lacing.  Aroma of spice, yes there is banana, and also a lemony zesty flavor.   Very good.

This is an easy to drink wheat beer with some pleasing flavors, but it is still kind of a simple offering in my opinion. Has your typical notes of banana and spices, but the mouthfeel was a bit more watery than your normal hefeweizen. Nice, crystal-clear apperance.

Bottled. Pale gold body, full frothy white head. Quite a crunchy taste, clean aroma of rising dough. Real bubblegum flavour, sweet fruit rather than any individual flovour shining through. Settles down with a spicy clove finish.

Clear gold, that perfect head that you expect in a Weihenstephaner beer.  Aroma is fillled with yeast phenols of bubblegum, clove, and banana, very nice.  A bit of a bite on the palate.  Flavors match those of the yeast, along with a very light wheat flavor.  Lacking the complexity of the regular hefe, but still a wonderful little beer.

Spicy colves and banana, estery and phenolic, bread-like yeast aroma. Crystal clear with good carbonation and large white head that reduces to cover fairly rapidly. Grainy flavour followed by cloves and banana. Cereal malt dominates. Very highly carbonated. Light body. Bottle (sampled with CapFlu and MartinT).
0.5 l bottle. Clear golden with a white lasting head. Aroma is of banana and malt. Malty flavor with hints of banana and clove. This is a good hot day brew, but not as satisfying as hefes.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text: 500ml bottle 06.09.04  Yet another pretty, clear, golden brew from Germany...if nothing else, their beers are spectacular to behold.  Big, brainy head.  Nice bready aroma. Hints at dough, clove, honey, and light citrus, as well as banana.  Flavors are savory with a bit of lemon.  Touched of coriander, cane sugar.  Very coating mouthfeel, wet, tart.  Reminds of a hybrid hefe/pilsnener.  Would like it drier on finish, but its an interesting style.  I can imagine it would be smashing with spicey foods.

(500ml Bottle) Pours a large, white head with a clear gold body. Nose of yeast, bananas and cloves. Clean banana and bubblegum flow across the palate. Sharp and dry. Good. Thanks to Rudge75 for this offering.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2012 Banana and clove perfume atop a transparent, bubbly body...Cereal and candy bubblegum smothered by muscular cloves...Wheat emerges in the end in this light, but very tasty kristalweizen...
Pale golden crytal clear with pure white head. Tart and lemony aroma. Very clean. Extremely refreshing. Pure and quenching with lasting tart, but smooth finish.

Bottle:  Aroma is citrus and cloves.  Pours a transparent pale gold with a nice white head that lasts a minute or so.  Not much lacing.  Banana is the stronger of the tastes with citrus and cloves in the background.  Slight bitter finish without much aftertaste.    A very good beer.  Ive been impressed by this brewery so far.

Very light overall. I have had better Kristalweizens. A very light gold color with a creamy, white head. Aroma of grass and slight banana. Taste is light and refreshing with slight orange and vanilla. A little clove spice. Too light.

Every time I try a beer from this brewery I am happy, and this one is no exception. Not quite the outstanding product that the Hefe Weiss is, but a close second. Good balance between yeast and wheat flavors.

Bottled, and my first kristalweizen.  Poured a clear golden color with lots of carbonation and a large fluffy white head.  The aroma is dominated by cloves, and the flavor was very yeasty with some hints of fruits - bananas, mainly.  I liked the hefeweizen way better, but this is interesting.

Typical Weihenstephaner aroma - banana, clove, hints of vanilla.  Pale yellow beer, lots of bubbles, thick white foam stand that comes out the top of my weizen glass.  Nice light wheat beer taste, plenty of banana and clove, although less full than the unfiltered version.  Medium-light body, high carbonation but it doesn't bite.  A nice light wheat beer that still has enough character to keep it interesting.
A pale yellow beer with a large white head, which is reatined well.  Aroma is fruity - of banana and yeast. The flavor is OK, but very muted.  Very light bodied.

Beers seem to be either 'beery', like most american domestics, or nice and sweet, like belgians and a lot of wheat beers.  This one surprised me by being a very nice balance between those two styles.  At every step, the beer is both at once.

I guess I have to agree with the "castrated wheat" comment in the style desciption.  Why filter these beers?  Anyway, beer is pale golden in color with a massive egg shell white head that is retained.  Aroma smells appropriate, banana, bubblegum, and clove.  Flavor has the right characteristics, albeit, in a very muted fashion.  I think in the filtering process they filtered out quite a bit of flavor.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2013 A wonderful aroma of vanilla ice cream coupled with a lemony background.  The appearance is clear light and carbonated much like a lager; no head or lacing to speak of.  The flavour is full, creamy and extremly clean.  Better in my opinion to hefe-weizens.Score 3.4Subsequent ratings scored 3.4, 3.5, 3.2 and 3.3. Score unchanged
If you must drink a filtered Hefeweizen, this is the one to drink. It has the most of the good Hefe characteristics left in. Still not the beer that their Dunkelweizen is.

Clear light golden amber with a massive frothy white head.  It looks highly carbonated, many streams of bubbles are present.  Aroma of dough, clove, banana, pepper, honey, straw,  and light bread.  Light medium watery body with lively carbonation.  Extremely refreshing.  Nice flavor of clove, banana, honey, pepper, light bread, wheat and a hint of orange.  Very good.
UPDATED: APR 17, 2004 Bottled (from Tesco, Amersham, Bucks). A pale and smooth wheat beer with a large loose head. Very, very drinkable.
Very clear amber with a thin white head. Very light aroma of wheat. Extremely smooth with a watered down wheat beer taste. Pretty enjoyable, but it felt like something was missing.

Clear gold, huge white head. Constant carbonation. sweetish crisp. Only the merest hint of wheat flavors, and a smooth, mellow finish.  Nice, but why bother? if you want a lager, drink that; if you want a wheat, drink an unfiltered hefe.

Poured clear gold with a rolling carbonation, and a medium head.  Aroma was of fresh hay and bubblegum.  Tastes milder than it smells, with a soft "stick to your tongue" finish.  Served heavily chilled like champagne is far preferable to how this gets when the head and carbonation diminish and it warms.

Crystal clear very pale golden with an enormous frothy white head. The aroma is full of banana esthers and possibly some pineapple. The flavor is light wheat and banana. Quite light. This is my first Kristalweizen so it is hard to draw comparisons or otherwise rate to style. The body is light and watery.
Bottle. Hint of clove initially which fades to leave fruity esters lemon and pineapple with dominant banana. Some sweetness with pleasant acidity and a hint of bitterness.

Pale straw color. Large foamy white head. Aroma is fruity and grassy. A medium bodied kristall-weiss. Malts are fruity and sweet. Touches of banana and clove, orange and honey. Hops are slightly spicy and floral. Nicely balanced. Light and refreshing. Carbonation is soft and lively. A touch sweet overall, but a nice beer. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and crisp. Aftertaste is slightly bitter
Golden pilsner like appearance with lively carbonation.  Smokey orange and golden nose.  Mild wheaty taste with orange tones.  Decent Weissbier crisp and not nastily sweet.
Very pale gold clear with a large lasting white head. Distinct wheat smell and taste. Sweet light taste with hints of honey and a little spicey.

Bottle from Metro Wines, Syston, Leicester. Beautiful, virginal white head, roughly 1 inch in depth. Lagerish blonde, with a rich wheaty aroma. Sweet yeast/wheat aroma - booming taste like a Hefe, but with a springtime crispness which makes this less full, but equally refreshing. Palate is fairly unchanging, though the flavour is bigger at the beginning. Some Lager taste but this is a vastly superior drink.

A touch of haze. Straw gold with lots of head that stays around and coats your glass; purty.  The aroma has a nice spot of wheat and crisp citrus hops. Also banana and clove, trademarks from these guys (or yeasts, whatever). The flavor is very smooth with some well balanced flavors, not over the top, but just well balanced with wheat and banana/clove esters. The finish is lightly watery but refreshing at the same time. This was a tasty beer!

Clear amber body with ample white foamy head.  Weak malt aroma and slight bitterness to the taste.  Something to drink cold on a hot summer day or to have with food but not something to sip and savor alone.
slightly spicy aroma; watery yellow color with a large white head; the taste is much better than the appearance - refreshing, a little too light, slightly smoky finish

Fits the description of Kristalweizen to a tee: Clear golden colour. Pleasing aroma of banana with just a hint of spice. A bit of fruitiness, but finishes short and clean with lots of carbonation. This is probably a good introduction to the world of Weizen, but I prefer a more classic style of hefeweizen.

Great to see Weihenstephaner in Australia, even though its only the Kristal. Having said this, this is a nice Kristal. Still has those fruity banana esters of the regular heffe, and still a huge cloveyness. Really smooth, soft, and manages to cover most corners of the palate quite nicely, tart flavour, with some welcomed saltyness. Nice one. Definitely one of the better kristall weissbiers i've had.

Sparkling clear, light golden lager with a large, frothy, white head. Good retention. Good lacing. The aroma is soapy with notes of bubblegum, clove and orange peel. Light-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Lengthy, spicy, dry finish.
The description sums it up pretty well.  For lovers of kristall brews this certainly is a benchmark.
Clear golden colour. Big, lasting head. Extremly pearling, it lasted for minutes. Very nice to watch. Taste yeasty, slightly sweet. Hints of spiciness and breadiness. Nice.

sugary yeasty caramel aroma.  piss clear yellow, big head.  Has a big carbonated malt taset to it. It ways it says its a malt liqour on it, thought not here apparently, and it does taste like a non skunked malt. Aint bad.

A light yellow beer with a beutiful though collapsing head. The aroma is of wheat and yeast - just like a wheatbeer should be. The flavor is of wheat with hints of banana and yeast - just like it should be - I think it is called 4-vinyl guajacol. An OK kristal - but really my type of beer.
Strongly sour wheat-aroma. Very yeasty! Unpleasant brew. Quite undrinkable.Classic school-example of a wheatbeer. Strong wheatyeast aroma, flavor and palate. Yark!

Bottled. Crystal clear pale gold beer with desperate larger bubbles rising consistently to form a thin speckled, almost fizzy head. Wheat and bready aromas. Crisp and fizzy on the tongue/palate. Flavour isnt so intense, slightly sweet with a short finish. I expect this would be lovely on a hot European day watching the Tour de France or something.
Gold with huge foamy head. Banana, clove and coriander aroma. Coriander is too much the dominant flavour. Not much of a finish.

Slightly hazy straw-golden coloured with a smaller sized white head. Aroma of banana, coriander seed, cloves and honey. Light to Medium-bodied; Nice spicey characterup front with a honey finish. Aftertaste light with some wheat an yeast characteristic. Overall, a nice kristall...lacking in a few taste complexities though! I sampled this 50 cL bottle purchased at Chevy Chase Wine & Spirits in Washington, D.C. on 28-December-2003.

Very slight haze almost unnoticeable.  Fizzy dissipating head.  But very carbonated and bubbled.  Yeasty nose with  banana and some kind of spice (clove?).  Crisper than I expected and has a nice yeasty flavor and a tad bitter on the finish.  Classic weiss beer.

Bottled(500ml). -golden coloured with white foamy head, wheat aroma with banana and lemon,
lightly carbonated with spicy aftertaste

This brew had the color of a lager, with a grand puffy head and fair lacing. Aroma of wheat, allspice and lemon. Light and citrusy on the tongue, a little bready, sweet with lots of cloves almost as if the brewer added some to it. The finish was typically short with a faint spicy aftertaste. An interesting beer and the first one I've come across of this style.

A lovely wheat beer. As the name implies, it is a crystal-clear golden color. A small ring of head forms at the edges of the glass and leaves the it squeaky clean without a trace of lace. Nose is mild with notes of banana and clove that would be expected of the style plus a trace of earth. Medium bodied, slightly sticky, and lightly carbonated. Quite tasty with a good dose of the afore mentioned banana and clove. Nicely sweet and very lightly tart. Refreshing and thirst quenching. Appropriate for the unseasonable warm weather we've been having this Ohio November for the past few days.
big fluffy white head and quite pale in colour. the usual kristall weizen flavours and aromas.  really quite fruity, and definitely one to try again.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2005 Looks like a heavily carbonated American lager.  Pleasant aroma of wheat and citrus.  Flavor has been stripped from this beer.  There is still some wheat and citrus, but nothing like in the regular version.  Light body.  Reminds of the expired Sprecher hefe I had last night.  I dont know why a brewer would do this to what is ordinarily a great style, but it might be a good beer to use to fool your lager drinking friends into trying something new.

I have never really gotten into Kristallweizens but this was really quite good. Prototypical clovey aroma with restrained banana. Pale, clear colour (of course) with massive head and OK retention. Flavour is full of the clean, juicy maltiness and marshmallowey flavour to be expected but there was a detectable bitterness which detracted slightly from my enjoyment. Also slightly overcarbonated for my liking. Good stuff, and not far from being great.

(Bottle) Pours a crystal clear pale yllow with an incredibly thick and long lasting white frothy head.  Had your typical characteristics of a German beer, but what can you expect from the world's oldest brewery.

Crystal clear golden body beneath a thick, fluffly white head.  The aroma seems to be an interesting blend of hefeweizen and pilsener.  Saaz maybe, but I'm not sure.  Light and refreshing flavor with banana, hops, and bready malt.  A refreshing style of beer, and this was pretty tasty.
Clear golden colour with decent white head. Retention not teribbly good though. Typical banana like wheat aroma. Thin watery mouthfeel. Grainy sweet wheat taste. Not as good as Hefe IMO.
Nice golden appearance, fruity nose of banana's and a good balance of flavours.
Nice yellow color.  This beer may look light but it is loaded in flavor.  Very hearty and just a great example of a good weiss.

Golden color. A delicate malt aroma with a touch of cloves and bananas. Crisp and clean wheaty taste. Aa little lighter than an original hefe. Aftertaste is lingering with mild hops and almost no bitterness. Utterly refreshing. Put a lemon in this one.

Pours a translucent amber or blond. Tall gossamer white head that disappeared quickly. Nose is similar to their hefeweizen. Spice, fruit and malt with yeast. The taste is similar, with spice citrus fruits, and some malt, but more sharp. Decent carbonation and crisp finish. Very good, but I prefer the standard hefeweizen.
a very clear appearance, large but thin head. Not much flavor, no aftertaste. I wouldnt recommend it to anyone.

Light clear yellow with a soapy white head.  Spicey aroma, like coriander, lemon, banana.  Quite effervescent, indeed.  Taste is expectedly light and thin, but the high carbonation and subtle lemon and melon flavors are quite satisfying at the end of an Oklahoma summer day.

A two-part rating:  Enormous white head topping a clear straw body.  Aroma is strong wheat, light lemon.  Taste is light banana, medium wheat.  Hint of lemon in swallow.  Watery light body.  I have no idea why this beer is rated as highly as it is (5/3/5/2/10).  Then I go downstairs with the second half of the bottle, and drink it with a Thai-based meal, rich in lemongrass.  Suddenly, this beer is so much better -- even kathy, who isn't much of a hefe fan, keeps on grabbing sips!  the mildness complements the spicy meal, the lemon stands out more, and there's even some crispness.  (6/3/7/4/14).  My rating is a blend of these two impressions.
This was ok.  I expected better after their Hefe-Weisen, but alas, I was let down.  Not great, but good.

7/20/03:  bottle.  wheat nose with some lemon.  pale golden-yellow body.  wheat flavors with some citrus (lemon in particular).  there is also a definite dirty banana flavor as well.  sharp, crisp and refreshing with a bit of a wheat bite towards the finish.

Light yellow body with an explosive white head that quickly diminshes. Some lacing.
Sharp, wheat aroma. Underlying lemon, yeast and malt.
Yeast and malt are the most pronounced flavors in the beginning. There's a hint of spice in the beginning too. Banana and lemon in the middle. A big wheat finish, crisp.
Smooth, quaffable beer. Very dry on the palate aiding in it's drinkability.

Color is a light straw gold, paleish yellow - tall, billowy, paper white head of tight soupy foam that fades slowly to a thin hazey top always present; leaves some spotty lace. 

Aroma of lemons in front, with wheat, banana esters, and a light sweet malt in the backing. Quite a fresh and spritzy nose.

Taste of light but favorable malt and banana ester start, nice fluffy breadyness on the tongue, swallow brings in wheat textures that are lemony sweet and smooth, clean, clear, with a very slight hint of yeasty spiceyness and vanilla.

Feel starts out kinda spirtzy and full textured with a gradual turn into a light bready crisp and clean dry finish. Very drinkable and easy, excellent summer wheat brew to quench down.

The aroma really threw me off - along with the malt, I could swear I also smelled bratwurst!  I guess it's time to visit that ear, nose & throat specialist.  Anyway, this is a terrific weiss - hearty flavor, great feel and finish.  Pretty in the glass as well.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Bottle.  Light clear yellow color with a foamy white head.  The aroma is yeasty with clove and banana hints.  Crisp clean flavor, perfect for this hot and uncomfortable weather tonight. The clove and spice come through in the flavor and leave an enjoyable aftertaste.

Head is huge frothy white, body is clear pale yellow. Aroma is slightly earthy. I also detect mild yeast, fruit, and slight sour. Washes over toungue slighty thin and watery, although refreshing. Top is slight spice and banana. Finish is dry and spicy and clean. This obviously does not contain the full flavor of regular weiss, but it has something to offer. This could be considered a very refreshing beer, in a category of refreshing beers.

A sort of mini-Weihenstephaner hefe.  Not a bad beer, but without the fullness of flavor or full spicey bite of the "real" hefe.  Great foamy white head over a golden almost clear wheat beer.  Enough spice and enough hops to be a great summer barbeque beer.

My first Weihenstephaner Kristallweissbier. Poured out a golden yellow color, with a high white head. Aromas mostly of bananas, with some clove in the background. Tasted good, with a slight hop bitterness to it, along with a sweet wheat taste as well. Has a crisp, clean mouthfeel to it. Has a slight banana aftertaste to it as well. A pretty good wheat beer in my book.

Refreshing, but as with most Kristals that I've had, it seems that a lot of the flavor has been filtered out - citrus is subdued more in the flavor than the aroma.  This is fine as a thirst quencher though.
had this on a very hot day after a little climb in a hill over Freiburg, very refreshing beer with a slightly dry and bitter finish

a little too pale for photogenic pulchritude: stone washed yellow comes out as pastel as a thin tincture of wax beans. head is meringue, pure alpen snow, and lots more evenly textured than say, st. bernard slobber. the beauty resides in a huge, perfumy bouquet of dewy jungle flowers, woods and fruits: banana, pear, gewurztraminer grapes, the earthy fingerprint of lots of baker's fresh yeast. so clean and healthy smelling it could be used to cleanse wounds. fairly sweet, abuzz with pleasant carbonation, good body and bitterness. not pushy with the citrus values, but more of a pineapple juice deluted with white wine and a splash of cream.

Very pale with lots of carbonation, pours a nice frothy head. Aroma of yeast with fairly strong fruity bannana tones. Taste is somewhat yeasty but much smoother than most wheats. Smooth mild hops blend well with a touch of lemon and bannana. Light and mild with a dry slightly bitter finish. Ive never had a beer that finishes like this.

Very similar to the Hefe but not as good in my opinion. Crystal clear gold with large snow white head. Filtration seemed to take the body and yeastiness out of it. Therefore lacks the flavor the hefe brings. Almost like a light version of the Hefe. Still a quality brew just not my idea of a classic wheat.
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: Clear, light golden with rising, champagne-like bubbles. Huge, rocky, lasting bleached-white head. Enticing nose: spicy and yeasty. Highly carbonated mouthfeel; somewhat watery. Malts are light and grainy. Hops are spicy, though subdued; not very bitter at all. Very dry finish. Overall, rather clean; light on flavor, heavy on aromatics.

Bottled at the Danish Beerfestival 2003: Very light golden. Medium lasting head. Yeasty and spicy with pleasant banana notes. Is full and wellbalanced. Has a pleasant touh of dry bitterness in the end. Great wheat.

This beer poured dark clear(crystal clear) yellow color and formed a huge white foamy head that latticed lace as it slowly, and I mean slowly, subsided. A heavy amount of carbonation was present. An aroma of malt, hops, cloves and bananas. The flavor was of malt, hops and yeast/bread. The finish was a touch doughy and light. Not as good as the hefe, but not a bad beer.

Weihenstephaner makes some great beers in my opinion, I mean hell, they are the world’s oldest breweries. This beer was a spectacular clear golden in color. It has a Smooth wheat taste and a luscious frothy head. This is a great beer; but I have just realized that I am describing beers as I would a beautiful woman! This upsets me is an odd way.
This is good beer but it can't compare to Weihenstephaner's hefe-weisse which I consider to be one of the finest beers in the world.
This was just an okay beer to me.Nothing all that special in my opinion.I picked up an aroma that reminded me of bananas.Definitely not one of the better German Wheat beers that I have tasted.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2003 This brew has a mild fruity banana aroma. A very lively pour resulting in a very large off white head that last lasted a fairly long time but left little to no lacing. It's body was a very light transparent yellow orange color. This brew has a mild banana flavor to boot. Mild carbonated taste with little to no after bite. Not enough character in this brew to make me appreciate it fully.

First Kristall I have ever had I think it is the best beer I have had not counting Hoegarrden wit and Hacker Pshorre Weiss. I hope to try more Kristalls. I think it has such a good flavor. What I like about Weiss beers is that they have a real food like taste. They can be smoky or sweet. Each gulp is different, and great. This is a sweet one and tastes wonderful

UPDATED: APR 26, 2006 Clove nose, some sourness.
Pale, big head,large bubbles.
Taste is still rather full compared to other Kristalls - banana and clove ad libitum, exits a bit weaker than the unfiltered version.
It is ok, but I must admit I have never seen the point in kristall weissbier...

I typically find Kristalls refreshing, but they taste to me like a hefe that's missing something which, to be fair, is a pretty accurate assessment.  Lovely light gold, nice head.  Nose is subtle and restrained, wheaty lemon and some banana.  Flavor has some yeastiness, but not a huge amount.  Banana again.  Crisp, quite refreshing, but I gotta say I miss my floaties.

Golden color with a smaller (for Style) white head.  Dry wheat and ester aromas.  Dry wheat flavors also.  Did a taste test between this and two other Krystalls (Spaten & Erdinger) while none was a clear winner, the last few ounces in each glass were combined and formed a beverage better than any individual.  Proving to me that these kristalls all end up missing something in the clarifying process.

This brew has an interesting nose of berries, banana, sawdust, perfume, and alcohol.  Pours from the bottle a cloudy light golden honey.  The towering collossal creamy snow white head is fully lasting with no lacing.  The well balanced flavor is mostly fruity wheat sweetness with light acidity.  Finishes short and sweet like a slice of bread.  The light and creamy palate is lively and finishes dry.  One of the better German Wheats I have sampled in terms of balance and depth.

One of the best examples of a German wheat I have come across. Clean, refreshing zesty banana-like aroma.  Soft, creamy, long-lasting lacing head.  Crisp flavor that wakes up your taste buds and makes them stand at attention. Appearance could be a bit more cloudy.  Would make a great summer beer - great for multiple servings.
Not quite as consistent in quality and taste as Tuchers or Erdingers, but a damn fine brew.

Very pale urinous gold clear with a large lasting white head. Medium bubblegum, banana and fainter sour grain and faint floral hops aroma. Medium light low carb body. Medium mild yeasty, sweet bubblegum and sourish grain start and middle where the banana and some corny malt comes through and linger into the finish and aftertaste. Interesting enough but its a bit clinical and lacks character and life compared to the hefe.
I wasnt really a big fan of this one.  It is extremely clear, some wheat flavor.  But not a whole lot.  Its drinkable.

sweet grainy malt malt nose with strong wheat-like smells. Orangy yellow color and large bubbles - no head retention. Sweet light taste with hints of honey and a little spicey. Overall rather mild, but with a clean palette and a round full mouth feel. Excellent beer.
Nose is vanilla, corn, hopps also flowers. Nice body, nice head. Tasted vanilla, also strong cloves, sweetness and unexpected dough - as there is no yeast inside. Fizzy carbonation, dry finish. Nice

Eerie.  A weiss that doesnt look anything like a weiss.  I had some issues with that.  Sure did do some interesting things to the palate though.  A tad light on the citrus as far as aroma goes but pleanty of spice.  Strange hint of latex paint, not to my liking.  A tad too "lite" for me in the flavour.  Virtually no finish whatsoever.  Not my favourite from the brewery.

Very clear pale yellow color, nice thick head. Surprisingly complex aroma: mostly clove, with a hint of banana and yeast. Light clove, banana, malty sweet flavor. Fairly crisp finish. Very refreshing!

Thick white head. Many many bubbles in this one. The color is a pale yellow. Great banana, bread, clove aroma/flavor. Much more substance in this beer than others this light. Crisp, light, bubbly feel that quinched my thirst perfectly. Very sweet and satisfying.
Good tall froth filled a large stein.  Char-grain wheat aroma. Peppery, without a whole lot of esters. Drinkable, but not very impressive.
A good German Wheat but not as good as I thought it would be. Not as clovey, or fruity enough for me. Very refreshing however.

A very nice beer but not as complex as the unfiltered version.  Aroma was well-focused with dominating notes of clove and just a hint at banana.  Flavor was very well balanced, with enough malt sweetness, clove spiciness, and dry finish to make this very nice.  Bright light gold color with large thick head.
Smells sharp and bitter.  Light golden color, ample head.  Tangy, fizzy and satisfying aftertaste.

So the North Peak Brewery in Traverse City, Mich, has an amazing menu, great atmosphere, and - sub par beer.  Their wheat disappointed me yesterday so I asked if they had any bottled weiss and this is what I recieved.  The NP wheat is an estery mess - this one, by stark contrast, is crisp, light, and subtle with its esters, adding a little citrus spritz for balance.  A far better choice for a sunny porch lunch.
Whew! What is that mustyness in the aroma...is it crystal malt and is that why this is called what it is? Pardon my ignorance. Wonderful subtle malt flavors, a little hop tinges. Good beer.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Golden straw color; Head was medium; Juicy fruit aroma. Much less annoying then most other kristal. Tiny bit of sweetness. Quenching.
Slightly flat wheat beer, with more bitterness than citrus flavours.  Average beer.
great end of session beer at the brewery. nice malty and refreshing bought some for the bus ride to munich (seems i remember getting getting on a bus before but that was something else)

Nice clear-golden color and yeasty, citrus nose. A nice and crisp citrus taste without the cloying yeastiness of an unfiltered Hefeweisse(which I like too, but not all the time). This is a very well-crafted brew in every sense.
Nice thick and creamy head, banana -clove taste. Close to their Hefe just filtered crisp and refreshing.

Re-Rate 04/29/02: Clear light gold, generous and creamy white head, sheets of lace. Nose malt, earthy, or yeasty if you like. Malt sweet at the start, light middle, the finish is acidic, dry, nicely hopped, crisp and clean, fresh. Delicate balance of hops, malt, wheat, perfection maybe another word to describe this beer
Very nice, with a lovely aftertaste. Refreshing and very drinkable. A clean and fruity taste.
Cisp would be the word I would be looking for. Pours great with a btight white frothy head.I enjoyed it.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2012 Bottle. Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is clear medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain/bread), lightly hoppy (flowers), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with notes of banana and clove. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery/syrupy texture, lively carbonation. Pleasant but nothing more.  A little too syrupy-sweet, as is now the case with their Hefeweisse too.

I normally avoid filtered wheat beers as stripping the yeast out takes a lot of the flavour away but this particular example seems to be better than some of the blander hefe weissbiers. Lots of cloves and bananas with a muted phenolic twang, nice big head and fruity finish.

Nice clean aroma, and as someone said earlier a definite champagne-like appearance in the glass.  The color is pale yellow, with a lingering and foamy white head.  Taste is clean and somewhat crisp as well, but nothing distinct stands out for me.  I keep waiting for something to come to me like it usually does when I describe the taste of beer, but it isnt happening.  I try to put words to the taste, but I just remind myself of the fragrant, bubbly, yet nondescript taste.  It isnt bad at all---its good---but its lacking something.  I definitely prefer the Hefe to this one.

Nice wheat aroma.  Champagne-like carbonation and a quite persistent head.  Light golden yellow color.  Spritzy, nice wheat flavor and some citrusiness.  Very lively finish, with a pleasant aftertaste.  Mmm!
Decent strength for the color. Too syrupy; not crisp enough for my taste. All in all, quite above average but just shy of outstanding.
Doesnt come close to the Hefe. Its good, just not as tasy as its bigger brother.
i never quite got the point of kristallweissbier

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2004 Very smooth, fruity and perfumey, but is definitely nowhere near the amazingness of the hefe. rer8: very sweet, lollyish, with banana, bubblegum and lemon. not much in the way of guts but crisp and easy to drink. a very good gurly beer.
Incredible that so much flavor can be packed into such a light colored brew. Toned down weiss flavors without the yeast but a very german beer none the less. Crisp and refreshing.

Clear golden color, with a lacey ring of foam. Smells of banana bread, very sweet and fruity aroma. Light and sweet taste, slightly flowery and banana taste pervades. Sweet and mellow, a nice drinking experience.

Copper/brown, clear, no head.  Yeasty, banana aroma.  Crisp and refreshing, the dominant flavors are subtle banana and a hint of pumpkin pie; slightly sweet. Much lighter than a normal weissbier, with no bitterness and non-existent hop presence. Slightly yeasty aftertaste.  Excellent, although not as flavorful or enticing as their unfiltered hefe.
Outstanding wheat beer - soft mouthfeel, perfectly balanced citrus notes and a banana touch that sums it all up.  A must have.
user_location: Palm Beach Gardens, FL, Florida, USA

text: Amazingly soft, gentle body is futher accented by delicate banana flavor.  So very refreshing and mellow.  A terrific Kristal.
Incredibly refreshing with banana aroma and nice foamy head. Crispness in flavor and texture.Less demanding then their Hefe Weizen. This is my favorite wheat!
UPDATED: OCT 24, 2007 clear and bright golden colour, firm white head; fair banana aroma; sweet and medium-bodied, the finish is slightly yeasty with more banana notes - gentle
